Reviews.Title: “Did the Job”
Reviews.Author: DJAnon
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel for the Singapore Grand Prix-travelled Sept Oct 2010 Very adequate clean with good staff- typical of a city centre hotel with the facilities being functional rather than luxurious however no complaints. Excellent location for walking along the river to all the major attractions including the Grand Prix Plentyy going on just 200 yards away Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: coradsl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good place to stay on a Singapore stopover and arent familiar with Singapore, I recommend this hotel. Lots of choices for places to eat and drink, good location near the river, food court in the basement, and reasonable access to transport. Hotel is very quiet and some of the rooms have great views over the marina area. Good price also

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liz363
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent trip to Singapore. We liked the location at Clarke Quay being quite a vibrant area. The hotel itself was disappointing, though. We could hear noise from outside through the night (yelling at 2am!), we had to ask for our inter-connecting rooms to be opened up, the beds were not in the configuration asked for and the room service dinner was of average quality. We expected better from Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: marcello_crystallo
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location is really great. Big food court and many shops in the basement of the same building, Clarke Quay is directly starting behind the hotel with a huge area of restaurants and bars, all with a nice view on the river. From there you can walk easily to may exciting places without the need of taking a taxi all the time. On the other side the close location to the nightclubs come with some light bass sounds in the night until 3 AM, but it was not too load, so we could sleep without problems. The room was spacious with 28sqm (although that is only the standard room) and from the 19th floor we had a fantastic view over Marina Bay Sands and could even see the sea and the container ships passing by far away. The Fitness center is more like a small room and not very comfortable , but at least with new gym equipment and a tv flat screen. The pool outside on the roof at 6th floor was not cleaned and prepared to use, maybe because we had some rain the days before. But it looked like its not maintained at all at the time, we stayed there. Only one thing was really annoying: The internet rates per day were 30 (!) $ and that is by far too much. We needed that in our room for business purpose and stayed 6 days, so we had to pay to lot for a service, that is free of charge in other hotels. Hey, they have nearly no costs for the internet line, that should be complimentary for the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Perfect Location, and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: srikrishna84 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A Good Hotel at a very nice location, however the nights during weekends may be quite noisy due to the Clarke QUay area..

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: chocoluvr
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night at this hotel on a stopover in Singapore. Didn't expect much from a mid-level hotel chain so maybe that's why we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Room was small but very functional and seemed like a lot of thought was put into where things are placed so everything was convenient and not obtrusive. Bed was not firm but not too soft which suited me really well (though may not be firm enough for some people) and the pillows were not the flattened-when-you-put-your-head-on-the-pillow kind like in 99% of chain hotels. And the towels were big, thick and fluffy -- the best among the 5 hotels we stayed at in this trip to Hanoi and Singapore! It is conveniently located if one does not mind taking cabs around since the nearest MTR is several minutes walk away, and in the Singapore heat, the distance matters. It is far from Orchard Road so not ideal for those who prefer to be in the middle of the shopping area. But it is right smack in Clarke Quay so perfect for those who like the nightlife. Maybe because we were on the 14th floor so we didn't hear the noise even if we were in the midst of party central Clarke Quay. The rate we got did not include breakfast so I can't comment on that. The only significant negative for me was the internet connection. Wi-fi is not free in the rooms and even in the lobby though there are Macs with internet connection by the elevator lobby that guests can use for free. But one can end up waiting in line to use the Macs, which is what happened to my husband and I when there was a family of 4 each using a Mac, so 4 out of 5 or 6 Macs was used by just one family whose 2 children were just playing games when there were already 4 people waiting in line. The parents were just so inconsiderate and total jerks! Considering there is limited free internet access made available to guests, the hotel should prohibit the Macs from being used to play games. Over-all, I won't hesitate recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply lovely”
Reviews.Author: SatayEater Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: With wife and baby, we only stayed in this hotel for one night, but all was as it should be, and I couldn't ask for more from the staff. I was warned that many hotels in this fabulous city are affected by noise, but we found no such problem. Accor, you offer great facilities, so why not step up a notch and refuse to offer pay TV pornography in your hotels?

Reviews.Title: “I love music but not all night”
Reviews.Author: 699kermit
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Hotel at 10.00 pm after travelling from Australia ,were given a lovely room on the 18th floor , showered and went to bed. The base notes and drums from the restuarants opposite the Hotel were so loud that sleep was impossible until about 3.30am.Needless to say we then slept in so long that we missed the included breakfast. The following night was no better and we staggered to catch our 9.00am flight to London after about 3 hours sleep. Add to this the fact that the included meal was really poor ,the welcoming drink non existent , and we wished we had found another Hotel. The music was not the Hotels fault ,however if this a normal occurrence surely you should advise prospective guests when they book. A good hotel ruined by outside events.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Maggi5
Reviews.Content: Right where the night life is, amazing in the evening and very central during the day,10 minutes ride to Singapore Flyer and Marina bay Sands. The breakfast buffet is amazing lots and lots variety even A choclate fountain and marshmellows or kids!!!! The only negative was the service levels both for housekepping and bell boys!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: beemarcus
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Singapore and we stayed three nights here and then went off to Malaysia, then stayed one more night as we transited back home. It didn't take me long to discover that hotels are pricy in Singapore so we were quite happy to find this Novotel to be on the more "reasonable" end of things. It's one of the few places that could accomodate a family of 4 in one room. Of course these are cheaper places, but it was a family trip and we wanted good hotel memories, not bad, and this Novotel was a good midrange choice for us. Yes, it's a great location, that's one reason we returned for one more night. The room are clean but on the small side, the bathroom are quite modern design with a great shower. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast buffet was just fine. Some great people watching in the neighborhood, particularly on weekend nights. I thought it was interesting that most of the stores in the mall below the hotel are Japanese, including the grocery story, so we enjoyed some good okonomiyaki, which is hard to find at Japanese restaurants outside of Japan. Like many hotels the price for wi-fi in the room was an absolute rip-off, but thankfully they provide some nice computers in the lobby for those like me who don't care to be ripped off like that. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “front office staff”
Reviews.Author: maricar1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in the receptionist said my membership card is not valid even though i told them repeatly that i have not receive my new card from advantage plus. The insist for my credit card as guaranty of payment even though it shows clearly that i book the room using my free nights from the internet. As this room is going to be utilise by my foreign guest and to avoid further inconvenience to my guest, i gave them my credit card. The receptionist keeps on repeating that if my card and free night is not valid, the will charge all to my credit card. This is really a big embarrasement to me infront of my quest.. On the internet when i book the room, i already provide my credit card number because i requested for breakfast to be inclusive and the extra breakfast chrage to be chrage to my credit card. To my surprise the next morning, when my guest went to the restaurant for breakfast, the restaurant staff insist him to pay cash for the breakfast. My guest was quite annoyed but he did pay them in cash. What had happen is really a big embarrasement to me and frankly speaking i woudn't mine if such episode happens in third world country but it is definately unacceptable for such a thing to happen here in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but some negatives”
Reviews.Author: degtravel
Reviews.Content: The lobby is located on the 7th floor, which means you first have to take an elevator to get to the lobby. And then a second elevator to get to your room.... It took them 10 minutes to check me in, 4 employees were dealing with only one customer.... a bit messy tbh. The internet was not free of charge. Room was okay, a bit depressing I must say because little daylight coming in. Going in and out of the hotel takes forever. They did have a very nice internet corner with large Apple PC's, definitely a plus. They extended my check-out time and allowed me to use the gym after check-out. Locations is great but somehow, did not like the hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LindaAccorMember
Reviews.Content: We stay My Husband Celebrate Birthday .Hotel Service and the room view is excellent. Novotel Is My first choice at Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rust47 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Novotel Clarke Quay with family for 3 nights in March, great rooms, terrific location across from Riverside restaurants etc. This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and I will be back there again next March. The staff are terrific on the front desk and the Concierge was great finding us places to go and restaurants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “NOVOTEL SINGAPORE CLARKE QUAY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel was definitely value for money. We received 2 free breakfasts and a dinner in our package and the service at the dinner was excellent. I considered it was in a great location for our needs and I could stay there again next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to enjoy the night life!”
Reviews.Author: Shells85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter Holidays for the second year in a row. The hotel is beautifully appointed and the staff are friendly (the front desk even remembered my room number on the second day). Would definitely recommend a room with a view overlooking Marina Bay Sands as it is wonderful at night time. The buffet breakfast has a good selection and the pool is reasonable but wouldn't be the best in town. I think we will continue to stay here on return visits due to the close proximity to Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Overnight”
Reviews.Author: david e
Reviews.Content: My wife and I satyed there for one night as we travelled back to Australia from Europe. the hotel is reasonably located at Clarke Quay where there are many restaurants to choose from and in easy walking distance. The good shopping is a little further away. The room was clean and adequate for one night's accomodation. The bed was so large that it had to be placed hard against one side wall. Reception is on the 7th floor. Access to the room necessitates the use of two lifts, one to level 7 and then another to the your floor. Construction works are taking place next doo tpo the hotel and there was considerable noise until about 10pm but the rest of the night was fine. The hotel represented good value and was more than adequate for our needs on this ocassion

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: anitansteve
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 superior rooms at the Novotel for a 1 night stay. We arrived on an early morning flight and arrived at the hotel at approx 7:30am. Although we were not suppose to check in until 2pm we were allowed 1 of our rooms early to let the kids have a sleep and shower. The rooms were very clean and comfortable as were the beds. The pool area was well kept with nice fluffy towels. The breakfast was the best I have ever had, what a variety! The kids loved the fondue fountain. The hotel also has free internet use in the lobby for guests. There are nice places to eat and explore near the hotel and the MRT is only across the bridge and easy enough and cheap to travel on. Would stay here again if we went back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Family experience”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne T
Reviews.Content: If you are considering this hotel with a family please request beds for every person that requires one. After an 8 hour flight and arriving at 11:00 pm( 3 hours behind Aus) to a room with 1 bed only I gave up at 2:00am Singapore time & after 3 visits and 2 phone calls to reception. The next morning i was advised if i have a reservervation for 2 adults and 2 children which also requires their age at the time of booking,that it was my fault for not requesting the extra beds. If travelling again with the family would definatley not stay at the Novotel but the Somerset is next door shares the same pool and cheaper. Its' a real shame the service i was given as the hotel was good otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marie190479
Reviews.Content: Really loved this hotel, thanks to the friendly staff we got an upgrade on our room because of some errors with our payment. We got a beautiful room on the 22nd floor overlooking Clark Quay! I'm so glad we stayed here. The bathroom was big and with a nice shower and bath tub, the bed was huge and also the TV. It's close to the MRT, and Clark Quay is a superb place to stay in Singapore with lots of bars and restaurants nearby! (some noise from the bars at night, but it didn't bother us that much). It was also very clean. If I ever go to Singapore again I will stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great central location at the river, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: drarbee
Reviews.Content: got bumped up into a suite; breakfast buffet is generous, although cleanliness of dishes is not up to expectations; check-in and -out is fast; big pool, small gym with decent equipment; WiFi in lobby and rooms (check for charges in rooms); can be noisy due its location near night life spots

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient hotel in good location - good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Madreda
Reviews.Content: We spend 2 nights in this hotel. Good location, nice and clean rooms. Food court, 7/11 and supermarket located in the same building. Clarke Quay amusement area just across the street. For singapore hotel prices good value for the money. Good for families....we will return. You can book this hotel without doubt. It is a standard mid-range Accor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: dkz1412
Reviews.Content: Just returned from short stay. Very impressed. We had the 3 nights for price of 2 deal which was very welcome as the value for money in Singapore hotels is always disappointing. Stayed in a 'Supreme Bay View' room on the 20th floor - fantastic view, great space, fittings and features all of a very good standard. Pool area (shared with the 'Somerset') was great with towels, showers etc. and a large, deep pool. The staff were very friendly and helpful too. The location of the hotel is excellent being built on top of a shopping centre ('Liang Court') - concierge on the ground floor, reception on the 7th, shopping centre in between. Starbucks, McDonalds and 7 Eleven all downstairs for snacks and 'fridge-fillers'. Clarke Quay is right on your doorstep with many bars, restaurants and clubs; I would also recommend walking 5 minutes up-river to Robertson Quay where there's a number of nice bars and restaurants in a slightly more sedate environment right by the river. Clarke Quay MRT is a 10 minute walk away on the other side of the river. Best stuff? - Location, quality of accommodation and helpful staff. Worst? - No complimentary WiFi in room. 30 SG$ a day! Go to Starbucks, it's free.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best place to stay and club!”
Reviews.Author: soochie
Reviews.Content: Location. Stone throw to Clarke Quay. Clubs, restaurants, bars, etc..... All too near to be true. 24 hours McDonalds located on 1st floor. Japanese premium super market located at basement. Room. Impressed with the quest rooms. Huge enough for two persons. Value. Acceptable price. Sleep Quality. Despite being so near to clubs, it is pretty quiet. Overall. Will return when my friends are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Clarke Quay stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Was travelling with a group of friends. location near Clarke Quay was great staff all helpful. thought the room for an upgrade was a little small. I didn't like the A/C and asked for balcony access which was given with fantastic view to Marina Bay and the light show. meals all reasonable and used accor card regularly to improve value.

Reviews.Title: “good location for nightlife in singapore”
Reviews.Author: omidi_farhad
Reviews.Content: The location is good just at Clarke quay, full of restaurant & bars. The room is clean & pool is good. The most important thing about this hotel is the location. So I you look for nightlife & dining it would be the best place.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at a wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Rahul_36_Sarawgi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family in standard rooms. The location of this hotel is excellent, just on Clark Quay which has all the clubs and restaurants. Nice place to party on weekends. There is a Indian restaurant in the basement where we got the best of the Indian food in Singapore. The rooms are well equipped with all necessary items, swimming pool is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Located hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: drscape Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel is one of the best located hotel in Singapore right next to Clarke. Raffle center is walking distance & the MRT as well. Very few hotels in Singapore that allows 2 kids for free in the room. Got a relative good deal online so value for money otherwise can be a bit expensive. Good services with a Indian restuarant in the hotel but otherwise infinte eating options at Clarke. Services was also very good specially free internet access at the hotel reception counter.

Reviews.Title: “Feedback”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: amazing location ... And food .. If only housekeeping was better it would be wonderful. A suggestion wifi should be provided in the rooms with no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Trip-er-lot
Reviews.Content: The orange tiled exterior is not the best feature, but inside the hotel is modern and functional. Very nice pool. Breakfast was a scrum but a good selection. Room recently renovated and good size bathroom wih decent shower. Not the best Singapore has to offer but at all bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range option”
Reviews.Author: DavidLD12
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of four (two young children) for one night. The best point is the location, just above Clarke Quay on the river with a great selection of restaurants etc nearby -though you'll need to take a taxi if Orchard Rd shopping is your priority. We booked an executive room as it was advertised as suitable for 2+2; as others have said, you only actually get one (very big) bed as standard, though we were offered an extra wheel-away bed which came quickly and at no extra charge. Our smallest child slept for a while on a very small sofa seat ledge thing, and then joined us in the big bed. As such fine for a short stay but not really comfortable for a family for a longer stay; but to be fair you're only paying for one room, so it's decent value. The room was big with a nice view of the park over the road, and a luxurious marble bathroom with separate shower and bath. Rooftop pool area was pleasant enough and pool big, but not somewhere you'd want to spend a whole day. It is quite a 'party' area and as we left for the airport at 6am there were young people just leaving the clubs -which had created some noise in our room. We ordered a taxi which was there correctly at 6am. Overall a nice place to stay, not amazing in any way (except possibly position) and I'd have given it 3.5 stars if I could have, but it's a sound mid-range option.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were better than i thought!”
Reviews.Author: PinkyPrincess
Reviews.Content: Being a local, i never thought much abt Novotel thinking its a rather run down hotel oops.. but i enjoyed my stay in the suite with my family over the weekend. It's nice to hang around in the living area catching up and heading downstairs for a seafood dinner anytime. Convenient and great for those who enjoyed nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In general, we are satisfied with thus hotel. we are very recommended and we are willing to stay in the next time. But there is a weakness "No Free Wifi" in lobby and room, troublesome if we should go to the lobby using free internet computer available there. Good hotel, good location.

Reviews.Title: “very attentive staff - great quality accommodation”
Reviews.Author: johnnysailorboy
Reviews.Content: staff throughout this hotel excel at providing customer service. recommend paying a bit extra for a 'premium; room with access to free bar (6-8pm) free internet and free breakfast in the premium lounge. great location next to the bars and restaurants of Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Location good but watch the noise”
Reviews.Author: moobaby214
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night mid week. Check in was a mix bag. Some of us were able to get rooms right away.Myself and one other who requested rooms NOT facing Clarke Quay waited 90 minutes. It really was not the wait that bothered me. It was the smug attitude of the front deck personal. After one hour I walked back up to the desk and asked nice if our rooms were ready. The assistant manager barked at me "just sit down" never had that before. Needless to say not that impressed right there. Once inside the room (which was quiet NOT facing Clarke Quay) it was small but fine. Everything worked but the A/C I thought could be a little cooler. The hot water seemed to take forever to get going. The cable channels were fine. The location is good for the area. Many place to eat or drink. There is a starbucks at the street level next to the hotel. Also a 7-11 for snacks or drinks etc. You really do have to watch which rooms you get here. Clarke Quay is night club central on the weekends and certain weeknights. I mean all the young kids from Singapore come here to party and get crazy. The good news the "party" is right outside the hotel. The bad news is if your room faces the party. Well you better be able to sleep thru a tornado or typhoon because you will hear it. Requesting a quiet room paid off (from reading TripAdvisor) my business partner had very little sleep due to the thumping of music. Overall the hotel is OK. I Personally think there are better options in Singapore. However IF you can get a room not facing Clarke Quay it should be fine. I

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a hangover”
Reviews.Author: Kouala
Reviews.Content: This Novotel is perfect if you plan to party in clarke quay. No need to get a cab afterwards, you can save a taxi fare. It is conveniently located. However the closest MRT station is not so near. The rooms are not very big but quite nice. I liked the bathroom, especially the mirror which makes a square reflect in your eyes, it is quite funny! Wifi is not free, too bad because I had to work. I did not use the swimming pool or gym but it looked nice, though small. Overall a good hotel with interesting rates

Reviews.Title: “Near Food and Events establishments but 500m walk to MRT”
Reviews.Author: SJCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights. Room size is just right for me, my husband and our pre schooler. Didn't try their restaurant but happy that its a short walk away from other food establishments since we didn't want to spend on pricey hotel food. 711, Starbucks and McDonalds just downstairs among other food court offering from Liang Court which has direct access from the hotel. Pool kept my son busy while I attend to official business matters. Relatively a long walk to MRT (500m+) if travelling with elders or young kids, but if willing, there's a bus stop that's 100m away only. Disappointed that internet access is expensive at 10SGD per hour, but they have a common internet kiosk near the reception. I'd likely be fine to stay there again if on company expense, but if personal expense, I can probably get better value for my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Experience in Novotel Clark Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Reception staff not so friendly, waited for 1 hour for staff to clean up the room and did not inform us when the room was ready until we have to ask again. Housekeeping department was promptly served when request was make.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: maureen186363
Reviews.Content: Room overlooked the water & park area where they were flying illuminated kites. A short walk to Clarke Quay & the station enabling travel all over Singapore. Clarke Quay is an excellent area for eating & watching the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “OK nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one week, and all in all everything was ok. Friendly and helpful staff, nice modern rooms and very good location, except during the weekends, since there is a lot of noise from the Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy presently due to construction”
Reviews.Author: Paul Drinkwater
Reviews.Content: Presently there is construction next to the hotel, which starts early morning. Its not intrusive but you can hear it. Good points about hotel: Rooms are modern and comfortable Hotel is right next to restaurants and clubs on Clarke Quay, and not far from MRT station modern rooms Apple Terminals in lobby giving 20 minutes internet access. The swimming pool is large and good for lap swimming Bad points about hotel: If you are much taller than 6ft then your head will touch the top of the shower room Room doors don't always close automatically so you need to check before leaving the room Internet in the room is very expensive ($30). If you have Platinum AClub membership then you may get a one category room upgrade, but noting else, and they won't give you complimentary internet access or a discount

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: bu123
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Novotel en route to Europe in August 2011 (we were upgraded to a better room than originally booked but I am afraid I don't remember the name) and had a pleasant stay. The room was comfortable, breakfast buffet was good (very much liked their omelettes) and the staff were extremely patient and kind with our pretty active toddler. The location was convenient for exploring Singapore and practical for travelling with a small child as it sits on top of a small shopping mall with a large supermarket with all the toiletries and snacks you may need. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Maintenance of rooms needs to be a lot sharper. Ask about aircon 3 days running and at high speed 16 degrees it is not cold, just satisfactory. The shower glass door needs a panel of plastic at the bottom as the water leaks out onto the floor. Told the staff at reception about it on the 2nd day. Still not done. We have extended our stay another week and still it is not done. Would rush back to this hotel but booked it as it's part of Accor Hotel and I am a silver member. Its been an average stay. Even in the lobby areas near Cafe Rouge your aircon is not regulated, it is super hot during the day and night, even if you turn it up/down to regulated with Singapore weather temperatures. Think you have an issue with maintenance at the hotel. We only stayed at this hotel as we couldn't be bothered moving to another but there were other options.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: B F
Reviews.Content: The rooms and toilets are nice and big - but almost all hotels at this price are. Service is sloooow (2 hour wait for an adaptor for example) and service tends to be cold and impersonal. Asking for something makes you feel like you are imposing. Breakfast buffet items are cold and in need of better warmers. Bacon is hard and chewy.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Clarqe Quay”
Reviews.Author: yvonne c
Reviews.Content: Price They are consider the most reasonable in clarqe quay area, with the biggest room, bigger than Park Hotel and Merchant Court with lower price! Accommodation Novotel are kind enough to give us a free upgrade, from standard room to premium room on 23rd level. its excellent room with OMG scenery, the bed is biggest than super single but smaller than queen size,very very comfy. Bathroom is big with bathtub and rain shower!! The pool is excellent but up to 2.5m deep, so be careful. Location 30seconds from clarqe quay, extremely near, just imagine if you are drunk. lolx Food Breakfast is excellent!! Or you can just go Mac at the lobby, or Japanese food stall at basement. Whats best? The location after a crazy night out at clarqe quay! And i will always stay here! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location, decent price, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, the free WiFi is brilliant and really helped to keep me working and moving while in the facility. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. The ground floor staff are very attentive. I will stay here again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Well located”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well located, in the heart of "active" Singapore. Within walking distance of the Suntec Convention Ctr (15-20 min) and many other attractions (Marina Sands, Esplanade, Cathedral, ...). The hotel is a little bit "old" in terms of finishing (old wall paper for ex. ) and worn door frames. However, it is clean and staff is pleasant. The pool is great, both for swimmers and family. I would definitely go back; the price is more than reasonable for the location and the quality of the hotel. The morning buffet is as per Accord hotels standards: variety and adapted to the region.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Elbereth Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and were very happy with it. The room was big with a great view on the marina, the bed extremely confortable, the service was excellent and the staff very helpful, responded to our requests very efficiently. We did not have breakfast there and did not eat at the restaurants so cannot comment on the food and service there. The location is perfect, Clarke Quay has everything Singapore has to offer, a vibrant night life, some malls, plenty of restaurants, a Starbuck's just next door and plenty of taxi stands around, so it is very easy to reach it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: John-and-Barbara
Reviews.Content: This was the third time in 7 years we had stayed here en route from Australia to UK. Name of hotel keeps changing (!) but location is perfect for a visitor to Singapore and we have always found the service and facilities excellent. Not cheap, but good value for Singapore. Great areas to walk around right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location offset by some minus points ...”
Reviews.Author: mozilla_monster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a conference / meeting recently, and here's what I think about this place: Plus: - Great location, being right next to Clarke Quay giving you access to food, drinks, and partying - Clean and simple rooms & bath - Easy check in & check out Minus - If your room faces Clarke Quay, you will hear the thumping beats from the pubs & bars there until 2am - The pillows aren't very comfortable at all. - No toiletteries aside from the shower gel, shampoo & soap? We're in an age where people expect toothbrush, razors, etc. - The hotel is a little aged, althought the decor does a decent job hiding most of it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Dan A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend for my birthday. I booked my room through booking.com. I was also fortunate enough to be upgraded to a Premier room by staff when I checked in, which was totally unexpected! Here is what I thought of the hotel; 1. Its location is superb. It is right on the Singapore River, only steps away from Clarke Quay, and its scores of restaurants, bars and nightclubs. 2. It is in walking distance to Merlion Park, the Singapore Flyer, Raffles Landing spot, and if you are feeling keen, Orchard Rd. The walking trail takes you along the river, so it's a nice walk. 3. I found the my room, (2213), clean, spacious and extremely modern. I had nice views of the park, Singapore City, the flyer and Marina Bay Sands. 4. The staff were friendly, professional and courteous. 5. Catching a taxi outside of the hotel is easy, or if there is not any there, then you can always cross the road to the taxi rank. 6. There is a food hall in the shopping centre in which the hotel is built upon. I thoroughly enjoyed my time in the hotel, and would not hesitate to stay there again in the future.In the big picture of things, prices for Singapore in general are not cheap, but then again, that is Singapore. If you want ultra cheap, then stay in a back packers, or travel to another country.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: 66princess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in early February. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and allowed us to check in super early and also upgraded our room (which may have been due to my husband's Advantage membership card). We had a fantastic view across to the Marina Bay Sands. The room (on Level 16) was quite spacious, the bed was comfortable though we had major issues with the shower - water streamed through a gap in the glass door and onto the bathroom floor. We had to lie a couple of towels on the floor to soak up the water. There's an ample selection for breakfast including Asian dishes, pastries, waffles, fruit, fresh omelettes etc. The pool area is large though somewhat average. The gym is adequate offering both cardio machines and weights. The location is great - walk out of the hotel and there's a large number of restaurants within Clarke Quay. A food court beneath the hotel is definitely worth a visit for cheap/quick eats.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KartikSharma29
Reviews.Content: I got a fair deal , with my Advntageplus card. + a upgrade to one of the higher / newly renovated floors . The hotel starts on the 8th floor onwards - floors below is a shopping mall . Rooms are clean / with stunning views of the clarke quay centre / ship building etc . You might want to ask them for a good view room . Food at the coffee shop isnt that great , but you can eat at the food court at the adjoining mall. - Also the gym as as small as a garage . Quite unexpected for Novotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good standard Novotel”
Reviews.Author: raura
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a wotif.com deal. Very expensive but so were all hotels during this week due to major Singapore event. Reception is on lvl 7 which is a little bit different. Nice rooms, good views of the city. Nice bathroom, good shower. Good TV channels. Gym quite small but ok. Taxi rank downstairs was 10 min wait at 9am which was fine. Close to Metro STN, and lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Alexandriad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night last August. Upgraded to a bigger room as I am an Accor member, it was large with a fantastic view and very quiet. The only downside was that it was dated and could do we a refresh, however for the price it was good and we didn't spend a lot of time there. The staff set up a cot on request and provided us with a pram (a little old and wonky but perfectly fine) to use as ours got lost on the flight. Breakfast was very good and the staff were very friendly. Good location to walk to the river and a train line nearby. The only real downside was that we had a package which included some extras, the reception forgot to talk to us about these so when we went to get the bus pass it was a bit of a hassle. Would be great if reception could check these things on check-in. A really good 4 star hotel, with everything you could ask for provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, 7-11, Macdonald's, supermarket next door!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelhkHongKong
Reviews.Content: Great location, heaps of food available at the food court next to the hotel. Clarke Quay is just 2 mins from the hotel. Make sure you choose the room away from Clarke Quay side if you want a quite sleep. However, if you want the view of Sands Hotel and the vibrant colour changing dome, choose a room facing Sands. 10 mins to the nearest MRT station (Clarke Quay). Supermarket with Sashimi, japnese style food and even Waygu beef direct from Japan. Close to China Town and most attractions, Taxi/cab usually within S$10 to most places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: kingbob494
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, the service was great, the room was good clean, staff is very friendly and very quick to any request during out stay. The location is amazing. Definitely would stay here if I go to Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “very good, great views.”
Reviews.Author: mark c
Reviews.Content: Getting upgraded always helps a review, however the newly refurbished club lounge, friendly and helpful service and excellent location clinch it. Couldn't fault it. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: AussiesBallarat
Reviews.Content: Had enjoyable 3 days at comfortable hotel near river. Had room on 23rd floor with access to Premier Lounge, where the service was excellent. Took breakfast in the lounge each day, dropped in for drink/coffee during day, drink and snacks in evening, internet access. Room had view over river towards the bay, with wheel and skypark mesmerising. Restaurant buffet was good, but a la carte also available. However had dearest lemon, lime and bitters anywhere I have been from the bar (SGD$11!). Can walk to Orchard Rd. Lots of eateries in Clark Quay area. Concierge staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's an OK one..”
Reviews.Author: AnyC3
Reviews.Content: The room is a bit dirty with some stains on the wall, curtains & bathroom. Totally the opposite of the lobby lounge..modern & clean. The staff at the front desk/reception didn't seem to know what they're doing (slow & unskilled), also a bit rude. Not many smiley faces but the concierge guys friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms.highly over priced”
Reviews.Author: HolidayAdvisorIndia
Reviews.Content: Pathetic and poor service.very rude staff with poor training. Poorly maintained rooms.anything one asked for took over fifteen minutes.bathroom supplies totally inadequate.breakfast repetitive And poor. Very slow billing process. Billed us twice and we had to wait for fifteen days before the charge was reversed and that too after many calls.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: AussieKC03
Reviews.Content: Room: Stayed 6 nights in a superior room over NYE 2011/2012. Was quite a spacious good size room with modern TV, minibar, iron & board, safe, wardrobe. Unable to get onto the small balcony as the door was locked. Sleep Quality: Twin King beds were quite comfortable. In European style, only a doona is provided. Room was very dark for sleeping. Given the city centre location, room was quiet from any street noise. Bathroom: Separate bath and shower. Shower was excellent with terrific water pressure and plenty of hot water. I didn’t use the bath. Clean with plenty of clean towels (including face washers) supplied and changed regularly. Food: B/fast: Wide variety of asian and western style from the buffet of good quality (although was a little pricey if paying full fare for b/fast). Also had the evening buffet on NYE. Again, so much to choose from and was very good in quality. Was a very enjoyable evening. Location: An excellent location in Clarke Quay and an easy walking distance (7-10mins) from Clarke Quay Metro station. The metro is super easy to use, making it easy to get to other parts of Singapore. The hotel is located above a shopping centre which also has a food court (asian options) as well as Subway and McDonalds. 7-11 is also nearby. Service: Disappointing and very average from the reception staff. Concierge tried to be helpful but at times their information was not always accurate. Food and Bev staff was average. Value for money: At ~£140 per night for a twin bed superior room, I felt this was OK vale, esp given the time of year. Wi-fi was not complimentary but they do provide Macs for guest use in the foyer (usually a queue for this though). Other: Good, clean hotel in a very good location and would recommend for a stay in Singapore if you can minimise your interaction with the staff. Quite a lot of construction going on near to the hotel so the pool area was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Still have not found a Singapore Hotel I would be happy to return to.”
Reviews.Author: karabatraveller
Reviews.Content: I have visited Singapore for leisure a few times, and never stayed in the same hotel twice. I am a creature of habit and would usually like to stay in the same place each time if I found it good, such as the Traders in KL. However in Singapore I have always had 'hotel issues'. The conclusion I have come to, is Singapore is not really set up for families; which is strange given the high volume of family orientated activities the city has to offer. We chose Novotel this time due to its reasonable price, and that it offers accomodation FOC for children under 16 years of age. The catch we found, is they may offer inclusive accomodation, but they don't supply a bed for them! Upon check in, even though we had specified two adults and one child aged thirteen (with a printed document), they said they had no available rollaways for the thirteen year old, with the excuse it was Chinese New Year. Interestingly, when I had casually asked the porter earlier if he was busy, his answer was the hotel is 'always busy Sir, but occupancy is low becasue people go home to their families'. This was not the story from reception. After reluctanly taking at face value we woud be given a room with two queen beds, we found the beds were even smaller than double beds. After returning to reception to advise we just could not sleep two adults and one thriteen year old in two large singles, I was again told they were queen sized. After a few phone calls I was approached by the night manager and told that they now had a rollaway (apparantly someone had just checked out - although strange someone had check out at 8:30pm). The manager also confirmed the hotel does not have any rooms with queen sized beds. We went to get some food at the conveniently located resturants in Clarke Quay, and upon return, the rollaway was still not provided. A call to housekeeping, and another call to reception, the rollaway was supplied a little later. The remainder of the stay was thankfully without fuss. Expect until the third day when the thriteen year old develped little bites all over. We could not confirm exactlymwhat they were, but developed new ones the next night. We suspected bed bugs as they were not mosquito bite sized. Rooms were decorated nicely with a very modern feel, a good bedside console to operate all electrical items such as lights, TV and Aircon. There was a little mould in the bathroom and carpets looked aged. Forget the breakfast in the resturant, even at SDG$25++ with children free, better food can be sourced at the food court under the hotel, or even McDonalds if you are not keen on local food. The local food was very cheap, and more appealing. Staff in the resurant at breakfast were unresponsive and appeared bored with soing their jobs. Service was not forthcoming unless asked for, and even then, came with more of a grimmace than a smile. Having said this, the Novotel was the most reasonably priced found in Singapore for the star rating. Singapore hotels are always pricey, and difficult to find hotels to accomodate children without purchasing an additional room (which is what we were 'offered'). As with most hotels in Singapore, internet is very expensive, and the 'package' offered rediculous. Better off getting a prepaid SIM card and getting 1GB for SDG$7 which lasts seven days. The location great for nightlife, and MRT very close, made it easy to get anywhere in Singapore. I still haven't found a hotel in Singapore which I would return to, and maybe I won't, but suggest hotel staff are sent to Malaysia for hospitality training, as the Malays do it much better. I love Singapore, and will return, but probably to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views from the room”
Reviews.Author: sporetravel01
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night in the suite which is amazing. Spacious with a huge bathroom. Bathroom has a jacuzzi which was fantastic. A pity there is no separate standing hower in the bathroom. They also had a nespresson coffee maker in the suite. 2 LCD tvs in the suite. Bed was kindda soft. MBS and the singapore flyer can be seen clearly from the windows. Breakfast at the main restaurant had more variety than the executive lounge but it is very crowded. Service at the executive lounge is good. The room is quite noisy from the noise from the clubs in clarke quay at night. Pool was dated and small. Didn't quite enjoy my swim there. Overall had an enjoyable stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Is location important to you?”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_hoppy
Reviews.Content: We had another enjoyable 10 day stay at the Novotel. Location - is fantastic right in the heart of Clarke Quay, with numerous restaurants and night clubs. A short walk to Clarke Quay MRT under the Central Shopping Centre or Chinatown (use the Clarke Quay MRT underground to Eu Tong Sen street. Once outside the station it is only a five minute walk). The hotel is located in a building which has a supermarket and bread shop in the basement, a food court, and the usual fast food outlets, plus ATMs on the ground floor. The next four floors have numerous shops, like books, electronics and gift shops. The ‘hop-on-hop-off’ tour buses stop at Clarke Quay as well. Room - We had a modern spacious King bed room which looked out to River Point and Robertson Quay. It had the usual stuff, but with more … a DVD, iPod docking station and pod coffee machine. We were on the Premier floor and wonderfully looked after by Lucia and her team Aira, Angelo, Syahidah and Don. A Premier Floor booking entitles you to: • a 'personalised' check-in and check-out services on the Premier floor • breakfast in the lounge • evening 'happy hour’ and • free WIFI in your room and the lounge I must say if you want to feel special, pay the extra and book a room on the Premier floor.

Reviews.Title: “It does what it says on the tin!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Petemcc
Reviews.Content: A bit of a late review from September 2011, but I am going back again in March. I have had a love-hate relationship with the Novotel over 6 stays because I hate to say I love it! Each time I go to book again I read reviews, and see all these bad ones and think, WTF, is the same place, same staff? Look, when I arrived last time I was an idiot and left my bumbag in the taxi, with my passport etc in it. It wasn't until I got upstairs to reception that I realised what had happened. No worries, ?Mohammed the evening concierge/manager told me they would rewind the security tapes, get the taxi's registration number, phone the company, speak to the driver and get my bag back. They did and I did! Excellent. The thing about Singapore hotels is they are expensive by anyone's standards, and what you may pay for 5 star + in some parts of the world is barely 1 star in Singapore. It's expensive so take it on the chin. The Novotel is expensive, but not as expensive as many and to be honest the rooms are as big as any you will find in Singapore, and everything, although not 100%, lined with gold, staff on your beck and call, is a hotel which in my opinion does the job and what it says. I have never had a bad stay yet. Yes, I get annoyed with Singapore ++ rates, no free internet (but note the free computers in the lobby), and stupid drink and food prices, but I have learned to work around that and I come back to a comfortable room, nice bed, everything works, and of course the location is fantastic. Going for my seventh stay, need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel !”
Reviews.Author: MissFreo
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Singapore and enjoyed our stay at Novotel Clarke Quay. We were lucky to be on the 20th floor and overlooking Fort Canning Park, so did not have a problem with the noisy nightclubs in Clarke Quay. However we could still hear them faintly well into the night so I can understand people staying on a lower floor would have noise issues. Room was spacious with a king bed and two foldaway beds put in for our children and still had room to move. Never had a problem with hot water and the bathroom was definitely not pokey! Never had a problem with renovation work so maybe they have finished that now. Found all the staff pleasant and professional. Breakfast was great with plenty of options for different nationalities. We had free wifi in our rooms too...part of the internet deal when we booked. There is a 7-11 right next to the hotel for late night snacks and a Starbucks for a coffee fix! Also a 24 hour Mcdonalds if you are in need of junk food! Easy walking distance along the river to Marina Bay and also to Chinatown. Five minute walk to Clarke Quay MRT next to Central shopping Ctr. Clarke Quay is great for strolling around during the day but a bit too crowded at night especially Friday and Saturday nights when the nightclub crowd descends on it. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Novotel !

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Eglevit
Reviews.Content: Our group of 7 people including 3 small kids recently stayed in this hotel at the Executive floor for 4 days. The staff was very helpful and quick, the rooms are comfortable, the breakfast is good. The only downside is the pool which is too cold to swim in the morning or in the evening. Maybe because of that it's always empty during that time of the day. Other than that is perfect. The location is good for exploring the city by foot. Close to china town, marina bay, on the riverfront of Clark quay, full of different restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience, makes us question the Novotel brand”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay on the Premier floor en route to Europe to meet family for Christmas, and had really wanted to relax after finishing work for the year and this was part of my husband's birthday celebrations. Yes, the location is good; and the beds are very comfortable. However, there were 2 major areas of extreme disappointment. One was the lack of hot water in the bathroom, despite running the shower (not environmentally-friendly, so why recycle your towels) for extended periods of time. We reluctantly complained, and John Chetty did everything that he could to get this fixed on multiple attempts. We fear that room 2312 has gremlins in it and would advise anyone who is given this room to ask for another immediately. The problems with lack of hot water seems to be a common theme in other reviews we have since read on Tripadvisor. The other major area of discontent was the renovations underway, and the way that this was not managed as promised in writing to guests by Simon Jones, the Resident Manager. We were provided with information that ïntermittent noise disturbance and reverberations"might be experienced, between 9:30am and 6:30pm. The noise was much more than intermittent and it extended way past this time. One evening it took an hour of our time to insist to that the workmen leave the building when it was still noisy at 9pm. Having travelled for 22 hours the previous day, we resented having to give up our valuable time to get some resolution to the noise issue. The offer of a late checkout does not really restore our faith in the Novotel Clarke Quay, nor in Novotel generally. Unfortunately, we left with the impression that the Hotel was content with playing catch-up only if people complained, rather than building quality in from the beginning. Hot water and a good night's sleep are basic expectations of a hotel guest, and this hotel did not meet our needs on this occasion. The good location, the good staff, the large rooms did not make up for these shortcomings. We had wanted something extra special and paid the extra money to stay on the Premier floor, but felt that the value was not there. We believe there are better accommodation options in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Swan29
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in mid-January having booked in the Accor 40% Super Sale in November. We had a room with 2 double beds on the 16th floor overlooking the river. The room was comfortable and the bathroom standard is very good with separate bath and shower. Getting to your room from the street level is a bit of a palava as you need to get one lift to the 7th floor where reception is located and then another set of lifts to your room but there are plenty of lifts and you don't usually find yourself waiting. Reception also has 5 PCs for internet use along the lift corridor - you have to stand up to use them which seems a very good idea as this promotes turnover at busy times. The pool is excellent - it is a very good size for laps and there is plenty of shade if you just want to relax by the pool. The hotel sits atop a shopping centre with a food court which I recommend for tasty cheap meals as the hotel meals are pretty expensive. All-in-all a great central location in Singapore. We have stayed there before and I am sure we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and full of nice surprises”
Reviews.Author: gwwyjjliu
Reviews.Content: A week in Singapore at the Novotel Hotel Clarke Quay was an excellent experience. The location right next door to Clarke Quay, a bustling restaurant/nightclub/entertainment district, could not be more ideal. The hotel sits atop a nice mall and is a quick 5 minute walk from Central Mall and the MRT station. It is 1 quick subway stop from Orchard Rd., Chinatown, Little India, and a pleasant 20 minute tree-lined riverfront stroll to Marina Bay Sands. The Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay, in keeping with other Novotels of this name, has stylish, European contemporary decor, with excellent, efficient service. Pleasant surprises abound, like scented aromatherapy candles in the lobby, a bank of iMacs for guest use, an iPad in the bar for the adults and an Xbox 360 for the kids. Housekeeping was efficient and left thoughtful touches like extra water bottles and toiletries. Our spacious, upgraded room featured sweeping views of the riverfront and Singapore's skyline, and had excellent amenties and, like everything else in the city, was spotlessly clean. Despite its proximity to Clarke Quay, where the bars and clubs are open until 5:00 AM, noise was never a problem due to the excellent soundproofing. Other facilities at the Novotel were top-notch. A second set of elevators lead directly from the lobby to the mall below, so you can shop and get a bite to eat at the excellent food court without ever having to leave the building. The breakfast buffet was of very high quality, with varied choices that we never tired of eating here for 6 days straight. The restaurant overlooked a superb rooftop outdoor pool filled with lush tropical foliage and featured panoramic city views and lots of spacious lounging area. The fitness center is compact but efficient, with a single multi-station weight machine and some treadmills. Overall, the Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay is an outstanding property and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jmkn_12
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on Clark Quay - great for evening strolling and dining and people watching. Very helpful staff. V gd rooms with wonderful views of the extraordinary city. V gd brakfasts in the hotel.Free internet service in the lobby. V easy to get taxis all over , which are incredibly ccheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HARCal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early January, 2012 for a one week business trip. This is a standard issue Novotel and similar to the one I stay at in London which is why I decided to stay at this hotel. It is perfect for a middle of the road budget business hotel. The hotel is totally functional and the room, though small by North American standards has all the appointments you would expect from a European hotel (everything is built in). For a business hotel, the room has a good desk, good internet access and all the plug ins to connect to the TV / Monitor in the room. This is especially helpful if you are testing any type of demo or presentation for a client. The hotel has a Starbucks in the building (the attached mall) and a full food court and a 7 Eleven. I only ate once at the hotel restaurant for a buffet breakfast and found the food quality to be at a much lower standard than the Novotel in Hammersmith, London. Therefore I ate breakfast at the Starbucks and lunch in the food court when I was working in my room (the food court is much cheaper than the hotel and the food was great as it was all local cuisine. The hotel is walking distance to Orchard Street if you are into shopping (lot's of good restaurants as well) and walking distance to Raffles and the MRT. You are right on the Singapore River and there are lots of places to have meal and drink in the evening. I would definitely go back here if I return for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Standard business hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Anna N
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for almost 2 weeks while on business in Singapore. The rooms are clean, modern and have everything you would expect from a business hotel. Additional perks is the lovely service, especially at breakfast. They knew my name after a couple of days and always ensured I had a good table. Wireless network worked well through out the hotel and came included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated for enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: frances m
Reviews.Content: This spot is perfect for nightlife round Clarke Quay and general exploration, just minutes from the MRT and Chinatown. Try Brewerkz, just across the river, great beers, and the Pumpoom on the quay. Service here is good, everything as you would expect from a well run Novotel. Very comfortable rooms. The breakfast is well worth getting up early for.

Reviews.Title: “Going Back. Brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: aussiechick000
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of our stay was good. Great room with view, excellent location, nice executive lounge (kids not allowed after 6pm - fair enough). Unfortunately we booked a standard taxi for our return journey, but a luxurious-but-expensive maxi taxi was ordered for us. We had to ask them to return to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for city views etc.”
Reviews.Author: Speedbird001
Reviews.Content: Central hotel so if location's your driver this one is fine. Breakfast melee not for me after first night and "coffee" simply awful so went for the Exec upgrade which was very, very, very good and for this alone I will probably return but tempted by Swisshotel and nicer Fort Cannon if one has some free time. Don't forget the service charge and tax on everything. My room safe was broken and no attempt to fix was made during my longish business stay. What irritated the most was the late check out fee of half a day's charge for 5 hours. Greedy and a bit scruffy but the location's good and the Exec Lounge excellent with brilliant staff and good coffee. Hotels are getting us to check in later and out earlier to save on cleaning staff but rooms serviced here nice and early unless one's on a LCO when totally ignored.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we'met kindly front desk officer and good amenity,in general the services is good. The room is good especially outside view we can see boatquay's river. So the best thing we like is about restaurant there is many resto n cafe,it's easy for us to find any kind of foodfrom many country.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay thanks”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had another good stay on Executive floor at Novotel Clark Quay. The premier floors are always good value and this time I was upgarded to a suite. I have stayed at the hotel several times before and I noticed he room and the lounge had been refurbished. The service is excellent with friendly and helpful staff. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but smokers on non-smoking floors are tolerated.”
Reviews.Author: Adrian182
Reviews.Content: We stayed a bit over a week in a premier, non-smoking floor. The hotel was undergoing renovations during the day while we were there. There was noise during the day, and it was not mentioned prior to our arrival. We were generally happy, except when our room started stinking of heavy cigarette smoke half way into the week. We made a complaint, and were assured it would be fixed. It continued. We demanded another room on another floor, they helpfully obliged. Reception told us that they could do nothing about the guest, despite them smoking on a non-smoking floor, "under Singaporean law". The room we were changed to stank in the bathroom like water had made its way into the walls/floor and had not drained properly. Internet access was included under our package and was fast and reliable 802.11n wifi. Breakfast was also good. Other than the hotel requiring renovation (which seems to be underway) and their reluctance to turf out guests who smoke on non-smoking floors (disgusting and highly inconsiderate), the hotel was generally good.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great trip but we did request an early check in as our flight was 7.30am this was confirmed but on the morning of our stay we could not get in till after 12pm - not good. Room was wonderful, service was at a good standard but the mess around for the early check in was not acceptible. Specially when they would sell us a room but not offer the early check in.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel is novotel -try your best to avoid it”
Reviews.Author: c-preference
Reviews.Content: Great location but 1. reception couldn't find the booking in the system 2. was given a stained room 3. the view was terrible 4. could not use the A-plus advantage points what's good 1. great concierge staff with excellent recommendations

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Novotel and it was fantastic. The rooms were clean, staff very friendly and helpful. Free internet on the macs out front and they even allowed free printouts for our online check-ins. Great experience overall.....We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and at the right spot”
Reviews.Author: Ch B
Reviews.Content: This hotel at Clarck quay is the right hotel at the right spot. Not a cheap hotel though value for money as it is located next to clarck quay. For the rest it is a efficient modern and elegantly decorated hotel. Not lavished but efficient and straight forward.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treat for Wife”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay was okay but we were very disappopinted firstly because the DVD Player was out of order so we could not watch our film on DVD that we brought along. Then when we requested for just an hour extension in checking out because our twin granddaughters were visiting us, we were turned down. Because of these two situations, I may not likely be renewing my membership.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Travelled with teenage boys, with interconnecting rooms. Location of Novotel was excellent. Felt very comfortable for the boys 14 & 17 to wander downstairs to the shopping centre by themselves. Nice clean food court at very reasonable prices SGD4-6 & great variety. Concierge were very helpful, reception was always polite. Gym was ill equipped and very cramped. Amazing access to nightlife,

Reviews.Title: “Great view nice location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I believe this is the best accor range of hotel in Singapore at the moment. They have a wonderful location, situation near the basin where you could run for the morning. They have a wonderful pool, DEEP over 3m and wonderful. The room are clean and big. The staff are very friendly. The morning buffet is nice and wide.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you can get if for a good price”
Reviews.Author: bjml9901
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way back from Uk to Australia with 2 adults and 2 children. When we arrived at 7pm we were advised that our room was ready but they would need to put the beds in the room for the kids. They did this but only one so then had to ask for another to be set up. I wish this had been done before our arrival as sitting there for 30 minutes while this happens when you have just got of a long flight was a little annoying. But overall very happy with the hotel. Rooms were a good size with balcony but it was locked and you are not given a key to it a bit strange. Breakfast is good with lots of choices. Pool is also nice. Check out is not until 12 miday and the nice thing is you can leave your luggage and then go and use the pool until your flight if it is a late night one.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: iirlane
Reviews.Content: Ok, the breakfast is great, the hotel is huge and well located, but is it too much to ask for hot water for a shower? I've tred to have my second of my stay here and it only runs cold.... i've complained and all they could suggest was to let the water run....fives minutes and a load of wasted water later it is still cold...this is not good enough in a hotel of this category.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and food”
Reviews.Author: katacove
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel to stay in, clean and comfortable. Try and get the Clarke Quay side, as you will have a better view and wont hear the construction next door. Staff are great and I really enjoyed the buffet breakfast and diner, especially the diner with great seafood. The bacon and lamb were a let down though, maybe chef should use Australian bacon and NZ lamb? AC was a bit cold, but that was easily handled. I will be back, thanks

Reviews.Title: “Check for upgrade work first !!”
Reviews.Author: no1smeghead Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, rooms and cleanliness...... however two drawbacks - one the hotel could easily remedy and the other you should ask before booking. We were in the high $ premium suites so very good rooms, lounge plus bedroom. There were however no instructions on how to use the equipment in the rooms. After calling maintenance (who turned up very promptly) we were shown that the way to switch the TV to the DVD input was by putting your hand down the left handside of the TV , finding the 3rd button down and pressing it until the appropriate TV input was discovered. Also the spa/jacuzzi in the bathroom didnt work until an unmarked lightswitch in the bedroom was turned on. Simple user guide fixes this and saves the mntce man a trip in the lift !! NOT so good was the fact that the hotel is being refurbished ..... the noise didnt help with trying to recover from the longhaul flight... this was a minor inconvenience compared to the smell of the paint which seemed able to permiate all throught the upper floor .... and with the windows being locked it was hard to get the smell out. A packet of nurofen was required to manage the resulting headaches over the stay. So if they werent refurbishing the hotel I would definately recommend it ...... but before I book a premium suite again I will be checking whether the painter man is going to be around or not - - because if he is then it is holiday ruined. cheers

Reviews.Title: “Very specious!”
Reviews.Author: misoTokyo
Reviews.Content: Pretty close to Orchard. (Just a short bus ride or if you have the energy, you could walk from Orchard.) Just a short stroll to Clark Quay MRT station. Very specious hotel room. We had 2 extra beds in becuase we were staying as a family of 4 (2 children and 2 adults) They gave us a nice X'mas present (cookies) which was nice. Free Internet at the lobby was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: zeffac Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the center of Singapore Entertainment destination. Perfect location for the New years.Everything is near to the hotel. Room was good spacious.Bathroom was clean. The concierge was helpful. There is a starbucks, Subway, McDs, and Kraze Burgers outlet right under the hotel.Very near to the Clarke Quay MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian G
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Close to Clarke Quay for restaurants and shops. Excellent breakfast buffet. Best thing about this hotel are the staff, really make you feel welcome and treat everyone like a VIP!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel located in Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: ttpluto
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, priced as you'd expect for Singapore. Staff was ok, some much better than others. Location couldn't be better, a short walk to the Singapore's excellent underground. The room had a bit of a smell to it, but service was quick to come and rectify (though it didn't do much to curb the smell which came from the plumbing). Other than that, I'd recommend it as a place to stay in Clarke Quay overall, especially if you are visiting Singapore for the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, but....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to MRS (train station), restaurants and shops and the staffs are nice, but I was a little bit disappointed. One night we woke up by a false alarm, the other night we were without electricity for a period and when I removed the protector of the mattress it was dirty and the bed was not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “New Year firework on your window”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, at 7th floor and above of Liang Court Building. Very close to food centre along the river. Food will always available supported by McD and some other 24hrs restaurant. During New Year eve, since I was lately arrived at the hotel, at midnight you don't have to go to Marina bay to see firework show , just open your curtain and enjoy the show

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Su Woon W
Reviews.Content: spent halloween's night there as we wanted a place to sleep in after all the booze and partying. for tourists, it will be a GREAT location if u love going for drinks at night. clarke quay which has many many drinking places right at ur doorstep. the hotel is also located right above a shopping mall. the shopping mall isnt super popular, which is good for some window shopping if u dun like crowds. many japanese restaurants in the mall too, plus a big japanese supermarket! if u want a place right next to the metro station, this might not be a good choice then. its a good 10-15 minutes walk to the nearest station? room is pretty decent for a 4-5 star hotel. service was ok. complimentary parking coupon has got a stupid policy of one coupon per room. many hotels offer all guests with cars a coupon each. i had to run an errand, therefore i asked for an additional coupon as i will need to exit the hotel twice. rigid staff couldnt give me a satisfactory explanation, but kept repeating to me "no, no, one per room, blah blah". pretty frustrating moment there. wun mind booking it again if we are gonna have another partying night nearby!

Reviews.Title: “experience with Novotel Clarke Q”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: quite satisfied.... closed to Clarke Q area..... the pillow is bit too hard ... and the construction / renovation work that was going on during my stay is bit annoying,.... fortunately it happened in the working hours while most of the time I was away....

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Nice location in Clarke Quay, within walking distance to several restaurants and bars. Excellent view of the city from my room. You can hear the music coming from the bars on Friday and Saturday nights, but wasn't deafening. Overall, I'd recommend this hotel to other vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise experience”
Reviews.Author: ABWidodo
Reviews.Content: Just realized that this hotel location is within of ... ehm what the right phrase .... FOOD PARADISE!!!. (Very very) Fit-in for person who claimed as foodish. Name it all thing about foods. Dont worry if you are hungry at late of night. I have ate satay, very delicious one. If you love night life, this is one of the right places to joint it. But, if you want "peacefully" night, you can get it in this hotel. I have around trip in several country and many hotels, in Novotel it was surprised that they provide condom in the room, surprise!!! I have no opinion on it. Anyway, very easy to reach this hotel, coz near with MRT station (NE5 Clarkequay). You only walk not more 500 meters to reach this hotel from that MRT station. Regardless condom experience (ha ha ha), definetly I will stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so so service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was messy everyday. The coffee machine was a hassle and frustrating for everyone including the employees. One day the light went off for 15 min but the whole breakfast became chaotic, nothing was working and the staff vanished. The front desk manager is not pleasant at all, although all the rest of the front desk was nice. The rooms are fine, the location is great, not sure if it is worth what we paid for. I would recommend but try not to interact with the managers...

Reviews.Title: “SECOND TIME AT NOVOTEL CLARK QUAY AND LOVING IT”
Reviews.Author: Colin F
Reviews.Content: I was back at Novotel Clark Quay in late September for two days of meeting for a major contract. Assiatant manager John Chetty recognised the importance of us having more space to work in and upgraded the three of us to the Executive Level floor. The extra space and great service allowed us to work more effectively and also gave us the best chance to wind down once the deal was done. It has one of the best Executive lounges that I have been in. Staff were friendly and very supportive and made you feel very much as if you were the only guest in the hotel. Well done Executive Level team. Back there next week for more great service. Keep up the good work John and your very friendly team. This is definately the best value business hotel in Singapore with all of the pleasures of Singapore right at your door.

Reviews.Title: “No warning about construction”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Novotel Clarke Key after a delayed flight from Franfurt meant we arrived at 7am instead of 8pm the previous night. After spending a fortune on dropped, or never ending 'on-hold' calls from Germany to Singapore to try to inform the hotel we would check in 12 hrs late we finally got through to confirm our res. After we checked in we had breakfast then decided we needed a couple of hours power-nap so as to be able to enjoy day in Singapore but this turned out to be more of a waking nightmare as coonstruction started on the floor above everyday at at 9am rendering sleep impossible. After complaining the hotel offered a rather pathetic 5% reduction on one nights stay. I will not stay here again, and Accor just lost a frequest traveller with Gold status. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at the best location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated next to the river with a mall right below and a convenience store at the entrance of the hotel. Its quite near Marina Bay Sands and not far from Universal Studios. Rooms are great and felt new and sheets and towels also felt new. Would definitely stay there again at the right prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It's located in strategic places, close to places to eat and hang out next to the river. Walking along the side of the river to Clark Quay MRT is an unforgettable moment, both in the morning or at night. The hotel provides breakfast with many choices, tastes good, and outstanding service. The children get it free. Is a fun holiday.

Reviews.Title: “New Year Celebrations”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is our third time at the Novotel Hotel at Clarkes Quay. We usually fly in for New Year Celebrations and stay at the Novotel as it is in a great location.
