Surrounded by restaurants and bars that have live groups playing for New Year. The hotel is very nice and there is a food court and mall in the building adjacent to the hotel. The room we had this time was a queen room and had been recently renovated, so nice and clean but a little bit too basic. There were no drawers in the room and only one chair at the computer and one chair to sit and watch tv or relax. As we had a 13yr old child with us, it was a tight squeeze to say the least. I preferred the old style rooms, it was much more comfortable. Next year I will re think where we might choose to stay. I like a bit of comfort too!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great facilities and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisch79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in transit from Australia to London. We were given a free upgrade on check-in to a better room, where we were really impressed. The room rate we booked included in-room internet, which was very fast. The selection of TV channels was quite extensive, and all of the staff we interacted with were particularly friendly. The manager met us on check-out and helped us to take our bags down to the concierge desk for later collection. For those who may not have internet access included in their rate, there are 5 iMacs located near reception which can be used free-of-charge. The breakfast selections were fresh and extensive, and the room service was fresh and delicious. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's not Novotel standard”
Reviews.Author: emilierolin
Reviews.Content: What a dissapointment! We usually really like the Accor Hôtels because their quality in terms of services is insured. Well, it was not the case this time and it was actually pretty Bad. It began right away at the Check-in where we had to wait 15 minuts even though we were only two to Check-in at that time. Then, the guy at the counter was not pleasant. They only gave us one key which was not practical for the two of us. It continued the following day where we had the chance to hear a hammer. After complaining, we heard that the room upstairs was under renovation. They didn't even propose us an other room or some kind of reumbursment. We don't even mention the breakfast which was a jungle... Well, we will never go back there. What a loss of money...

Reviews.Title: “Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My stay there is good except that the hotel swimming pool is not suitable for my young children who are 7, 5 and 3 each, the pool is too deep for them; so they were quite disappointed. Perhaps the hotel can consider to have some space or other facilitiy e.g. indoor game room for children.

Reviews.Title: “Very good base for visiting Singapore”
Reviews.Author: editionsofyou
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights over Xmas and provided you ate elsewhere this represented very good value for money. Good location next to Clarke Quay attractions. The standard room was comfortable, clean and everything worked efficiently. No bath but the shower was walk in and invigorating. Staff helpful and keen. Only tried the breakfast once since it was so busy and stuff was running out but the Starbucks next door was good and also overcame the silly charging for in room wifi. Pool good and fitness room very good. If you can get a deal here then highly recommended. Front of house manager really helpful when we needed to deal with a problem with return flight.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant getaway. Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eng_lee Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near nice restaurants and shopping. If you like pubs, nearby Clark Quay has a whole range to sample. The hotel is right next to a mall where you could easily get snacks and fruits. A-Club has some excellent deals which was how we secured this room for a staycation.

Reviews.Title: “Cigarette Smoke smelling room (for a supposedly smoke free room)”
Reviews.Author: Santi59
Reviews.Content: Arrived midmorning from London en route to Perth for two nights, only to have a room that really smelt like it had been smoked in - not great for two asthmatics, only offered to spray room with some deodorizer (made little difference). Sprayed Chanel no. 5 to minimize awful stink. Shower was cold on early morning departure and only of the three of us had one at 5am in the morning to get flight. Never ever revisit this awful hotel for us. The in-house Indian restaurant and staff in indian reataurant were a redeeming feature, as were the breakfast staff and meals. But not enough to return to stay in a poky smokey smelly room for non-smokers. Our clothes we'd used still stunk when got them out of the case in Perth.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place - to stay and do business”
Reviews.Author: AMITSPVERMA
Reviews.Content: This was special - as we chose this hotel to stay as well to have our business review meetings to happen in their executive board room. Though we heard some stories about how the construction was hampering and invading privacy, i would say the three days and two nights we stayed over were fabulous. It is bang on the quay with lots of eateries and just a short drive away from Orchid road the shopping paradise as well as further eateries on the side of the river - very nice and approachable. It is kind of landmark and with few shopping complexes around - it is more than sufficient for a city jaunt as well. Did not get time to do some sight seeing. The room was nice and comfortable - which was duly upgraded when we checked in. Nice cosy room - with good morning breakfast served in their coffeeshop. Even the room service that we used for a night was very good. Staff were nice and friendly and the concierges were always there to give you a hand. Internet in the room is great but the noticeable feature is the free internet enabled Macs that you can use in their lobby. The conference room and banquet facilities were quite decent and they had dedicated staff put up to take care of our requirements. The boardroom was pretty standard in nature but very functional with all neccessary details . Only one let down was their indian resturant - Mahal, which was very average to say the least. Every thing screamed out of place right from decor to food to presentation - which made this resturant look like the cynasore on this hotel opluence. Food was too oily and no taste - the decor was bland and so was the food - you cant do this to Indian food and that too in Singapore - I could have pardoned it for a far away place in Japan or Scandavian region but not here - it was Bad. Hence - overall four stars - it is worth a place where you want to go and stay whenever there.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with NOVOTEL”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: I am happy with their price and service. I enjoyed the stay with novotel singapore & shanghai. Both are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “December 2011 stay”
Reviews.Author: myshka2
Reviews.Content: Novotel, Singapore, having stayed previously, thought a good place as central to bars,cafes and 10 min. walk to the old China town. However, the first night and upgrade to the 25th floor, views great, fridge not working! Arrived back in Singapore 23rd December for 4 nights, firidge not working, cooler in the room! This is a real problem when people have certain medication which must be kept under 4 deg! Rouge coctail bar, happy hour (not so happy) buy 1 round 2nd round free, so had our 2 drinks ane decided to have a meal, the bar tender requested we sign our bar bill,fortunatly I checked it, charged for 4 drinks so refused to sign this caused a real disturbance! Dining room another experience advertised a buffet, so I requested al-a carte as we were not very hungary, no not possible, so we had the buffett WELL, that was an experince dry chicken,rice, worst meal ever, @ like $38 pp. And then we still had hassles with our bar bill requested to sign yet again for 4 drinks! We did a silly thing pre-booked Christmas lunch @ like $48 pp, UGH worst meal ever, would you believe scrambled egg, chicken sausages and has browns (from breakfast!!!) tiny bit of ham size of a postage stamp! yuk, will not be going back! But please note that after the bar incindent we had a lady called Justine very effcient, helpfull the only credit I may add she will go a long way!

Reviews.Title: “very good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: CSoph
Reviews.Content: very good family hotel for Xmas break. good location (close to Little India, MRT and Chinatown, 30 mn from airport). Very friendly staff, particularly with kids. good breakfast, comfortable and quiet rooms, though located in a very touristic area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to stay at Novotel Clarke Quay, we availed of their scratch & win promo with breakfast, unlimited internet, city tour plus the discount. We were very satisfied with the services. The staff were very friendly & helpful. Good location. Will definitely stay at Novotel again & will recommend this hotel to our friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel where you are welcomed back”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and this time I alone, have been staying at Novotel Clarke Quay many times. The location is excellent (only a few minutes from the MRT) and Clarke Quay is an attractive place with many opportunities to enjoy yourself. The staff are attentive and, what a surprise, they recognised me from earlier visits, treating you like an "old friend",

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located in an attractive part of the city with easy transportation services to business and tourist areas of the city. Within walking distance of Clarke Quay which contains many entertainment and eating high spots. Hotel offers the necessary basic needs for short or long term stays in a pleasant and reliable atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “comfort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel have a good location in a heart of singapore. The staffs very helpfull, the rooms are clean with balcony and good sceneries to marina bay. This hotel rigth in the heart of singapore night life. And I love the breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location pity about the building work next door.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clarke's Quay is an ideal location normally but this hotel is now surrounded by building sites on two sides, the work has just started so it may affect the hotel for 6 - 12 months. The rooms are clean and spacious, a ten minute walk from the MRT. Breakfast is good with plenty of choice. If you are thinking of spending relaxation time at the pool don't pick this hotel as one of the building sites is adjacent to the pool. I would not recomend this hotel at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and a lot to do...”
Reviews.Author: contactwaqas
Reviews.Content: Novotel Singapore is located at the best location. Rooms are spacious. Hotel is located at a very happening place Clarke quay.. There is everything you want near that. River view, good hotels, mrt, supermarket, shopping malls, park. So, just stay one and you will really enjoy . Off course you will have yo pay of want to see all this. Enjoy your stay. I only stayed once so .....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lunch with family and friends - Novotel is the best”
Reviews.Author: samson n
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic meal with very good ambience and the whole experience was wonderful. The food selection was superb with staff service with smile and being attentive it great gathering for our loved ones and finishing 2011with welcoming 202 was neat - Big thank you Novotel and the staff to making it happen. We will be back definately for another treat.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: plyaric Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Clean, staff is friendly and ... amazing location. Just in the middle of Clarke Quay. I recommend to buy a Premier option. It this you have breakfast, Internet access and entrance to Premier Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location IF you like tourists”
Reviews.Author: ELO_Australia_Travel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Singapore was my natural choice for my first official business trip to that beautiful country. My expectations were fuly met regarding friendliness, cleanliness and value for money. But because the hotel next to one of the night club areas (Clark Quay) it is noisy until early mornings - 5am at least. Thankfully my room was on the 20th floor, so it was OK but the rooms below me must have had many sleepless nights. Another area for improvement is the Gym. It's basic and you need to get up early to get onto the machines. It's good but basic. Yes, I will go there again - simply because it's good and has an awesome vie wof teh city.

Reviews.Title: “Good recommendations for staying and holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The sleeping room and bath room are most important for me. Keep the cleanliness ! Location of this hotel is strategic and closed to the exciting dinning restaurants. The room is big, it's very good. Service is very good for the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but the lifts are a hassle”
Reviews.Author: Brocko25
Reviews.Content: Easy 15-20 minute trip from the airport, about SG$25 in a cab. Friendly check in, although not fast. The reception is located on level 7, and they have a "mac corner" for free internet access. The room was mainly clean (a bit of mould in the shower), and the bed was comfortable. My room seemed to have a small balcony although the sliding door didnt open. It was called a bayview room I think, although it really just had a view of a small part of the river, and the city. The pool area was good. You have to change lifts on the 7th floor to get to your room, which was a bit annoying when the lifts were slow to come. Room service was quick, but lukewarm. Check out was a bit slow, they need more staff on the desk. I was served reasonably quick by the one person on duty, but I dont think the 5 guests lined up behind me were impressed. I probably wouldnt stay here again. The hotel is functional with restaurants and a shopping mall underneath, but it lacks character or any kind of competitive advantage as far as I could see. One problem they need to address - the hallway on my floor absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and very comfortable hotel !”
Reviews.Author: keith55London_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel, Clarke Quay, 30th November - 4 December. This is a very nice and comfortable hotel and is very convenientally located for all the action in Clarke Quay. We stayed in room on 18th floor, with stunning views of the Singapore River, the "Singapore Flyer" and Marina Bay Sands. The balcony is kept locked (for safety reasons) but will be unlocked if prepared to sign a disclaimer. Rooms were kept impecably clean and beds extremely comfortable with high quality Egyptian cotton sheets. There is free internet access available on the 1st floor lobby area, where five Apple Macs are available. Useful for printing air boarding passes etc (foc !). The hotel is generally geared towards business travellers rather than tourists, but it is worth the extra to stay here, although the room price is above the normal price range for tourist accommodation in Singapore. Package did not include breakfast, so unable to comment on this aspect. All staff very helpful and friendly. Keith & Sunay

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, rooms a little tired 3.5?”
Reviews.Author: sparky_112358
Reviews.Content: I keep getting hotels which deserve a 3.5! But I went for 4 because The best bits are the location, central to lots of cool places and walkable to the marina and other exciting places. Also at the top of the list are the staf,, attentive and helpful. Ok I mentioned the rooms but my biggest problem is the breakfast buffet 30 Singapore Dollars and all I really wanted was toast and coffee, the selection is brilliant but htat is why I weigh so much! Also I am going to start boycotting hotels that charge for the internet!

Reviews.Title: “Great location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: got upgraded to premium floor with stunning river views. staff was friendly and accommodating. breakfast buffet was diverse and superb. place was right beside clark quay and 7 eleven convenience store was downstairs. will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A warm and helpful welcome was received. Bed against the wall and no ability to move it was the greatest negative. Dining room/breakfast staff very friendly and helpful and breakfast choice was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: w0r1d_trave1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights for a business trip to Singapore. No complaints at all and tis hotel provides everything you need for a business hotel - rooms are very clean, spacious, all facilities were working, free internet connection. Breakfast was also very comprehensive and staff are friendly. Location is good and it is a 2 minutes walk to all the restaurants of Clarke Quay. I obviously wouldn't recommend this hotel for a pleasure stay as it id definately tailored to the business traveller. Probably not great value for money, as it's towards the pricey end, but overall a good stay

Reviews.Title: “place to rese your head”
Reviews.Author: henrychan5
Reviews.Content: We had a great view some 20 floors up looking over the shopping district. Noise below over the weekend was a bit loud but apart from friendly service and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BUSINESS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location for business traveller - within walking distance to financial district and close enough to the MRT for travels to all parts of Singapore. Problem encountered during stay - hot water system in the shower was erratic. One had to wait at least 3-5 minutes for the hot water to come on - what a waste of water!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But Bring Your Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Rutman
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about this hotel except the "boom-boom" that went most of the night from the clubs 19 stories below us. I don't know what anyone does to solve that problem. Maybe a room overlooking thr river is better?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Outaroundtheworld Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Novatel in Glarke Quay is perfectly situated for getting around Singapore. It is close to the MRT and to all the best shopping districts. The views from the rooms are great and so is the service you get. The staff are friendly and helpful. I would reconmend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a great stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip - SGP Nov 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Despite the clealiness and service is of very good, the the building facilities is getting old. The showering area that I used, water cannot flows out, and the water wetted the entire bath room, showring cannot last longer than 5 minutes, or will get flood. House keeping service attendance is slow, takes more than 25 minutes to turn up. However, the Reception area manage to change my room on next day after numerous complaints. Overall, it is still a pleasant trip, but overall facilities of the room needs to review in due of the building is "Aging". Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to say...”
Reviews.Author: afrokenn12
Reviews.Content: Good clean room, basic view of Clarke Quay is ok though doesn't look great in the daytime. Good if you want to stumble home from a party but not that close to the MRT. Not that many cabs to the area though that problem may be SG-wide. Service wasn't great but wasn't bad either. Overall a decent experience. One thing to complain is that the lifts to the lobby from the street level are few and when there's a lot of people there aren't enough...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent: in front of Clarke Quay, close to MRT, 24hr convenience store, fast food chain, and super market. Room is basic, nothing special. My room has glass wall window with a view to Clarke Quay, but also not a very nice view over the hotel's dumpster :(. Breakfast is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is confortable. The room has a good size, clean. People is very friendly. The buffet for lunch or dinner is really complete. The breakfast too. The hotel is downtown and closed to a place where you'll get all restaurants and bars... very convinient. Only problem. THE NOISE !!!! If you go there to go to bed at 5am and enjoy the night, no problem. If you want to sleep, forget it or bring your ear plugs, otherwise you won't sleep. Music up to 6am !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Large clean comfortable rooms which are starting to show their age. Superb staff (from checkin, restaurant and business centre staff) and great location. Hotel foyer, bar and lounge is not inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our upgraded room was wonderful, with view over the river. We love the location - so close to everything, yet away from the hurley burley - except Fri/Sat nights when the dance clubs are thumping! Breakfast wonderful as always. And great chilli crab at the riverside seafood restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service, and location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, service, and location! You're in the heart of everything ... restaurants, pubs, supermarket, spas, shopping and right on the river. The service is fantastic, great views, and the lounge has wonderful food!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, some opportunities for improvement”
Reviews.Author: TempleofPeace
Reviews.Content: The location here is great - very central, close to MRT station (Clarke Quay) - though actually the signage in the MRT station is not good - views of the new Casino, balconies for some rooms. I was offered an upgrade to a large room on check-in, but having ordered a King Size bed, I got two singles in the upgrade! That wasn't quite so ideal. I guess that they were small queen size singles. The beds were comfortable and one doubled as a wardrobe for me. There was no hot water in the taps - yes, it is warm in Singapore, but I don't think that it is too much to ask for hot water! There was no warm air in the air conditioning. Only freezing cold. Well, I like warm - so I had to open the windows and get it from outside. Fine for me, but probably not very good for the room given the humidity. The door chain was broken - you could fix it to the door or the wall, but not both at the same time!!!! I don't worry about security in Singapore, but nevertheless, if you want to have a door chain, it had better work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Julia708
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times for 1 or 2nights enroute to the London. Staff have been excellent to deal with and very efficient. Rooms provide plenty of space and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet choice is also excellent. The location is great as you can walk from Clarke Quay to China Town or a nice morning stroll through Fort Canning Park. Have recommended to many people and will be staying again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: shorty23jkt
Reviews.Content: The hotel has new refurbished rooms and looks much better inside then the outside (ugly yellow building) would suggest. Big bathroom as well. Location is just next to Clarque Key. Only downside is that you need to pay for the internet. The lobby is on the 6th floor which was a bit strange. I will consider this hotel for my next stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Little_Rascal23 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Recently traveled to Singapore for my sister's wedding so we stayed at Novotel. The location is very close to ROM and in the heart of Clark Quay. Orchard road is just a stone throw down the road and Bugis is another 5 minutes by taxi. There is an MRT station right in Clark Quay as well. I would say location wise, it is very good. The hotel is very cozy and beautiful. We went to the gym. Equipments are very new and well maintained. There is drinking water and towels available. The rooms are very cozy but we had a little bit of a problem with the air-cond. It was so hot that I couldn't sleep the whole night. We lodge a complain at the reception and the engineers were very quick to fix the situation. However, only my sister's room was ok, mine was still a bit hot but since we're already checking out the next day, we thought we would not like to make a fuss. Overall the hotel is good and meet the standards of Novotel. Free internet on 5 Macs at the lobby. What's there to complain? :)

Reviews.Title: “Poor services”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Poor services of : Receptionist is not profesional & friendly to handle case Operator is not helpful, keep pushing around the call And the hotel restaurant having a poor quality service, lack of cleaness on the dining tools. Just a few dishes serve for the international buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Business”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Meets Australian standards and felt very comfortable in this environment Meets Australian standards and felt very clean Meets Australian standards and food was great Meets Australian standards and service was pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Review of the hotel rating”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the cleaniess of the hotel bed. This is a four star hotel and i assume the quality and cleaniess must be in place but I found some sandy pieces of things and a dead ant under the bed sheet. Secondly, the buffet served not worth the price. The food served are cold and not fresh especially the crab.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: starman1405
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotel rates are expensive but great rates offered here with no complaints about the hotel, very clean, good pool but the room was a little worn. The breakfast area and food was superb, found a voucher on trip advisor for $1 a day! The hotel is central with good metro and river boat connections to other parts of the city. Clarke Quay not really my bag, mediocre food and very expensive, a pint of beer over 13 GBP. Catch the metro to other parts of the city, chinatown, little india for the real experience. Overall with breakfast at $1 great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, not many cheap places around, this one is ok price”
Reviews.Author: jim508
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful people with all the facilities you would need. nice and centrally located too.

Reviews.Title: “Room - TV & Lights faulty”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was stay at roo 1004 & realised the TV remote control is not functioning & also the DVD unable to play the disc as TV control unable to change to AV channel. Very disappointed everyday & mid night got fault alarm & we all wake up when announce. realised the services & room standard was drop. Shower & water will spray/leak from the glass door even close. I think they should check for all this before let the guest checking.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Jarl_Norway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and absolutely loved it! We had a quiet room at 23. floor, so a high floor is preferred. We where offered the "Premier" upgrade, and also highly recommend this. We payed s$60 extra, and that included breakfast, wi-fi and Premier Lounge - The PL alone was worth every penny, with nice and quiet breakfast and the free afternoon-coctail (fx.cheese together with a good wine) in the afternoon. The view from PL at the 24. floor was also stunning. The service here was tip-top, and the location straight on Clake Quay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Truly excellent, great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Julien v
Reviews.Content: Location is great, staff is extremely friendly, no bad surprises and the amount paid, was the same amount I saw on my screen when I booked the hotel. There was no single extra fee. Next time I won't even bother comparing other hotels, I'll just come back.

Reviews.Title: “Clarke Quay river view”
Reviews.Author: Lake-District1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great position for Clarke Quay and Boat Quay. Pay extra for supreme river view room, the view to skypark is fantastic. Clarke Quay comes alive at night and plenty choice of restaurants and bars

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for traveller”
Reviews.Author: Chingp
Reviews.Content: Stay at Novotel Clarke Quay in Oct for some events.. Novotel CQ is definitely convenient for all business travelers where can access to business district easily and a place for dining & clubbing after a long day meetings.. The room is big, clean, neat and tidy! I was being upgraded to executive floor but w/o the executive floor benefits.. One minor problem was the shower room heater takes about 15 to 20 mins. to heat up the water. for those who is rushing out for appointment, my advise is to let the shower head water flow for aprrox. 10mins. before you start shower otherwise, you will be shower in cold & freezing water and you will catch a cold after that. I just hope the hotel maintenance division to take note of this problem for not letting your guest shower in cold water or wasting on water flowing for 10mins just to wait for the heater to heat up to get enough hot water to shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location a real gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All of the staff from the concierge, reception desk and restaurants were very helpful and friendly. They all made us very welcome and made our trip to singapore very memorable. The beds in the rooms could have been a little softer and the rooms seemed a little old, but everything worked fine and was clean. We are definately coming back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good room, ... but shame Novotel and Accor passes policies before satisfaction of the client”
Reviews.Author: cportal
Reviews.Content: I read all reviews before booking in Novotel Clarke Quay in Singapore. I noticed that there has been a lot of complains in February 2011 but I understood that the hotel was in the middle of renovations at the same time. So be it and we booked for 6 nights an executive room for me and my family (two children 6 and 3 years old). I am member of the A-Club and asked through them to have the exceptional authorization of an early (11:30 instead 14:00) checking in as we were landing in Singapore after a night in the plane, at 10:30 in the morning. I received a commercial answer saying that Novotel policy was a booking at 14:00 and if I wish to be sure to have a room I need to book (and pay) the night before. When we arrived at exactly 11:30 at the reception, the argument was the same:... Policy of the hotel is check in 14:00 and not 11:30. The room is not ready... Eventually at 12:00 reception proposed us to take a twin bed room instead the king bed that we requested. We refused because it would have been very difficult to accomodate two children and two adults in two single beds. The young intern that was communicating with me has been exceptionally friendly and polite but policy is policy even if two children are sleeping on the coach of the lobby with two luggages and several bags all around. Not even a cup of coffee was proposed. Customers were passing around us laughing to see the kids sleeping on the coach. At exactly 14:00 the young intern came to us and said that the room were ready. I cannot believe that people that were cleaning the room finished their work exactly at the time mentioned by the policy. I believe this has been deliberately obliged by the management. Several employees tried to interfere and were blaming the young intern. I totally refused to speak with another person as he has been obviously doing his best and was looking very embarrassed by this situation. We travel very often and I tried several hotels in the world including Novotel and other Accor group properties. It never happened to me to face such stubborn and intransigeant attitude. Policy seems the only reference in this hotel but management should remember that customers have the choice and there are certainly around much more friendly places to stay where at least refreshments will be offered. In conclusion Novotel Clarke Quay is certainly a great place to stay but as solo traveller or in couple but not with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Relaxing stay in a comfortable hotel. Great location. Has a food court underneath with good food at cheap prices if you don't want to eat at the hotel. Clarke Quay 50 metres away at most. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “To be expected”
Reviews.Author: KiwiKeith15 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Singapore Novotel Clarke Quay was everything one expects from an Accor medium to upper range hotel. It's well located b the river tourist area so there is heaps of choices for eating out and also close to the boat stop. Obviously one has to pay more for this type of a stay but it was worth it. They have a great pool and gym facility.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to the Novotel brand”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels and brands under the Accor umbrella all over the world and this is the first time where my experience was less than satisfactory. On arrival, I was given an hotel on the 11th floor which, at first sight, appeared great. Then I realized that it had connecting doors to another room that were paper thin. You could hear people just talking in the other room as if you were there. The ceiling in the shower was also leaking and the noise from all the clubs outside going until 5am were deafening. I requested a room change and was bumped to a room on the 18th floor with no connecting door but sub standard in quality compared to the first one (not updated in a while). Service was also questionable. Rooms were made every day but bedsheets not always changed despite specific request (using a tent card provided). One day, service left without leaving any toilet paper. It took 3 phone calls over a period of 3 hours to have that situation resolved. If you are looking for an hotel close to the party zone, don't mind the noise and rooms that don't live up to the Novotel brand expectation, then this is probably a good hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, Clarke Quay. Many good places to eat and drink very close. Also close to MRT public transit station for easy access. If you don't mind spending a little more, go for the executive room because the exec lounge is wonderful and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with the services”
Reviews.Author: rohss
Reviews.Content: i compared holiday inn and 2 other hotels and finally chose this hotel and i am glad i did. the rooms were spacious, clean and felt good to stay. Entire clarke quay is full of eating joints so thats the best part of the hotel - perfect location. the hotel opens to a 7-11 and has a 24 hour operational mcafe on the ground floor. the staff was extremely helpful and it was a pleasant stay. the only thing i dint like about the hotel is the infant blanket i had requested for - it was torn and not worth using. i was totally disappointed with the blanket they provided. the duty manager on the day i checked out was helpful. she gave me baggage storage options and also allowed us to use the 5th floor to freshen up once we had checked out and came back from our Sentosa trip. again the only thing bad was the baby blanket. All taxi drivers know Novotel so it was easy navigation. Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Asia sojourn”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service at the Novotel Clarke Quay was as one would expect but no more. Room was adequate but the bathroom was too small for two adults at any one time. Location was very good, close to buses, food outlets and Chinatown. We thought the food in the casual restaurant was overpriced, compared to other hotels we stayed at during our five weeks in Singapore, Malaysia, Laos and Cambodia including other Novotel premises..

Reviews.Title: “Good location a step away from night life”
Reviews.Author: Ben_MiMi-TH
Reviews.Content: The room furniture are basic but the view I had in my suite was very nice by night time. Just a step away from Clarke Quay, so for a night out no needs for a cab. I try the buffet for dinner and it was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was meant to be a getaway on my birthday, which I have been looking forward to, but sad to say this was not what I was expecting from a four-star hotel like Novetel. I am totally disappointed on the rooms allocated and the cleanliness of the rooms. Got a room where it was facing the back of the river, nothing to see but the UE square. Air con was faulty and there were wasted papers under the desk. When I called the reception for help, it took them nearly 20 mins to address the issue...Even after the technician checked, the air con is still not working... In the end, I have to request for a change of room after another 20 mins...No initiative to suggest for change of room, not to mentioned to suggest an upgrade....Beside the air-con, TV and the DVD player's remote was not working well either. The new room allocated to me was as bad as the first one. The fridge was not cold and the edge of the toilet sink had brown stain. I informed the front desk about the stain and they said they will send someone up to clean it. When I came back in the evening, the stain was still there. I have to clean it myself. The bed is noisy when I sleep on it as I can hear and feel the springs. I have just enough to ask to change another room. With all these details which the hotel is not attentive to, it has greatly spoilt my mood for my birthday celebration. Honestly, the price range and this type of service and room I'm getting, IT IS NOT WORTH IT AT ALL. No breakfast and I didn’t very much feel like home. I won’t be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and chose the Novotel due to its proximity to work and school. We were familiar with the surroundings and just needed 5 days accomodation between leases. At night the music from the surrounding night clubs etc could be heard from teh 17th floor; we had to pay for parking as Liang crt is not a part of Novotel, although they did offer a single courtesy ticket for a one time use only over the 5 days. The coffee was below parr as was the buffet breakfast. Staff were very friendly in dinning hall but not so much in reception. HATED the compulsory two elevators (1st to reception and the 2nd to your floor) and the fact that you coudln't take the stairs as you cannot get out at reception and the breakfast hall on Level 7. Decor and lights very tacky in bar area on level 7. Rooms were good, Beds were comfortable, bathroom was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay. Staff very friendly and ready to assist if required. Room very comfortable. Hotel close to quay and within walking distance to nice restaurants, train and sightseeing as Orchard Road, Raffles, Singapore Flyer etc. Taxi Cabs reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: 22Euro Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Average hotel in a good location. Generally satisfactory. The one gripe we have is the irritating fruit flies found buzzing around in both the club level business lounge and the breakfast restaurant. I would recommend the hotel for its location but would caution about the expectation on the service.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights in Singapore room 923”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was small but ok. Location was very good.Unfortunately windows were dirty which spoiled an otherwise great view. Balcony would have been good. Lift from the street to level 7 then transfer to new lift bank to go to rooms was inconvenient. Climb up stairs from L6 to the pool at L7 was annoying; why not access pool from L7 lift? We booked a late checkout (6.00pm) which we paid 50% of the normal rate for ok, but we were also charged a room servicing fee on top. Our room was not serviced the last day. Power shutdown for 7hrs maintenance made room uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times, and will continue to do so. It's a great location, quite central, and for Singapore is quite good value for money. Although some of the rooms a little small, they are well laid out, good to work in, and always very clean.

Reviews.Title: “stay in spore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Couple of things that really annoyed me: 1 - a false alarm early morning whcih distrputed my sleep which affected the whole day 2 - guests does not give way for those are coming out of the.elevator

Reviews.Title: “NO electricity.”
Reviews.Author: Himanshu66 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Shocked to reach hotel and find that there is NO POWER for the night. The staff was very evasive and I am personally very disappointed. Had to fight / argue to get shifting to another hotel for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, adjacent place with a lot of restaurant excelent. The position of a hotel good. One minor issue - a little noise was heard from the disco bars close to the hotel. Fot those who does not like to go to a restaurant a small shopping mall is right at the hotel. For a those who like jogging a Fort Canning Park is close where one can excersise.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Singapore...”
Reviews.Author: Cheuryous
Reviews.Content: Having recently spent 6 nights here I would have no hesitation in recommending this excellent hotel for the holiday traveller. The staff were extremely helpful, pleasant and obliging. Nothing was too much trouble. Central location means many of the Singapore attractions were within easy reach. We took the Premier package which gave us an excellent room and access to the Lounge which provided breakfast and canapes/drinks from 6-8pm. Well worth it! . Will definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was great, great location and friendly staff but I would give dinner a miss as mine was a bit disappointing. xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “A good family stay @ Novotel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall opinion good, accommodation pleasant for a adult with 2 children, staff helpful and available when needed. Well laid out with good services. Some minor issues with room (desk-light not working, "a dodgy" wall power socket). Exterior to hotel can be a little noisy at weekends due to it location next to the Clarke quay complex.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing customer service - great location”
Reviews.Author: 834michelle83 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many novotel hotels and have been a loyal accor member for many years. This was my most disappointing stay so far. I was checked in by a trainee reception member who was over-inquisitive and rude. She did not inform me of any details about the hotel, acknowledge my accor membership and/or its benefits within the hotel. I was not adequately informed where my room was, so I returned down to street level where the lovely concierge gave me directions (I had the return to reception and take a different lift). We stayed in room 1019....there were pink stains all over the bathroom floor and rust/brown stains around the bathroom doors and other areas. Maintenance were constantly ringing the doorbell to fix 'something' in the room. To the point that we had to put the 'do not disturb sign' on all the time so that we received some privacy. On the night of the 30th there was loud noise for over one hour coming from room 1020. At approximately 3.40am I called reception to see if anything could be done about it. I was rudely told that they would see what they could do, no apology or follow-up. When we checked in we were not informed about the details of breakfast (which was included in our deal). I had to return to reception and ask. We were also not provided with any details about the accor lounge...when I asked I was informed that this was a service for the corporate travellers and must be booked before arrival - I question whether this is actually true? The room itself was clean (aside from aforementioned bathroom comments) and comfortable, unfortunately the service was very disappointing and stopped us from wanting to spend any extra time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at a number of hotels all of which were excellent themselves but the location of this hotel gives them an advantage.Walk to the quay in less than a minute, or a short stroll on two streets and you are in Orchard rd shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mgtkHongKong Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Clarke Quay is well located, has the usual high standards one can rely on from from Accor hotels adn this provides a vdry pleasant place to stay in Singapore. It si particualrly well located for transport and good eating.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: rightfully located in the center of clarke quay, you got everything, night spots, good food depending on your budget, shopping center just below the hotel, a 7 eleven convenient store just right beside the main entrance to the hotel, easy access for taxi. the service of this hotel is excellent, just upgraded the the premier floor without the added benefits, but who don't want to be upgraded anyway. the staff are well trained, expect a really good service especially to a-club members. the buffet was really great, live up to a traveller expectation. the staff was generous enough after a short trip to universal studio theme park, since i was already check out, the staff allowed me to use their shower at the pool area, it really did help since i am catching a flight that same night, overall, would recommend all kinds of traveler to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Club Access Not Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: pandora m
Reviews.Content: There is no need to opt for the club access if you are travelling with young children. We recieved a warm welcome at the club access level and was shown to our room. We had a baby with us. We were however, given a rude surprise when we were turned away in the evening when we went to the club level at 6pm. Apparently, the club access bans children during peak periods (which includes breakfast time). I was extremely upset as we were already shown to a seat, and I had already pick up a plate and was about to take a sandwich before another staff told us that we cannot be there because of my baby (I was carrying a sleeping baby in my sling) . I was made to feel embarrass in front of other guests. I felt that the situation could have been avoided if we were told about this during our check-in which I would then not have paid extra for the club access since it is not family friendly. It had not been a pleasant holiday experience for me. I would not stay there again with my family. But to be fair to the hotel, it has a great location being beside Liang Court (shopping centre) and right in the middle of clarke quay. The hotel is generally clean and well kept. There is also a nice spread of breakfast food. The other staff (at the restaurant) were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As an Accor member we were disappointed with our room for two main reasons. Firstly the room was at the back overlooking construction work and swimming pool. No view of Clarke Quay, one of the main reasons for being there. Any view was blocked out by the jutting out of the room next door. Secondly, the bed was against the wall with no bedside cabinet or reading light for the person in the corner. It's the first time I have encountered this at an Accor hotel. This does not represent 4* accommodation in Singapore where there are so many hotels from which to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I participated in a draw for a discount on accommodation and received 5% discount plus free breakfast. I was there for 7 days and the discount was worth it. Breakfast was the standard European plus Asian and was well preseneted and a good selection. Rooms were good for business with a bench to work at with a lamp. The free wifi worked well. Staff were courteous and spoke good English. I attended a conference at Marina Bay Sands hoptel which was only a $6 taxi ride away. Most of the offices I went to were no more than a $5 to $8 taxi ride away. It is close to Clarke Quay for good food and entertainment and only a ten to fifteen minute walk to China Town.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay much better... Will be back next year.”
Reviews.Author: KarinaGavPerth
Reviews.Content: The last time we stayed back in October 2010 the experience was not so pleasant but this time was much better. Stayed in a Premier Suite 25th Floor, for 9 nights from 21/10/11 till 30/10/11. We checked in on the Premier Lounge floor, this time around the staff were much pleasant and helpful compared to the last time. The room has improved especially the bathroom and the bed is very comfy, also had a Nespresso Machine and new furniture. The housekeeping guy was probably one of the nicest guys there!. Breakfast on the Premier Floor wasn't too flash, every morning was the same thing so we didn't bother after the 4th day. We did not head down to the pool as it still look dingy plus too many little kids around running around and diving into the pool (FYI pool shared with Somerset) so it does get packed. The room we stayed in was over looking Robertson Quay (Park Hotel Clarke Quay). We did get room service twice, the food was good but a bit on the pricey side. After our second stay here and giving it a second chance, I have to say it's not so bad especially being close to Clarke Quay, a quick walk to Orchard Rd and Chinatown. Still room for improvement. FYI - Starbucks, Money Changer, 7/11, McDonalds, Mediya (for your food shopping) and Food Court in Liang Court, all this below the hotel. The food court is very cheap and great food available. Across the road, theres Burger King Bar and lots of bars and restaurants also to checkout Central Shopping Centre. I say definitely give it a go but my experience is based on the premier floor.

Reviews.Title: “Comments about My Stay”
Reviews.Author: malou p Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel location and the buffet breakfast were very good. However, there was only one espresso machine (the Ibis on Bencoolen has two). Some of the furniture needed to be cleaned or reupholstered. The shower door and the bathroom sink leaked. We had to use our soiled towels to absorb the water on the floor. We complained to the hotel staff but nothing was done. There were not enough hooks in the bathroom to hang our robes, etc. There were not enough drawers to put our stuff in.

Reviews.Title: “where should i start?”
Reviews.Author: batkung
Reviews.Content: first of all, let me say that the location for this hotel is great!..right in the middle of clarke quay, loads of restaurants, clubs, bars etc....unfortunately, that only applies if you are single and on the hunt for partying 7 days a week. because of the hotel's proximity to clarke quay, night times are extremely noisy, the bass lines from the clubs near the hotel can be heard even on the 24th floor...but that's only on wed/thur/fri/sat/sun I've stayed at this hotel many times, each time my room has been either disgustingly dirty/smelly..the aircon didn't work, the balcony doors wouldn't close properly. Each time I've had to change rooms at least twice. Like I said, the only thing this place has going for it is the location..and if I'm not paying for it, then I have to bite the bullet. The food in the hotel is not good either. The main restaurant is buffet only, so you are stuck with paying a high price (plus plus plus) or dealing with room service if you want to eat in the hotel. I ordered a room service grilled cheese and ham sandwich and got a stale ciabatta with a slice of ham and a cheese slice on it..not even grilled, all for the great price of S$20+++ The silver lining behind this cloud is the great food court downstairs in Liang Court..for less than S$10 you can have a really good meal compared with 3 times the price for a less than mediocre meal in the hotel. The in-room TV channels also have issues..often they suffer from bad reception and sometimes they drop out completely saying "signal lost"...some of the room s have TV's smaller than the monitors you use for your PC. Internet access in the rooms is also expensive, S$30 per day and not all websites work. Why do we have to put up with this crap? The hotel has positioned itself as a trendy young place to stay in..with the FOH staff reflecting this position. This creates situations where the FOH staff are arrogant, non-responsive and downright rude to guests sometimes. Coupled with the thick singaporean accent that the staff has, it can be extremely hard to speak to and get your point across to them. one point I made last time i was there, the advertisements for the buffet breakfast show a really nice looking smoked salmon eggs bendict...i made the point of asking the eggs chef for an eggs benedict and was replied to with "what's an eggs benedict?"..eventually the head waiter sorted it out. all told, this hotel promises the world, but delivers very little quality...for the price they charge they should be 500% better... If you want a good hotel that cares about its guests, I'd recommend the Grand Copthorne or the Gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Too low for that money”
Reviews.Author: AlinaVel
Reviews.Content: The view from the room was awesome. The size of the room was all right. However, overall I had quite an annoying experience. Non smoking room smelled like an old pub. With archaic electronics: TV with few colors missing, Airco with no temperature control, fluorescence lamps making load noise. Would fit to 3 star standard in Europe, but definitely not for those money they ask!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were wonderful and very accommodating. The pool was a great size - for kids and adults alike. The rooms were very clean and the service staff were friendly and very accommodating. I would recommend others to stay there and I would stay there again - the location was terrific, although it is better for quiet on the side of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location for all the amenties, excellent service for the value, very helpful staff towards local area and transportation, enjoyed our stay in every way, thanks to John Chetty, been very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit....First Class!”
Reviews.Author: McPlump
Reviews.Content: I have already reviewed this hotel, so I have said it all before. However to recap, I cant fault this hotel. Perfect location. The Novotel is close to shopping, eating, and the MRT for for eating and shopping. Of all the international hotels that I have visited in recent years I have to say that this place offers the best breakfast. The rooms a a good size, clean, and the staff are attentive and very helpful, right down to the concierge arranging transfers for our group.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Radar16 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Clarke Quay is in a great location and has friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay and look forward to be back there later this week. The only area that would benefit from a greater focus is the buffet breakfast. It was a little disappointing with food at best warm. It is a minor point in an otherwise good value hotel. The reception staff are a key asset.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore stop over”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and enjoyed being close to great eating options and nightlife.Very helpful staff in recommending places to go and taxis. Excellent pool however access past the dining rooms and meeting areas was somewhat revealing for some!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Executive room which was very spacious, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was also very good with a wide choice available. The hotel is in a great location with plenty of restaurants / bars within walking distance. The Staff are very pleasant and helpful. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: No hotel has a small shopping mall underneath, so there is easy access to groceries. Location is in the heart of Clarke Quay, plenty of bars and restaurants. Close to MRT station, so it's easy to get around Singapore. Room is spacious. The hotel exterior doesn't do it's justice. The interior is a lot nicer. Every time I have been to Singapore I have stayed in Novotel and I would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A bad night's sleep for a lot of money!!”
Reviews.Author: Vicky1100 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore from Europe very early in the morning & were told our room would not be ready until 2pm that day. Travelling with two young children, we were all exhausted and desperately needed to sleep! We were told that for an additional $120 we could upgrade to an executive suite, which we agreed to do out of desperation! Executive suites are not our usual room choice (financially) but we were desperate to sleep! The room set up was beautiful - king bed in the main room & the kids were set up in 2 fold out beds in the living room. Well, the noise from the air conditioner in the ceiling in the bedroom was unbearable! Not to mention whoever was ringing the doorbell & knocking on the door in the morning to collect laundry! (if I had laundry, I would have arranged collection! I don't need someone shouting & knocking while we're trying to sleep!) We promptly put the do not disturb sign on the door after that! We stayed that night in the executive suite again & the noise from the airconditioner was unbearable again - so I effectively paid $500 to sleep on the couch in the living room near the kids! We also let the kids get in the spa & when my daughter got out she was covered in some sort of "gunk" which must have come out of the jets in the spa - I don't even want to think what it could have been!! Not a good introduction to the executive lifestyle! The next night we downgraded to a normal room which was better but nothing flash for the money you pay. Location was good if you're happy to go to Clarke Quay for dinner etc - the train station was a bit further than I would have liked with two exhausted children.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Philal
Reviews.Content: On our arrival in Singapore we arrived at Novotel Clare Quay and very impressed With this Hotel, the rooms were spacious and very nice and clean. Eating at this Hotel was also great with plenty of choices and Breakfast also very good. The Novotel Clarke Quay is in a great Location with plenty of attractions close by, and also plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The Staff at the Hotel also ver helpful. Would definatly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Young Family”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a good location. The staff were generally excellent. The technical upkeep of the room was a weakness with a few problems taking too long to rectify. Quality dining is available in the hotels restaurants. The swimming pool and gym are relatively good. The wireless connection is a little slow, however, the broadband is good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Receiption Desk”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As the receiption desk is in 7th floor, which is also the transfer foor for the elevator, the customers would always pass by the receiption desks whenever you need to in/out hotel and dinning. Clearly, they are not so friendly may be due to the crowd space or too busy and boring jobs. Once I approached one lady handing over her a key, she asked me to que with unpleasant face. While, I actually just wanna to return a key to her as i have four keys for one room due to some times i forgot key inside room. So, do i really need to que? of course i know what i am doing and no need her to teach me how to do with proper way. Actually, the worst is checking out day. I requesting for check out for 2.30 PM as i have to go to the mall to change my new larggage, which was found cannot work when i was packing. The two trainees told me cannot. THen i told them i met problem and i am A club gold member and i stayed in the hotel for ten days already. Finnaly, they agree only to 2pm. That's really too arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Peggysue43
Reviews.Content: On arrival at this lovely hotel we were greeted by very freindly and courteous staff on both ground floor and the check in floor (7), our room was spaceous, clean, bed very comfortable. Location was great right at the the very colourful quays district. Breakfast was plentiful and enjoyable. Computers in the reception area a great idea. We found it very easy to get around, All in all a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the location, otherwise not worth”
Reviews.Author: rajeevemirates
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in their suite and should say it was a disappointment. Good things- location,location & location. The hotel is located in clarke quay, which is the happening place in Singapore dislike - the suite room was very spacious and had very good view of MBS. However, it's not appealing nor it has that luxury feeling. The bathrooms are infect rundown and not very clean. The buffet breakfast is also not so gr8. Having previously stayed in Ibis, bencoolin which is a budget hotel I would rate that to be a much better hotel than this. Not worth enough and I wonder if the suite rooms are like this, how will be the normal rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CorporateFlyer
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (7am) after a long flight from Paris and within an hour had our two rooms, as early check in and upgraded - great service. Several hours later I went down to fix up some keys and the same staff member remembered me and the room numbers without prompting. The rooms we had were on the executive floor and nicely renovated - big tv and comfy beds. I was a bit concerned about noise from Clarke Quay - referred to in other reviews, however this was not an issue (although we were all very tired). The breakfast was very big, with a lot of variety and freshly cooked eggs/omeletes etc. Internet is charged (S$30 per day), but there are 4 or 5 apple computers in reception that you can use for free. Location is very good, you can get by taxi everywhere in Singapore for only a few dollars and we did taxi to/from airport for under S$20 each way (dont get sucked un by "limo" service ex airport at S$35).

Reviews.Title: “Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice location and reasonable facilities and staff assistance. My bugbear was that I had specifically asked for a QUIET room, hopefully on a higher floor and away from elevator as I had just come off a long-haul flight from Spain and am a light-sleeper. I was given a smelly room on 9th floor (out of 24?) overlooking Clark Street. Very noisy at nights and difficult to sleep. Also the drains gurgled and smelled of old socks.

Reviews.Title: “Flexibility”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When I arrived the requested room was not available, s I was given an upgrade--which was very good. However because of the Qantas strike I had to extend the booking and was charged at the "walk in "rate for the upgraded room--which was totally wrong--I did not request the upgrade,I was not responsible for the plane delay--yet the Hotel -who were unable to provide the requested room on arrival--charged me excessively for the one day extension--when it clearly should have been at the rate that I had booked at--and which booking had been accepted.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: JulieLB2011
Reviews.Content: highly recommend. had a great stay at this hotel. staff were fantastic and rooms were spacious and very clean. Breakfast was excellent. So much variety. we arrived hours ahead of our checkin time and it was no problem to get us in our room ASAP. We checked out at noon and our plane wasnt leaving until midnight. We were still able to use all of the hotel facilities including their free internet. Perfect location. would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop-Over”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great overnight stay. Location is great for many of Singapore's attractions - China Town, the Quays, Asian Civilizations Museum. It is located beside a small shopping centre that has a very large supermarket should you need to stock up on essentials.Staff efficient and friendly. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Hotels are very consistent all over.”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn H
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Novotel Clarke Quay in Singapore. Rooms were spacious and comfortable and staff very helpful. stiuated close to Clarke Quay restaurants, we would recommend staying there

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Singapore Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We came for the F1 Grand Prix Race so my Partner needed to be able to get to/from the track easily and I needed to be able to go out in the evening with our 2&1/2yr old so being on Clarke Quay & close enough to MRT & Boat Quay was great. We had everything at our doorstep - a shopping Mall, a Seven Eleven, restaurants, the HOP ON - Hop Off buses. The Buffet breakfast was delicious and we couldn't have asked for a better room (big bed, big bath & fantastic views) I will be booking the Novotel Clarke Quay next time we go to Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Bill252
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in a superior bayview room which had a view across to the Singapore Eye and the new Marina Sands hotel, both look spectacular lit up at night. The staff at the hotel are very obliging and friendly, great pool area, and an excellent buffet breakfast. But the best part of the hotel is its location right in the heart of bustling Clarke Quay, and above a shopping centre which has a supermarket and the usual Starbucks, Maccas and a food hall (Kopitiam) which sold good food at very cheap prices. The MRT (Clarke Quay) is a short walk, and there are literally dozens of restaurants and bars in Clarke Quay, and strolling thru the area at night is very pleasant. On the Friday and Saturday nights we were there a local kite club provided a spectacular exhibition of small remote control motorised kites fitted with laser lights, at a vacant lot just near Brewerkz, simply stunning and totally free! Looked like something out of a sci fi movie. Totally enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “happy holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our holiday, especially our grandson who met many friends at the swimming pool after our days sightseeing.The position of the hotel was good as were the rooms, spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Singaore Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good, just one issue that hopefully will progress in time is the ability to have free internet within all rooms. Having just travelled through Europe and UK most hotels we stayed in had this capability.

Reviews.Title: “Ambience galore”
Reviews.Author: DarwinTropics
Reviews.Content: Our 7 day stay at the Novotel Clarke Quay has been one of total relaxation. Arriving very jetlagged from a long flight from London, we were quickly checked in and able to settle into our room (which was on the 25th floor with wonderful views). Our executive room was very spacious with large windows - roomy bathroom, bath that include an overhead shower, separate shower and all the accessories you need to enjoy your stay. Beds are comfortable with a range of pillows to suite individual comfort. Access to the Premiere lounge on the 24th floor where you can enjoy a wide range of appetizers, wines, beers and spirits. The view from here has breathtaking views of the Marina Bay, Marina Sands with laser shows in the evening is very relaxing and a pleasure to watch while having your evening drinks. The staff in the hotel are polite and helpful, concierge will help you with all your daily needs for getting around Singapore. Breakfast buffet is plentiful and a wide range of continental and asian selections are available. Room order meals are ample size - try the satays they are delicious. Being on the river, Clarke Quay the hotel is situated in very close and within walking distance to the Marina, Merlion, Boat Quay, Chinatown and various shopping complexes. Highly recommend. We are looking at staying here over the New Year - celebrations right at your door step!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: buns24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way to Bali and really enjoyed the hotel. The room was great and the breakfast buffet was awesome (you pay extra for it). There are computers connected to the internet in the lobby that you can use for free while you have to pay extra to use wifi in your rooms. Location is excellent - just around the corner from Clarke Quay. We took at taxi from the airport to the hotel while we took the metro back to the airport (very easy and cheap - cant remember how long it took, but not more than an hour, I think). Staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “10 DAY STAY IN SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: afshan_11
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Hotel was quite an excellent place to stay. Close to entertainment and shopping. Friendly staff. Nice lounges and seating. Good conference facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Top class service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellence will be a word to miniscule to describe the fantastic service me and my family received at Novotel, Clark Quay. Arrived at the hotel very tired and weary in the wee morning hours and were surprised to receive a free upgrade from superior bay view room to a suite. The hotel team right from reception to the restaurant team who served us top class food at 2 AM and the Manager John Chetty ensured top class service. We had a relaxing time and enjoyed our stay at Novotel. The hotel is close to Clarke Quay MRT and all tourist destination are just a short drive from the hotel. Will definitely be staying at Novotel, Clark Quay whenever we go to Singapore next. Thank you Novotel Staff for making our stay at Singapore a perfect one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good hotel, but a little noisy...”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel with great service in a great location. Accessible to public transport and taxi's and a stones throw away from the night life and entertainment of Clarke Quay. My only complaint is that the rooms are not as sound proof as they could be, meaning that noise from down below can be heard. This is, however, just a minor issue, and for the right price I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite address in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Micannjon
Reviews.Content: The Novatel Clarke Quay is a fantastic hotel in a great location for food, entertainment and transport, it is ideal for the business traveller and the tourist alike. The staff are exceptional, they are committed to ensuring your stay is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “jterryb”
Reviews.Author: jterryb
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel. Centrally located at Clarke Quay. The staff were very helpful. Rooms very comfortable and clean. Would be very happy stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bontaks
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the biggest plus. Being right at Clarke Quay, and within walking distance to all the other ‘quay’ spots, made it ideal. The rooms were spotless and spacious (we had a superior, river view room with a perfect view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel from the 19th floor), and the towels were large and thick. We didn’t pay for an inclusive breakfast deal, so only had the buffet breakfast one day (it was $31 SGD per person), but it provided a large choice for every possible taste. To be honest, being savoury breakfast people, we did the bargain option of having Subway from the shopping centre downstairs. Some people have complained about the fact that you have to change lifts to get to your rooms – one set of lifts from street level to the reception on the 7th floor, and then another set for the rooms – but this is not really an inconvenience, and it is there for security. This hotel’s facilities are used for business, and they don’t want non-guests having access to other floors, or even taking up spaces in the lifts designated for that purpose. Quite sensible, actually. The mac centre in reception (which provides about 6 very new macs and free internet access for guests) is very handy. It made checking emails and printing boarding passes a breeze. The pool area was very nice, but stipulating that guests cannot bring food or drinks from outside the pool area is a little restrictive. Not everyone wanted what was offered on the menu. The Chinese restaurant on the 6th floor was lovely, and had excellent dim sum discounts for lunch, as well as a la carte choices. One slightly negative point would be that sometimes staff were misinformed, and passed that misinformation on to us. For example, at 1:45pm I asked reception if the Chinese restaurant was open still for lunch, and was told no, so we nearly went elsewhere. We decided to swing past there on our way out, and found they take their last lunch orders at 2:30pm. Also, the concierge told us that we did not need to make a reservation to have breakfast with the orang-utans at Singapore Zoo, but when we arrived, we found we should’ve. These are small details, but they do, on occasion, make a difference. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again for the value for money and location – afterall, not all of us can afford to stay at Raffles or The Fullerton.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pandie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Novotel several times and have always found the service to be at a good level. Our most recent stay was at the time of F1 motor GP and prices as with everywhere in Singapore were ridiculously high. Parts of the hotel are starting to show the signs of its age and an upgrade must not be too far off. It is situated in a very good location with easy access to all parts of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “'Charges all around & Not so Good as jotted'”
Reviews.Author: AsisParajuli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel in September 2011. I felt it was not as good as it meant to be. The rooms were nice with a balcony with the view of city - River side, Clarke Quay. The hotel is very close to the Singapore most night clubs and pubs (Clarke Quay). Be aware they might charge you hiddenly in any thing that you might not know so be aware. Also be aware of watching the inroom entertainment as they charge $28 for an hour. The bathroom of my room were not so good it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: arifin_dena
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with great location,, near by to MRT station..!perfect night life ,,clean hotel and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Songul_73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Novotel Clarke Quay twice.The first time was after a business training in Singapore, October 2010. My sister was with me and we have actually made a booking for another hotel from booking.com which we did not like at all. We checked out after one night and moved to Novotel. The front desk staff, Ming, could understand from our expressions that we had a bad experience and promised to give us the best room he could and we were very happy after seeing our room looking at Marina Bay Sands. After that we knew that we could approach him and all his colleaugues for our concerns. My 2nd stay was a stopover with my husband after our Phuket trip for our 7th anniversary. We made our booking for a superior room but were upgraded to an executive room. When we arrived our room we already had a bottle of complimentary wine which we really appreciated the quick service. The rooms were clean on both of our stays, we enjoyed the pool area a lot, but the best part was the staff's attitude to the guests.
