On our return day I realised that I lost my immigration card and Ratis from front desk was so kind to call airport for us and as it was late afternoon we could not reach anyone at all. He was still asking us what else he could do for us. He even called one of his colleagues from guest relations to check if he had any idea what could be done. He was so calm and patience within this period that me and my husband knew we could not thank him enough. One more positive thing about the hotel that they have 4-5 Apple PCs next to the front desk for free which is very good as most Singapore hotels don't have free internet or Wi-fi. I would definetely suggest this hotel to anyone as you will feel home with their wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stop over in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Kevlee2022
Reviews.Content: We stopped off in Singapore, breaking the flight to London. We stayed with Novotel Clarke Quay. Very nice hotel. Very organised when booking in and out. Extremely polite staff, could not do enough for you. Rooms very clean and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden charges for unused services. Inflexible service.”
Reviews.Author: VillaAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference I was asked to give a speech which was in this hotel. Obviously the location is great, that's the biggest selling point of this hotel. On the to negatives though, their "check in desk" is on the 7th floor, not on the ground floor, so the sense of arrival is not so great, and actually a bit confusing. I stayed on the "club/lounge" floor or whatever they call it. It was ok, bed was fine, AC was extra cold, the ceiling feels a bit low, the bathroom was ok, the shower water was hot enough and had ample water pressure. The shower was a bit too small for me though, it's like showering in a box. And there is no where to put your shampoo, conditioner, soap etc. They just have a tiny soap tray in the shower - it sucks. Anyway, if that were the only comments I had about the hotel, I would say I had a good enough time there - not great, but satisfactory. Apparently, with my room, without me knowing, they booked me an airport transfer to and from the airport. When I left the airport, I looked around to see if someone was standing there from Novotel waiting for (sometimes hotels provide free hotel pickup... so I thought it would look, even though I don't recall hearing about a pickup (free or not)). No one was there from Novotel waiting for me. So, of course, I get my own taxi to the hotel. As I arrive at the hotel and check in, they tell me about the driver waiting for me at the airport. I tell them, I wasn't aware of anything being arranged, so I took a taxi. They told me they would sort it out later, ok, fine. As the front office clerk is showing me around my room, the phone in my room rings, I don't pick it up because I'm still putting my bags down. 3 minutes later the phone rings again, it's concierge telling me that there was a car waiting for me at the airport for 1 hour. I explain again! the situation, he says "Well, I'll look into it." Not exactly friendly, they're already assuming I'm guilty or lying. I get a letter the next day from the hotel saying that they called my secretary and that an airport pickup and drop off was indeed listed on the booking confirmation and if I wanted to cancel this mysteriously added / unrequested airport pickup, I would have to call them one week in advance of checking in. And so, because I didn't, I would have to pay $70.09 as the cancellation fee! Who charges $70.09? Why not just make it $70? Where do they come up with these numbers? As I check out, I see a charge for both airport pickup and drop off $70.09 each way, I explain: A) I was unaware of the pickup - if I was, I would have used it B) There was no one waiting for me with a sign at the airport! C) $70.09 was a bit excessive for a cancellation charge. The lady at the front desk says she'll call the manager. Ok, fine. 10 minutes later a guy comes, with what looks like poppy seeds in his teeth and sharp pointy fang like teeth, to explain the same thing to me. I explain my reasoning again. Another 15 minutes wasted - I need to get to the airport. Then he says he'll have to call the sales manager. I wait another 15 minutes and I ask the front desk lady, "I thought you were calling "the manager", this guy is now calling "the manager" ". The whole idea of "calling the manager" is that this person is able to solve all problems, whether it is a definite yes or no or we'll reduce the fee etc - not to have to call down a team of "managers" to solve a small problem. So, as time was ticking away I was running out of time to make it to the airport and the other "manager" still hadn't arrived. It became clear to me that they were not going to help me with this and instead have me arguing with a circle of people from the hotel. I wasn't interested in doing that and I really needed to go to the airport. So, I just paid it all and left. Bad first impression of the hotel and bad last impression of the hotel. I'll be looking somewhere else to stay during my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AllSaints325 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, very convenient. Great service, especially the concierge who the moment you step out of the lift asks where you are going and then immediately goes to order you a taxi if that is what you require. Extremely efficient service from all members of staff. Speedy check in and check out. The only downside was that in all the promotional material for Novotel and Families, they state that they have late check out on Sundays at 5pm. As we required this due to a late flight out of Singapore, we asked about this and were told that unfortunately due to the hotel being full, we had to check out at 1pm. This should be stated clearly in brochures that the late check out is conditional. The rooms are extremely clean. However, for a family of 4, only 2 towels were given to us, and we then had to go about trying to request more towels for each day. The restaurant was great in which we had breakfast every morning. Nothing to fault at all. All in all, a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice in Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: applecart3355
Reviews.Content: If you love the vibrant, modern side of Singapore, staying in Clarke Quay is a good choice. Among the hotels in Clarke Quay, Novotel is a good option for a more casual accommodation, compared to the Swissotel Merchant Court. The hotel lives up to Novotel standards. The room is very comfortable. If you reserve online, be careful, sometimes breakfast is not included. But if you're up to some adventure, hawker centers are better place to find exotic Singaporean breakfast menu. The only thing that bothers me is the long walk to Clarke Quay MRT Station--but I'm lazy feet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location, and 5 star service from check in to check out!”
Reviews.Author: Lilly0530
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay for one night, as we stopped over in Singapore on our way back to Australia from England. We wanted a hotel near restaurants and "nightlife", and as I am familiar with Accor Brand, I thought Novotel will be a trusting hotel. I regulary use Accor Hotels, from Mercure to Sofitel/Pullman, and hands down this hotel provided the most 5 star service out of all of them. From check in to check out, the staff were very friendly, presented themselves nicely, and nothing was too much trouble. The lobby and bar area were very clean and modern looking, and bedrooms looked recently refurbished and had all the right amenities. We are planning on visiting Singapore at the end of the year with some friends, and will definetly use Novotel Clarke Quay again. Very impressed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: Wandering03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for very short trip to Singapore. The location of the hotel was quite convenient and the room was comfortable. Breakfast was included in my rate which was a nice perk. The reception staff was not particularly friendly when I arrived, but the concierge in the hotel lobby was very helpful. All in all, I would recommend this place for a short stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: amir z
Reviews.Content: Doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside th hotel is really nice. Friendly and quick check in. The rooms are nice and comfortable, even though the AC can get even too cold at times. Nice bathroom. Staff extremely helpful and nice. Always attentive, very reliable. Breakfast is so-so. Interesting-- great music piped through the speakers. Actually found myself shazaming the elevator music.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KFSKSP
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for probably over 20 times (due to company hotel policy) over the last 4 years. There is really nothing great about the hotel, but a lot of shortcomings as pointed by others which I am listing below, - Overpriced, between SG$220-250 - Tired looking, needs a major facelift - Terrible food, whether it is breakfast, lunch, dinner or room service - Poor service - Check-in and check-out process could be very time-consuming - Internet is slow and unreliable - If you do not have computers, there are 3 or 4 Macs at the lobby level which are free to use Its only selling point is its choice location right in Clarke Quay and the views of the room. I have had rooms with the view of the river, the leafy park, and Marina Bay Sands.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to its previous standard”
Reviews.Author: stephen p
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in this hotel on numerous occasions, and always found it to be excellen, I arrived with my family only to find this visit to be a bit of a let down. The atmosphere in the hotel was not the same, the staff seemed uninterested, and cold, and were somewhat dismissive of any issues (one relating to the rooms) that were raised with them. The pool area had had a cheap touch up job done on it. The A Club is also confusing, as points cannot be gained if a stay is booked through a travel agent, even though our there was evidence of what had been payed per room. Points can only been gained if the hotel had been booked via the internet. Unfortunately, after this stay, I will think twice about staying when we pass through Singapore again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel mostly because my MBA workshops were held in the same place. Food is good, room is nice, just that bathroom need to be touched up as it gave really feeling of staying in outdated and old hotel. Room is spacious, clean and really nice. I like the surrounding, mall is just downstairs, seven eleven also just next to the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST TIME IN SINGAPORE AND WHAT A DELIGHT”
Reviews.Author: Colin F
Reviews.Content: I arrived late on Sunday night after a delayed flight from Australia. When I arrived into the Hotel, I was greeted warmly and check in was fast and friendly. I enjoyed an upgrade to the Premier Floor and for the two days, I could not fault the service.I had a guest for breakfast on the first morning and he commented on the good service. Johy Chetty and his team are doing a great job. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle025
Reviews.Content: Rooms very clean and modern location excellent close to Clarke Quay with fantastic restaurants. Food at Novotel good also but a bit expensive. Has shops adjoining with Starbucks mac d and subway 2 mins away also. Has large pool and resort like setting. Convenient place to stay with family.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clark Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised and pleased with the hotel and the room. We stayed in a suite on the Premiere Floor, through our Accor membership, which was an extra treat. All in all a very good stay. Centrally located near shops, restaurants and nightlife. Excellent staff and attentiveness. One small A/C problem, fixed immediately.

Reviews.Title: “complain mengenai harga yg tdk sama”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay at novotel for 2 nights with Accor member status by wearing two name two members Accor, I was told to upgrade but are not given extra bed. while my friend upgraded. but given the additional beds, at the same price, 58 dollars singapore / night

Reviews.Title: “Good facility and Good value”
Reviews.Author: MCJChengdu_
Reviews.Content: not planed to stay in this hotel due to pre-arrangement of Singapore Tourism Administration. but when we arrived Singarpore we found the hotel which Toursim Adminisatrtion arranged is not acceptable. So we had to find a new hotel by ourselves. Since Clark Quay is a highly recommanded destination for Singarpore travlling, we choose Novotel. the hotel has a great location at Clark Quay, you can walk to the night club district of clark quay in 2 minutes and even you can see the full sigh of Clark Quay just from your window. take a 5 minutes walk you can take the metro. the breakfast is delicious with varies of foods in asia\western style. most important, the price of room is quite fair in a place like singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Again, check-in took too long”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in process simply took too long, and it was in the late afternoon, where the queue was not even long. It seems to be a prevalent characteristic across Accor hotels in general, be it a Sofitel, Novotel or Ibis, especially when comparing against other hotels of equal categories. This is an unbiased observation made over time, across various properties in China, Singapore, Australia, as well as in some countries within Europe. That aside, it's still a Novotel, just like what you'd expect to it to be like, simple, fuss-free accommodation. This particular location is good if you like to hit the pubs and explore the nightlife by the Singapore River.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Singapore and the Novotel was chosen by fluke. I am thrilled that we stayed at this second to none location. The package that we bought was amazing, it included a scratch and save, a city tour and breakfast. We booked the executive room and was over the moon when we got upgraded to a Suite. The staff are all so generous and can't do enough to help. The front desk ensured a speedy check in, the Manager goes the extra mile to ensure gr8 client service and the chef at breakfast makes a mean chilli omelete. My daughters are ages 7 and 13 and they loved the helpfulness of the staff as well. This hotel will for sure be our hotel of choice in Singapore. I am already looking at booking for the end of September. Thank you Novotel Clark Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel before and knew we would enjoy the same level of service and attention as our previous stays. The staff are amazing and go out of their way to help- from the concierge, to the reception staff to the cleaners.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel . easy to go anywhere. close to mrt and mall”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to CLARKE QUAY MRT. . Foods just a step away from hotel . Very convenience. Bedroom is not too small . But the pillow is not good quality . Bathroom amenities are very poor . No shower cap, no tooth brush .

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: mlchong Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and my 3 year old. The hotel is very family/child friendly. Location is superb as it is just next to the happening Clark Quay. As the hotel was walking distance to many restaurants and eateries, it was easy for my kid.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i book for suite 1 king bed executive, inside have living room with big lcd tv, big king size bed and one more lcd tv, spacious bathroom with jacuzzi, my daughter really happy with the bathroom and verry happy every time take bath, and for internet i must give big thumb for the speed and also free. for travelling around, downstairs already shopping center, at food court there's fried dumpling and very delicous. for walking you can easily go to chinatown. will book and stay over there very soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AJJAustralia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in different hotels in Singapore over the years and this year decided to choose the Novotel Clark Quay. We were quite surprised with just how vibrant this area is with its cafes and restaurants running the length of the river. A spectacular view from our room looked out over the river and we could see as far as the Sands Marina. The room was large and very comfortable. The pool area very attractive, and the choice at breakfast was awesome. Staff were friendly and efficient. Our 2 nights were very enjoyable and we will no doubt return to this hotel on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, service was good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: JackoinSyd
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location, about 10 minute walk with kids to MRT, 5 minutes if you are power walking. Taxi's easy to get and good value if you have 4-5 people. Hotel was very busy and the staff were pushed to the limit. they managed well and tried their best, but hotel could not cope with the number of guests. At breakfast, there was a line waiting for the buffet, but staff were doing their best to find seats for everyone. 30 SGD per day for internet access, overpriced from my experience. Good hotel, but price was not matched to the value, approx 400 SGD per night for family of 5 in two standard rooms (2nd room was at half price, inc breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Almost smoked out, burned instead”
Reviews.Author: consunji Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Over-all a so-so stay. Issued a smoking room then told no other room was available, Angelo helped get us a non-smoking room 15 mins later. Watch out for the numerous burn & scald hazards at the breakfast buffet [which was so-so]. 'Someone' should look into ways to reduce the scald risk for customers. Didn't bother to eat in hotel because lots of great food choices at Clarke Quay, just steps away [Jumbo was the best seafood around and Muchos had decent Mexcian food also].

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Billy M
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay is well located on top of Liang Court and is literally surrounded by great restaurants and bars, so you're never stuck for choices of where to eat. We had the breakfast buffet included in our package and was well worth it, they had a huge selection from fruit and cereal through to eggs, bacon and even steamed dumplings noodles! The staff were friendly and always willing to help out where they could. We had one minor problem with our room which we reported and it was fixed that very day. Transport is a breeze with a taxi rank and bus stop just outside and an MRT station just over the other side of the river. All in all a great place to stay while in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel”
Reviews.Author: pinayflashpacker Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: ~spacious room w/ big bed ~good buffet breakfast w/ many choices ~w/ attached mall ~beside clarke quay ~free internet macs in the lobby ~loud water pipes (from neighbor room) ~no exhaust in bathroom ~expensive

Reviews.Title: “Novatel Clarke Quay - A Great Break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleasantly surprised when we stayed at the Novalel recently! We were on our last leg of our return journey from Europe and had been away from home too long. However the Novatel provided the most comfortable bed and pillows that I have ever experienced at a hotel, and the location was fantastic - we went to dinner and then one of the bars close by to listen to a very good band playing there - also a welcome experience. The service standards in the reception and restaurant in the hotel was immaculate, when we went for breakfast - the chefs should be congratulated as well! If we could have done so, we would have stayed for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel still have rooms that does not derserved to be part of this chain”
Reviews.Author: Abiyoyo
Reviews.Content: Obsolete batroom, with leaks, with old silicone with balck due to humidity etc. The rest of the room was OK, but the bathroom look like from an old 3* hotel not being maintained long, long time ago. As stated this kind of room should not be opnend to the public till are renovated. Pity.

Reviews.Title: “Poor toilet position”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Much improved since renovation, however, you almost need to sit sideways when using the toilet as there is so little space between toilet and shower screen. Overall the room was otherwise good and I particularly liked the complete light blockout curtains which are not always truly effictive in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant two hight stay. Room clean, staff very friendly, amenities satisfactory. Location right on Clarke Quay with easy access to river boats and MRT. Minor problem is that the reception is on the seventh floor, so two elevators required to get to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE AND A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was very easy to work with the front desk, it is a great location close to Restaurants and Bars. i found the pool to be great not to busy and plenty of space to swim. we had dinner in the restaurant the seafood buffet was sensational. our room was very fuctional for business with pleanty of power outlets and easy internet conection.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant evening meals are a disaster !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service is excellent... but "half buffet dinner" concept for evening meals is a disaster. The main meals are disgraceful. First night the steak was drowned in sauce that completely covered the plate and had some old green lettuce shoved on the plate next to it. Next night the apparent "signature dish" the crab, exact same thing, so much sauce over it I literally could not pick up the crab to eat it so I sent it back. There is defintley no trained "chef" cooking out back. Its more like you would get from a "cook" in a rest home or somewhere, not an international hotel. Smallest flat screen TV I have ever seen in a hotel like this. 22 inch TV is not what you expect. Whoever is inspecting the cleaning please look on the top of ther toliet doors, I could see the dust build up from the shower... Only thing got going for it is friendly staff and good service...

Reviews.Title: “Great serice, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: BearsRus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 8 days in a premier floor room, service was brilliant from the moment we entered, very quick personalised check in, fantastic views of Clarke Quay from our room and brilliant views out towards the new Marina Bay Sands Hotel from the premier lounge. Booking a Premier room is well worth it, great lounge for quiet times during the day when you need to recover after sightseeing and shopping, breakfast each morning and happy hour from 6pm to 8pm each evening with free drinks and canapes with really friendly staff. Really good for meeting fellow travellers, which you don't normally have the chance to do, staff are very courteous and as mentioned the views are even more spectacular as the sun goes down. In your room you have a fully stocked fridge, with 2 free bottles of water a day, more in premier lounge if needed, and it was a bit sticky compared with Australian weather, add to this the free internet and late checkout, the hotel was very modern and great. Below the hotel there is a shopping centre with a Starbucks and a full supermarket for those things you need or forgot to pack, 40 metres across the road is the start of Clarke Quay, the bunboat ride in the evening is a must do, the views from the river are brilliant, takes you all the way down past the Merlion and around the bay in front of the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands, which looks like a modern ship has landed on top of the three towers, quite spectacular, dont forget your camera or your passport if you intend to visit the casino. Along the Quay there are shops/shopping centres and literately hundreds of places to eat, if you cant find something you like, your obviously very picky and should head back to the Novotel to their lovely restaurant. Brilliant place to stay, excellent service, central location, we will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliness and hospitality was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Debbiemreid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Clarke Quay in Singapore twice in July and found that it was amazingly friendly. Everyone went out of their way to look after us and they did it with a smile! The dining room where we had breakfast each morning and dinner on a couple of occasions was particularly good. We were blown away with the friendliness and warmth of all the staff. We were greeted by Arjun, the maitre'd, who was very obliging and even remembered our names! One of the chefs, Varnan, went to a great deal of trouble in attending to the particular dietary requirements of my husband who was not well. We really felt looked after. The food was also fantastic - a good blend of Western and Asian! We would recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys good service with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel well appointed.”
Reviews.Author: BillandBeryl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 17 - 20th with my family, so handy to Clarke Quay and all the resturants. Very odd having reception on the 7th floor, friendly staff all willing to help and their continental breakfast was excellent and a lot of variety. Would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Intruder”
Reviews.Author: Jshepardtx
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last night....I arrived at 10 pm....at 10:15 an guy was letting himself into my room (maintenance)....I was not dressed.....luckily I had the manual latch on so he could see through to the bed where I was relaxing.....this is totally unacceptable for someone to let themself into a room when a guest is in the room when nothing has been asked for by the guest. I checked out this morning and will never stay there again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: Bolly27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Clarke Quay area of Singapore so very close to many eateries and Chinatown. We were lucky enough to be up-graded to the Premier floor and really enjoyed our large room and bathroom with a bath and seperate shower recess. Unfortunately we were not told of the lounge in this area where we could have happy hour drinks and nibbles. Breakfast was plentiful with many choices and the pool area very pleasant for a dip after a day of sight-seeing. All staff were efficient and helpful especially at the concierge desk where we booked our included city tour and a night safari tour. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, it is in a fantastic location in Clarke Quay. It is above a small shopping centre and 7-11 which was very convenient, therefore we did not eat at the hotel, which was more expensive. A short stroll from a train station, and the Singapore River, a spectacular area at night, especially on a river cruise. The children really enjoyed the pool. While most staff were fairly impersonal, the Chief Concierge and team were wonderful. I lost my phone on my flight, and he made all the calls to try and retrieve it for me. He also corresponded with me prior to our arrival via email and gave me some great advice regarding Universal Studios tickets, and Breakfast at Singapore Zoo, and trains vs taxis. His great advice saved us alot of time and money. Thanks again Ashok!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TravellerNormandy
Reviews.Content: We had a room at the 24th floor. everything is perfect, good limo service. Breakfast excellent and service over expectation. Maybe because this hotel was previously own by The New Otani. Well located close to Clak Quay with an easy access to the other parts of Singapore. Only one wish: improve the gym. It is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location with easy access to Clarke Quay precinct”
Reviews.Author: JARMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend business trip. The hotel was within easy reach for our work. However our hosts in Singapore took us to Clark Quay for Dinner. We enjoyed the area, and for a Friday and Saturday night it was very busy. The hotel is upto the Novotel standard expected. We were in room 2102. It was a corner room, and there are 4 corner rooms on each floor. BEWARE each of these rooms are slightly smaller than the usual room. No real problem except the bed was situated up against a wall, made it hard to get into bed for the 2 of us! We had breakfast in the Square restuarant. It was a good breakfast with eggs omlettes done to order. We also had dinner one night in the buffet. That was also good. THere was a wide range of food options. Some of the meats in the salads were however quite tough. Will stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelClaim
Reviews.Content: Singapore has a lot of hotels and it was difficult to choose one, so with a little bit of help with Dr. Google and TripAdvisor I was able to decide on Novotel Clarke Quay. This was a modern hotel with a lot of comforts run by a fantastic group of family staff no matter what time of day/night it was. I chose this hotel for the brand reputation and also for its location...Clarke Quay...which is situated near all the waterfront hotels and restaurant. Below are my pros and cons. Pros: The hotel is close to everything! Restaurants, nightlife, shopping complexes (in fact the hotel sits on top of a small shopping complex) and there is public transport easily accessible. We caught the taxi with ease every day. Although it was close to everything it was also not in a place where it seemed very busy and noisy which was a bonus. The rooms were very modern, clean and spacious. I actually wish I had a slightly smaller room since I was staying in one by myself. The minibar was well stacked, some of the beverages were a little too expensive so I bought my own drinks and kept it in the fridge. The breakfast every morning was a treat! It was all buffet (didnt really want room service, but if I wanted to it was available 24/7!), they had all forms of eggs, breads, meats, cereals, fresh fruit, curries, noodles....First morning there we ate so much we didnt even have lunch! The staff were very attentive and polite, serving us coffee. There were also a restaurant and bars which we didnt get the chance to try, but looked very nice! Cons: The late check in was the only time we had a staff member seem really...uninterested...but when you consider that we were checking in at 3am, I too would be tired and wanting my shift to finish. Getting to the actual hotel lobby itself was a bit confusing, it was located on the 7th floor and if there were no staff at the building lobby we would of been lost, its only a minor issue but since there were always staff available its also nothing major. Bathroom was large, but when you turned the shower on, remember to close the glass door otherwise water will flood the bathroom and also the toilet is positioned in an awkward way so when you sit on it and have to lean forward your head hits the shower glass. Overall I loved the place and will stay there happily each time I visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: skazmer
Reviews.Content: We went as a family group and had 2 rooms, the hotel was very good, rooms were clean and modern. The location is second to none!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Novotel Clark quay for a week with Spin & Stay offer. Very clean rooms, perfect location and very good breakfast. Free Internet & Free breakfast & Free Day tour was included with this offer. We enjoyed all. During the weekend was too much noise in the rooms up to midnight because of the location in Clark Quay. If someone looking for silent rooms not recommended. Anyway we enjoyed the location because very close to shops, MRT , restaurants and nice location in Clark Quay.... The hotel upgrade our room to the superior room free on the check in time... Recommend to everyone...

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay in Singapor”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an ideal spot, you have easy access to most sight seeing spots and it is close to dining areas. Ths staff were exytremely helpful and the meals were great, the rooms were cleaned daily and are a good size.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: nikkie_inWanderland Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is fantastic .Need better pillow.Easy to go to night hang out.Free shutter bus for free route.Service is good staff are friendly.Value for money. I got the web promotion half price!!!i really love it and i will try other novotel in other country.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...great hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoffmark
Reviews.Content: Novotel Clarke Quay is one of the best Novotel's we have stayed at (and we have stayed at a lot of them). The location is great with the MRT not too far away, dining options so close and nearby to a lot of the major attractions. On arrival reception advised us we needed to check in on the premier floor and escorted us up to the lounge there. As soon as we entered they greeted us by name, offered us a drink and checked us in. Our room there was fantastic and well decorated with a bathroom with a seperate shower as well as a shower over the bath. Service was efficient whenever we requested anything and as for the premier lounge staff nothing was too much trouble for them. The lounge was a great place to relax after a hot day out with a varied range of food and complimentary alcohol between 6 - 8pm with soft drink and coffee available during lounge opening hours. Breakfast was relaxing in the lounge but if you wanted a wider variety we could eat at the restaraunt downstairs which was also very good. Overall this is a great hotel in a great location and we will be staying there again next time we go to singapore

Reviews.Title: “Should with Free Wifi in Room~”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As I did stayed in the executive floor of twin bed room, it should inculde the free WIFI service for this room type. And the TV in room is too small only 19' or 20'. It is really not match the class and the size of the room. But the services are good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, loved our stay. The location is great, right in the entertainment area on the river and only a $5 taxi ride to Orchard road. The pub on the other side of the river is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed and returned AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Durian1
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel. The staff, hotel and restaurant was excellent. We had access to the Execuitive lounge which was as pleasent (with a great view) as any 5 Star hotel I have stayed in. I would highly recommend this hotel to family, friends and anyone who enjoys comfort away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant end to a nice holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was a very pleasant one. From the time we arrived which was early in the morning, we were greated with a smile and a very helpful FELICIA. As we had been on an overnight flight, Felicia did her best to accomodate us with a room. We found it to be in a great location, very clean and good facilities. I would certainly recommend this hotel to my friends.,

Reviews.Title: “VERY ENJOYABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in good location. Extremely helpfull staff and would come back again sometime in the future. Air conditioning set too cold compared to outside temperate but otherwise very comfortable rroom. Only had a short stay as a stopover from 1 month in Europe

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and am going back”
Reviews.Author: lskmuse
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in Singapore. I cannot say enough about the location. It is not 'luxurious' but it has every amenity including a great pool. The staff is excellent. I loves the concierge who was endlessly helpful; they went out of their way. It is a good value and the greatest thing is the food court in the shopping mall (4 floors of every shop you can imagine). The food in the food court was superb and cheap. Its location, location, location. Also near the subway. You can get. Cab to Raffles for a drink but I would stay here again and I am!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: GFCJ Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located adjacent to Clarke Quay, this is a pretty nice hotel. I booked two rooms and one had a terrific view down to Marina Bay. Breakfast was good quality and plenty of choice for all tastes. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotle or using it in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: AlternateRoute
Reviews.Content: Good: right in Clarke Quay - hot nightspot, dinner location just next to the river good quality furnishings etc good staff Bad: expensive - but Singapore hotel's are all expensive compared to elsewhere front desk is oddly located Singapore real estate is extremely expensive, and hotel costs have skyrocketed. Comparatively, after living here and learning the hotel situation pretty well, this is not bad value for money. If you want a good quality hotel this is a good choice. You can find more deluxe, or cheaper, but I love this location and found it a good place to stay. Rooms are well appointed with quality furnishings (note: I stayed here twice in 2011 and both times was on the club floor - so, not sure about their standard rooms). Staff were not exactly warm and friendly, but very professional. If you want to enjoy some nightlife, walk along the river, get some great food riverside - this is a v good choice. Would I stay here again? Yes, if I have the money!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: anizen
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit tired, the beds sagged a little in the middle, which is disappointing for a 4 star hotel. Location was close to a shopping centre and a short walk to Metro station. Not enough internet computers in the Lobby, so it was difficult to access internet.

Reviews.Title: “A good stop-over”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller36 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is a convenient place for a night or so while transitting Singapore. As the River has lost its historic business bustle and Chinatown is a shadow of what it used to be the location no longer has as much touristic value. The odd check in arrangements - going to seventh floor to start the business - do not pose much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not polished.”
Reviews.Author: juliababy
Reviews.Content: The rooms and location are of a good standard. The annoying thing for me was there was absolutely NO information in the room about things like room service, what facilities there were and when they were open. As a result I did not eat at the restaurants as they did not promote themselves to hotel patrons. The hotel staff were fairly dismissive like they were not overly interested-this included reception staff. I stayed at another hotel in Singapore on the same trip and the comparison was quite noticeable. The internet facilities were great, both in the room and in the lobby area. top marks for this. The pool area was also great, although I had no idea where to get the pool towels so used my room towel. There is room for improvement here-mostly with regard to staff training and catering to the tourist. There was good lighting in the room, which is not often the case in hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “its value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel clark quay always become the first choice hotel for me to stay in Singapore. Its offer nice room - you need to try executive rooms its very spacious and ideal for family with 2 children- , strategic location - close to clark quay surely and to MRT station. Its really Value for money

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: allaPerthWA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right on the river with direct access to all activities around the river. It provides an open space feel, not like hotels located amidst multi highrise buildings of the CBD. We had stayed at this hotel in 2005 and wanted to go back because of it's position. The river area is fantastic, particularly at night with many eating and drinking places, boat rides up and down the river and of course some shopping centres. Also located close to Chinatown and the MRT train system. We stayed this time for nine nights in an Executive room which was very large with a big two shower bathroom, and accomodated our granddaughter with a rollout bed and there was still plenty of room. I think most rooms if not all have a small balcony which is great for taking in the wonderful views of Singapore, but not necessarily for sitting. Breakfast was included, most plentiful and of excellent quality and choice. The hotel entry at road level is the concierge and luggage, then you go up lifts to the seventh floor for reception. From there you enter lifts to your rooms, which require your room key cards to operate for security. I have read some reveiwers complaining that this is an inconvenient way of getting to your rooms, however I consider this more private and not a problem. The hotel has been around a while but the rooms and pool area have been renovated. The pool area is okay with plenty of space, lounges and cabanas, but is not your typical "lagoon type" pool, but it is very servicable when you want to cool down. Our granddaughter enjoyed it and we relaxed there on a few occasions. The staff are very pleasant and helpful, and in particular Mr John Chetty assisted my wife to find a doctor when she developed a medical problem ( nothing to do with the hotel or Singapore). We did have a minor issue with the room service ( nothing serious) and was pleasantly surprised to find when we arrived home, I got an email from the general manager Mr Kevin Bossino asking for my phone number so he could ring and talk to me about the problem, which he did. This to me indicated how much importance they place on ensuring their guests looked after. Singapore is a lovely place to visit and very safe. They do it so well for tourists and there are many things to visit including the Zoo, Jurong Bird Park, Singapore Flyer (Scenic wheel), Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Casino and Sentosa Island with the new attraction Universal Studios, Sky Tower, Laser Light Show, The Luge. Taxis are relatively cheap and plentiful to any place and the rail system is terrific. We would stay at this hotel again and would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Booking needs fine tuning.”
Reviews.Author: mizgina
Reviews.Content: Overall was happy with the hotel but a few issues were experienced. Booked asked for 2 rooms close to each other. In the end we had rooms which were 3 floors apart! Unable to access with room key any level apart from your own. Great for security but not so great if you have friends on a different level. Aircon in room was hot, but a phone call at 1am saw the maintenance man come and and fix. Found that young people buy their alcohol at the 7/11 downstairs and in the early hours of the morning when heading away from hotel making a racket which can be heard on the 12th floor, windows need double glazing. Great location, close to Clarke Quay and all it offers, close to transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well located for Clarke Quay attractions, a short walk to MRT station. We were upgraded to Executive room with great view over the river and of the Quay. Staff friendly and efficient although from time to time there can be a bit of a queue at Reception. Have stayed here several times and happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JissBobby
Reviews.Content: next to clarke quay makes this hotel fun.lots of options to eat.Rooms are reasonably sized, so is the bathroom. priced high, reception is on the 4th floor i guess, rooms are above that.good view of the city skyline from the 7th floor room

Reviews.Title: “location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: donzero
Reviews.Content: Can't fault Novotel Clarke Quay for their location. The hotel is very accessible and conveniently located. Their connecting room offer is why i considered this hotel in the first place. we didn't get the family themed room as they are costly, We were charged only the regular two rooms though we got a connecting room which, is a plus if you're traveling with young teens. You have to call the hotel for this though, you will not find this offer in the website. Their child age is under 15 which was a plus as two in my company are 12 and 13 which would be counted as adults in most establishments. check in: quite tedious but nonetheless okay check out: like checking in! buffet breakfast: yummy! Breakfast crew was very accommodating. Kudos to Sashi, the Asst Manager for the great assistance provided. Walking distance to GMAX too If I get the chance to go to Singapore again, I'd book here without another thought.

Reviews.Title: “Location is very good !!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near Clarke Quay which is the real entertainment place. Just walk 2 minutes. Also, concierge is very kind. They reserved famous restaurant and explain all about Singapore. The distance to Mariba bay sands and Universal studios is very short. If you want reservation to Universal studios, just tell to concierge. Every 9AM, the bus to Universal studios will come to carry you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some things lacked however...”
Reviews.Author: SparkeysDadNZ
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel location was the best. You can't fault it, well worth the stay. The room was clean and tidy. The reception on the 7th floor was confusing, but we made it. It was crowded whilst checking in though, especially with lift passengers pushing past. Our room however had no hot water which was not good. The TV remote wouldn't turn the TV on or off either which was annoying. 2 other rooms in our group had broken remotes as well and 1 other had no hot water. We also had our son share the room with us, and whilst we had booked in for 3 people, they said we couldn't have a rollaway bed as we didn't specify it separately. This was a bit strange. And they claimed they has none available. Our son had to sleep on the carpet with our bed throw over him and one of our pillows. Not good really, we expected better. So for me 5/10 score. Great location, but needs to do better. I would stay again, but next time I would be way more vocal with my concerns.

Reviews.Title: “This is where they know what quality service means”
Reviews.Author: Jiggleontour
Reviews.Content: I had already spent 2 nights in Singapore in a 5 star hotel before I came to Novotel. While Novotel is officially a 4 star hotel, it actually puts the 5 star in its shadows because in Novotel they actually redefine quality service and attention to detail. It is evident that staff are exceptionally well trained and especially Rathish who had the ability to second guess ones needs. Stay in this hotel to feel safe, cared for and experience a stress free version of a Singapore stay. Can't recommend it enough for its service quality and standard.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Perfect Service. Perfect Location. Perfect everything”
Reviews.Author: Pradoboy67
Reviews.Content: I regularly travel to Singapore for work and have never stayed at the Novotel. That’s going to change moving forward. The service, facilities, rooms and hotel location cannot be beat. Located in the heart of everything and the MRT a short walk away makes this hotel perfect for the family vacation and business traveler alike. All I can say is thanks for a great holiday and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday visit to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location of the Novotel is great - we really like the Clarke Quay location as it easy to access MRT and all the other main locations of the city. Lots of restaurants and services right nearby. Hotel breakfast very good. We really liked our premium room and the pool. No negatives to report

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the location ideal, we were able to get to anywhere in Singapore from our Hotel within moments by taxi, tour bus or aquaduck, enabling us to hop on & off when we wanted during the entire day for one cost. All visitors must visit Little India and China town which are both a 15 minute walk from the Hotel. We recommend you do this early in the day if you do not enjoy humidity. A supermarket is now next to the Hotel (downstairs) which can accomodate all your food and alcohol needs at a fraction of the price of the Hotel. American Breakfast is well worth paying for as an additional cost when you check in, but avoid paying for the internet as it is free at reception with plenting of wide screen monitors available. Service by staff in all restaurants was exceptional to the point of your coffee being filled the moment you put down your cup.. A dissapointing aspect of our stay was the lack of visitor information available at the hotel. When asked ,we were advised to speak to the Concierge on the ground floor who told us "Sorry I dont speak very good English". The Hotel lacks information first time visitor need, there was not even a city map available. We walked accross the river to another Hotel and were given all the assistance we axpected from our own... Out of 10 this rated a 2.

Reviews.Title: “Please Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: ATLconsultant
Reviews.Content: Some of these reviews are just dead on: the ones that mention the noise and the lack of attention to detail. I'm staying here right now, in room 2106. i arrived last night at 2:00 a.m. (7/24/11) -- late due to equipment problems with our jet in Beijing. Check-in lady was very friendly. Went to room. Room was a complete disappointment. If you're from the U.S. and have ever had the misfortune of staying in a Microtel, the rooms are modular like a Microtel....i'd say to accurately describe it would be a cross between a Microtel room and a Marriott Courtyard room. The rooms are tiny too. I'd say about 200 square feet. But i was OK. It's just for a week of business. Plus, the view is terrific and you have a balcony that they will open for you. i'd never have stayed here if I had purchased the room myself, however. Not for $200 USD/night. There are MUCH better options in Singapore for quality vs. price point. Then morning hit. At 8:00 a.m. it sounded like people slamming palettes of heavy boards (coming from the center of the tower where the staff moves around in service elevators. Every 20 minutes it sounds like they just dropped another palette of heavy items somewhere about 30 feet from my room. Turns out it is the door slamming in the service area, behind laundry carts that are coming up. Crazy loud. Went down for breakfast. Another mistake. The buffet is dreadful for a "4 star" hotel (but this hotel is truly more of 3- 3.5 star variety). It's free with my rate but it's so bad that i won't return. i'd rather pay for breakfast elsewhere...it really is that dreadful. Food is horrendous. The last straw: i had laundry that I needed clean before work on Tuesday. I called downstairs and they sent a gentleman from housekeeping. As i passed him the bag he looked over his shoulder and into my room and he said, "when will you have your room cleaned? We can't clean your room until you clean up your room." I had 2 pieces of luggage with shoes, some socks, and a robe on the floor. I had just arrived late last night and had not had a chance to organize yet. The nerve. i'm not a 21 year old. i'm a 39 year old man who travels 40 weeks/year for my work. i'm well aware how to organize before housekeeping arrives. i do not appreciate being condescended to. You're also in a very heavy weekend party area for 20 somethings. They mob the 7-11 and McDonald's downstairs by the entrance and there are restaurants/discos with patios right beside the hotel. It gets very loud on weekend nights until about 3:00 a.m. If you're into that, then stay here cuz the location is unmatched for partying at Clarke Quay. But if you're not into it, remind yourself that many of those early 20 something people will be at the hotel, to take advantage of the location, and will be carousing through the hallways late at night as well, normally drunk and screaming. I can count on one hand the number of people i saw who were sober when I arrived last night. Last night felt like a weekend peek into my fraternity house, back in college. Unless the manager can move me to a room away from the housekeeping door, i'm leaving tomorrow. I'm hoping that the partiers are leaving today. Even though our training is inside the hotel, i'll walk to work from another location! i'll end this with Pros & Cons: Pros: 1. Front desk is nice. 2. Concierge gentleman was very helpful this morning. 3. View from balcony is very very nice. 4. Mattress very comfortable. 5. Location if you're in your early 20's Cons: 1. Breakfast is atrociously bad. 2. Rooms are small and need renovation badly. 3. Loud hallways. 4. Common areas are only of 3 star quality. 5. Location if you're not in your 20's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: finnternational
Reviews.Content: I had trouble finding a hotel that would take a couple plus 3 children in Singapore so found this hotel through a travel agent. I had read mixed reviews but when we arrived, found it to be outstanding. Our room was very nice and had one small problem which was the Australian power socket was broken. I discovered this at 10pm at night and desperately needed to charge my camera battery for the next day. Reception sent a guy to my room who didn't speak English but he didn't give up til he figured out the problem and got it fixed and my camera was ready for Universal Studios! The buffet breakfast (included in the price) was amazing, everything you could imagine plus more, like chick pea baked beans. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful on several occasions. The staff were all lovely, didn't have any problems. The location was excellent. We had considered staying on Sentosa Island and so glad we didn't as it's an overpriced, manufactured tourist trap. Clarke Quay is great for restaurants, wandering around with kids, the underground, and the hotel is above a shopping mall with a large supermarket where we could get nappies, snacks to take out for my toddler etc. It's a nice, safe area. I felt so lucky that we got a great hotel, as it's really a gamble when you're booking it. I only wish they had a babysitting service to look after my daughter and 2 stepchildren and my husband and I could have gone to some of the interesting bars around Clarke Quay. The kids corner is pretty weak, just a few bits of furniture and rockers but we were out most days anyway. The pool was very nice. I can definitely recommend this hotel and would go back if we return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: Somer213
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011 during our honeymoon, our first stop was in Singapore after the wedding. The hotel was very centrally located and near one of the few "party" areas of Singapore, Clarke Quay. But don't let that discourage you if you are not into that kind of thing, because Singapore is pretty mellow even in the "party" area. The room was super spacious, the staff very nice and we had an amazing view of all of Singapore. You are in a good location because the park is nearby but you can also walk pretty easily to Chinatown and Little India. You are also very close to public transit. If I stayed in Singapore again, it would definitely be here!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly suprised with this business hotel”
Reviews.Author: David19603009
Reviews.Content: I got an upgrade to a better room. Great central placing, you just walk out and there the night life is. The concierge was very heplful ; better to ask and take his advice than "go solo". Service attitude was foremost in the minds of all the staff. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: jiuma
Reviews.Content: The photo tells part of the story. Trying to get some rest upon arrival was impossible because of banging from construction/rennovations. Free internet was only available in the lobby. Requests to offer a discount fell on deaf ears. $238 Singapore Dollars a night was far to much. What a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 130pm and were advised that our requested non smoking interconnecting Superior Bayview rooms were not ready, so they registered us, gave us our room numbers, 1119 and 1120 and told us to come back an hour later. We arrived back an hour later to find that they had changed our room numbers from 11th to 8th floor, and when we went to the rooms we found they had put us on a smoking floor. We went back to reception to advise that we requested non smoking rooms and that we were not happy to have our 3 young children on a smoking floor. They advised that they did not have any other interconnecting rooms so put us on one of the Premiere floors in rooms on opposite sides of the building (only one of which was similar to the Superior Bay View room (ie. was larger, with a balcony and a bath) but without the giving us the Premiere benefits (complimentary breakfast and internet etc) When I rang to complain about the second room not having the facilities that I'd reserved with the Superior Bay Vew room (extra space and a bath) they advised that it was an "upgrade" and I didn't seem to be able to help them see that a smaller room with no bath on a higher floor with no Premiere Benefits was not an upgrade in my eyes...Later we went down tot the bar to meet some friends before going out for dinner only to have drinks that we ordered not turn up, so when we went to go out for dinner an hour later I advised the lady i had ordered the drinks from not to worry as we were leaving now... This stress was not what we needed for the start of our vacation in Singapore !

Reviews.Title: “For Info Ask Fellow Travellers”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found out more interesting things to do and how to get there from fellow travellers, than "official" means. The Singapore Info on the TV channel was not very helpful. It said have a good time, but presumed we knew where everything was.

Reviews.Title: “A truely great family holiday”
Reviews.Author: dhclarke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel - Clarke Quay - Singapore both on the way to Bali for 3 days and on the way back for 2 days. The Novotel experience was fantastic. The staff made our trip so easy - nothing was too hard. In particular, Thamil Vanan in the kitchen and Razali at the desk bent over backwards to provide magnificent food and great local knowledge and directions. The position in Clarke Quay was great - close to great restaurants and a quick taxi ride to Orchard Rd. We love Singapore (our 8th trip) and are looking forward to returning to the Novotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Services”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is very strategic, near to the culinary center and places of interst, but still provide environmental serenity. The services is fast, from the fist entrance to check out and taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MrASB
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in an amazing part of Singapore. First time in Singapore, decided once again to go with a name brand and something not bang in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. This hotel in my view had a prime location, Not to far from the likes of Orchard Road, which is great for electronics and not to far from the main mall either. The other and main advantage this hotel has is its located and convenience to Clarke Quay. A lovely strip of bars, restaurants, coffee shops all along the Quay. Staff are friendly, as are most people in Singapore to my experience. No problem during check-in. Hotel food can be a little pricey, But I opted to taste local Cuisines at one of the many near by fresh food markets. Highly recommended by myself. Roughly £6-7 from main airport via taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great all-round hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Vernmeister Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Positives - great breakfast, very good location next to Clarke Quay restaurants/bars nighclubs,shopping mall next door, walking distance to Chinatown, Fort Canning etc Negatives - renovation work at entry, a bit smelly around entry level, we were upgraded to a Premier Room, but were not told we couldn't use the Premier Lounge facilities - were embarrassed when told we shouldn't be here.

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Absolutely enjoyable stay -wish it was longer. Staff were helpful & friendly, check-in & out were speedy & efficient. The room was very clean & comfortable - everything was new. The only minus is that the lobby is not on street level, but on the 7th floor. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having the free Wi-Fi only in the lobby was not convenient, as there were no areas for confidentiality. Free Wi-Fi area should be disclosed. Location is excellent Ground floor staff could be more efficient and helpful, especially in helping with taxis. Think it is hard for them to distinguish hotel guests to other users of area.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service and no wifi in the room”
Reviews.Author: jeremyuk101
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel due to a deal online that included Wifi. When I arrived a nice lady informed me that my room had been upgraded to a nicer room with a view of the river - things were going well! When I got to the room there was indeed a lovely view out of the window..then I noticed the very loud sound of drilling and what I can only guess were jackhammers. I noticed a letter on the table stating that building works would be going on till 6pm. It then dawned on me that my ‘upgrade’ was in fact a room that had been rejected by another guest due to the noise. I felt deceived. I decided not to let it get to me and had a shower and went out. I returned in the evening and the noise had not stopped. In fact, it didn’t stop till about 6.45PM. I was tired and now had a headache. I decided to check my email. No Wifi. I went downstairs only to be told that there would be no internet in my particular room as they were currently installing it - hence all the noise. I felt deceived again. I reluctantly paid for wifi access in the lobby area. Never going here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location being opposite the Go Fly Kite area on the park was fabulous for us. The hotel is a little tired but was comfortable enough. The staff were pleasant generally and we enjoyed the breakfast. Our teenagers particularly enjoyed having access to a gaming machine.

Reviews.Title: “NOVOTEL - DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in hoels all over the world, this hotel came across on the net as high quality and was priced accordingly. what a disappointment! Transient feeling. No free WIFI! Poor reception, good concierge. overall very poor value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for a conference, and decided to stay a few extra days afterwards so I transferred to the Novotel at Clarke Quay. Great location, staff were helpful and the rooms and modern and clean. The only issue I had (and it's the issue I have with novotel's in general), is the price in regards to what you get. For work, I stayed in another hotel, closer to the marina, which was only slightly more expensive but I had free unlimited internet and buffet breakfast included. In hindsight, it would have be 'cheaper' to stay there (I didn't purchse their internet, I thought $30 SGD a day was a bit much or have their $25 SGD buffet breakfast). But it was a very nice hotel, with a lovely pool and nearby lots of night spots at Clarke Quay so definitely worth the trip. But look at what's included at other hotels if the novotel appears cheaper, because you don't get anything except the room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall a very satisfying stay. Clarke Quay is a great spot for entertainment with heaps of things to do and very busy. The Novotel hotel is very nice and extremely clean and comfortable, and the breakfast has good variety.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Unbeatable Location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jinapsan
Reviews.Content: Family stayed here for 4 nights before going on a cruise. The Hotel itself is in a great location in Clarke Quay, close to numerous bars, restaurants and shops. The room we stayed in was in a premier floor with a nice view of the city. The room was clean and spacious. There was wired internet available and was complimentary for our room. I am not sure it would be complimentary for non-premiere rooms. The bathroom was of a good size and with nice amenities. My only complaint would be the prices for the rooms were quite high. Other than that no complaints really.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect hotel Except no Wifi Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall the accommodation was great. The only weakness in this hotel are no wifi provided even if staying in premier floor. Wifi only available in premier lounge. While Wifi actually consider quite common requirement in a city like singapore. If free wifi are provided in every room, then this hotel will definately be my choice on my every visit in SG.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Definately be back”
Reviews.Author: oneforme
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the premier floor. It was excellent. We had the choice of the Premier Lounge Breakfast or the full buffet in the dining room. The staff everywhere were courteous, friendly and helpful. There is nothing to complain about and the Premier Floor Staff went out of their way to make us fee special. Thanks Novotel we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner for four nights and we enjoyed our stay very much. Breakfasts have great selection of dishes, both hot and cold. Room service is very good and prompt. Although it is not near the Orchard Road area the restaurants on the river banks are very close.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Longies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights being our first visit to Singapore and were extremely lucky in being granted a complimentary upgrade to a suite after having booked in to a queen standard with breakfast. Breakfast was amazing and the staff were very attentive...always made you welcome. The location was great....a very short walk to Clarke Quay, take a bumboat cruise, walk along the river bank, have lunch/dinner at any of the many different types of restaurants. Taxis were easy to come by. The view from our room over Singapore was excellent and even better at night. The suite itself (for which we were very grateful) needed a little bit of maintenance to keep it up to scratch but we did not mention or complain as were just happy to have the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and wonderful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bernie47801
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that has everything that you need to have a memorable stay in Singapore then you will be hard pressed to find a better hotel than the Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay. The central location on the trendy Clarke Quay is only a few minutes walk to the MRT and therefore minutes away from all of Singapore's wonderful shopping and tourist hotspots. The Hotel has well trained, friendly and very helpful staff. They may you feel welcomed and are able to resolve any issues you may have in a timely and efficient manner. The facilities are as you would expect from a Novotel Hotel. Clean and well maintained public areas such as the lobby, reception, pool and gym make it a business and family friendly hotel. The restaurants offer great food and wine. The Premier Lounge on the 24th level offers a peaceful area to relax or conduct business meetings in a private room, enjoy breakfast and also complimentary alcohol and food from 6-8pm daily. This feature of the Hotel is well worth upgrading your booking to. I can thoroughly recommend booking and staying at the Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay on your next visit to Singapore. I most certainly will be back.

Reviews.Title: “High budget Youngsters Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is suitable for youngster, because the location is in Clarke Quay with its famous nightlife center... There are a lot of club, cafe and other entertainment near the hotel It is locate at river front and beside Liang court shopping mal... Easy to reach by bus or taxi, far away from MRT (10 min. walk)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy and Happiness during stay at Novotel Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: our family very happy & enjoy during stay at hotel Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay.We will visit again next time.Thank you very much for all support during stay at Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay.Maintain the service continuosly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lots of noises!”
Reviews.Author: Mojito_mija
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay at Novotel Clarke Quay. The room was spacious, but noises from clubs downstairs could be annoying at night. I had fast check in and out. Breakfast was nice and staff was friendly and attentive. The location is perfect, right in the middle of the city, and subway is so closed by. I would definiately go back to this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Room was nice and overlooking Clarke Quay. Little disappointed with staff attitude at times, but only at the checking in and checking out process. Apart from that very enjoyable stay and will be back. Room service and breakfast above normal quality.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: reto6065 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night at the Novotel (complimenary as part of the ADV+ program). Booked a King Bed Superior but was told that there are only Twin Single available. As it was only for one night it didn't matter. Little things didn't work: Remote control of TV and only one light out of three in the bathroom. Good selection buffet breakfast. Continental good value (S$ 18).

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: KiwiR0b
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the Novotel , walk out the door and you had numerous bars and restaurants . Across the river was the metro and a mall with more shops and restaurants. The room we had overlooked the river and had spectacular views of the Marina Sands Hotel. Breakfast was a pleasant buffet style with Asian and Western delicacies. The swimming pool was large and had the sun most of the day , lots of loungers and plenty of towels made the pool area a great place to kill a few hours. Would recomend the hotel to business people/couples and families

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is good, but let down by a number of things”
Reviews.Author: plu81
Reviews.Content: I'm a Gold A-Club cardmember, upon check in at 8pm the "A-Club premier check-in desk" was unattended (and for the rest of my stay) and I had to wait for 20 minutes for the girl at reception to confirm that my room had been cleaned and was available to me. Daily buffet breakfast was good, as was the room. However the ceiling above the shower was noticeably lower than other parts of the bathroom so if you're over 180cm tall don't try to do a stretch in the showerbox. The hotel was very close to Clarke Quay (literally just across the road) so if you're into a bit of nightlife this place is perfect for you. Getting a taxi can be tricky on Friday & Saturday nights as you get all sorts of people jumping the queue who are not even hotel guests at the hotel entrance. The biggest problem I have with my stay is I booekd myself in for a "spin and win" room which was a promotion ran by Accor that entitles guests to "stand a chance to Spin & Win attractive prizes worth up to S$8,000! Attractive Prizes include: - iPhone 4 - iPad with Wi-Fi + 3G (32G) - Blackberry Torch 9800 - Blackberry Playbook Tablet - 3-Night Novotel Nusa Dua Bali Stay - Universal Studios Tickets for 2 - Captain Explorer DUKW Tour for 4 - S$50 Hotel F&B vouchers ". However nothing was ever mentioned to me throughout my stay, and when I enquired about this when checking in, the staff member said to me "oh, this is actually done at the back office and we will notify you if you're a winner." Nothing was ever discussed since. I have to say I somewhat feel conned by this promotion. All in all the hotel has good facilities, but was majorly let down by the service to its loyalty cardmember and the "dodgy" promotion.

Reviews.Title: “Party Hotel not for family traveler”
Reviews.Author: Anand_1699 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a party hotel for bachelors. I did not like it at all. The beds were worn out, and you can see a shape of human. My colleagues stayed at Peninsula at the same rate, and had much better room and service. It was my worst choice of the hotel. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location to combine business and nightlife..”
Reviews.Author: mexicoduke
Reviews.Content: As we were updated at our arrival on a 1 day stay on the weekend, I can only say about the renewed rooms...executive floor, ..nice modern furniture, very clean, lot of space at the room, which I didn´t expected ...We loved that it is walking distance to nightlife in this area of Clarke Quay, restaurants, and having a little trip by boat, which took you to see the Riverwalk"..close to the Sands Hotel also..I would come back to this Hotel if I visited back Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Boring hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Tannalee
Reviews.Content: My review is a bit late as real life has taken up so much time:) We spent four nights here over New Years Eve. I had concerns because of all the negative reviews so we came with realistic expectations and had a wonderful time. This is a basic, pretty boring hotel not a resort, so don’t book expecting anything flash. It was just a hotel room, very clean and roomy enough for us (Two adults and two teenage children).Our room was high and over looked Fort Canning park so we had no noise from the clubs, I can imagine noise could be an issue so ask for a room away from the noise. Pool was huge, clean and had plenty of sun beds, the position can't be beaten and that is what we wanted, a hotel in a great position where we could all be together and didn't have to pay a fortune. I did get the room on a special deal, with breakfast and internet $263 SGD a night for four of us, over New Years Eve. Our room was ready when we arrived, but like so many past reviews we had to ask a few times (and make a bit of noise) for the roll away bed, we had to ask a few times for the balcony door to be unlocked. Actually we had to ask a few times for anything we wanted. It was all good though as each request was met in the end and it didn't affect our stay here. We absolutely loved Singapore and didn't stop the whole time we were here. Little India, Suntec Computer complex, Duck Boat tour (pre book), Singapore flyer, Marina Bay Sands (amazing want to come back and stay here), Haw Par Villa (Google it, amazing place it’s bizarre!!), China town( could spend a whole day) and so many other places. Taxi drivers were all so friendly. We got the train out to Haw Par Villa and a taxi back, it was cheaper to get a taxi than the rail system! Mostly we walked and walked, soaking everything up. We will definitely come back to Singapore and if our needs are the same and we got a good price I’d stay at the Novotel again. Just don't expect this hotel to actually add to your holiday experience, it really is one of those hotels that is just a place to sleep, have a swim and energize, ready to explore wonderful Singapore! Its position makes it perfect for that type of holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to stay over the weekend as well”
Reviews.Author: 2adults2kidsonBudget Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location right next to Clarke Quay, still one of the best place to chill after a hard day's work and conveniently on top of a shopping mall providing easy access to some retail therapy. The room's are standard Novotel fare meaning everything spick & span though nothing exciting either. Just right for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: travellinghorizons
Reviews.Content: the locality is the best factor... convinience stores + starbucks+ mcdonalds... Clarque quay a min walk away...

Reviews.Title: “Located in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: rubykesury
