Reviews.Content: Novotel is located in the centre of the city and provides easy access to Chinatown and Little India both. Clarke Quay is the night life of Singapore and provides a foray of entertainment. The hotel rooms are spacious and comfortable. The rooms either provide a view of the canal flowing through Singapore or the new Marina Bay Sands hotel and its upper deck with the infinity swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “We dont Care about our customers”
Reviews.Author: kamleshmanuja
Reviews.Content: This was my international business visit and was there for a conference. Due to some goof up by the sponsors the booking was done form one day before ( for a 2 days stay). Though i agree that the advance booking was done by them but there was no shivelry and courteness displayed by the staff. I reached the hotel at 10:30AM and told them that i shall have my breakfast in 15 mins and to which they refused to serve a breakfast as the time ( 10:30am) is already passed. I think they should be more flexible and accomdative if they want higher customer foot fall.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: shine70
Reviews.Content: My family (wife and young daughter) and I stayed at Novotel Clarke Quay for two night in June 2011. Our stay was overall very pleasant and we will surely book again in this hotel on our next visit to Singapore. On arrival our room was not ready (it was well before check-in time) but it was arranged pretty fast by the staff. The room, a king bed superior, was decently sized and faced north. It was very comfortable and quiet day and night. The bathroom looked new and well maintained. A big plus for this hotel is its very central location, smack at the edge of the Clarke Quay happening area and few minutes away from the MRT and Orchard road. Last but not least, considering the Singapore prices, this Hotel has great value for money (I booked directly on their website after some research on the Net).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rahulnahata
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel last year it has great location, bank on clarke quay area. which is supposed to be night life party heaven area. location is posh. rooms are very nice. service is good ill definitely consider going again

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained equipment in the room, but clean and good overall service”
Reviews.Author: JSM_Travel
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel in 4 years. Rooms have aged and there were some maintenance issues (bathroom fittings missing, airconditioner too cold on warmest setting and light switches not working correctly). However staff were excellent and we cannot fault their service. The ideally situated: close to restaurants at the Quays and easy access to all major attractions. We paid for their business package and used the lounge facilities for breakfast. We had one breakfast in the main restaurant which we found noisy and poorly laid out (too many tables pushed together).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but poor reservation system.”
Reviews.Author: norvee
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. It is just beside a strip of restaurants and a shopping mall. The MRT is just a stone's throw away. The room is clean and chic. The facilities are great. Unfortunately, they seem to use a poor reservation system where they can't quite figure out the reservation/package of the guest. We took the room+breakfast+day tour package and reserved online. When we arrived, we were told that they do not have this information in their system. Fine. No big deal. Stuff happens so we showed the staff at the reception everything to prove our reservation such as our online confirmation, the sms message confirmation, etc, etc....4 staff & 5 explanations later, their system still didn't show our "package". The next day, during breakfast, we had to explain the same thing for the 6th time. It's like nobody bothered to verify, rectify, and update the system. It was frustrating but this minor glitch didn't stop us from enjoying our stay in the hotel and in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Administration”
Reviews.Author: jakobj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine-nice room and good amenities including a great outdoors pool. However the hotel administration services are very poor. While we were staying at the hotel I received an email stating that I would be charged for a no show for a reservation which I had previously cancelled. When I complained at the front desk they said it was a mistake and that I wouldn't be charged. They followed up with an email to confirm his. To my surprise 2 weeks later they charged my credit card for the cancelled reservation. When I e- mailed them they again apologized and assured me it was a mistake and they would issue a refund. After several follow up emails they finally issued the refund 4 weeks later. However due to the difference in exchange rates they still owe me money I've sent them an email re this to which they haven't responded. I won't stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Smile is expensive here.”
Reviews.Author: JJTL
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 8.00 am in the morning, the concierge and porter staff was friendly, they have Starbucks beside the front door (It's the best thing.) The Receptionists all is not so good, rarely smile, flat face, and the worst thing I have to wait for my room till 11.00 am. The room is Ok, have a mini bar, the refrigerator is cold (nice), the air condition works properly, very cold (very nice) The view was very good facing the Clarke Quay and river I choose King Bed Superior Bay View, I got 10th floor. Nice view but comes with great minus. At night the bar and club in Clarke Quay gave me a very loud big fat bass! If you party animal or Clarke Quay is your main interest this place is suits for you. Last thing, the aroma in the concierge, lobby, and lift is funky, like tiger balm. (That's I don't like it) l

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Comfort near great food and night life - Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need a moderate budget hotel in Singapore with all of the necessities plus great staff, try Novotel in Clarke Quay... I have used this for simple lay-over and transit nights through to weeks of projects in Singapore. Always friendly, good food selection, location with BrewWerks and Pump Room a short walk (or stagger) away. Accommodation is above the 7th floor and out of the noise of the night life.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good 3+ star hotel. Good breakfast . Alcohol very expensive. Staff were cheerful/ helpful. Free access to web via reception. Easy/cheap access to Orchard Rd and adjacent to restuarants at Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it and will consider for the future trips also.”
Reviews.Author: amitdube
Reviews.Content: Convinience and Connected This is a Hotel, saved me from the traffic because of it's location, travel time reduced. In the evening, there are good outing joints nearby. In side the Hotel also, one has good food and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room service that scars”
Reviews.Author: angshernice
Reviews.Content: Good location, excellent view and efficient check in. If you want a total enjoyable experience, NEVER order wine and dinner for room service. The staffs need more training in this area given that it is an award winner 2010 for outstanding service!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay @ Novotel Clarke Quay Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dkeff Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a king bed bay view room for 2 nights on our way back from Thailand. Clarke Quay is a fantastic location, everything you need is right outside the hotel within a 10 minute walk. The staff were very obliging, the room was modern, neat & tidy and the bed was extremely comfortable. Having a balcony is always nice as we are smokers and don't like to smoke indoors. The only gripe we had was the noise from the night club (Arena) downstairs, it was pumping until 6am both mornings although it wasn't a huge issue. To avoid this next time we would request a room on the opposite side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: FoodEnthused
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice and while the first experience was okay with no problems to note, the second time was not so pleasant for us. The first room that was given to us reeked of cigarette smoke despite it being on a non-smoking floor. We requested for a change and when we asked for a room with two twin-size beds (instead of one queen size), we were asked to pay extra! That's certainly a first for us, so we stuck with the queen size bed. As for the second room (which faced Clarke Quay, no other choice apparently) that was given to us, the airconditioning was not working well despite us having turn it on for hours hoping to cool the room (important, especially in humid Singapore). We had to ask for another change in room, and this time they did not ask for us to pay extra for a queen size bed! At the end, we got a good room, facing away from Clarke Quay, with two twin beds at no extra charge. That said, we found Novotel's location convenient (close to happening Clarke Quay and vibrant Chinatown) and the MRT Station is merely a short walk away. Something different from the usual favourites along the Orchard Road shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: FOR: - Great location - Excellent service, especially when I needed assistance with lost property - 6 Apple PCs with internet connection in main lobby AGAINST: - Although room was nicely fitted out, the bed was very hard and unconfortable, making it difficult to get to sleep, and when I woke up the following morning, I had aches and pains all over. - Coffee shop was noisy, cramped and generally depressing, and breakfast offering was very "3 star". I had expected better quality - Swimming pool area in bad need of a refurb - it is very scruffy - Gym was inadequately equipped, and located in a nasty cramped room with insufficient A/C. Also in bad need of an uprgade and refurb

Reviews.Title: “1 King Bed Executive Premier Floor”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in, Check-out, breakfast and drinks all available in the premier lounge, a nice touch to get you away from all the kids. But, be prepared to replace the children with rude business men who think they are staying at an 5 star exclusive resort for royalty. Executive Room had comfortable king bed, huge plasma TV, study area and expansive bathroom, with both shower over bath & seperate shower facilities. The biggest let down for a room that cost AUD$300 per night was NO in-room Wi-Fi. Yet the night club across the road has an unsecured Wi-Fi network you can access from on the street?? Square Restuarant was a turn off, full of extremely rude customers having what you'd think was their last meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great areas, very serviceable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: No complaints, excellent service as I was sick during my time there and needed to go to hospital. Novotel even covered my phone charge after i went to hospital (only a few calls but a nice gesture). Only complaint is no free wi-fi or ethernet in rooms. I recall the cost is $30 for 24 hrs?! Very expensive, considering hotel Ibis has FREE wi-fi and cheaper room rates. If internet in the rooms was included in every package, I would stay here every time.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value and too noisy. Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: AustralianGirl_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights. First checked into room on level 9 Clarke Quey side, and the nightclub noises were unbearable! Even on a Tuesday night! Could not sleep till 3am because of the beats. And we are a young couple!! Didn’t make it to the weekend noise as we asked to be moved and were placed on the 20th floor overlooking the pool which was much quieter. As said in another post. This room had the double bed pushed up against a side wall so you had to crawl into the bed form the end. Not really a problem, though not expected in a room of typical Novotel standard. And the fridge only kept things just on cool, which is not what you want in the Singapore humidity. Pool was nice. Cocktails not too good unless you like pure alcohol and no flavour. The strawberry daiquiri was tequila and ice but no strawberry. And they advertise poolside bar, however it is really just a phone for you to call the inside restaurant. Breakfast not worth it at more than S$30 per person. They quote S$25 then like many tourist areas add the ++ taxes. At breakfast the bread had mould, and one of the staff looked at me very confused when I pointed at it, as she didn’t know what it was. Another staff member quickly took it away. For a typical buffet breakfast it was very dismal and below standard. Also the Clarke Quay restaurants are very expensive compared with other tourist locations, and again hit you with the ++ taxes at the end of the meal. They do have a $15 nett lunch deal which is good value. Though in general, much better deals at Orchard Road or Sentosa I wouldn’t stay here again. For the same price there are much nicer hotels in better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: LilleNigel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good. Great location, within walking distance of most Quay side and Marina attractions. Also handy for the Metro. Hotel generally clean but rooms beginning to show their age. Reasonably priced for location and hotel facilities. My room had an amazing view of the Marina. Bad. I had an early start for my city tour so needed a fairly early night and a good nights sleep. Being on Clarke Quay the night life continues into the early hours, so all i got all night was thumping disco beat and drunken screams.......i'm not a kill joy but............!!! I am an Accor Gold card holder and do expect a bit of "Extra". When I asked for a late check out I was refused so I when up and got my bag and came back to check out. The girl then said "why are you checking out, I thought you wanted a late check out". I said "but you refused so I need to check out now" she then said "OK we give you a late check out" Bit late now i've packed my bag and left the room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Singapore vacation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at Novotel. The service we received was superb from the time we arrived up to the time we left. Everybody was helpful. The Filipina staff named Desiree was very accommodating. She gave us 2 rooms in the same floor since I was travelling with my teenage children. The hotel location is also convenient because the nearby mall Liang Court can be accessed using the hotel elevator near the restaurant at the 7th floor. It is a short walk to the MTR station. There is also a catholic church nearby, just a 5 minute walk. Thanks to Novotel Operator named Maria who patiently gave us directions going to Sacred Heart Church and the schedule of English mass :-)

Reviews.Title: “ROOM PROBLEM”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a premium room and arrived tired from a long 'plane journey and need sleep. The room had just been "refurbished". The room had the following problems which are UNACCEPTABLE: 1. Hot water supply was inoperative: only lukewarm water was available (i.e. cold bath and shower) 2. Insufficient water pressure in the stand alone shower (as well as cold water) 3. Air conditioning control inoperative: It was on all the time and the room was cold (less than 20C). Could not change it 4. The Bedsite lights were inoperative Clearly the room had not been properly checked after the "refurbishment" After a nights sleep (in the cold) we brought these issues to the attention of the staff and were then fixed over the next 3 or so hours. We chose not to immediately complain because it was clearly a major engineering issue which would take sometime to fix and we need the sleep. Apart from this problem the hotel was fine, I have stayed there before and will do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room and amenities were great, no complaints. Clean and tidy, great bed. Breakfast had large variety. Very close to Clarke Quay/River walk where all bars and restaurants are. Close to all other shopping districts. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel-expensive hotel prices in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: teelee
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Singapore & this time we had a lot of trouble finding a decent priced package in a good location for 3 people that included breakfast. As we were with a large group, some of who were staying in much more expensive hotels in the surrounding areas, we finally chose Novotel because of our club card- & because I know Singapore quite well, I knew the location.I had no idea the prices were so high now & unfortunately we'd paid for our airfares so we couldn't decrease the number of nights in favour of Malaysia.I gag if I have to pay more than $100 NZD for a hotel room so paying more than S$250 didn't go down well! We had 2 different packages the 1st one on the executive floor was nice with a lovely view of the river.The 2nd one was on the 18th floor which was not so nice- shabby & mouldy wallpaper & the shower had terrible "black spot" mould.Our 1st night in that room we got no sleep because the aircon wasn't working, but we got that fixed.We still had a nice view of the river though. We received a notice in our room telling us renovations were to take place on the Premier floors above us so for the next week we couldn't take time out in our room during the day because of the very loud construction on the floors above.Add to that the annoying housekeeping staff- one morning they woke us up at 8.30 am (our only sleep-in day) & asked if they could clean the room. On our last day in Singapore they asked at 8am if they could check the minibar, even though check out wasn't until noon.They were very intrusive, I've never struck that before & have stayed in many hotels. The fridge was really tiny so we kept food in there & just kept requesting buckets of ice for chilling our water etc.We piled everything up in a corner from the minibar & thats where it stayed for 10 days! The hotel has a great shopping center underneath with a supermarket, foodcourt etc , & breakfast at the hotel was pretty good-with a few asian items, but it would be nice if they'd provide some variety each day as it was a bit boring after 10 days.Check out was very painful- it took over an hour because of numerous overcharging errors.This will be our last time in Singapore as accomodation prices are so expensive now.Bye Singapore- it's been nice visting you......

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Exec Premier Floor 07-10 May 2010”
Reviews.Author: TIGEROZ
Reviews.Content: Having access to the lounge was good - Wi-Fi access, spectacular views across to Marina Bay Sands. Breakfast in the lounge was quiet and the cocktails/finger food were a feature btwn 6 and 8 pm. The normal breakfast area was just OK in terms of food quality and preparation. We encountered the same problem as others re air conditioning in our Premier room. In the first room assigned it didn't work at all. We were moved to another room and found that we couldn't adjust the temperature. 16C felt more like 22! We had a city view room but would recommend that you ask for a Marina Bay Sands view room upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Ideall business and leisure traveller hotel in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: PTomlinson1968
Reviews.Content: The Novotel in Clarke Quay is an ideal base for both the business and leisure traveller visitn Singapore for both a short and long stay. clean, tiday and with excellent staff. A three week stay was a pleasure, icluding the extend check out service. Thanks for a great stay and I will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for bus and river cruise.”
Reviews.Author: lizajg
Reviews.Content: We are a family with kids and we enjoyed our stay at Novotel. We got the stay 2 nights and get a night free in an executive room and it was very good value for money. The hotel room was spacious, with contemporary furnishing and new. There is a mall in the lower levels and a ramen place, food court and a 7-11. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again. It could be improved if we didn't have to keep asking for 2 extra towels every day. We were 4 occupants and the hotel knew this. It was a bother to have to keep asking for the towels day after day. If you are going for shopping, it's better to stay along Orchard Rd. to save time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located at Clark Quay, the most leisure and focal point of Singapore. The most attractive spots are in the 5 minutes walk periphery. It's room is spacious and decoration is cosy. I am sure you will get more than you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 2 nights. The staff were friendly and helpful, although not quite as sociable as staff at other Accor hotels we stayed at throughout Asia. I think thats just Singapore though. The Novotel is ideally located a very short walk to Clarke Quay on the Singapore River. Perfect if you like Alfresco Dining with a large selection of eateries and Bars to choose from.. The Hotel is what I would expect from a Novotel. Clean & comfortable, although the beds were a little hard. The Buffet breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: LQK2010
Reviews.Content: Location was the best advantage of this hotel: just few minutes from MRT station, next to Clarke Quay with lots of fun, bars and good restaurants. You could see the Singapore river from Novotel. The Central Mall is right there as well. The breakfast at Novotel Clarke Quay, so far, was one the best I've tried. Had only one dinner there and it was so fabulous! The room was good enough but a little bit upset to us as our rooms were not ready when we came there even though it was 6PM at the time we check-in. One more thing: because located next to Clarke Quay, it was so noisy for us at night and my mother could not sleep well there.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mrmtee
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as a stopover to U.K I got to the hotel late but checking in was a bit slow ,but did end up getting free upgrade to exec floor (room 2509), room was nice, clean, good bed, big TV and nice shower. The room did not face Clarke Quay so was very quiet. The hotel is right next to Clarke Quay, turn left out of hotel and it’s about 50 meters walk to restaurants. The hotel is situated on a mall and once you go in from the entrance it’s a lift ridetothe7th floor where you get out and go to the check in desk, then it’s off to another set of lifts to go to your floor..this does get a bit tedious after the first few times. Staff were friendly and efficient, pool was big and well maintained. All requests were tended to promptly, such as after getting to my room I couldnt open lock on luggage and I called for assistance at 1am and within 10 minutes there was someone at the door with bolt cutters.. I didnt try the breakfast, a bit to pricey but the mall next door does have a maccas and star bucks as well as a food hall with lots of local food with great prices. Centre of town is only a short bus trip away or a 15 -20 minute stroll around the park..Its a nice walk... If doing a stop over or staying for a few nights I recommend this hotel Only downside is there is no free wifi and access is very pricey, they do have 4 0r 5 pc's in main lobby for use in 20 minute lots

Reviews.Title: “30 SGD FOR INTERNET!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: powerrose
Reviews.Content: Wow. 30 SGD for internet, and not even wireless internet. In fact, the broadband just had a short little cord, so you have to sit at the desk, fuming over the 30 SGD (PER DAY!!!) that they charge. I'm guessing that this is because there are a lot of hotels with supposedly similar rates. But then instead of paying $160 SGD, you end up with $190 if you want their internet. I just find this practice so deceptive and downright crappy. Congrats Novotel, you've lost my business!

Reviews.Title: “Would have given it 5 stars...but for faulty rooms and slow service”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: We booked from the hotel website. There were 7 of us so we needed 3 rooms. We got a deal for Executive Floor room with breakfast and lounge access. Around 250 SGD per night. Not cheap but not bad also. We booked for 3 nights. We had taken the Royal Carribean cruise from singapore and got into SG at about 9 AM and went to the hotel. The hotel location cant be beat if you want to have a good time at Clarke Quay (CQ). It is literally 50 meters from CQ action. The hotel is on top of a mall. The lobby is on 7th floor. We were early and we got our rooms by about 10 AM. That was good. We were first given room 2519. On top floor. The room felt a bit hot. Turned up the aircon but nothing. Finally after half an hour complained and engineering came and fixed something and then it started working fine. Went for a shower and there was no hot water. I mean zero. Complained. They said they wud fix it. Our room faced CQ. The good thing was the view. Entire marina sands and bay view. The bad thing is that on the weekend ur in trouble. Although the windows were pretty sound proof we could hear thumping sound till 4 AM in the morning. So if you are a light sleeper choose the bad view but peaceful opposite side. Next morning went for shower, again no hot water. Complained again. Took my daughter to universal (excellent; get the express pass). Came back in evening and wanted to shower again no hot water. Then I lost my cool. Started pulling up people all over the hotel. Engineering spent half an hour in my room and then said they cant fix it. The manager on duty decided to give me a new room (wonder they they waited for 1 full day to do this). New room was 2001. Supposedly an upgraded executive room. The hot water was working but the aircon was not. At this point I really lost it. Called the 2 managers and was pretty annoyed with them. Airconditioning and hot water is par for the course. How can it not be assured in a 5 star hotel when ur paying 200 usd per night!! The manager asked us to relax at the executive lounge as he wanted to give us another room and wanted to test all to make sure it was working. After half hour he came back and apologized that the room in mind was not fully operational. Finally after an hour he moved us to a suite; 1723. There all was working. The next day the Quality assurance manager met me. He told me that their top floors were brand new and that these rooms were released for sale just a few days before we checked in. My point was that they needed to make sure that all was working fine before they sold the room. Seemed like the manager was genuinely interested in fixing these problems. So that was that. Overall the hotel is great. Food was decent. We ate breakfast and had dinner at the Indian restaurant in the hotel. The rooms are brand new. Only they need to improve their service and response time and also empower people on duty to make decisions. My room shud have been changed the very day I reported a problem as there was a problem with the piping; a problem not to go away quickly. I will surely repeat this hotel once more and give one more chance. Would have given 5 rating but for the above problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Catherine39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as a stop over - found it a pleasant hotel ideally located in Clarke Quay and within easy walking distance to most places that we wanted to see/visit Clean, modern and comfortable rooms, polite staff, wide choice for breakfast No complaints really - would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A well spent vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our 5 days 4 nights stay in Singapore at Novotel Clarke Quay were superb. Location of the Novotel is very convenient - to places of interest, to transport lines, shopping, and dining. The hotel is very restful including the pool where one can relax after a tiring day of going around. Our grandchildren enjoyed Universal Studios, Night Safari, and the Flyer. My mother who is 85 years old and who came with us in this trip has a very good impression of Singapore especially as this is her first trip to Singapore. Staff of Novotel is very accommodating to guest's requests. Our granchildren enjoyed the X-box corner of the hotel especially as it afforded us time to shop in the mall at the ground level of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TV Problem”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: TV problem - like no picture but when call staff they said it is due to the station which we never believe the fault is with the station. We were disappointed because we cannot see the local channels. -----

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clarke Quay - Great value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location & pool and fantastic food.don't forget the supermaket under the hotel. Excellent service. Make sure you ask for a non smoking room if required. Everything that was asked for was attended to swiftly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but”
Reviews.Author: RKBeij
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect, being situated right within Clarke Quay and in downtown Singapore. We arrived in the very late afternoon (5:30pm) but we still had to wait for the rooms, they had not been ready. After that it took about an hour until the luggage was delivered to the room. The rooms do not meet the proposed standard. Breakfast is buffet style and ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good view from the Window”
Reviews.Author: Shika_Matsumoto
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night on October with friends as we get 1 night complimentary from Accor membership. When you look out from the windows, good view of river and muti-color of cafe, shops and restaurants can be seen. The furnitures in guest room are modern style. Necessary amenities are fully provided. TV still have not been the flat screen yet. There are 7-11 and food court nearby that you can get a yummy and reasonable price of foods. Crossing the bridge there is a Jumbo Seafood restaurant, and "Central" shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel with very accommodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The most important factor for me whenever i stay in a hotel is the bathroom, breakfast and the staff. This hotel was able to cover all my expectations. They have a very nice staff that you can always approach, clean bathrooms and of course yummy breakfast. I liked the fact that it was also located in clarke quay which is just beautiful at night and is a short walk to the mrt station. Its also very convenient because there is a mini mall under the hotel complete with a grocery store and other essentials plus a kopitiam fastfood. I stayed in this hotel twice and i will definetely come back and stay with them when i visit singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I find it that Novotel Clark Quay is the best place to stay in Singapore whether you are on business trip or holiday. Just a step away from the Clark Quay pubs and restaurant makes this hotel is a best place to stay for you to relax after office hour or during your weekend. I call it entertainment at your door step.

Reviews.Title: “House Keeping”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have always loved staying at this hotel until my recent stay and during which I was very disappointed to arrive to my room around 5:30pm and found out it was not serviced yet eventhough I did not have the do not disturb sign on my door. I was very disappointed and do not understand how this could have happened.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found staying at Novotel Clarke Quay was the best location, centrally located to everything we wanted to see. Transport (trains) was very close and could walk to everything else we wanted. Transport in Singapore is fantastic, never have to wait more than 4-5 minutes. Staff at the Novotel were fantastic, especially some of the waiters in the dining room. Highly recommend Novotel Clarke Quay. There are plenty of places to stay in Singapore but we will be going back and staying at Novotel, best location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel amenities and excellent location just dissapointed with certain aspects.”
Reviews.Author: des707 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had book a VIP package with the best twin room available including breakfast and hop on hop off bus. At check-in i was told that for the bus tour you just have to ring the concierge however i was never told that they only have two times 9am and 11am so i consequently missed them. The room was large compared to most places in singapore, it had a separate bath and shower cubicle. TV reception was apalling and it broke down twice. Bathroom was also leaking water - however this could be due to the renevation they were doing. The amenities and the location is excellent, i just don't think it is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Reliably Novotel”
Reviews.Author: thepolarbeer
Reviews.Content: Under refurb at the moment but the completed rooms are nice, well located and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are incompetent and cannot communicate efficiently and effectively internally.”
Reviews.Author: OO1HK
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Clarke Quay has everything going for it location wise but apart from that it’s pretty poor. The staff are incompetent and cannot communicate efficiently and effectively internally to get things done. I tried to book the hotel directly and they did not answer my phone or email enquiry hence using Hotels Club. I tried to book baby sitting and confirm it before we arrived at the hotel but the staff didn’t get back to me. We had arranged for an additional child’s bed to be put in the room and it wasn’t there on arrival nor did they put it in the room when we went out for dinner specifically to give them space and time. A simple lunch of sandwiches took half an hour to arrive. We had to chase everything which was incredibly frustrating and time consuming. There is one other problem and that is that there is pumping music in the small hours of the morning from Clarke Quay’s night clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the location to be excellent, nice and handy to buses, trains and lots going on in Clarke Quay at all times of the day and evening. The only negative would be the pillows were like rocks and the profile too high!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Novpotel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Novotel Clarke Quay (Aug 2010 and April2011). We took our two adult kids and spouses plus three grandchildren 10, 6 and 5). We booked Exeutive suites for the two families and executive room for us. Booking online saved heaps and Vinnie at Novotel looked after our requests for two beds for grandchildren in one suite and one in the other. The hotel is in a great location near the MRT and restaurants. The hotel is a little tired, but we have been told they are to upgrade it this year.

Reviews.Title: “Refresh and relax”
Reviews.Author: Jessee2000 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good to relax and refresh with family.The swimming pool is not so crowded.The gym is a little small,can hold for more than 8 people.There are not enough towels when we went there at about 9.30am. The hotel didnt provided any tooth brush and comb. The hotel view is nice and aircon is cool. We relax and refresh there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice at Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were greated with a warm and helpfull welcome. Check in was a breeze. We had a newly renovated room that was snug but well done. The bed was a dream, we slept like babies, which was good as we had arrived at the Hotel at midnight. Breakfast was a treat. All of the staff were helpfull and answered our questions with ease and knowledge. We will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Asian hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Willem_Derksen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Novotel Clarke Quay for 4 weeks from mid March till mid April, one of the reasons to stay in this hotel was the good location, close to many attractions, restaurants and bars even if I must travel every day 30 minutes to my job. View towards the Marina Bay Sands and Singapore Flyer is beautiful even if the window was dirty! Because of all restaurants and bars in front of hotel there is also a problem with noise of music in the early night, especially during weekend when you would like to sleep. Bed is comfortable and linings are clean and this was my first hotel (and I’m all the year in hotels) were the room maid is leaving the towel on the rail as I want and change it when on the floor that’s in my opinion ‘green’. All Novotel staff is friendly and helpfull, real Asian hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel with central location”
Reviews.Author: ratata
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in connection with a business trip to S'pore. Luckily for me the hotel was overbooked and I was upgraded to one of their newly renovated suites. The hotel has a very modern style, the suite was very nice and even had a bubble-bath. The food in the hotel restaurant was okay, but it was a bit quiet there. However, the situation was totally different in the morning because the restaurant was overcrowded for breakfast. I had to queue up for a table and a lot of things were missing (no fruits, no coffee etc.). The only thing I can complain about was an extremely bad smell in the bathroom, which might come from the drainage system or similar. It was uncomfortable to be there, although it was a totally renovated and really nice bathroom. There was some noice from Clark Quay during the night, but it was not a significant problem. The hotel is centrally located and just a short walk from the restaurant- and pub area in Clark Quay. I will definitely stay there again if I get the opportunity (but, select another bathroom this time).

Reviews.Title: “pleasent stay good location”
Reviews.Author: embraer33
Reviews.Content: 1 st stay i SINGAPORE we travel a lot around the world but this hospitality of novotel here is remarkable we found the hospitality and the guest service of john chetty amazing he went his out of his way to assist us making our stay with the family a memorable one and we are very happy to be back again soon with the children and explore Sin again food and beverage plus front office staff were helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our Superior room to an executive room (8th floor) for only an additional $25 (before GST). The room was big and clean and items such as ironing board and the iron itself can be found in the wardrobe. This made ironing of clothes convenient without having to ask or it and no extra cost. Bathroom (including of a separate standing shower and bathtub) is clean and pleasant. We would love to go there again for a small gathering of 5 to 7 pax.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Notovel Clarke Quay is in an excellent location and very easy to find. Within easy walking distance of all the main central city attractions and a also a cheap taxi ride within the central city. The service was excellent and we we received an upgrade to a larger room without requesting this. The main restaurant provided a large variety of buffet style food and again, the service was excellent and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good price, will come back”
Reviews.Author: unknown90
Reviews.Content: welcoming and helpful staff pancake for every breakfast should be good idea A Club service : very good one

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou for a wonderful stay. The staff were very friendly and accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: 255103Louise
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Novotel at 6am in the morning. Check-in time is 2pm. When we arrived (after flying all night) we were greeted by lovely front reception people and told that there was a room that we could go to until our room was ready. Our room was ready at 9.30am and transferred into that. The room was very nice. It was a renovated room and was clean. The staff that we came across in the hotel were always very nice, polite and couldnt help us enough. After reading some reviews on Trip Advisor we were a little apprehensive about staying here but we have nothing but praise for this hotel. It is in a great position - over the road from Clarke Quay, shopping centre in the hotel area etc etc. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Thanks to everyone at Novotel Clarke Quay for making our stay a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this modest hotel is FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: NicStar78
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing. Centrally located - it takes about a minute to walk to Clarke Quay, 10 minutes to walk to Boat Quay or ChinaTown. There is a MRT just around the corner and a taxi rank at the front. There is a shopping mall and a few restaurants located at the base of the building. The staff are extremely friendly and their service is second to none. My room, which i wasn't sharing, was allocated with two single beds. After i raised it with staff i was immediately upgraded, at no cost, to a room with a Kind sized bed. My room was very cleaned and well maintained. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, nor stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: shelob
Reviews.Content: Very accessible to Clark Quay where a lot of restaurants are and a quick walk to the metro. Service was OK, nothing special . Rooms nice and clean with a great view of the city but smelled of cigarette smoke and showing signs of minor disrepair. Regardless, beds were very comfortable and you get good sleep at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: quornS
Reviews.Content: So pleased I chose this hotel after others reccommended orchard Rd. Really inviting entry and reception area with friendly staff. We were asked if we would like to be upgraded to a superior twin room and were happy to do so. The room was large with a good size bathroom and separate shower. everything clean and the beds were really comfortable. Our room on the 17th floor had a fantastic view over the river toward marina bay sands. We were disappointed we were unable to have buffet breakfast included in room price, however this was due to the booking site, so do be careful when you book as cheaper rates are not inclusive of breakfast. This hotel is next to fabulous night life and restaurants on the river and a shopping Mall with grocery dept in basement. Highly reccommend Novotel and would love to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, service and staff - couldn't fault anything!”
Reviews.Author: jentren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and 8 days in March this year. We found the location was perfect and rooms a decent size for a family of 4. Close to Clarke Quay, MRT and shopping centre with a food court right next door. Lots of choice for eating out and with children ranging from 15 to 9 this was a god send. Restaurants along both sides of the river and markets on the weekend were really good. Pool got a thorough working out by the kids who loved it (not to mention the adults too). X-box was also a hit when the kids had had enough of waiting for us to get organised. Staff very friendly and getting to Orchard Rd and Sentosa a breeze. Conceirge staff were full of ideas and nothing was too much trouble to arrange. Overall a very successful and fun holiday. Would definately recommend Singapore and this hotel to anyone. Very easy to get to and lots of things to do within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD --- BUT!”
Reviews.Author: happyBundaberg
Reviews.Content: WE HAVE BEEN ON NOVOTEL BEFORE, AND THIS TIME WE STAYED FOR 6 NIGHTS, BUT I MUST SAY, THAT THEY HAVE TO BE CAREFUL WHO IS RUNNING THIS HOTEL!!! the first room they booked us in was crap, so they changed it to a better one, on the 21 floor, much better, at least there were2 chairs!! beautiful view over the river and marina bay, we saw the laser show every night. still close to MRT and everything. however, you need to train your staff, to understand basic english, and the same go for your service off your rooms, and your house keepers!! we asked to get 2 teaspoons for the room, to this day we havent seen them( i took them from the resturant , the first night!!!) i am not sure that we will go back there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Location good - hotel really needs to step up service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to have a pleasant stay and enjoy a few days off with my family. It ended up being a changing room ordeal for the first 2 days. Their rooms which have been renovated have a terrible stinch/bad smell from the bathroom. Even after changing rooms, it was still there, seems like their gutters are never cleaned. Breakfast was okay, could have had better variety from similar Novotel I have stayed in the past. Also, service was terribly poor, I thought SIngapore quality would be better, but not at all. The only good part was the location - they did not even offer to take care of my first night stay given the terrible bathroom/stinch experience...that is not service or customer oriented culture....

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: TheFoxSydney Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this conveniently located hotel. Included buffet breakfast was outstanding. The staff always greet you with a smile and are very helpful. Good pool area not to be missed. A taxi to/from the airport should not cost more than S$20.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clarke Quay -GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I recommend Novotel Clake Quay. Fantastic location. Close to everything. We had a lovely room overlooking the river. It was worth paying the extra we thought for the view. Bed very comfortable & we loved the doonas & pillows. I also thought the pool area was nicer than it looked in the photos. Only 1 small thing, no childrens pool. Luckily I took a blow-up ring for my son who is 3 years old. We also spent a few nights in a hotel near Orchard rd & far prefered the location of the Novotel. Also, great food court next door for cheap eats.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel@Clark Quay”
Reviews.Author: JM070707Singapore Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked on 19 March at Novotel through advantage plus member's rate online. Novotel is the right location if you're into clubbing and exploring the sights & sounds of Singapore night life. Kinda disappointed, that our room was not ready when we arrive at 1.00pm. Had actually requested for early check in at 11.30am, so when we arrrived at 1.00pm I expected it would have been ready. Makes me wonder what's the point of being an Advantage club member, when the hotel did not accommodate to a simple request. Also, had specifically mentioned that it was my husband's birthday on the 19 March and our friend who knew the Reservation Manager, has requested to have a bottle of champagne in the room, however there was none when we checked in. Other than the 2 disappointments mentioned above, overall it was a clean, business hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: bmwZ4_10
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in this hotel for about a week with some friends. This is the best hotel I've ever stayed. Fancy furnitures, gorgeous breakfast buffet, fabulous pool, various TV channels....everything makes me satisfied, and make my trip memorable. Every staff is nice and always smiling which makes me secured. Especially John the quality service manager is very friendly and gentle. Glad to know he likes my country. Most of all I love hop into the pool at night. You really have to try pool when staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located great rooms”
Reviews.Author: philippe1953
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to wonder towards the newly developped Marina complex walking along the river at night the Clarke Quay location means that numerous Bars restaurants are kjust minutes away The hotel sits atop of a shopping complex with a great foodcourt offering superb value and an amazing supermarket with a wonderful range. It was all very easy.On the Street level squeezed in between the Hotel concierge and the & eleven there is a money changer that offers very competitive rates.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic family destination”
Reviews.Author: TarynChris
Reviews.Content: Such a friendly, clean city. It is easy to get around whether it be on MRT or Taxi. Everyone we met and all the service providers were friendly and eager to help. Nothing was too much trouble. Staff at the Novotel Clarke Quay including Alvin Tan, Prabu, Huey in the square restaurant and Justine at La rouge Bar were outstanding, friendly and spoilt our children.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Accor hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed different hotels in Singapore and other Accor hotel across the region, but Novotel Clark Quay Singapore is definitely the worst ever. - I booked the rooms about 2-3 weeks in advance, for 02 rooms (family of 4). I also stated that we will be arrive at 4pm but when we arrive, the room was not ready (the staff said: "the room we prepared for you is not ready until 9pm"). So my family was forced to stay 2 different rooms, 01 at 21st floor, 01 at 11th floor. And the 11th floor room was a Smoking (or not i dont know but it was all very very smelly of cigarette). My wife is pregnant and ofcourse we can not stay in that room, so we got a change, but it is still a twin bed room (not as we requested of a double). Nevermind all of the above, the room lack of basic stuff like: toothbrush, spoon & cup (for cofffee). And ESPECIALLY, the house-keeping did a LOUSY job - after they cleaned the room (we stayed 02nights), it was still dirty, the toilet is still dirty all over, the bed was still dirty too. It was a very bed experience for us. I think Novotel Clark Quay have alot of works to do to improve the standard, if not i think customers would never come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, clean and well situated.”
Reviews.Author: j0belly
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed here for 4 nights and found the staff very helpful. Our flight in to Singapore was delayed so we arrived quite late - 11.00pm. Desiree at check in got us checked in very quickly, and when we discovered we had left one of our bags on the airport minibus - she promptly rang the company and they found it and returned it to us within half an hour. We were upgraded to a room on one of the premier floors and it was very well supplied with toiletries and clean. Only downside was as mentioned in other reviews, the very large bed was against one wall and quite firm. Our room overlooked the pool, so we had no problems with noise from the Clark Quay restaurant strip. The breakfast staff were friendly and welcoming. There is a 7-11 and a money changer with reasonable exchange rates next to the entrance and a supermarket and shopping centre in the bottom levels of the buidling - very handy for any of those little bits and pieces you might need. Checkout was very quick and the concierge was very helpful with advice about catching a taxi at the right time back to the airport to avoid the rush hour surcharge. All in all, a very pleasant stay and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loch78
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Singpore staying at the Novotel Clarke Quay. We could not fault the hotel at all. The service, the room and the breakfast were all very good. The room spacious and clean the staff polite and helpful. The breakfast was still available up until 10.30am and was good. The thing to watch for in the area is the local bars. Highlander Bar at Clarke Quay charged us $123.00 Singpore Dollars for a coke, 6 beers and a plate of wedges. Be aware of the prices in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and the price is not too high”
Reviews.Author: AashishSharma
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of Singapore's Clarke Quay, the Novotel is a convenient hotel for business and leisure travelers. The hotel is well-equipped with options for dining, fitness and other facilities. Positives Location is very convenient (situated in Clarke Quay). The rooms are large and well equipped. Free wi-fi in the lobby area and free wired Internet (if part of your room deal) in the rooms. Not so good You need to change 2 lifts to get to your room, which is sometimes bothersome. The breakfast spread is interesting but the food quality is not that great. And lastly the rooms are a bit old and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSteve99
Reviews.Content: Worth the money to stay on the premium floors. You're treated like royalty. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings About Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently spent 4 nights at the Novotel on Clarke Quay. I can related to much of what previous reviewers have said both pro and con. I purchased a package that included breakfast, a "view" and free internet. On arrival we were given an upgrade to the 24th. floor. The room was of good size and seemed clean. The view was great, but even on the very top of the hotel the disco music from way below vibrated until the wee hours of the morning. The buffet breakfast was good and the variety extensive. Service in all aspects of the hotel was good for us. We enjoyed the pool that was never busy but never used any other hotel services. The location of the hotel is quite good. It's near a subway station and one can easily walk to China Town and other sights. Taxi's in Singapore are of a reasonable price and are right at the hotel door at moments notice. The hotel is situated directly on top of a large shopping mall complete with McDonalds and Starbucks. There is also a large supermarket in which one can get almost any type of food one could want. If you are homesick there is something from your home country available in this store. The lobby on the 7th. floor is at first a bit odd but it's really no big issue. The elevators were quick so if you do get a high floor the ride is fast. Our biggest gripe was the air conditioning. It was either "on" or "off". When off the Singapore heat quickly takes over Opening a door offers little relief. When "on" it was like a freezer in the room. The temperature adjustment device never worked so we just threw on another blanket. Better cool than hot for sleeping. If you can get a decent rate and can get a room up high that doesn't view the river this isn't a bad choice. There is much to do in the immediate area of the hotel including a wonderful brewery called "Brewerkz" directly across the river (great beer). Be prepared to spend lots of money for dining and drinking in Singapore. The signature Singapore Sling at Raffles Hotel will set you back $27 U.S. However at a bar on Clarke Quay it was "only" $20. Singapore is clean and safe and a nice place to spend a few days.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service in a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: traceylew
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Clarke Quay may pretty much look like a 4 star hotel, indeed it is a little shabby here and there but the room was clean, comfortable and quiet and I would rate the quality of our stay right up there with many of the 5 star hotels we have stayed in. We requested a quiet room so after reading the trip advisor reviews we knew to ask for a room high up and with a park view. There was not a room of this description immediately , but Joanna who was taking care of us at check-in went out of her way to track one down and have it cleaned and made available for us as quickly as possible. We had a few minor issues in our room but a quick chat with Joanna had everything taken care of without fuss or delay. Every hotel needs front of house staff like Joanna. I was rather worried about staying here after the negative reviews I had read but that had been a waste of time. The breakfasts were great with heaps of variety and the free computers on the 7th floor near reception were invaluable. Having a 7/11 store near the hotel entry and a super market and food court below the hotel made eating tasty and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overrated. Terrible Service!!”
Reviews.Author: seanfrom
Reviews.Content: At $300 a night, I would expect some basics regarding service to be corrected. - $30 a day for internet is a joke in 2011. They offer free internet in the lobby, just not where you need it - your room. - The bar fridge managed to keep all drinks hotter than room temperature, whilst powered up. This is a rare feat for a bar fridge. There was no temperature control function, - I had to ask housekeeping for the complimentary water, it was never left in the room. - Toilet was not clean. - To open the balcony door, I had to call housekeeping, wait 20 mins, and then sign a liability waiver form. Yes, to open the door. - I ordered and paid for a pizza through a delivery service. When it arrived, the concierge asked me to go the ground floor to collect it. I asked for it to be delivered to my room, and they said it wasn't possible. Eventually, they walked the delivery guy to my floor... after I had to complain VERY loudly. Quite simply, this hotel must be the most annoying place I have ever stayed. If you have lots of money, a lot of time and patience, and like to listen to Hotel Costes Vol 1 all day long, every day, then this is the right place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MelbournePam
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced for such a good location. Clean room. Excellent pool. Good place to base yourself to view all of Singapore's attractions. Only drawback is having to change lifts at the sixth/seventh floor (5 floors below are shopping centre).

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good Hotel. Awkward entrance.”
Reviews.Author: Our_USA_trip
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly good,clean,comfortable but is awkward to enter which requires 2 lifts.Club lounge very nice and stadd attentive.Overall no problem at all.Just beware of noise of Clark Quay at night!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this hotel unless you ask for a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: catloverSotogrande
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite late after a long journey and too tired to complain about the room we had been given. There were signs everywhere saying that they were renovating the hotel and we were unlucky enough to have a room that had not been renovated. The bathroom was disgusting. Mould everywhere, cracked sink, water spilling out from the shower door and just generally awful. The room was quite small with only one bedside table and lamp and a very small television which we could hardly see from the bed. The following morning the front desk person moved us to a room which had been renovated but I wonder why were we not put there in the first place? The new room was much improved - the bathroom especially. They also had put two bedside tables and lamps in the room and a much larger TV. The bathroom has a separate walk-in shower which is really nice. It is in a great position in Clark Quay in the middle of everything. We were given a two hour extension on our departure time for no charge which really helped us a lot and we were grateful for that. They also had computers to use in the lobby which was a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Timelyreport
Reviews.Content: When i first checked in, we where given a room on the 15th floor. Within 15 minutes, I heard A jack hammer on the floor above us, a rather loud one at that. I called the front desk, and complained, they reassigned us to the 23rd floor, and problem solved. The staff is pretty good , and room was nice and large enough for us, for the 3 days we where here. The location is excellant, close to everything. Singapore is a expensive city, 1 beer will cost you 5 dollars or more, even in store. Malls are everywhere, but prices are no bargain. The only deals are on the restaurants located in the food courts of many malls. Everywhere you go in city cameras are watching you. Try malaysia, thailand, for more cheaper, friendly places to go. Big brother is watching you here.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again as the hotel is well-positioned. It sits atop a shopping centre so you can access all the facilities therein. Especially good if you are on the way home in Europe or Australia and need a few cheaper services such as laundry. The hotel had a few problems with linen and towels. All clean but a few holes and tears. Service was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay is in a great location, close to the MRT and entertainment complex. The staff were always helpful and polite and the hotel was clean and tidy. The concierge always assist you and point you in the right direction and assist you with planning your day!

Reviews.Title: “The worst!”
Reviews.Author: fghjksdjsahjk
Reviews.Content: great location however the fact that taxis are cheap and that major destination takes abt 10mins location shouldnt be an importance. Stayed in sg for 4 days- got woken up by an fire alarm at 3 and then again at 7 this repeatedly happened again and again. After the fire alarm we woken up again at 8 as there was construction that was happening. Shower was dirty and hot water system wasnt running. Had cold showers everyday. Despite all this service was okay. Wouldnt recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: GTQ8 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location right in the center of entertainment. Close to numerous cafes / bars / restaurants. Efficiently managed establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Was really a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: To start with, I have stayed in Novotel, Singapore in November and had a wonderful time. I spoke very highly of the hotel. However, my next trip was very dissapointing. As I checked in, despite I have reserved an executive king size bed room, I was given a 2 single bed room. All the duty manager could do was to apologize for the error but has no room for me. To my dismay, I was promised an upgrade next day, just to find that room is worst than the one I checked in earlier except that it had a king size bed. It had a small tv monitor and the dvd were not working. On top of all this, the construction starts at 9am next my room that I could not even sleep. I was told by another couple that they had problem with their booking too as they did not get the room they booked. As guest we should have been told upfront at the point of booking that there will be upgrading work going on so that we could have looked at other option. I am very dissapointed with the level of understanding and consideration here.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: tomboy96 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you have a room on the side of the Hotel that loks over Clarke Quay and its a weekend,then be prepared for the Booming of Base Music from the Attica Nightclub that this side of the hotel loos on to.It goes on until 5am(both the Fri&Sat)that we were there,leading to a total lack of sleep.First time that we have stayed at this Hotel and it will be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Confused on Room Call Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Press "ROOM SERVICE" button, it connected to laundry service dept. No auto or initiative of transfer service. Was told to Dial "02". On the same day at a time, I dialed "02", replied "wrong number". My wife helped me dial "02" while i'm bathing, the opposite guy helped service. At the end, we are completely confused.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Novotel Clarke Quay Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JenJenBrisbane Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After traveling to Qingdao, Shanghai, Niseko, Shenzhen, & Hong Kong, over 4 weeks we planned a final few days rest at Novotel Clarke Quay Singapore. We thought we were booking a 4.5 star modern looking hotel with a central location. We are regular travelers and not regular complainers. After booking two rooms online we were very disappointed in how old the hotel was and when we arrived they informed us they were renovating and sorry for any inconvenience. No discount offered naturally. The first room was in terrible condition, access to only one side of the king sized bed, bathroom very ordinary, old towels etc etc. We complained nicely and they transferred all of us to a floor that had already been renovated, and apart from a nicer bathroom you could hardly tell the difference. No free internet unless you stand in the lobby and share 5 computers with the rest of the hotel. Toilets not cleaned for 3 days until we asked, room not cleaned one day until 3:30 after we called them, lights not working properly and when we asked them to be fixed they left a mess on the floor which we had to call about getting cleaned, and they still did not work. The daily paper only came once in 4 days, the sheets had marks on them, the decor was still old in the "renovated" rooms, and you could not have a rest during the day due to the work going on in the hotel. One of the showers overflowed when used, the door fell off the fridge cabinet, the coffee cups were never cleaned or replaced, the tea & coffee satchels were never replaced unless we asked, and these were in the "renovated" rooms. The duty manager was never on duty when you called to sort something out, and when asked to do something for us you always had to ring back to get an answer. Sorry Novotel, good location, poor hotel, will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth staying at while noisy renovations are being carried out”
Reviews.Author: JHC479 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When I made the booking, I requested either a Queen or king size bed and selected the appropriate booking. On arrival I was surprised to see the room they had allocated to me was a room with twin beds. After making complaint they allocated me another room with a king size bed. Although this room had not been updated, it was quite comfortable only to ne disturbed early morning with the noise of work being carried out on the floor above. Paying S$ nearly 200 I was surprised that no breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Suite - Nonsensical Lighting System”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked the suite and was taken to the premier lounge to check in upon arrival. Whilst it was nice to check in on a different level to what you normally would, this process seemed to take much longer than when I have checked in to this hotel in the past. I don't think the formalities are required when all you really want to do when you arrive at a hotel is get to your room ASAP. The suite was very pleasant and more space than you could use for a couple. The only real complaint was the Master Light system. There were many locations to turn off lights around the apartment but the buttons in certain areas did not make any sense. There was only one button that would turn on/off a light in the bathroom and it was located at the entrance. There were a few other cases where you would have to leave the room to turn on/off the light in the room you were just in. Also, using the master on/off button did not always work depending on if you had switched a certain light on/off previously. Stayed here during a 50% off special. For the full rate, I would suggest checking into a cheaper room or just waiting for another special.

Reviews.Title: “1st visit”
Reviews.Author: EastLancsExplorer Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great ocation close to Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and Robertson Quay (where there are some lovely restaurants which could be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_hoppy
Reviews.Content: We have had another enjoyable 10 day stay at the Novotel. The location is fantastic right in the heart of Clarke Quay, with numerous resturants and night clubs. A short walk to the MRT, which gets you around the city very quickly. We stayed on the Premier Floor and were well looked after by Lucia and her team Aira, Angelo, Angeline and Desiree. I must stay if you want to feel special, pay the extra and book a room on the Premier floor, where you will receive 'personalised' check-in and check-out services, breakfast in the lounge and evening 'happy hour'. The lounge also provides free WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Change room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 single bed with bay view through Internet which slightly pay more than normal. But I found that there are different rooms after check in. After stayed 2 night, we can changed rooms. Other than that, Novotel Clarke Quay was good to us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with all Convenience at Your Door”
Reviews.Author: princesseunice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel during the Chinese New Year period. Seeing that it was a peak season, we experienced none of the earlier review's check-in delays, etc. Our room was ready when we walked in (about 1.30 p.m.) and the view was the best (Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, etc.). We couldn't be happier. Extra bed was set up very quickly and luggage was sent up in less than 5 minutes. The porter came with extra information on what to do during the first couple of days (during which many shops were closed in Singapore). We were upgraded to an Executive Room the next day (don't ask me why), and was given a chance to check the room and then decide whether we were willing to move (or not move). We did move. Although the second room had practically no view, it was larger and travelling with kids, more space is always a good thing. Ratthish at the front office (I hope I spelled his name right) was very helpful during check-in and check out (and all the paperworks in between), making everything smooth as silk. Vinny at Reservations was also very good at making sure that all my requirements are met. The construction work were 3 floors at a time, and each group of floors took 2 weeks. We were not bothered by this because a. The first few days they weren't working and b. We were out most of the day. On our last day, however, we were in our room at about 11-1 p.m. and the room reverberated with all the impacts of the renovation. My brother in law (who stayed longer) was moved to a much higher floor due to this renovation. The mall in the hotel complex had everything we needed and more. There was a food court with the local foods, Subway, McDonalds, Starbucks, 7-11, a pharmacy, a bookstore, a supermarket and lots of restaurants. If you are a fan of all things Japanese, then this place is perfect. Owned by a Japanese, it had many Japanese tennants selling Japanese products that you wouldn't normally find elsewhere (recently been to Japan to know this). All in all, service was very good (top to bottom). They could do with a little more care in checking the amenities in room (1st room: no toothbrush but had everything including body scrubs, 2nd room: lots of toothbrushes, soap, shampoo and bath gel, but no showercaps, etc.). We had a very smooth stay and would come back and stay there again without a second thought (especially with the renovation done). FYI: A superior room has enough space for 2 adults and 2 children under 11 as long as you don't mind sleeping in a bed with a child each (their twin bed is 120x200). An executive room gives you an extra sofabed (and space).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but too noisy.”
Reviews.Author: coconutti
Reviews.Content: This is an older Hotel which is currently under refurbishment. We were not advised prior to arrival of the renovations happening from floors 14 - 16. You could definitely hear the work going on, but the contractors generally finished up by 6:30pm which was good. Not ideal for people planning to stay in their rooms all day! Worse that that though was the noise from the night clubs at Clarke Quay. Even with my sleepmaker rain app playing on my I phone I could still hear people screaming, shouting and of course the bass from the music. Let me add that we were staying as premiere guests on the 21st floor. We should have been placed in one of the suites from the 22 - 25 floor, but they didn't have a room available. I dont think it would have improved the noise anyway. Breakfast in the club lounge was enjoyable every morning, simple- fresh-delicious. The breakfast downstairs was pretty average. Can I add that the tiny Tiramisu and Jaffa cakes served at complimentary drinks n canapes was to die for! Yum yum yum! The staff are outstanding with their service, and the place is squeaky clean. The lift doors sometimes wouldn't close when they should and there was o e lift that kept randomly stopping at the 13th floor. Another downside of being sooo close to the nightlife is that the staff have to put up signs on the front doors directing the drunkens to use the toilets at McDonalds, the outside is trashed by midnight on a Friday night. If I could be guaranteed complete silence when in my room, then I would stay there again as the staff are lovely, but considering the location, I think that's wishful thinking!

Reviews.Title: “Lost of sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were not told of the renovation upon booking. The renovation went on till 9pm and I had to call the duty manager to stop them. The drilling noise was unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “a week in SG”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I like to stay at Novotel SG, because the hotel is near to MRT station and the room is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 1night (02-03Feb'11) Overall is Ok but I don't like the attitude of the concierge...they seem not appreciate every single customer. When we arrive at Novotel with our bags no one asked us where we are going because the reception was on the 7th floor so you need to take the lift to check-in (its very confusing for us) and no one seems care. I like Ibis more...for the service And location

Reviews.Title: “Good value great location”
Reviews.Author: runitloveit
Reviews.Content: I booked over Chinese New Year and got a stay 3 pay for 2 deal which worked out as good value. The location is fantastic on the river with loads of restaurants and a five minute walk to Clarke Quay MRT. I was warned about noise from renovations but didn't hear a thing. There was some noise from the street (even though I was on the 20th floor), but it was Chinese New Year, so celebrations were happening. Plus I could hear slamming doors and other guests/children in the halls. If you are travelling to Singapore over Chinese New Year please be aware that most places shut down for 2 days (some for longer). Most of the tourist places were open, but alot of the city take holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for nightlife of Clarke Key”
Reviews.Author: rnizmo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location if you want to be next to Clarke Key for the nightlife and endless dining options. During our stay renovations were underway to upgrade the rooms. Unfortunately the noise started earlier and ended later than the posted signs stated which was a bit annoying. Breakfast at The Square resteraunt was good and there was plenty to choose from for all dietary requirements. Room was tidy and clean and once renovations are complete we would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Worth upgrading to Premier room”
Reviews.Author: Quartermen
Reviews.Content: Traveling with two teenagers, we had originally booked a single room, but it was too cramped for the four of us. So we upgrade to a suite, and it was a good decision. The room was spacious and comfortable, and we enjoyed some of the extra facilities - free internet, use of the premier lounge. One criticism - the jacuzzi bath didn't work. Excellent location with great views, and reasonably priced, so a reasonable base for a city break in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Tired By The Quay”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCarlito
Reviews.Content: The location is the biggest selling point for this hotel. Located literally by the quay, where all the night life and action is, you can't go past this hotel for its easy crawling distance from the many bars that line Clarke Quay. You will also find that staff are generally efficient and helpful as well. So those are the standouts here. However, don't expect too much from the rooms and the hotel in general. The rooms themselves are quite basic, given its rating as a 4 star hotel. You certainly get the feeling that everything is dated and old and in dire need of refurbishment. The furnishings, the linen, the carpet, the desks and fixtures can all be suitably described as "old". We also managed to see the gym facilities, located inside a claustrophobic room. It has basic machine equipment, water and TV for you to use. For the price we had paid for this hotel, we couldn't really complain what we got. However, given the high quality of hotels in Singapore, I was a little disappointed with this 4 star effort. For those on a budget and not too fussy, then this will be quite sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “quick family getaway”
Reviews.Author: sharonbaby Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 5 - 1 teenager (17), parents + grandparents - 3 rooms were required. G/parebts were on the 24th floor - premiur suites - excellent facilities (although wardrobe was placed in the bathroom, which gets humidity - not good for clothes). The other 2 rooms were on the 17th floor overlooking the pool - shared with another hotel. Only complaint was that in one of these rooms the bin from the previous guests was not emptied and that the full length mirror could have been cleaned better.
