Overall the staff were good, location excellent for eateries and nightlife, right near the river. Buffet breakfast - no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Check In Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Come to hotel at 2pm, but room not ready yet. Advised to come back at 3pm, but room again not ready yet. Complained, then hotel offered for late check out. What? Later, hotel offered upgraded room. Finally upgraded room ready at 4pm. Thanks God I am not in business trip.

Reviews.Title: “good location especially for eating”
Reviews.Author: scotaussie
Reviews.Content: Novotel is located on Clarke Quay right adjacent to one of the few existing old town areas of Singapore. The hotel is combined with a shopping centre so the concierge is on the ground floor and the reception of the 7th which is not a problem. This does mean however that all rooms are elevated and get some great views. I was upgraded to a premier floor and the rooms are very large by Singapore standards with a king bed and a couch that looks like it folds out for an extra bed to make a family room. The bathroom has a bath and large seperate shower. Room has internet access at a fee or you could use the free computers and wi fi in the reception. Breakfast was $S24 which is not bad and there was a reasonable selection. Early in the morning service was a bit slow removing dishes etc The location of the hotel is great if you do not demand to be next to high class shopping centres. Clarke Quay is a renovated former harbour with an abundance of eating choices both on the river and in a covered area. Clarke Quay MRT station is just across the river or it will cost you around $$30 for a taxi from the airport. Clarke Quay is also a shopping centre. You can walk to chinatown very easily for more great eating and culture. To get to Orchard Road just jump on the MRT. Buy your ticket at the machine. Usually around $S2 to $3 with $1 back so very cheap. A must do is follow the river downstream for a very pleasant walk past the old colonial buildings to tne new Marina Sands Casino. Take the lift to the top for fabulous views over the city and harbour

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dzack Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I'am having a good time at Novotel. The room is clean and our room have a good view, Singapore River. The reception are polite and very attentivefully. She try to accomodate my request eventhough I check-in early in the morning. Eventhough is an old building but the hotel been upgraded to a new and modern look. Overall I have no bad comment about this hotel and would stay again for my next visit... definately...

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th stay at Novotel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel perfectly positioned on the riverside on the edge of Clarke Quay 15 minutes walk from Chinatown and a $6 taxi ride to Orchard road. Friendly helpful staff, superb breakfast. Large comfortable rooms and a supermarket in the shopping mall below to get those extra few things you need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service.”
Reviews.Author: adrell
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from a young lady named Noliana. The day we check in till the day we checked out. Renovation noises drive us crazy.I have to come down 2 times to speak to the duty manager. She was very helpful in looking by moving us to a new room which was quieter and with the connecting door as we have 3 kids with us.My wife was impressed with her friendliness and the service she given to us for the 7 nights we stayed with Novotel. Without failed she would greet me and my wife by our named when we passed the reception. Hotel would be enjoyable stay without the renovation and leaking from our bathroom. Would definitely stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Novotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: suvitsachdev Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am a Frequent Flyer and fly approx 75000miles per year....this is the worst hotel i have stayed for the amount i have paid Usd.150/night. The bathrooms were very bad. The Shower room has got dirt on the walls and needs srubbing...The cieling in the room has a gap and there is so much dust there...two cockroaches fell on to the bed....after that the staff sprayed DDT and we could not sleep the whole night because of the Smell. My wife was sneezing all night......asked for hot water for medicine and it took 2 hours and many reminders.......worst hotel in the world......i am a Accor advantage member and always stay in Accor....was in Novotel in mumbai in October and that was very good....so not all accor hotels are bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel , but”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the staff were fantastic . Unfortunately our room had a used towel and bathrobe still hanging up in the bathroom and there was a dirty tissue in our bed . Obviuosly the bed sheets hadn't been stripped before we arrived. Other than that we really enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very unprofessional service...first time with Novotel and hopefully the last time!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location just 2 steps from the wonderful Clarke Quay! And the hotel was perfect for my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Novotel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is good, 10 minutes walk to MRT Clarke Quay. Too bad as almost every night (say around 2am) there was false alarm which disturbed our sleeping time.

Reviews.Title: “4 day stopover in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed Novotel Clark Quay which is located near a number of great eateries and entertainment venues. Found the staff to be very friendly and obliging. Had the best crayfish Laksa that was the room service menu however the chef was happy to make for us in the restaurant. Public transport and scenic bus tours located within a few minutes walk. The hotel caterers easily for families and business. The hotel rooms are getting a lifftle tired however I do understand they are currently being refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Numerous small problems spoiled our stay”
Reviews.Author: Ozcyclist
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Novotel in Jan 2010. It was not a happy stay. The rooms are a bit tired and slightly weary looking, though clean and mostly comfortable. The first problem was that the air conditioning didn't work properly (I see someone else has reported the same problem). The room was really, really cold, despite turning the thermostat up to 28c. After reporting the problem, we were told it had been fixed, but it was still the same. I reported it again and a technician came. He said that basically the only solution was to turn it off. This resulted in the room being too hot and humid. So we had a choice of very cold or very hot and nothing in between. On our second night, neither of us got any sleep because of noisy music until 5 am from Clarke Quay - a relentless pounding bass and drums. Next morning I asked to be moved to a quieter room. The reception staff were very helpful, but the move was stuffed up twice, firstly by not moving our bags which they said they would, and then by giving us a double bed instead of twin beds, which we had booked. Eventually we got a room which was quieter and had working air conditioning, but it was a frustrating and tiring exercise. Breakfast was included in our stay - it was ok, but VERY crowded - there always seemed to be a series of minor problems - missing glasses, missing cups, missing cutlery, coffee machine not working etc. and if you got up to get a coffee, there was a good chance your table was given to someone else before you sat down. The staff try hard but something is wrong which results in things not quite working. My last comment is that $10 per hour for internet access in your room is over the top in this day and age, when many hotels provide it free - the Novotel does have free terminals for 20 minutes in the reception area and we had some complimentary time in our rooms, but it seems to expire after your first day. A beer by the pool will set you back $14 - I didn't bother. Singapore in general has become very expensive - its not unusual to be charged $12 for a beer. Most main courses in tourist venues are $20+. Its not a cheap destination any more. You can get cheaper food and drink in places like Chinatown, but in the main Clarke Quay area you pay through the nose.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the same hotel last year and had a very good stay however this year it was not up to the same standard. We booked a King room and were given a twin which we were unable to change. We were traveling with friends and the hotel mixed up the rooms on check in we were charged for their meals even after we told the hotel twice. We booked into the restaurant for New Years Eve for a buffet with drinks included, the meal was outstanding however we were informed at 1030 PM that the free drinks had finished and we were required to pay if we wanted any more. This was very disappointing, as the year before the drinks went until midnight. Overall the hotel is in an excellent location however it is unlikely that we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel looked after”
Reviews.Author: rachiesparrow
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Novotel Clarke Quay, we were made to feel looked after and valued. Such lovely staff - couldn't ask for nicer treatment. Everyone has been wonderful. The rooms are being upgraded, which they do need, but the noise is actually minimal and is occurring between reasonable hours. We haven't been disturbed at all. Breakfast also is fantastic. Cannot praise highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Superb location, convenient, go down you will get Liang Court with variety of food & beverage outlets, food court, fashions, kinokuniya book store, hugh electronic gadget/appliances store and many more even seven eleven. If you can't sleep, go to Clarke Quay which just few steps away from hotel. Wonderful! Everything is fine unless when we change room to premier floor there was water leaked from the ceiling, smell of carpet was horrible and we requested to switch to other room. It took quite a time via telephone, so you'd better go down to the receptionist directly to get a replacement immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clarke Quay stay Dec-Jan 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good location, with shops, restaurants, and transport close by, The room was comfortable and roomy, its worth paying the extra to get a room with shower recess, because bathroom flooded when using shower in our bathtub. Renovations caused a lot of stress going on well into the night, and past the 4pm curfew, and customers should have been notified at time of booking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suite for 2”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I got this suite for a weekend getaway. It was great. It came with a jacuzzi for 2. The service staff were friendly and the experience was good for couples. =)

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Recommended for tourist looking for some action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Finghin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on our way back from Australia to Ireland. From the minute we arrrived we were impressed with the freindliness, helpfullness and courtesy of the staff, especially Guna, the young lady who checked us in. The room on the 23rd floor offered spectacular views of the city and the location allowed for a really excellent range of eateries. Could not recommend this hotel highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel breakfast was superb but would not book Hotel shuttle to pick up from airport as it was twice the price of the local taxi

Reviews.Title: “So very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MissMeg1970 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had booked in April for the Christmas break and were plagued with problems from this point. We tried on numerous occasions to get reservation issues sorted with the hotel and they were less than helpful. This is a very nice hotel with the restaurant staff being so lovely and helpful but we sadly would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The suite is consider spacious for hotel in Singapore. Just nice for a couple with 2-3 young kids less than 12 years.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get a good sleep in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel hotel is my first choice whenever I make a personal trip. However, my stay in Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay was a disaster!! I stayed in this hotel from Dec 25-28. You could hear the disco music from the pubs and night clubs nearby till 5:00a.m. or 6:00 a.m. in the morning (probably because of Christmas celebration) and worst still, the hotel is under a room renovation project that the renovation works starts from as early as 9:00 a.m. in the morning, meaning that one could only get <4 hours of good sleep a night. And there was another misfortunate that the smoke alarm rang at around 3:00 a.m. of Dec 28 that woke everyone up but eventually turned out to be falsely!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything went wrong”
Reviews.Author: CSom
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation online for Christmas eve, wanting to suprise my wife but was told she couldn't make it and asked me to change to Christmas night. Called the hotel directly but was told that I'll have to do it online to avoid cancelling charge. Wife called back saying she would rearrange her meetings so let's go ahead. However when we checked in, was told there was no reservation. Finally found out the booking was cancelled. How could it be cancelled if I didn't cancel it online? Receptionist told us all delux room taken so upgraded us to executive, and she stressed - without benefits.... My wife asked what sort of benefits come with usual executive room, and was told not much, anyway the free room upgrade was good enough for us. Went in to the room, found it full of cigarette smoke, called the reception, and was told by the same receptionist all rooms full, but she can ask housekeeping to opening the balcony windows to air the room. She also said anyway the room is much bigger and nicer and a free upgrade, should be good enough for us.... Don't really understand what she meant by good enough for us. Called for room service, had 2 soups, but found a piece of plastic in the soup. Went to take shower, found the rubbish bin still filled with waste from previouse guests who checked out. By this time it was 2 am and we were to tired to call again. Went to bed, but the lights in the room kept flickering on and off throughout the night. Wife thought the hotel is haunted. Went for breakfast the next morning and found juice glass chipped. Never had a hotel stay where everything went wrong that we had to laugh about it. Finally spoken to Duty Manager Marina and shared the horrors we experienced and was told we'll get an upgrade to a suite - with full benefits, the next time we check-in..... Finally checked out, told the receptionist about the plastic in the soup, they didn't care, still charge me for it. Shown they all the pictures I'd taken, their face seemed rediculous.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff at the Premier Lounge has made our stay a memorable one!”
Reviews.Author: zena96
Reviews.Content: During our 8 night stay we were woken up four times between about 12.30am to 3 am by the announcement over the room PA system that the fire alarm is activated. Fortunately all turn out to be false alarm. Downside have to take two lifts to get to our room. The Concierge was very helpful with our luggage, taxi, and booking our tours. The Restaurant was spacious, friendly atmosphere. What made our stay unforgetable is the service, friendliness, professionalism of everyone at the premier lounge. We were treated like royalty, special mention of John Chetty and Lucia Lee who in my opinion has done above and beyond their job. We actually were feeling sad when we left as they have made such a big impression on us. This above everything else would be the reason we would return to stay here. Five Star Service from your five star personnel at the premier lounge. Thank you again Lucia, John, Samn, Angelo you all have made us relax and enjoy ourselves in your company.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clark Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First reason I choose Novotel because of it's strategic location, near the Clark Quay River which very crowd during night hour and it's kinda easy and short journey having access to other area such Orchad or Marina Bay. After checked in, I really feel the helpfullness of the staff from bell boy to front desk. Entering the room I feel a little bit dissapointed because it feel not modern (interior design) as in the website, but luckily the cleanliness of the room and bathroom were pretty nice. The bed are quite comfort so our sleep quality are good. Amenities in room are complete from TV with pay per view movie (both blockbuster and adult), minibar, hairdryer, safe deposit box until iron. This hotel also have a swimming pool but sadly there is no time to use this facilities. Internet corner also available at this hotel. For the restaurant I think the ambiance are pretty good but for the taste and variety of food you must check it by yourself because I don't take breakfast package. Overall I have great experiance with Novotel, the service is good, rooms are clean, good location but I suggest to upgrade the design and mood for the rooms so it can catch up with the latest look from design and equipment. For getting the lowest price try to book far before your trip and use official website or other site that can give you great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For my next visit I will still stay with Novotel Clarke Quay because of its accessibility and view of the the City. We had a great time and the dining staff are friendly and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: HatMelbourne Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay on our way to Cambodia. The room was in need of an upgrade - cracked tiles, mould in the bathroom. One bed side table was missing and in general the room was very tired. Our room was overlooking Clarke Quay which was a lovely view, however very noisy on a Saturday night with all the night clubs. Breakfast was dissapointing - cold eggs - not a great slection. The lobby and the pool were very nice. Overall this is a great locationl - but expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a Premier Room disapointed with level of room facilities at the price not good value for money. Fridge did not work, air conditioning was not controllable, freezing or off. Disapointing. Staff in Premier Lounge excellent.

Reviews.Title: “About Novotel in Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The overall stay was good though i thought the staff were overwhelmed by guests at times. There were simply not enough staff to provide good quality service to guests especially during the festive season. I guess this is expected as the hotel is fully booked. Anyway, the room was great and i look forward to coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful situation, administrative nightmare”
Reviews.Author: wsymes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully situated, has some lovely facilities and (mostly) very courteous staff. However, the ongoing hassles we have had with the administration over the simple booking of two rooms turned my lovely Christmas holiday vacation into an insanely stressful occasion. This problem was not confined to our family. Every time we stood at the front counter trying to sort out the issues the hotel had created (at one point they had created bookings for 11 different rooms on totally different dates from the ones we were staying, and tried to charge us for them) other people would comment that they also had been shafted by the administration, or join the queue behind us to register their own complaints. Despite having booked (the previous April) rooms for 4 people, we found ourselves having to argue for (and being charged extra to get) enough beds in the rooms for us all to sleep. During the multiple phone calls we made from Qatar to Singapore to try and sort out the situation, when money would suddenly go missing from our bank account because the hotel had charged us yet again for the same rooms, we were told that it was too difficult for their staff to understand and we would have to call back at another time. Even the maintenance of the rooms was an issue after we had arrived. We would go out for an entire day and come home to find that we had to leave the room so it could be cleaned. On more than one occasion rooms were not cleaned and beds not made up at all. It is a great shame, because the hotel has so much going for it. However, if you are incapable of taking and implementing room bookings then you are NOT a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Great for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: thebasifamily Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2010 in one of the twin rooms (2 adults and 2 young kids). Excellent room size and with any Accor hotel; you always know what you're going to get - great value and consistent quality and a central location. The ground floor of the hotel has a Starbucks and a 7/11 store always handy if you don't want to pay extortionate hotel prices! A gentle 20-30 minute walk along the river to the Marina and only 5-10 minute stroll to underground trains.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, free internet, good for families”
Reviews.Author: LucyDas
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the location. Its a 1 min walk from Clarke Quay - the epicenter of Singaporean Night life. We were there on Christmas day and the atmosphere was great. It is also close to the jetty where the bumboats start. The mall next door offers various eating options like McDonalds, Subway and the local food (Kopitiam - food court). The Clarke Quay MRT station is about 5-10 min walk (across the bridge) though its on a purple line that is not too convenient. It is however on the same line as Harborfront station from where you could go to Sentosa via bus/monorail. It is also close to Chinatown (20 min walk) or a short taxi ride away. Don't forget to drop into Jumbo Seafood (there are 2 branches) across the bridge from Novotel for the famous Chilli Crab or Pepper crab. We lost count of the no. of eateries in the area so if you like to try different things - this is the place for you. Our package included breakfast for 2 adults and 2 kids < 12 yrs. That was very convenient. However, even if you don't opt for that, there are a few breakfast places adjacent to the hotel (McDonalds, Kaya Toast, Local eatery, a Crepe place and a bakery inside Meidi-Ya supermarket - all in Liang Court mall next door). Overall experience: Great. High point: Location. Price wasn't the best since we went during peak season. So, if you beat the crowds, you might get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Problem solved”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel and the great location, but were disappointed, initially, that we had not been told when we booked, that there were renovations being undertaken. We had hoped to catch up on sleep during the day we arrived, but as the construction was scheduled for 10 - 4pm each day, we were unable to do so because of the noise, so instead went sightseeing and came back at 4pm. Unfortunately the noise was still going at 4.30pm, so we contacted the reception and they said they would look into it. It was still going at 5.45pm so contacted the Duty Manager who then organised a change of rooms within 3/4 hour to a higher level above the noise. Once all the older rooms are renovated it will be a very nice hotel. Thank you for fixing our complaint without us getting too upset.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent atmospher”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: At the check in /out counter should placed more staffs during high seasons.The Variety of food should change atleast on a monthly basis.Those that are populars stays and drops out or replaced with new items.I have eaten the bufet 4 times over a period of 4 months and no changes .

Reviews.Title: “Fair value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: Batsamai
Reviews.Content: The plus for the Novotel is the great location in Clarke Quay, the most vibey part of Singapore with great restaurants along the river. My husband and I booked a room for 4 nights just before Christmas. Clean rooms on the small side, with the basics. The bathroom and bath tub were very small with no stand alone shower. The room we got had great views of the city. The staff at reception were efficient, not particularly friendly. The deal we had offered free internet but only via a LAN cable in the room and not Wifi even though the hotel was on wi fi. Wifi was not free and a voucher was required. The deal we had included breakfast and the hotel offered a good spread. There is a 24hr McDonalds and shopping centre adjacent to the hotel which offered alternatives to the hotel breakfast. The hotel also has a large swimming pool which is great for cooling off after a long day. Singapore is hot and humid. Overall Singapore is a great place to visit, good metro system. The nearest MRT to the hotel is at Clarke Quay through the shopping centre "The Central" which is about 10 min walk. Otherwise the bus stop is just across the street from the hotel. The is also a taxi stop just outside the hotel and taxis in singapore are generally very affordable. Must visit places: Night Safari, Little India, Sentosa Island (we did not manage to get tickets to Universal Studios because of the peak season), Orchard Road, Mustafa's (24hr shop in Little India - perfumes go for a song!)

Reviews.Title: “New year at novotel”
Reviews.Author: LindsayCheshire
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel for location as we were staying for new year break. Busy and lively night time entertainment on doorstep. Fast check in and one room had great views to Marina bay hotel and observation wheel area, level 20. Worth requesting this side of hotel but be warned outside music can be just heard until 5.30am! Our sons room on level 16 facing swimming pool, no disturbances. Hotel as described and expected for the novotel chain, clean, functional and just right for Singapore, as mostly out and about, sight seeing and shopping! Taxis available immediately outside hotel main entrance. Have visited Singapore previously and stayed in Holiday inn orchard road, which was a little more stylish, and great for shopping as no taxi required. However, if it's night life on doorstep you are after than novotel is the answer. Don't be put off by the hideous colour of the outside of the hotel, can only assume they don't change it as it is easily recognisable!! Hotel staff very efficient and pleasant, breakfast buffet style was adequate, Plenty of selection, but obviously busy as hotel full for new year celebrations. Small supermarket and larger shopping area just around the corner. Supermarket sold alcohol aswell, so great if you don't want to pay the mini bar prices! Be careful not to be drawn into thinking happy hour is the cheapest beer option! 23 dollars for 3 Hieneken bottles of beer, better going for the pitcher of local Tiger beer! We stayed on the promotional hotel offer for discounted attractions and breakfast. The discounts however, were just between 5 and 10 percent which are also available in the many sightseeing booklets at the voucher section. The free bus tour we picked up from the Singapore flyer, which was on the green line tour, which was ok, but only used the once. We found it easier and quicker to jump in a taxi, as we managed to see the many attractions of Singapore in a shorter time period and a little less tired and hot! Didn't make use of swimming pool area or bar areas, which both seemed small but adequate. Although there were many families with smaller children staying at novotel, I'd say it was more suited to those with older children, if travelling with family. No connections for iPad use in room, only cable connection. Complimentary wi fi connection did work in lounge/ lobby area for ipad despite initially being informed that it didn't work! So worth a try! The other complimentary computer areas were very busy but you can use them for airport check in and print out boarding passes for no charge. Hotel reception is on 7th floor and use of room card to access the other lifts to the hotel rooms is required. We booked x2 superior rooms which I would say would be standard rooms in other hotels. Mattresses differed in each room, didn't cause a problem for us, but if you prefer a softer mattress, worth mentioning at booking in stage! Bathrooms had separate shower enclosures so maybe this was the "superior" upgrade?! Would recommend this hotel for a stay in Singapore if you are looking for a lively location and functional clean accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Anna234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay for 8 nights over Christmas. Whilst the location is undeniably great, this hotel is definitely not worth it's five star per night price tag. During my stay I was put in a room where the air conditioning wasn't working and then relocated to a room that stank distinctly of pickles and vinegar. When house keeping arrived to do something about the smell it was so bad the guy offered to leave me a whole can of air freshener. Other complaints include being given smelly towels with holes in them and rooms not being made up until 6pm. In short I'd say this hotel is definitely not worth the money. I wouldn't stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad services”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in and Check-out was terrible. Staff at check-in counter has no service mind at all. We were waiting for 15 mins for check-in and 10 min for check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 1. The location is excellent as the hotel is very close to the clark Quay, Boat Quay and Raffles Place 2. Service was excellent as well. Two examples: when I missed to bring along with me the door key and my wife was at the room. The front desk helped me going inside the lift that requires the key to press the floor button. Moreover, after I checked out, I needed to go back to the room as I forgot to bring some belongings from the security locker, Ms Park (the front desk) checked carefully my ID with smile and let me do so. 3. One thing needs to be improved: We heard an announcement about a false alarm (firm alarm) in both the two nights we stayed. It was too disturbing as they happened at about mid-night. Regards, Kwok from HK Eric

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Question Marks???”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is very good,very close to Clarke Quay,China Town,City Center.But the Hotel is a bit too old,for example; -Hair Dryer in the Room will stop every 20 seconds or so,due to heat.So to dry long hair,you need 30 minutes or more -We stayed for 4 nights,but at least 3 nights,there were Fire Alarm at around midnight -The Room has a Shower Room,in addition to a Bath-Tub,but the Shower did not work properly,and the Hot Water is not hot enough As the location is very good,it is very unfortunate that the hotel could not meet the standard required.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good food and service”
Reviews.Author: tg_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel in Dec 2010 for 5 days. The highlight of this hotel is its superb location. Right at Clarke Quay, you can walk up to any of the bars and restaurants anytime you please. The rooms that offer a view of the river are excellent! Our room did not have any noise or sound coming in from Clarke Quay. The hotel is located above Liam Court - a small mall and has a 7/11 right at its entry. The buffet breakfast is a good spread, well managed with excellent service. The pool on the 7th or 8th floor is open, spacious, and clean - ready for you to dive in! There is free Internet on Mac Machines at the hotel lobby for hotel guest...which is always a bonus. The Central Mall is right across (cross a bridge), the MRT is 5 minutes away, and Boat Quay is very walkable. We even walked up to the Merlion and Esplanade from our hotel. It was an ambitious walk but the weather was on our side and we could do it with our 7year old!

Reviews.Title: “Novatel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, the staff are very persoanble, not stuffy and treat you like a friend. You can have a joke with them and nothing was a bother. They are to be commended on there level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular service in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Aliboolala
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute & were given an executive room which gave us access to the private suite which served wine, nibbles & sweets in the evening and breakfast in the a.m. overlooking this gorgeous city. The room was plush, bed extremely cozy, bathroom was huge & the shower was magnificent. There is a Starbucks :) at the entrance, a 7-11, Mickey D's, and shopping mall attached. Also, a grocery store below- which is fabulous. The staff was very kind and helpful. Free internet on the check-in floor and the breakfast buffet was Amazing! I didn't want to leave :) The location is Perfectly close to Clarke Quay & within walking distance of a wonderful park with military history- well worth the visit. I'd definitely book again!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only saviour”
Reviews.Author: rickyb62
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here at Clark Key. As others have mentioned location location. I would give this hotel a rating of 4 out of 10, two of those points go to location. Rooms are average, as we stayed on the executive floor you would expect something better, but no. The really big p#@s off is the fact that they do not allow kids in the executive lounge?? Being a member of the accor plus club for 3 yrs now, and use accor hotels through out asia, this is the first time. Not good enough, if this going to be the case, they should advertise this on there web site... As I would not have even bothered staying, paying the extra if I had known this. Staff were friendly, good location. But thats the end of it. hotel is tired, old. Singapore is expensive, there is no doubt about that, but common Accor, get it together. I for one will not use this property again, I pay the money I expect to get value for it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nothing much i can say about dis hotel.......P.E.R.F.E.C.T............mall just with the same hotel building....starbuck, mc donald, subway, kopitiamn muslim halal food the most importing things 4 muslim like me.....and the staff i give *****.GOOD location ,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tamoi
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in 20/12/2010 evening. Upon arrival 2 young female porters assisted us with unloading of our3 baggages from the cab. (Not to be a seixst but it just makes you wonder why on earth would the management delegate 2 slim looking ladies for baggage handling?) We were told that our baggages would be taken care of and that we could proceed to the 7th floor to check in. Checking in was a pleasant experience with good sevice received. We were also quite pleasant with our rooms and thinking that we had made a good choice. However when we received our baggages from the porter we discovered that one of them has been severely damaged with dents and scratches clearly visible. We were absolutely certain that this piece of luggage was completely intact. Therefore we raised the issue with the reception and was told that they would investigate and would give us a feedback before our departure on 23/12. The next day we received a "3 lines letter" from the "Assistant Manager", Ms Marina [--]. The letter simply stated that their "video record showed that there was no damage done to your suitcase by our staff". There was no apologies, no explanation whatsoever. When we expressed our frustration her attitude was extremely arrogant and the fact that she asked us to call the police did not help the situation. Anyway we had to carry on with our journey with this damaged baggage....I would have thought a 4 star hotel would treat their customers better. Aww I was wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great relaxing stay in a comfortable room. Convenient location with good shopping and Japanese food around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: AmitMajumdar
Reviews.Content: If it was not for the restaurant and its staff, I would give it a 1-star. So let's start with the positive. The Square restaurant works very well for families with kids. The staff is friendly and helpful, the menu is great. And now the rest. We arrived after a 20 hr flight from San Francisco with 2 children, very tired. After the initial niceties at the lobby, we were informed that we would get a room that did not exactly match the one we booked. One less bed. We bent over and said ok. When we went to the room we found that it was 2-beds short. So we called and they apologized saying that there was a miscommunication between reception-desk and the other department. 30 min. since we arrived. I went down to the lobby and they changed our room. I collected my family and moved to the other room. Well, this was 2-beds short as well. Hmmm. I called. Reception desk apologized again. Same reason. Miscommunication between their 2 departments. They said they will fix this problem and that we should just wait in our current room. 50 min since we arrived. I decided I should go down to the lobby again. I had waited for an hour to get the room I had booked. I was less than cordial and it showed. When the lady at the reception desk once more offered to change my room to "fix" the problem, I asked to talk to the manager. The manager, who happened to be at the next station all this time, responded that she will help. We had to wait for one of the vacated rooms to be cleaned before we could move in. Changed us to a superior room in the way of an apology for their mess. We soon realized that the superior room was the apology for putting us through this crap. Not much for words, the manager only offered a smug attitude and small talk with the kids. One-and-half hrs after we arrived at the hotel we had a room. This is a 4-star hotel with terrible service. There are many other hotels in the same area with better value. Not worth the trouble wasting time with the likes of Novotel Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Accor hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Best of the 3 hotels in Singapore beloging to the Accor Group. However, it will be good to have unlimited access to car park entry/exit for hotel guests rather than just a signale entry/exit. Also, it will be good to have a games room for young children to entertain them.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was good except the AC in the room was'nt that good. Because of the warm weather in singapore it was annoying at times when the AC dint do was supposed to do.

Reviews.Title: “Accorhotel promotion”
Reviews.Author: Pauqueen Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was selected because it has won an Outstanding award in 2010 and that it came with the "US$1000 cash-back" promotion; which includes discounts on rides and free city tour. Generally the hotel stay was good and for future improvement, a hotel of this standard should have toothbrush / toothpaste / cotton buds / shower cap included. As for the tie-in with City Tours promotion, this had been a nightmare as there is no timely reply of email/correspondences with on-line booking. Other disappointments are: - there is no reply on confirmation of tickets although reminder emails and calls were made from Malaysia; which ultimately caused the confusion of unpaid flyer ticket - i had to wait something like 20-30 mins to settle the issue - there were the expense of international calls made to clarify This is not something to expect from a tourist attraction supposedly patronised by foreigners.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clarke Quay Singapore is AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: smileyjene
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were made to feel like royalty! My daughters were having their birthday and we even had a birthday cake waiting in our fabulous room. I booked a Premier Room and this gave us access to the Premier Lounge - free drinks and snacks from 6PM until 8PM. That was fantastic! The view and the fantastic people, from John Chetty and Sam to all of the staff...I can only have the highest praise for making our Singapore stay just amazing!! I will definitely stay at Novotel Hotels again and hope to visit this hotel in the future> Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Singapore no!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the restaurant was good but the room was very disappointing. The bed felt like it was 20 years old (it was very uncomfortable!) and there was not even a shower cap or face cloth in the bathroom. I was told by a housekeeping employee that they were by request. I thought face cloths and shower caps were standard items in 4 star hotel bathrooms! Even the Ibis in Singapore, another Accor property but only a 2 star one, had a shower cap and face cloth in the bathroom. Very poor!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in a good location close to shops and China Town. As most Hotels are overpriced in Singapore, the Novatel was average. We had our evening meal in our room from the room service menu and the meal was very good and room service was very quick. Whilst the room was clean, it was old and in need of an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Bath-tub was a problem”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: So many black spots(seemingly molds) are observed on sealing silicone of bath room tiles(maintenance manager should have applied anti-molds cleaner to clean off black molds) and the silicone-sealing work appears at level of unskilled amateur. Enamel was partly broken by mounting rusts of bath-tub metal and rusts appeared visible. Room 1711. Bath room rating cud be zero star. Hi time to replace old enameled narrow bath-tub with Acrylic resin made wide one.

Reviews.Title: “Great service thankyou!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy the courteous and professional service in Singapore. Thankyou, it makes for a very pleasant trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: az412
Reviews.Content: novotel clarke quay singapore is situated right at the entertainment and night clubs area of singapore, which is the clarke quay. however, don't be fooled by "next to the MRT" thing. because it's not immediately right nest to the Clarke Quay MRT. u have to walk about 10-15 minutes in order to reach this hotels, thru Central Mall, Read Bridge and the pubs itself. it is quite a good walk, but if u carry a lot of stuffs it is not advisable at all. in a hot and humid wheater, this can be tiring and troublesome of u carry a lot of stuffs. in this case, take the cab. even buses did not ply immediately in front of it. check in is at 7th floor. the ground floor is just the concierge. checking in is ok, BUT u have to make sure they give u the correct room. rooms that have the bay view is a bit expensive. i booked for rooms that overlooked the bay, but the clerk gave me the room that overlook the other side (offices). it is not fair at all coz i paid more to have the bay view. tried to change the room, she refuses to change my room. only at night another receptionist gave us the room that we wanted and apologize for it. as for the room, not impressive. the view is nice but the room is old and tired. nothing fancy about the room. nothing to be excited about. more to 2 1/2 - 3 star kind of room. tv - petite size, not clear signal, the channels are standard for most hotels. paid porn are available - damn expensive! amenties again, boring. paid internet service (again expansive). well, nnothing is cheap in singapore overall, this hotels claim itself as 4 star, but i only see it not much more than 3 stars. even some 3 stars hotels are better than this. really nothing great about this hotel. just an expensive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay at Novatel Singapore Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: * My wife and I stopped over in Singapore to break our trip from Sydney to London, finding that this helps to reduce jet lag. On arrival, we were met at the front of the hotel where were immediately assisted with our bags and directed to reception on the 7th floor. On checking in, our keys and directions to the room were given efficiently. Bags were delivered to our room quickly. * The room itself was clean, comfortable and airy with a good view over Singapore * The hotel is located close to shopping areas and was only a 10 min walk to Orchard Rd where the Christmas decorations were spectacular. The price of the rooms was reasonable and represented value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not terribley impressed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Poor Room Preparation. This was supposed to be a premier room. Room Service was poor. Room Smelled of Sewrage on second day.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chrissy291150
Reviews.Content: We chose the Novotel Clarke Quay in Singapore to stay to celebrate my 60th birthday. What a great choice it turned out to be. Fabulous location, great rooms, fabulous bathrooms with separate shower. and views. Breakfast was included and had every choice you could think of. Staff were fantastic - no request went unheeded and nothing was too much trouble. My husband had contacted the hotel prior to our arrival and asked for help to make my birthday special. I don't think even he expected the response he got from Lucia. It is certainly a trip I will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is near Clark Quey. It's easy to access MRT but have to walk a bit. There is the department store in the same building and 7-11 also. So It's very convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel with good basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: Sporthead Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in was swift but that could've been aided by the fact we arrived after 8pm. I'd prebooked a few months in advance and had received a very good rate. The Iady at reception was nice, gave each our kids a stuffed toy but she was trying to rip us off our breakfast. Lucky I had a printed itinerary with our entitlements. I had informed the hotel I needed to stay in Singapore for an extra night about 6 weeks before I arrived. They offered me the same room at more than double the rate I'd paid for. When I queries the fariness of that, they weren't prepared to help so I checked out and stayed at the Swissotel Stamford for the extra night (for a far better price) and didn't regret it! The size of the room was good at the Novotel. Although the hotel had advertised sofa bed for the kids, this wasn't the case, we just got one rollaway bed and the other child had to sleep in the king bed with us! Rather disappointing...... The breakfast buffet was pretty good and we enjoyed the pool as well briefly. Checkout was slow. I informed reception that I was an A club member but didn't have my membership number handy at check out. Rather than perhaps try to help me find it online, she just gave me an email address to email and let them know. Found that very impersonal. Overall, if you get a really good deal, its not a bad value for money hotel. I had paid around $200 SGD per night for the executive king room (inc. breakfast) inclusive of taxes. If you're asked to pay rack rate which is pretty much what I was asked to do for the extra night there are far better hotels to stay at in singapore, where the facilities are better and the staff is warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service in a Dismal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacintoshFans
Reviews.Content: i was there recently on a holiday and the moment you set your eyes on the hotel exterior, you know your about to enter a very old building compared to the buildings around the area. I was proven right when i got to the room. Half the items in the room was NOT working *minibar, tv, shower, etc. And to think that this was one of the recommended hotel of my travel agent. The location was near to the shopping areas but the area the hotel is in is terribly noisy and if you get a room facing the bay, god bless. * they actually have the cheek to charge more for a bay facing room. However, there was one huge redeeming factor for this hotel and that would be its staff. This could actually be the only reason i could think of that the hotel would be in the recommended list. They seem to have a team of fanastic staff, all of them seem geniunely helpful and they did provide us with alot of assistance. Special thanks to Sulman*Concierge/for providing us with all the useful directions, Eve*Breakfast Staff/for being so cheerful, Guna*Frontdesk/for helping us move to a much quieter room & Ming*Frontdesk/for all the little tips that he gave us that even the concierge didnt know. I sincerely hope the management would do something about the state of the rooms and the equiment in the rooms as they really do not justify the price that we pay for them room.

Reviews.Title: “My Opinion”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms certainly need an upgradation of furnishings and the TV s just faar too small and old . It really looks out of the place. Internt is chargeable.. again in times like this when wif fi is complementary in all the new hotels.Tand Bathrooms again need an overhaul. Breakfast had very limited choices and very basic standard... nothing very new.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, terrific view of the Marina Bay Sands from window. Concierge very helpful. Breakfast was very good with good variety. No complaints, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location on clarke quay and very effecient staff.”
Reviews.Author: janetbanfield
Reviews.Content: stayed on 21st floor and had great ariel views.Breakfasts were really good -hot and plentiful with lots of choice.An international style hotel but expensive for an independent traveller not on expense accounts or corporate hospitality.Would stay there again if visiting Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Clark Quay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel, well managed. Excellent location being so close to Clark Quay. About the Minus Points - some stinginess for Towels, Shampoos and small nitty gritties. Reception Staff need to improve a bit! SMILE a bit more than have stuck sour faces... Rooms with a View had too much thumping noise from Discos below although we were on 20th Floor!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but else average”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located in a good location, just above plenty of restaurant and bars. However since I was driving, the car park is extreme hassle as I have to park at the shopping complex with no special designated parking for hotel guest. No free parking made it worst as the hotel does not have own parking facilities. Air con was only moderately cool, have to keep blanket off otherwise it would be hot. Sink got stuck throughout the stay too. Bathroom is deisgned badly as the floor gets really wet when you take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very porr quality in bothe room preparation and resturant service and practices”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs lessons in quality control for its housekeeping, maintenance and resturant services

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The views were great. Marina Bay Sands view was the best and the last visit I had was the pool view. The staffs at the reception were good and very helpful. Thanks for a wonderful stay. My kids loved it. I choose this hotel as it was very near to Clarke Quay where we had a birthday function.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location but dont expect a place”
Reviews.Author: BigVerntherealone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a number of times and the good and the bad is always the same. Value for money is good and location overall is very good for Clarke Quay. Rooms are somewhat utilitarian and not very welcoming- always looked like they have been stripped of what was originally designed to be there. Check-in is usually fast but I only ever arrive there at midnight and always get given a smoking room which then has to be changed to a non-smoking room. This time this enabled me to get a room on the club floor which was pretty much the same as the ordinary roooms but was not allowed to use the club floor facilities. Breakfast was OK but nothing special. Similarly with service overall. On check in I was asked for email address and made it clear that i did not want to receive promotional material- i have already had an email asking me to join frequent stayers club etc Overall an OK hotel but not memorable and does not do enough to guarantee i would stay there again but would not have a big issue if someone booked me there anyway

Reviews.Title: “Great !”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very focussed on customer services and all staff always friendly and trying to help. If you are a customer of the Premier floor, you will really enjoy the special attention given to customers in the loundge. Location of the hotel is great a the neighbourhood offers a large choice of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and outstanding service in premier lounge”
Reviews.Author: bmwZ4_10
Reviews.Content: come often. have stayed other hotels but will stay here from now on

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Journeyboomers
Reviews.Content: Check in was rushed due to crowded check in area. Porters were hopeless leaving people to eventually retrieve their own luggage which was left downstairs and unattended. Restaurant food is expensive and not of any great quality. The breakfast is very ordinary and if one asks for more bread or other food to be replenished it 'must be approved by the manager' and invariable people are left standing around awaiting 'approval from the manager to be granted! This hotel needs to get its basic services back on track to justify the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and clueless as to how to handle”
Reviews.Author: dablair99
Reviews.Content: Hotel was overbooked and had numerous people complaining at check-in. The staff appear to be trained to tell the guests anything you could to steer them into a room that the didn't want - in my case a single bed when I had confirmed a king. After 3 different "stories" about why no king was available, somehow a room magically appeared.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Telaga
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Novotel Clarke Quay for four nights during Sep 2010. Overall our experience was wonderful. First the location - the hotel has very good location in the centre of Singapore right next to Singapore River. You can walk along the river at leisure or a take a boat trip. Liang Court shopping mall is next door and it has a Meidi Ya Super Market and a Kinokuniya bookstore. Clarke Quay metro station is about ten minutes walk. G-Max Reverse Bungee is also there for the enthusiasts. Fort Canning Park is across the road if you want a quite corner. China town is also about fifteen minutes walk. The room was excellent. We stayed in an Executive room which was quite spacious and had very functional amenities. The staff was extremely cooperative and courteous. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore River View”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for a relaxing walk along the river . Bars and foods are among the best specially the chilly crabs. Need to request a higher floor room to avoid the noises from merrymakers. Do not expect to have early check in or out due to high rate of occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: thewinchester Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property at a special, publicly available rate for Premier Floor rooms which included a number of bonuses available to guests on this rate. While we didn't access those bonuses, everything else was pretty much top notch. From on-property dining being virtually flawless, rooms near sparkling (bathrooms were showing age and were overdue for deep cleaning), and Premier Lounge staff at the top of their game. There are only two minor flaws with this property - the first being that two separate lift journeys are needed to reach your room, and that the acoustic design of main buffet dining option (The Square restaurant) didn't lend itself to the sheer volume of people on property - making a peaceful breakfast in that location impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and central but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: cwodavids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for our honeymoon en-route to Australia for 3 days. The hotel was nice, very clean and comfortable. The location is perfect for all the hustle and bustle of Clarke Quay. The staff were very helpful and the free WiFi in reception was a life saver for finding where things are in the city. The only complaint we both had was the cost of the alcohol which was around £7 for a bottle of Tiger beer which is made 20 miles down the road!!! After speaking to a few locals they assured us that this was because we were there on Grand Prix weekend the prices for everything was inflated. Singapore itself is a fantastic country in so many ways. The whole place is immaculate with no litter, grafitti or crime. There is plenty to do if you are there for a stopover but i think after 4 or 5 days you would struggle to stay busy. I can definitely recommend Sentosa Island which is a purpose built island that has several attractions which are worth visiting. It is very easy to get to, as indeed the whole country is due to a brilliant underground system which is cheap, very punctual and clean. One piece of advice, get the underground from the Airport rather than a taxi as it will cost you half the amount. Clarke Quay underground is 3 mins walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore - Novotel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Fletscher
Reviews.Content: very good location, near to area full of restaurants and shopping mall nearby. The executive rooms have even iPod docking station which I found a nice feature. The view from the premier lounge is great! Service is fantastic, as I had the flight back very late I could still come back to the hotel having a shower - I appreciated very much.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, excellent location and service. Relatively small room. One of the disadvantages is the permanently operating air condition in the room which starts working when you are out, so when you come back it might be too cold. The breakfast is nice, but if you stay for several days the choice becomes boring - the same stuff for all the days of your stay. The staff at the reception is professional, but in frames of the basic things, if you ask a question which is a bit wider then "where is the breakfast", they are lost and don't know how to assist you. It may happen because they are too young and not experienced enough. Opposite, the concierge people are more experienced and have a wider range of possibilities to help. During all our stay in the hotel the fridge was not operation and we asked to help - there was no response. At the same time some plummer arrived to repair some pipes (or other staff, that we have not complained on) and forgot his instruments in the room. It was not annoying, but amusing. But generally, the hotel is very nice, well located, good quality and Singapore is a very very good place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Novotel Clarke Quay is a good hotel in a great location. Walking distance to Orchard Road, without the Orchard Road price tag. Yet, in the heart of Clarke Quay, which is good for many reasons. Service in this hotel is brilliant with very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nov 2010”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was great. Location was great Air Conditioning in the hall and lift areas was poor. I have no Invoice /receipt for stay.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Novotel Clarke Quay is well located on the river. We used tourist passes to get around. Cheap and effective air conditioned travel. We ate at food halls mostly, except for special occasions. These are great places to meet the locals and sample the different cuisine . Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, quality hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nicko_jess
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Novetel Clarke Quay on the 9th until the 12th of November and were very impressed by the overall value offered at this hotel, you are getting a hotel in the absolute best location possible in my opinion. Clarke Quay is so vibrant and fun, the hotel is literally in the heart of the hot spot of town. The pool is very nice, excellent day beds for a quick snooze and tan in the sun. And the buffett breakfast is amazing. The breakfast staff were really friendly. The concierge were great, helped us out with our bags and directions throughout our stay. I really have only good things to say about this hotel, it impressed us!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel for the price and location. Staff were also helpful. Downsides: the special deal which involved discounts to Universal studios, etc was not properly specified that we need to go to an office at a separate location to get these offers. We figured that paying for the to-fro taxi ride was not worth the 5% discount offered. Also, the staff did not confirm the updating of my A-Club points. They don't seem to take the A-Club affiliation seriously. Other than that, its a pretty good hotel per se.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Petemcc
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 2 nights there with my partner in a 'superior room'. I first stayed at the Novotel 3 years ago and quite enjoyed the experience, and was quite bemused to read the many negative comments here, so I was apprehensive about booking a room, but now I am glad I did. Check in was flawless and took a few minutes. The staff couldn't be more courteous. Check out was again flawless, smiling staff, no problem. The room was clean, nice bathroom with separate bath (with shower) and shower, and toiletries provided. The TV was small yes, but that was a minor point. The bed was very, very comfortable, and despite the fact we didn't leave until about 1400 on the first morning, when we returned the room was completely made up, everything replaced. The rooms aren't huge, but it's Singapore and that is just the way it is, but my girlfriend who is Thai and has very high standards said she liked it a lot. We stayed at the Park Hotel just across last time, but it was booked out/too expensive, and in hindsight, the rooms are nowhere as good as the Novotel. Great location, eat in Liang Court on the ground floor, buy what you need in the 7/11, it's just too good. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjcvictoria
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Novotel in October and were very happy with most things. After reading reviews on TripAdvisor I booked a room facing the river and not Clarke Quay because a lot of people complained about the noise from Clarke Quay. We were on the Premier Floor (24th floor) and the view was OK but would have been so much nicer on the Clarke Quay side - don't think the noise would have worried us on the 24th floor. The service on the Premier Floor was well worth the extra - we loved the drinks and snacks in the lounge from 6 - 8 pm but ate breakfast in the main restaurant because the lounge was a bit small. Should have free internet in rooms on Premier levels - available in the lounge area but would have been more convenient in room. Had trouble trying to get the air conditioning to a non-freezing temperature and had to turn it off most of the time because it was just too cold. The position of the hotel was very convenient to everything. Don't be put off by the not-so-attractive exterior - the interior is beautiful. Also, wish we had thought about getting the balcony door unlocked. All staff were very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Problem staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall service is good.Only adverse experience is with your breakfast omelette chef.He did not look happy to serve me.My both day experirnce with him is the same .On the second day after finishing doing my omelette he put it aside even though I was waiting right in front of him and proceeded to serve other guest.After he had served the other guest I had to demand from him for my omelette.Only then he reluctantly gave me the cold omelette without a word.You definitely have a problem staff there.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with hotel and enjoyed stay - no further comments required”
Reviews.Author: ReggiesSay Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi guys - as per my title above I had no problems with the Hotel and its services. It was an absolutely fantastic location - close to everything and everywhere we wanted to go. If I did have ANYTHING to add - it would be about the Premier Room facilities. We were overseas in one of the Asian countries about 2 years ago and whilst I cannot remember the hotel, I do remember that they also had a premier lounge for guests. The thing that was brilliant about it and you do not have this - is that they served Alcohol from 12.00pm onwards till they closed. When you are on holidays this is fantastic. So whilst this is not a priority for guests there on business, it is great for persons such as ourselves who are on holidays etc. Just a suggestion for you guys. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: .If you are looking for a good hotel close to the famous eating area Clark Quay then this is the place to stay. This hotel is high quality and right in the heart of the best eating area in Singapore - make sure you wander out of the hotel and via to the right and wall straight into the famous Clark Quay eating area - has about 50 restaurants in a fantastic setting with cannels and water fountains. The hotel room was good but I was in a premier room on the higher floors - my colleges lower down felt their rooms were only OK. The service from staff was very good - better than most hotels I stay at

Reviews.Title: “We had the most pleasant 5 day stay at Novotel Clarke Quay!”
Reviews.Author: possmina
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent..it is situated in the Clarke Quay area with lots of restaurants & bars. The Novotel is situated on top of Liang Court Mall with Starbucks & 7/11 at the ground floor. The MRT station is only a few minutes away and it is also within walking distance to a lot of shopping areas like Chinatown, Funan Digital Mall, Raffles City & Marina Square via City Mall Link. Across Marina Square is the famous Suntec City. The staff in The Square are all very friendly and accommodating. Summing it up, I can say we indeed had a blast at the Novotel..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: LynSunshineCoast
Reviews.Content: Like others I was concerned about staying at the Novotel after reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor. Finally decided to stay there & we are glad we did. We booked a Premier Floor room (about $50 extra) but found it excellent value - it included buffet breakfast & drinks/canapes for 2 hours every night - worth much more than the extra we paid. I requested a river view room which was honoured even though I was paying less than other business travellers paying rack rate. Our view was among the best you could find in Singapore - straight down the river to the Singapore flyer & the new hotel (Marina Bay Sands). We had no problems at all with check in (maybe because I had sent an email a week before asking them to confirm the reservation). At check in I requested the mini bar be emptied & the balcony door unlocked & both were done within the hour. We didn't try any other restaurants but the breakfast buffet had a good choice & omelettes & waffles made to order. A minor complaint would be the pastries were cold & not as fresh as they could be. Our room was immaculately clean & serviced promptly. The 7 Eleven downstairs is very handy & their cold beer is cheaper than the hot beer in the supermarket in the basement. If I had to find any negatives it would be the location of the pool (on the 7th floor but accessed via the 6th floor along & round corridors & then up a flight of stairs) or the lack of tourist info available at the hotel - getting info from the concierge is like pulling teeth. They're happy to help but you have to know what you want to ask. All in all a great hotel - we're hoping to return to Singapore in 2011 & will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Location and Cleanliness Good food and free Internet

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this is the ideal location for a stay in Singapore. The hotel is only meters from the lively restaurant area of Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but few amenities”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I think the location is good as there are lots of nice restaurants around there and children can play riverside. Besides, at night I heard some sound, a kind of music , from outside...it annoyed me a little bit. As for the room service, I think there were few amenities. There were only soap and shampoo...

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: idontlikechina
Reviews.Content: When you have a reservation for the evening and you indicate that you won't arrive until 2am or so the next morning, you would think they'd have those late arrival reservations set aside and ready to get you in and to your room when you arrive...wrong. I arrived at 2:30a just as I indicated in my reservation and then ended up waiting for about 30 minutes while they checked on what rooms were or were not available. They then needed to go verify if the room was OK for me to go into. Not sure what the heck that was all about, especially since it was only me at reception, but they did say they gave me an upgrade room, even though it had two single beds (reserved a king) but it had a nice view of the city, I'll give them that. The quality of the breakfast was poor. Food was cold, in some cases sparse, then even though I had breakfast included in my rate, I still got double charge one day because they insisted I needed to fill out a bill, which I did, but I knew that would bite me at checkout. So stay tuned. I hit McDonalds and 7-11 after the first two days and bypassed the restaurant, even with supposedly included breakfasts, it wasn't even good enough to be free, except maybe the pineapple juice, that was pretty good! The room was clean for the most part, but the AC unit rattled quite a bit in the middle of the night, but turning it off then on seemed to fix it. The pillows sucked. They were hard or way too spongy, beds actually were OK. But even on an upper floor, I oculd hear the club music from Clarke Quay nightclubs most of the night, which sort of sucked too. Then at check out, I spent nearly another half hour arguing over the breakfast bill. they said I signed for the bill and should pay. I said that the breakfast area insisted I sign because for whatever reason my room number was not on the list. I think we were only talking about 17 Singapore bucks, but they had to dig out all the receipts to try to find the double charge and actually didn't find the receitp while I was there, so they finally removed the charge. Also be aware, if checking out early, the club kids come to the hotel to pick up taxis and this seemed to delay getting a taxi a bit in the morning Plus, it looked like a bunch of couples were heading up to try to get a room for the morning (6:30a by the way) so maybe that's why my room wasn't ready or a king bed wasnt' ready when I checked in at 2:30a as they were handing then out to the nightclub kids wanting a bed to share... Will I return, I probably would only because this is one of the recommended hotels for my company. But, the shopping mall and food court serving a lot of different cheap foods was a great feature for a guy traveling and eating solo, as is the McDonalds, Starbucks, and 7-11 right there too.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING !!”
Reviews.Author: HIGHLANDER16PERTH
Reviews.Content: My family, with children (7 & 6) stayed at this hotel after being recommended by friends and close family; I too read the feedback on this hotel before we stayed, and yes I was very concerned by some of the negative comments from other travellers. Well, as it turns out 'never judge a book by what other people say about it until you have read it!' Our Singapore stay was at the end of our three week overseas adventure, coming straight off a cruise ship we headed straight to the hotel where we were met in a very efficient and cordial manner; our bags were loaded up and off we went up to the reception area on the 7th floor. Upon our arrival, we were very well looked after by the Supervisor in charge of reception counter who by the way we were received, was aware of our impending arrival and requests that we had made through our travel agent; we were booked in and had our room cards in less than 10 minutes. On arriving at our room, we were met with a well appointed room with everything that we had requested, even down to two portable beds for our children instead of what you would usually get (portable bed and a fold out sofa) - suffice to say, our children were wrapped! We had a view over Fort Canning which was great to wake up to. The bathroom was very clean and well maintained and the daily cleaning of the room was without fault. The pool area was also well maintained and easy to get to without having to go through the lobby. The free internet usage on the 7th floor was a great bonus, huge screens with a super quick ISP; the 20 minute limit is a great idea, especially keeping young teenagers from spending hours looking up face book!! The breakfast (included in our stay) was well appointed, with heaps to eat, especially the HUGE waffles - there was plenty of food with coffee / tea being constantly offered - you would have to be extra picky to fault the breakfast meals served here. Underneath the hotels there are a variety of small shops and a eating hall, money changer etc; there are also plenty of other eating venues around; dare i say, unless you like spending $70+ eating meals along Clarke Quay proper, you will find equally fantastic at a far lesser cost normally at the bottom of the various shopping centres around the immediate area. When it came to our check out, it was quick and painless - less than 5 minutes! Overall, my wife and I were very happy with the hotel, and will be recommending our friends and family to stay there; we intend travelling back to Singapore in mid 2011 and we have already decided to stay again at the Novotel Clarke Quay. Tip for any traveller staying at any hotel in SE Asia, it cost you nothing to be friendly to staff, yes be firm, but stay friendly - as the saying goes first impressions do make a lasting impression; if you go in aggravated and get short with staff, then expect the same to come back at you, after all it is a two-way street. My wife and I have travelled overseas many times and NEVER had a problem. Good manners cost nothing.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: SALA_Samui_Resort
Reviews.Content: Before booked Novotel Clark Quay, I had read so many reviews, just to make sure I selected the right place for my family. It took me a week to decide whether to go for Novotel or Marina Mandarin but I ended up stay at Novotel Clark Quay because of the price offered and the prompt communication from Novotel. I found some reviews mentioned about changing the elevator in order to go to reception but seriously there's no problem for us at all considering that there are 4 elevators and very very fast. The hotel offers the free internet services at 7th floor where the lobby and restaurant located. We got a nice Executive Room which the room size is spacious. The bed is very comfortable, we added the extra bed for the kid but still have plenty of room for her to run around. The amenities the hotel provide are excellent. Water pressure with both hot & cold worked properly. The breakfast selection are more than enough. The pool area is lovely and good size. All staff are very professional and always smile.
