Novotel is one of the best hotels in Singapore, located in the heart of Clark Quay, very very convenient for everything and it is worth to pay for especially they provide the breakfast for the children for free when you hardly find that in Singapore as well as the free internet services. The concierge is very helpful, always ask if you need help. The Premier Lounge Manager, Lucia is very helpful and professional when dealing with. I will definitely stay at Novotel again when return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SAINT58 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideally located,great place to stay with in house ammenities - dining good and reasonably priced I would go back

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: lylouloustph
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at this hotel and found it clean and comfortable. It has a comprehensive breakfast, although no muesli. The staff were helpful and spoke English. We paid an extra hundred dollars to be able to check out at 7pm so that we could have a rest and a shower before heading to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the room”
Reviews.Author: the_retirees_Perth
Reviews.Content: The holiday was for a special occasion. We had checked out the rooms on a previous visit. How disappointed when we found we had a decent sized room, however the queen size bed was set against the bathroom wall requiring the person sleeping on that side of the bed to climb over the other to get out of bed. Ok if you are in your 20's or 30's but not so good when we were in our late 50's / early 60's. It took 2 hours for our luggage to arrive at our room. We have complained in writing, and by email, but in 2 months have had not response. Previous stays in Novotel Hotels, mainly in Australia, have been great.

Reviews.Title: “Best tourist location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing location. Adjacent to the Clark Quay area, lots of restaurants, night time activity along the river. Really fun area to be in. It's about a 5 minute walk to the MRT subway which makes it very convenient. The hotel is somewhat dated, but the public areas are kept up nicely. If some caulking in the bathroom bothers you, you'll probably see some. The furnishings are not brand new, but everything was clean. There is a 7-11 convenience store at the entrance, a 24 hour McDonald's around the corner, in addition to maybe a hundred restaurants nearby. There is also the large Central shopping mall across the river. The room service food was really good. The staff were all very friendly. Sometimes it did take a long time for them to pick up the phone, so I just called the Operator, and they connected me faster. They have maybe 5 free internet terminals in the lobby (standup), or you can pay for it in your room, it worked very fast. If you're a tourist, I think you can't get a better location... seems close to just about everything. It's a good value for a convenient hotel, though it does show some signs of age in the rooms. If that bothers you, you might pay twice the price to be on Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Reception and Help”
Reviews.Author: sam154964
Reviews.Content: We are writing in response to the excelent help we received from the eployee at the reception desk " Ella Guo". She was so helpful and We could definately say she goes the extra mile. no matter the question or enquiry was all about. we are enjoying our stay in this hotel and we hope to come back again in the future. Dr. Samuel Fam.

Reviews.Title: “Girls in business club,thank you so much.”
Reviews.Author: silkworm00
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel are superb,i am enjoying the sunset from room view while having my coffee on the balcony (i missed that moment )....but room are old and not so comfortable,but if you are not use to stay long in the room so it is fine because singapore a lot of places should visit which is you need the whole day to spent.There is one place in this hotel would make you comfortable is the business club....the moment you step in, you would find the multi-racial smile and welcome from the staff which make you feel most welcome one,its really 5star rate (not for hotel rating, it is airline rating) Their service just like u flying first class airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tolliss
Reviews.Content: This is a decent 4* hotel. The rooms are clean and beds comfortable. The service, check in and facilities are good and the pool a pleasant surprise. There is free internet access at the apple pc’s in reception. Our JBL i-pod dock did not work, but the staff repaired the TV very quickly when asked. We did not eat at the hotel. It is in a very good location by the quayside and the views from our room were great. We were overcharged extra tax at check-out, which we only noticed because others in our party paid less. This was corrected quickly, but if we had been unaware, it would have been very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: kfpswr Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with friendly and helpful staff. I stayed for three days and it was great. Facilities, location and especially service. They could not help enough, especially Evelyn at reception who was extremely courteous. I travel a lot and believe that this is one of the good ones.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: DipikaMumbai
Reviews.Content: Firstly, Novotel is so well located at the tip of Clarke Quay, which is one of the hottest places for restaurants and partying. Clarke Quay also offers boat cruises on the river which give an amazing view of the city. The rooms are very spacious contrary to what a lot of other hotels have to offer. During the same holiday, we had the opportunity to stay at another hotel where the rooms sizes were ridiculously small. Also the day concierge - Ashok helped us to plan our tour erally well. He had amazing tips on what to do during the holiday and also helped us with seats on some amazing tours. The hotel looks awesome and the service was amazing. I would recommend this hotel very strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable hotel with brilliant staff.”
Reviews.Author: CHM1943 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in. The staff are very attentive and helpful, the breakfast buffet range is huge and the place is spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TAshkar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Clarkes Quay for 4 days on route to Thailand. Because of the early morning arrival of our flight from Heathrow we got to the hotel just after 9am. Reception said they would try and get our room ready ASAP and asked us to come back after 11am. We did not expect to get in the room until after 2pm so were grateful that they were going to try and get us in earlier. Managed to get into room after 12. Room was nice, nothing to special, but as we were in a city did not expect to spend to much time in the room. One thing the Novotel do not supply is wash cloths and as I did not bring any I had the inconvenience of having to buy one. Staff were very polite and always greeted you when you passed them. Hotel is right on Clakes Quay and very lively, loads of bars and restaurants. We really liked the Cuban bar as they had a live band every night and we like that Latin sound. We did the normal tourist things, Raffles, China town etc, but I really enjoyed the river boat tour as you get to see a lot of the city from the comfort of the boat. Only downside to Singapore is that it does have fantastic malls, shops, etc but no cheaper than home, so no real bargins to be had. Did like the market etc at China town though. One last thing about the Novotel, we were there for our 25th Wedding anniversay, but nothing special from the hotel, not like the hotel we stayed as next in Thailand, chocolate and fruit, so something like this from Novotel would of been nice. But on the whole we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at this Hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Von1950
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with Staff, the service and cleanliness of our rooms and hallways, had different rooms each stay, definately not a 4 star Hotel. Was on a pre & after cruise stay. Took 1 hr for our bags to get to our rooms after having to ring up to chase them. Whenever we needed a taxi we had to go & ask somone to call a taxi as there was no doorman who voluntarily organised this. Both times the bathrooms had mould in the shower & sink as well as visible around the air conditioning units . Both bathrooms there was only a couple of tissues which ran out & there were not little extras - like cotton buds etc. The door to the wardrobe in one room was broken inabling access to the safe which we reported immediately after waiting for over an hour for someone to come but as a tour and ringing a second time and told staff we had a tour to go on and that we needed to lock things away we had to leave having to take everything with us. The safe in the other room back kept falling off dis enabling the safe to be locked. Reception staff were not helpful and didnt seem to care who they served first despite being the midday check out time only had 2 staff on and they randomly picked who they serverd not first come first serve basis . Internet access was NOT secure & the positioning of the computers made it possible for anyone waiting in reception / lift area to see . I dont know if there was a "A club" accomodation option - with private floors, lounge, internet as we were not offered to upgrade. We are returning to Singapore early next year ( 4 of us this time) for a longer stay but will not be returning to the Novotel. This is very disappointing as we have stayed at Novotels in other cities and had a great experience. I will also bepassing on this feedback / information to our travel agent and anyone else who asks my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel - Bad Customer Service - Bad rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Karina_Gav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 1st of October till the 10th October (3 people). First, checking in was a total nightmare. I was served by a lady called Lisa at the front desk, no hello and not even a smile from her. The room booked was a premier suite room. While checking she advised us that there will be a $900 dollar bond! I thought that was just ridiculous. I only had $250 singapore dollars on me. She told me that I cant give you your room key until you have paid the bond. I was furious when she said that to me. I said that there was no way I am paying that much of a bond! After a few phone calls to her supervisor in a different language (little did she know that I can understand and speak Malay). I told her in Malay that the hotel has been paid by the travel agent here back in Perth so what is your problem?. Secondly, after been allocated a room (2323) - the room stunk so badly that my partner threw up. The was such a bad sewer smell coming from the air-con system. This just made me even more mad. I went back downstairs I spoke to the Duty Manager at the time Genie, she was very helpful and gladly changed our room to room (2114), this time the room was much better but for the amount that I have paid for this room it was so NOT WORTH IT! Dirty lamp shades, mould in the bathroom, dirt and dust under the TV, old TV in the room and mould around the air-con. Also, having to take two lifts to get to your room is ridiculous. We also had access to the premier floor lounge - free drinks from 6-8pm which was ok it just didn't have much of an atmosphere to the lounge - staff were nice there. Thirdly, after coming back from Clarke Quay during the night Lisa is normally on her shift - I have noticed that she has very bad attitude - she will look at you, whisper and laugh about you to her colleagues. On the 2nd last day of our trip - I spoke to Manager Mr Tan, I explained to him the situation from the start till end and advised me fill in a Survey Feedback form. We normally stay at Park Hotel Clarke Quay - which is so so so much better, because this time there 3 people travelling and Novotel could accommodate 3 people in a room. I advise all you people that are intending to stay here - please choose a different hotel (so many good ones around). I was wiling to give this hotel a chance after reading all the feedback on here and now I know for myself not to step foot here again. The only good thing is it's just footstep away from Clarke Quay. VERY DISAPPOINTED!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: face00
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a nice place to visit clean and peaceful. They have well preserved ecosystem. The hotel is centrally located on top of liang Court. Hotel itself is clean and staff very helpful. Our room was ready contrary to most of the reviews maybe because we checked in the morning not too busy. Or maybe to avoid hassle confirm booking before leaving your place. We rquested for twin bed in non smoking room when we went the room is not available on lower level so they upgraded us to the penthouse 25 floor. One of the staff ASHOK very helpful,you can take short trip bus 32 to Orchard Rd, dont spend too much time there if you are not buying brand name items,bus132 goes to queen st and burgis where cheap shopping is, quuen st is where you can take bus to JB yellow bus causeway only 2.40 to malaysia.Sentosa garden and universal just take taxi 9 dollars.IF you have plans to see Singapore zoo be there early latest 3 pm so can catch both attraction zoo and night safari.night life is just accross the hotel and a central mall is also good. grocery and 7-11 too expensive. overall stay in this hotel is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Novotel”
Reviews.Author: suej61
Reviews.Content: Although we have stayed at other Novotels (Bangkok) we will not be staying at this one again. In summary the bags were an hr geting to the room after a long flight. While the rooms were clean there was a lot of mould in the bathrooms and air conditioning vents. The reception staff gave average customer service and their internet access was not private - being located between the lifts and reception in the hallway. We were not offer to upgrade to a club room although now I read they were available. Do the staff only go out of their way for Club members? I have sent an email to management regarding my concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Not THAT bad....just not very good...”
Reviews.Author: Avolette
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Novotel Clarke Quay during the Grand Prix 2010 in a Superior room. The hotel reception is on the 7th - we stayed on the 8th floor. Positives: - Hotel is in a great location, a minute's walk away from trendy Clarke Quay where you will be spoiled for choices for restaurants and bars. - Staff are professional and helpful, the concierge made an effort to walk about 50m out to the street to hail a taxi for us. - Free internet usage (20 min) on the Mac computers at the front desk on the 7th floor. - Good buffet lunch at the hotel restaurant - No issues with check-in as reported by other TripAdvisor reviews. Negatives: - Hotel is very dated. The interior is "very brown" which adds to the old, dated and slightly unclean feeling. Slight musty smell. - Hotel has a balcony but the door to the balcony was key-locked with no access. - Bathroom didn't feel clean (brown patterned tiles attributed to this). Shower leaked all over the bathroom floor (very minor flooding!!) - At approximately 4:00AM, a LOUD hissing noise woke us abruptly (sounds like white noise from a TV/radio with poor reception) and the noise continued for about 30 minutes. Upon investigation, we suspect that this is actually the noise from the old water pipes. Somebody from another room or floor was probably having a shower. OVERALL - It wasn't too bad of a hotel, but for AUD$230 (or upwards of AUD$350 for the Grand Prix season), probably best to stay elsewhere in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, close to the river and historic Civic Centre in a comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Elinor55
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned about the check in having read previous reviews. We got to the hotel at 10am and were told we would have to wait for an hour and a half. We wandered back into the hotel after an hour, the staff rushed up to us to tell us the room was all ready for us. We had a superior room on the 19th floor and it was very roomy with a King bed. Anything we requested was dealt with quickly and efficently. The breakfast was very good and plenty of choice available. The busy Clarke Quay was right outside the door and it was an easy walk to the quieter Boat Quay and the up river restaurants. We also loved having Fort Canning behind us a restful place after the busy river and city area. The 4pm check out was very welcome as we had a night flight. Wireless internet Macs were available near reception and we could have bought internet connection in our room if we had wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some severe noise issues though”
Reviews.Author: Kroppers
Reviews.Content: Overall we were satisfied with our stay at this hotel. Breakfast was well stocked with fresh food but was very busy! The biggest problem we experienced however was one particular night we were woken at 1am with yelling and screaming in the corridor from a group of people. We asked the other guests to move back into their room. Another 20 minutes later the same noise continued - we called reception and they apparently dealt with the problem. The noise from the other room three doors down still continued after 3 calls to reception to sort something out. Around two hours after our initial complaints about the noise we managed to get to sleep. Overall we were extremely disappointed with the level of service that we received after losing all that sleep, and that we were staying in an executive room - and in the end dealing with the noise problem ourselves! The only compensation was offered the next day when we were offered to move to an un-renovated room on the otherside of the hotel. If this is the type of service afforded to guests when they are inconvenienced then we certainly wont be returning to this hotel any time soon. One final point - having to change lifts when going to your room from the road level gets quite tedious after a few days.

Reviews.Title: “We just fell in love with Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: sjh2181
Reviews.Content: hotel was perfect location to Clarke Quay with cafe's, restaurant's, and bar's right out the front doors. the hotel had very friendly staff that were very helpful. we only ate breakfast at the hotel but was fresh with a great variety.

Reviews.Title: “Better than your usual Novotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sermann
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a room on one of the executive floors and the experience was very nice. Much better than your usual Novotel. The executive floors included free breakfast and drinks in the afternoon, but I did not really use them. The hotel was previously part of a large Japanese chain: elegant rooms, well designed and comfortable. Sound insulation was not very good – the outside noise was quite noticeable. The location, close to Clarke Quay is great for the nightlife. MRT station is close and taxis are easy to get. I was disappointed by the size of my room: it was one of the 4 small corner rooms of the floor. Given that I had paid almost rack-rate and that I am a very frequent guest in the Accor chain, I would have expected a normal-sized room... I feel I overpaid somewhat... Staff was friendly, but not very experienced. Not a bad hotel, but had better experience at the M Hotel and in the Swissotel The Stampford for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not available, wrong bedding, poor.... no, abysmal service”
Reviews.Author: Burgo8888
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice during August - first time whilst Youth Olympic Games were on, and prices were escalated by 50%, and breakfast was excluded.. 2nd time after the YOG when prices were back to normal and breakfast was included. We arrive very late at night with two tired children after a 10hour flight. Check In went quite smoothly until I asked about the bedding configuration of the Room. We had booked, confirmed and paid for 2A and 2C with King Bed and expected a sofa bed for the Kids.. No.... the room I was offered had two Single Beds only... Duh!!! I was told by the front desk and the Duty Manager that there were no rooms available, and only after arguing and waiting for more than an hour, were we given what we had booked, confirmed and paid for... it was given under the "guise" of a complimentary upgrade... The Duty Manager promised that our second visit would be trouble free... and it was, but it was also under the "guise" of being a complementary upgrade to make up for the inconvenience of the first visit.... This time breakfast was included, so we decided to take advantage..... The service was to say the least... Abysmal.... We were shown to a table that had incomplete settings ... had to complete the setting ourselves from nearby tables, as no-one was available to help. The pre-prepared food was not being replenished fast enough for a reasonable variety to be available at any time. The butter ran out, and was replaced, when asked, after a long delay by 5.... yes 5 only pieces for the entire restaurant.. The poor (one) person on the cooking station had a backlog of orders which was taking more than 20 minutes to deliver... we gave up waiting after 20 minutes... don't know how long it might have taken. I was asked to give my feedback online, and did so. To their credit I received a reply from the Hotel GM's secretary offering a 'next category upgrade' if I visit again during the next 12 months.... Ahh!.. Thanks... I had an upgrade for both of my visits, both of them simply upgraded me to the level of accommodation to which I had booked, confirmed and paid for... Why would I want to repeat the experience? AND why not go out to a wonderful Hawker Centre for breakfast instead of disturbing the peace of the breakfast waiters and waitresses who are unable to make eye contact for fear of actually being asked to do something... I don't think so...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service. OK rooms but get a high floor.”
Reviews.Author: MartinSurrey
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in September for business. The standard of the hotel is good for a four star and the rooms were fine if not huge. Nice pool and gym and the restaurant was decent but nothing particularly exciting. My only word of caution is try and get a room on a high floor. I was on the 09th floor (the lobby is on 7th) and had trouble sleeping over the weekend as there was a lot of noise from the bars and clubs in Clarke Quay. Great if you are out having a good time but not if you need to get up for work the next day.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome place - Try their 'Chilli Crab' and Durian Pengat (Simply Sensational!!)”
Reviews.Author: DavidK1010
Reviews.Content: My recent business trip to Singapore was an absolute success !! The exemplary service and great food at The Square @ Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay was a great experience. Teresa, a young talented foreign (Vietnamese) student and part time trainee waitress impressed us with her highly commendable customer service never seen before in my dining experience in Asia – Teresa is an absolute asset for any service company The buffet and food served here was sensational and their signature dish “Chillie Crab” was a favourite and the best I ever had in South East Asia. Their durian pengat was an excellent dessert too and I highly recommend anyone to give it a go. My client and I enjoyed them heaps. Their location on Level 7 was a plus point; a perfect spot for business dealings, quiet, peaceful and cosy, away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore's busy lifestyle & overlooking Singapore skyscrapers – it seem like a perfect place to dine with a love one too. Hats off to the management and staff for the wonderful experience and the positive results they help me achieved. Chef Michael and Andy along with Jason Yang (Asst Restaurant Manager) were equally great. Chef Michael and Andy came over to our desk to enquire about their signature dish and other meals while Jason was elegant and professional in his approach introducing himself as the Restaurant manager . My client and I had a wonderful experience in this Hotel - a positive customer oriented culture is definitely prevailing here Overall, I found it to be great value for money; it’s a pleasure doing business there. A 4-star hotel with a 5-star service; absolute contentment Cheers David Kalai (Melbourne, Australia) kalaia@tpg.com.au

Reviews.Title: “After reading some reviews, I thought I'd checked into a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: NW28
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel in a club room. We arrived well before check in time and were whisked off to the executive lounge for check in and apologies that our room wasn't ready (even though we were very, very early). We had breakfast and a really good strong coffee and relaxed until our room was ready. It was on a nice high floor with a balcony and wonderful views. We freshened up and there were a few things we wanted done in the room (balcony door opened, batteries in tv remote fixed, that sort of thing) so we asked at the exec lounge on our way out and it was all done when we returned. The staff in the Exec Lounge were happy to help with anything at all, including directions, reservations and making enquiries on our behalf. There is also a balcony in the exec lounge - the balconies are not big enough to sit on but it was nice to stand out there and have a drink and watch the city. It was a tiny bit noisy from Clarke Quay on the Friday & Saturday nights but not enough to keep me awake. We had breakfast at both the club lounge and the restaurant downstairs and both were fine. The pool area was well used but we were always able to arrange a sunbed & umbrella for ourselves (although it is interesting how the pool seems to be shared with the Somerset apartments). For anyone considering staying here in a club room, the hotel seems quite unfussed by dress in the club lounge and most patrons didn't seem to dress up (we saw people straight from the gym having breakfast, and thongs (flip flops) and t-shirts seemed acceptable in the evenings). The location is really handy to walk to Chinatown or the MRT or any of the Clarke Quay establishments, and the 7-11 and shopping centre in the building is useful also, although the multiple lifts to try and exit onto the street can be annoying if you're in a hurry! Would I stay again? In a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: yargnits
Reviews.Content: The room was okay but this place is a great place to stay because its price is good for the great location. The night-life is plentyful, expecially on the weekends. The Clarke Quay is mostly restaurants that caters to non-Singaporean tastes. For shopping hop on the MRT to Orchard Road. Take a quick taxi ride to River Vally Rd for clubbing. The MRT can also take you to more traditional spots in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Davee10
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We arrived at 0900 an were escorted to the premier lounge for check-in. This was a geat personal service and we were offered a complimentary breakfast. Very nice touch. We knew our room would not be available until later due to our early arrival. We were offered other upgraded rooms that were available imediately but we decided to wait for our booked room as we especially asked for a balcony room as we are smokers. The staff were very friendly and helpful and will be staying at this hotel on our next and every stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojo_cgn
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in the Novotel direct located at Clarke Quay. Clean, friendly and modern interior - nothing to complain about :) Very warm welcome at the reception desk. Complimentary internet connection in the lobby. Unfortunately I couldn't make it for breakfast - so no recommendation on that side possible yet. Will be back in November :)

Reviews.Title: “More Check-in Problems”
Reviews.Author: Chris_in_Makati
Reviews.Content: I just want to confirm that the recent reviews of this hotel are right on the mark. The hotel definitely has problems managing its room inventory. I arrived at 2pm and was told that the room with a king size bed which I had already booked and paid for was not available. They offered me a larger room if I was willing to accept a room with two single beds instead. I accepted that only to be told that the room would not be available for another 30 minutes. I walked around the shopping mall next door and came back 45 minutes later but still had to wait several minutes longer before they finally had the room ready. I'm an Advantage Plus customer and I don't think that is a very good way to treat regular guests. They could at least have offered me a complimentary breakfast as compensation for the inconvenience. Anyway, the problems didn't end when I finally got into a room. There was only one channel available on the TV. The remote control didn't work, and I manually tuned the TV through all channels but nothing else was available. Make sure you're a fan of Cartoon Network if you choose to stay here. The worst experience of all was during the night when it became clear the thermostat on the air-conditioning was not working. Even on the warmest setting, the air-conditioner was still on full blast and the room got absolutely freezing. The only option was to turn it off completely, which made it too warm. I didn't get a very good night's sleep that night. On the positive side, I have to say that the room did have a magnificent view over Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great servise”
Reviews.Author: happyBundaberg
Reviews.Content: when we first arrived to novotel, we were upgrated, and what a view over the river, close to MRT and everything, the staff were wonderful and helpful.we had a wonderful stay at novotel, we were supose to cheke out at 12pm, but they let us stay to 6pm, which was great. We are going back soon to singapore, where we will be staying at Novotel clarke quay.Keep up the good work,! and thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! Hotel is known for check-in problems - no room or no extra beds! BE CAREFUL”
Reviews.Author: beryl_be
Reviews.Content: Families - please take note and read all the negative reviews on this hotel. I read a few of the negative reviews but I disregarded what was written, thinking that other travelers simply had bad luck. I have since found out that it is not bad luck, room problems with this hotel is normal and an everyday occurance. Anyway, here is my story and if you compare it to the other reviews, it's exactly the same experience! Problems with getting: (a) the room you booked (& paid for) (b) getting INTO the room you booked (c) getting extra beds into the room for your children (even though you had already asked for extra beds when booking) Ware a family of 4 (2 adults & 2 young children) We had pre-booked and prepaid our 'Executive Room' because the website says it accommodates "up to 2 adults and 2 children' with one king size bed and 2 singles for the kids. We arrived at night, around 1.30am. The kids were overtired and exhausted as they could not sleep on the plane. We arrive at the front desk and got our room key. We arrive at the room, ready to crash out but notice that there are only 2 single beds in the room and nothing else! I call downstairs to tell them that I asked for the Executive Room (i.e. 1 King Bed & 2 singles) The idiot replied "Oh, you didn't tell us so we didn't know what you wanted, so we just set up the room with two single beds" I was furious as I had a print out of what I booked and it specifically said that we were a family of 4 etc. Anyway, the ditz then fumbled around and said that she would send up an extra two beds asap. [Mind you, the room was very small and they were going to fit another 2 single beds into the room? That means they were planning to put 4 single beds into one room. But, alas, I was tired, and any bed was better than nothing] So, we started unpacking our suitcases and I tried to get the children to sleep whilst we waited. However, after 20 minutes, still NO extra beds. I call down to the reception again and ask about the whereabouts of my bed. The ditz then says to me "oh, we decided to move you to another room which is already set up with the King sized bed". Then I freak out. We had just unpacked two suitcases full of clothes and now she wants to move us. She could have told me earlier! So, I go downstairs to speak to the imbiciles face to face. I am very angry by now. Then "Meng" at the front desk sees me approaching and he says in Chinese "oh, here comes a mad crazed woman" Little did Meng know that I know how to speak Chinese! I was FURIOUS. But lucky for him, I held my tongue for fear of being escorted out by security as I am not an unreasonable woman, all I wanted was a bed to sleep in! So, another girl gives me the key and we move to another room. We arrive and it has one King sized bed and one sofa bed. Oh my God, we are STILL short one bed. I freak out again and go downstairs again to speak with the Duty Manager now. I tell her the problem. She says she will get a bed to us asap. I return to the room and we wait another 5-10 minutes and the beds arrive, finally we can sleep. After all this, NO ONE even apologised or even followed up on our check in problems. It is the worst customer service we have ever experienced. Very very disappointing for a 4 star hotel. The worst part is that this is a constant problem in the hotel. Whilst we were there we met two other families who were also having problems. One Indonesian family had to wait one hour for their room to be ready (check in wass 12.00pm and they arrived at 3.00pm) They were offerred a smoking room which they declined as they booked a non-smoking room. The poor family had to wait all this time and on one even offered a complimentary drink or meal in the adjacent bar/cafe. Not even a sorry was muttered from the Novotel staff. Another family we met from Spain arrived late afternoon and found out that their room also did not have the requested extra rooms they booked. We all later found out that the hotel does not put in any extra beds until you CHECK IN. Therefore, you have been warned. If you are checking in during the day, then be aware. If you are checking in late at night, with kids, then please don't stay at the Novotel. There are plenty of other good hotels out there. May the force be with you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay There”
Reviews.Author: AstridBarr
Reviews.Content: As previous reviews have mentioned the check-in service is shocking. We arrived at 10:15pm did not get a room till 11:30pm, offered a non-alcoholic drink. Also a dinner but the restaurant was closed. We did get a dinner the following night - but we had to ask for it. The key cards did not work - back to reception. The luggage did not arrive - rang receptio but no answer so back to reception. The check-in is obviously an ongoing issue, when you arrive at a hotel after a flight you want to relax, especially at that time of night, when we were there, there were about 6-7 groups affected by having to wait, the next night another line of people. Booked a twin bed room - none available. King size bed - nope. My husband has a medical condition which makes sharing a bed extremely difficult, first night I slept on the floor!!!. 2nd and 3rd nights fortunately he was a bit better and we shared the bed. Would I stay again - no not even if paid to. Did I complain - a little but even I could see that the situation was out-of-control. But we loved Singapore - so do go there just don't stay at the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborMHT
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Novotel Singapore Clarke Quay the end of July 2010. My first comments will be strictly about the hotel which is in a fantastic location in the heart of dinning/entertainment options, boat trips on the river and near the Chinatown MRT. Within walking distance is both Chinatown, the business district and waterfront. Because of a hotel reservation mistake, our room was not available upon arrival at 2am, so we were upgraded to the Premium Floor with privileges in the hospitality suite. The room was clean, well appointed with good amenities, a flat screen TV, average size. The bathroom had slow drainage and you couldn’t open the balcony door; they are kept locked. Buffet breakfast was included and you couldn’t ask for more options both Asian, Malay and Western food. They even offer ice cream for freshly made waffles. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for it’s fantastic location and rooms. Booking the hotel and their reservation management is another story. I booked online via their website one room with a “special package” which included free internet and “valuable coupons”. I had to cancel the first booking which is very straight forward on their website and provides a confirmation number. I rebooked another room with single beds. PTD I emailed the reservation manager to make sure they noted our early morning arrival (we booked the night of July 29th, but actually arrived July 30th at 2am) and requested information on how to book the “special package” city tour and night safari. Because of our arrival time and limited time to see the city, we needed to have our activities organized to make the most of our time. I received an email back noting our arrival time and no further information, so I emailed the reservation manager again asking to have the requested information available at check-in, but never heard back. Upon arrival at 2am, there was no information as requested, the room we booked was not available and they had not cancelled the first booking I made, so we had two rooms and neither had single beds. It took them over an hour to straighten out the list of problems and put extra beds in the one king size bed room. In the morning we had to pack up and check out because that room was promised to another person! This is why we were upgraded, which I believe was reasonable compensation for our inconvenience. The next morning I provided copies of the canceled room confirmation and my emails to the reservation manager that had gone unanswered, so our reservation could be corrected by check out the next day. When we checked out the following day, they STILL attempted to charge us for the second room that I had canceled on the internet and provided them with a copy of the confirmation! So if you decide to stay at the Novotel, book with care as they seem to have an inept reservation manager! Otherwise, this hotel is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful ....”
Reviews.Author: Topender1
Reviews.Content: Sadly, when I booked this hotel on line, I did not have time to read others reviews, otherwise I would not have touched it. It seems there is a large problem with guest flow, that is, late check outs, and overbooking, leading to he inevitable block at the check in counter. Check in is supposedly at 2pm. We arrived after a very long 26 hours of traveling from Oxford, to Heathrow, to Singapore. It was 8 pm. After playing with the computer for 20 minutes and repeatedly telling me there was no problem, it seems there was a large problem. Yes we had a room, but sorry, they did not have king bed as booked ( and paid), and we could not move into our room until 1130 pm. !! We were given an offer of a complimentary soft drink and a free dinner whilst waiting. At this stage eating was the last thing we could face. We were offered an upgrade to a suite the next day , as we had booked for 2 nights. Whist waiting for our room to be ready, 4 other couples were in heated negotiations with management re delay to check in. We did move into our suite at 4 pm the day after, and it was lovely. However overnight, a shocking sewrage smell developed, and persisted. By this time we were too exhausted to complain and simply put up with it. I saw loads of dirty dishes sit for 2 days at the poolside bar. Never moved or cleaned. The bar was closed the whole time we were there. Never again. This hotel needs work, it is dated, and inefficient. Many of the staff seem to stand for hours doing nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Imir
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not up to the usual Novotel standards. The rooms need renovating but were still clean. Beds are very low. the position of the hotel is excellent. Clarke quay at your door with plenty of restaurants and some shopping. The metro is nearby (5min walk). Service at hotel was appalling. Like they didn't want to be there. Duty manager was excellent and met all our needs. Would not stay here again as the value for money was not good nor was the service.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CLEAN AND AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: esther1867
Reviews.Content: We got in from a 4am flight from Perth and we were told that our room wasn`t ready. we had to sleep in the lobby until 6am (there was the European Ash cloud going on then and they had given our room to someone else who couldn`t get back to Europe) We finally got into a room, but it wasn`t the one we booked (at least it was something) we slept until 8am, then went down to breakfast and the manager gave us a free buffet dinner and we got the room we booked. Our kids slept on fold outs(9 & 11 yrs) and we had the double. The view was lovely and was of Fort Park. The bathrooms are average size and they worked fine. The kids enjoyed the pool as it was up high We were very close to Orchid Road and walked everywhere. Clarke Quay at night is full of atmosphere and the kids enjoyed the lights and the boats. We had a shopping mall right next door with Subway, Starbucks, a food hall in the Plaza with Japanese. Good location and right price. We would recommend to families.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: maree1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year on my way back to the UK. I am here again this year on my way back to the UK but have had my visit extended due to a DVT developing in my leg.Family have gone home so I am here alone. I was here for 4 days before my leg began to cause me a problem.I was due to check out when I discovered hat I would be unable to fly.The hotel were fantastic,let me stay in my room evan though they were fully booked due to the Youth Olympic games.Unclear yet when I can fly but no pressure from the hotel. Rooms are great.I am on the 24th floor so I get to use the premier lounge with all its amenities thrown in. The pool is great too. Free internet and 2 huge applemacs in the premier lounge This hotel is in the centre of Singapore .I highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: spchase
Reviews.Content: We had travelled over from the UK to Singapore, were tired and we were hoping the hotel staff would quickly sort us a room so we could change and go out for the evening. Unfortunately, despite our booking saying to the contrary, they were insistent we had booked a twin room rather than a double room, and we were left to wait for 2 hours until we were eventually given a room for the night, an upgrade. I had to literally wait at the desk to force the issue as room service were taking ages to prepare a room. In the morning we were still very unsatisfied with the service of the reception staff, so we spoke to a manager who was very helpful, listened to our concerns and gave us the upgrade for the remainder of our stay. After this we were able to relax in the hotel, the breakfasts were good and the location is excellent. So if you stay at this hotel and have problems go straight to the manager as the reception staff all seem poorly trained and unable to cope in a busy environment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location, helpful staff, bad food”
Reviews.Author: calgaryguy91
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights...good location. Asked for an upgrade andin exchange for purchasing internet and breakfast up front (which I would have bought anyway) I was upgraded to a "premiere" floor room. Room was good. Shower got lukewarm at best. Breakfast buffet was mediocre and room service screwed up an order (and the food wasn't that good). Overall nice, clean, comfortabel hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Work.....!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Maynman
Reviews.Content: Booked a couple on nights here as a respite to break the return trip from England to Australia. Arrived early evening and the entertainment began. Guy in front of us was complaining that his booked king was in fact a couple of twins. After 20 minutes of playing on computer with our registration my wife asked "is there a problem?" The receptionist said "oh, no problem" and promptly disappeared into the back office. Five minutes later - PROBLEM. Room wasn't ready and wouldn't be until 1130PM. We settled in to the lounge for a 5 hour wait. During that time the main entertainment was two profanity laced encounters between Australian would-be guest couples and the very polite and completely non-responsive staff . They bullying didn't work and the Aussies disappeared into the sultry Singaporean night. Now appearing to be virtual saints in comparison my wife and I were elevated to the status of hero guests. We declined the offer of a free dinner (sensing more trouble in the completely empty large restaurant) but were supplied with complimentary soft drinks from the bar. We also enjoyed the free hi speed internet on nice large screen iMac PCs. The duty manager did come out and apologise - explaining flight delays and some sort of system problems were to blame. Anyway next day - as promised we were give an upgrade to a suite and a late check out. Unfortunately mid-evening the suite bathroom started to smell like sewage and the whole unit soon smelled. By that time we had given up and lived with it. Bottom line - a very unrestful experience and I would never consider staying there again. Although the staff were very lovely they simply cannot handle logistical problems. They probably overbook with Internet deals and consistently get themselves into trouble. Physically the place is definitely on the wane and is probably no longer a true 4 star. FORE WARNED IS FORE ARMED.......

Reviews.Title: “Good location, customer orientation could be better”
Reviews.Author: ts80
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at ~9am after a long-distance flight at the Novotel Clark Quay and the first thing that happened to us was that we were charged 100 SGD for "early check-in". This never happened to me in any other hotel all around the world - no matter when I arrived. A hotel management can decide to do so - however, this is definitely not the best way to canvass for customers. The hotel itself appeared us to be good - but not perfect. Our room was nice, but also partly worn. Battered or broken parts - even if not technically functional - should be replaced in a good hotel. Nonetheless, the Novotel is a good option to stay in Singapore - particularly because of its great location next to Clark Quay and the great views on the city from the rooms... Another plus is the free internet access in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous Experience - Never Again”
Reviews.Author: jztravels
Reviews.Content: We booked a room months back during the Accor 3 day sale and paid for it in full. It was clearly stated that the check in time was 2pm and when we arrive at 4pm, there was no rooms available. In fact, we were not the only ones who were experiencing this. There were many groups of people sitting at the lobby waiting for their rooms. The receptionist was poorly trained in customer service. We had booked a King size bed on a non-smoking floor. This was a simple request which I believe hotels should be able to provide because we are paying for their service. However, the receptionist looked at me as a matter of factly and asked me to choose kind bed smoking or non-smoking twin beds. There was no apology or sorts for not being able to meet our request. It was a totally frustrating experience. We spoke to the manager and she mentioned that she would freshened up the smoking room for us but it simply didn't cut it. The room, the sheets all reeked of smoke. We could even see burnt marks on the sheets and carpet. We decided not to stay there anymore but the receptionist simply told us that she could not give us a refund. It was most distressing. There was no offer of compensation for our terrible experience either even when we made it clear to the manager. My advise is to pay a little more and head to Merchant Court Hotel just 5 min down the river. This is just not worth it. Novotel is offering late check out to all guest whom they check in late - this just extends the problem to guests who will be arriving the next day!

Reviews.Title: “A classic travellers hotel, busy at strange times...”
Reviews.Author: Brooska
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, busy 24hrs, lots of travellers, including flight crew, banging doors etc Plus point can check in anytime, so very good for travellers arriving at odd hours. Good buffet with all you can eat local crab. Gets a bit of conference/business crowd for lunch buffet at $34. Drinks at $8 a beer (£5) so not the cheapest but definetly not the most expensive what with Singapore Slings at Raffles $30 a drink.... River trips from the quay are very close - as is Clarkes Quay night life and restaurants in abundance. Lively area but rooms are quiet. Elevated pool and bar for the jet lag..... No WiFi - only wired (very high speed) Internet in rooms. Macs in lounge for customer use. As we had iPhones (no option to cable) not able to use in room access....

Reviews.Title: “No rooms available when we arrived at 8pm and had booked & paid in January”
Reviews.Author: lins001
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a long flight. We then stood at the reception waiting for 15 minutes while the receptionist typed on a computer, eventually we were told the hotel only had 1 room (that was not ready) when we had booked and paid for 2. The receptionist stated that if we would wait she would try and find us another room. The receptionist told us that the hotel had overbooked the rooms and the hotel was full. Understandably we were not happy; we asked to speak to the manager but were told they were too busy to speak to us. We complained bitterly to the receptionist and were appalled by their lack of organisation and customer care; eventually we were offered a free meal in the hotel restaurant and were asked to come back in one hour to see if they could find us the 2 rooms that we required for our booking of 5 people. After a disappointing meal we returned to the reception where they had managed to find an executive room and a business class room. I would not recommend this hotel as this ordeal caused a lot of stress. We had been travelling for 20 hours and expected to book into our hotel and quickly get our rooms. I can only presume that the hotel has very poor managers who cannot organise their bookings effectively. There are many hotels in Singapore within a similar price bracket which you would receive much better service. I would never stay with this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Singapure”
Reviews.Author: Pozmartin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in July. We were offered an upgrade to a suite for a small premium which included access to the Premier Floor Lounge. Well worth it just for the views alone (and the free booze!) Everything about the hotel suited our needs - friendly staff, clean and modern. The only complaint would be the shower which was not very powerful and hard to set the correct temperature. The location for sight seeing was convinient with the MRT station at Clarke Quay only 5 minutes away and all the nightlife is right outside the front door!

Reviews.Title: “Room wasn't ready at 8pm??”
Reviews.Author: J_and_R_AKL
Reviews.Content: When you arrive off a flight and have prepaid a room and been really clear on what you need I don't expect to wait in the lobby with kids for 45 mins. Then to get to the room and it not have the kids bed and room service then screws up your order.... fail fail fail.. Should have stayed at holiday inn as we did 2 weeks prior for the same money. Room was tired and bedding not good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Bit middle ground - there have to be better options in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: FSHK
Reviews.Content: Had two nights in this hotel, on business, but there with my husband who was also on business at the same time. The hotel is conveniently located next to Clarke Quay which is good for touristy evening meals (I haven't found the restaurants there to be great quality, but that's not the hotel's fault!), but I could also walk down to Raffles Place for my business meetings (15 mins walk), and from Orchard Road (20 mins). My problem with this hotel is that it is just indefinably "blah". Our room had a big bathroom but no flannels were provided and the fittings looked dated/wonky. We had a TV in the sitting area and a TV in the sleeping area but the one in the bedroom had poor reception. Overall the appearance of the room is just dated. The reception is on the 7th floor and so the hotel has an odd sort of flow to it. I have rated it three because it is not terrible, but just boringly average and I am SURE there are better places to stay in Singapore (the problem is that room rates fluctuate a lot there and I think just now it's all pretty pricey). I'd recommend it to a tourist on a short stopover because of its location next to Clarke Quay, if they couldn't run to one of the swanky ones down town.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Onmytrarvels
Reviews.Content: Arrived 6am to witness a few drunks from the clubs in hotel reception arguing with the reception staff, security after a while arrived & threw them out . Advised our room not ready which was fair enough as 6am ,would be ready 11am . At times think reception was under staffed & people would be getting a bit annoyed. Brekie good, rooms ok, service ok . Location in clark quay great. Would stay again .

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rjagga
Reviews.Content: located at the clarke Quay area - the best night life in singapore, it is the best place for a weekend of night life in the town.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: avjm37
Reviews.Content: The check-in process was terrible. We arrived at 7.45pm after a 13hour flight with young children. The receptionist did not seem to have a clue about what he was doing. We were told that the room we booked - an executive king - was not available. We had to stay in a standard room. So 4 of us had to fit in 3 single beds - as you can imagine we did not sleep well! We were given the correct room the following day. However we were then told that the 2 extra single beds for the kids may not be available. Luckily after an hour or so, they did provide the beds. We also had to request extra towels. The linen was really old, with some sheets having holes in them. In the brochure it stated that facilities such as bottle warmers were available. However when I asked at reception, they looked very confused, and then said they did not provide such a facility. On a positive note, the staff in the restaurant were very attentive and helpful. The hotel is also in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever check-in experience!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaM42
Reviews.Content: We had just travelled 8 hours from Brisbane with a sick child and all we wanted was to get to our room once we had arrived around 4:30pm. Upon check-in we were told our room wasn't ready but would be in 20 mins. An hour later we approached reception again only to be told that it would be ready within half an hour. At 6.00pm we were told that the room still wasnt ready and we were by this stage all very tired and frustrated,especially when the check in time states 2.00pm. After finally getting to our room at around 10:00pm after making numerous enquiries to various reception staff ,we were once again disppointed to find one bed to sleep 4 people as well as having to explain to our tired and crying children that we would need to organise beds for them too. After 11:00pm we finally had two folding beds jammed in to our room. May I also add that once we were settled in our room we realised that our baggage had not arrived in our room.Finally around midnight everything was in order. The whole check-in procedure was absolutely disgusting. We travel quite frequently and have never experienced anything like this before. If we were told the truth at 4:30pm and not strung along for 6 hours it may have eased our frustrations. We found out the next day from a guest at the motel that an airline had cancelled a flight therefore instead of looking after incoming clients the motel decided to look after their existing clients by letting them check out late, hence leaving us sitting around with no where to go.May I add that we were not the only clients that were let down that night. We chatted to numerous disgruntled guests about their bad check-in experience as well. On the brighter side the location was great and so was the buffet breakfast. Its just a shame the way we, and many other guests were treated so poorly that night. We are business owners and if our management and staff treated our clients the way we were treated that night we would have no business. It will be interesting to see if we get the same generic response back to our review or maybe something a little more personal.

Reviews.Title: “100% satisfied”
Reviews.Author: rosemary26
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights to July 5th .Check in at 5-30pm efficient, courteous & fast. Room very clean. Location - fantastic. Clarke Quay view superb, and breakfast an excellent selection. Had a minor problem with fridge which was swapped over when we reported it. Staff were extremely helpful & friendly. On past trips to Singapore have stayed at Furama City Centre & Peninsula/Excelsior but now would never consider staying anywhere else other than the Novotel Clarke Quay. Most impressed - Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I can read on TripAdivsor”
Reviews.Author: JetSetBerlin
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Novotel Clark Quay at the Executive Floor. The rooms are a bit old but clean and sober. The executive lounge is great and the time I allowed myselft to rest in the lounge in the early evening and have a snack and adore the view was really worth it. Can only recommend the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Mareeebee
Reviews.Content: Check in was a nightmare. Went to check in at 2.15pm, room wasnt ready. Waited 2 hrs, then given wrong room (requested king bed and given 2 singles) moved to correct room and what a disgrace. Room was damp and had a terrible smell. It was obvious there were problems due to the rotting carpet and wood. We asked to be moved. Well after waiting for maintenance and housekeeping to check it out, they decided to move us, and of course no available rooms. They said they would have a room ready in 20 mins. Well 2 hrs later we got our room. What an awful experince. I treated us to a premier floor room and what a disppointment it has been. I would never come back and as a A/club member I expected a lot better service. All I can say is the hotel has very serious management issues and I mean serious!!!.

Reviews.Title: “nice location which makes the hotel attractive to stay”
Reviews.Author: SATSBangalore
Reviews.Content: the hotel is good but not great, the location is excellent and this is what makes me stay here again and again

Reviews.Title: “"Trading Off Solo Travellers for Corporates is Not Funny"”
Reviews.Author: pisang
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Singapore but our recent experience has left us worried about the management culture at this hotel. We booked online at a very high rate of AUD$268.00 per night and arrived from Europe at 9.20pm. Upon arrival the lobby was in chaos. The management had been asked by a major airline to accommodate 17 passemgers who had been delayed 24 hours by the aircraft breaking down. Even though the hotel was fully booked they took the offer of high paying corporate business. And that is OK I guess. But in doing so they knew they were about to displace 17 incoming guests. And they did nothing to address the impending disaster! As a result we, along with many others , sat until after midnight waiting for someone to help us. At 1am the staff decided that they would arrange an alternative hotel. And the good news was we wouldn't have to pay the taxi fare to get us there!! Yippee. The generosity!! We finally got to bed at 1.45am the next morning in an alternative hotel-in a smoking room that we had specifically not wanted. Sure, things can go wrong in the hotel business but the management at Novotel-Clarke Quay need to re-look at how they deal with guests when their own actions have caused 17 clients to be displaced. Not good for Novotel and not good for Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice....if with family/children”
Reviews.Author: ruchileekha
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for a couple of nights.....the location was excellent.....and was overall a good choice....especially if u have young children with u.

Reviews.Title: “Booked a room after a couple of nights at...”
Reviews.Author: Dio67
Reviews.Content: Booked a room after a couple of nights at the Goodward. Concierge was helpful and we were able to check in early. Receptionist refused to budge on the room price even after i said i could get it cheaper online. A quick walk to their free computers saved S$50 on the total. Great location for the Clarke Quay nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location.....”
Reviews.Author: faryyd
Reviews.Content: Novotel Clarke Quay is my favourite and ideal hotel to stay at Singapore.This is the second time iam staying here and believe me it gets better each time.The location is outstanding with the Singapore river in front of you and as you everbody is aware Clarke Quay is where all the best restaurants and pubs of Singapore are located.It is also a ten minute taxi ride to orchard street,suntech and many other places.The mall in the ground floor of the hotel also is very versatile with a huge super market and a massive electronic store and the regulars like starbucks,macdonalds etc. The views from the rooms are breathtaking and the breakfast is not to be missed.A walk outside the hotel in the evening is a sight with the many pubs and malls all lit up.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, good location, recommended for families, would like to stay again”
Reviews.Author: TeamWilliamsAus
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel had fast baggage service BUT check in upstairs took over 3 hours as our room was not ready until after 10pm. Staff friendly but not particularly apologetic for delay despite two very tired children after our flight. When asked staff agreed to provide a late check out in compensation, but this was requested not offered. The room was a very good size for a family of four, clean with a good sized bathroom. Pool area was great, a large and deep pool so lots of fun there. No Wifi, but free use of Macs in lobby. Buffet breakfast was lovely and kids ate for free per Novotel policy. Dinner was great, but don't tell your kids about the chocolate fountain until they've eaten their mains! Restaurant staff were fantastic, chatting with the kids and recommending dishes. Good location over a shopping centre which includes money changers, food court, supermarket, Starbucks, Subway and McDonalds. Overall, I'd happily recommend this hotel for families, and we'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CairnsGirl25
Reviews.Content: Just your normal average hotel room, but a great view across the Singapore skyline and right on the doorstep of Clarke Quay, so just outside there is the river and all the great bars and restaurants. Didn't think much of the wine selection in the hotels own restaurants so we ate out every night.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKangaroo
Reviews.Content: Checking in to the hotel was very pleasant and good surroundings. Unfortunately the room did not come up to this standard. It was however very spacious and well equipped but it just looked as if it needed a lot of work. There is a small balcony which you have to ask to have unlocked and sign a waver in case you jump off or something. The room smelt a little of smoke even though it was non smoking. We had a lovely outlook over Clarke Quay. The bed was a little on the hard side but not too bad. The bathroom was very big and had a separate shower which was good but it needed some work also. Clarke Quay is a good place to stay and the MRT is fairly close. It is very quite during the day but comes alive at night especially Wednesday night which is ladies night. There are about 5 Mac computers in the foyer which are free of charge with a 20 minute time limit which was vert handy Breakfast was quite good and as I am an Accor member got 2 for 1 which made it very affordable. The best thing about this hotel is the pool which was brilliant. Long enough to swim laps and very clean. It is shared with another hotel but it wasn't at all crowded when we were there Overall I would say that with a bit of work this hotel would be a great place to stay but at the moment it doesn't quite stack up but would stay there again once the upgrades are done

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel.... breakfast was a good start to our hectic schedule”
Reviews.Author: theSHAHS
Reviews.Content: Novotel Clarke Quay, ... we had and excellent Stay. We were in Singapore for a family holiday for 5 nights with our children 6 and 9yrs old. the Novotel is an excellent choice if you are travelling with kids. We booked an executive room, which i must say was very comfortable, two roll away beds and a double bed for us, and yet, we were not cramped. Large bathroom, with separate bath and shower, not the best bath products, a bit too minty for me.The airconditioner worked very well , beleive me you need it in Hot Singapore the hotel itself was a little run down and old fashioned but the room is what matters, clean linen and the room was cleaned well, everyday.!!free internet , depending on which room you book. the breakfast was great, children ate free...there was everything from chinese to continental , ofcourse the usual eggs to order bacon, ham , cheese platter ,fresh juice ,croissants ,etc, etc and very nice staff serving you. check in was quick they even gave me a room early at 9:30am even though check in was at 2pm. very nice of them. will definately stay here again. if you like to eat out and party this is the place for you.... its just 2 mins walk from the hustle and bustle or clarke quay...great location.. and you cant hear any shouting or loud music or anything. definately recommend.. its not fancy but very practical.

Reviews.Title: “Very average service for an executive package.”
Reviews.Author: geoffsr
Reviews.Content: The service from the concierge and porters was excellent on arrival. Unfortunately the experience went downhill from there. The executive room was tired with stained wallpaper and cracked tiles in the bathroom. We had selected an executive package so that we could use the executive lounge. This proved disappointing as, whilst the service from the staff was excellent, snacks were not available during the day. The advertised cocktails andHors d'Oeuvres from 6 pm to 8pm offered limited food and on both evenings white wine ran out by 6.45. Whilst we were offered other drinks we were advised that no more white wine was available to us or any other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for an all-nighter excursion to Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: IshDewyn
Reviews.Content: If you're intending an all-night out at Clarke Quay, then this is probably your most convenient choice to crash at as it is literally right next to Clarke Quay. We did that recently, just walked into the hotel and asked for a room on a Saturday night, and were offered a standard room with a double bed for SGD291, incl. tax but without breakfast. It was more than adequate for our purposes: it was clean and the bed was comfortable, and it was some place for us to sleep in relative comfort. Unfortunately, the room was rather small (puny closet) and we had to keep the bathroom door closed at it smelled rather distinctly of sewerage. However, I also stayed here once about 2 years ago, and remember being quite underwhelmed by the experience. Despite asking for a non-smoking room, the room smelt quite strongly of stale cigarette smoke. We were not able to change rooms as we were informed that there were no other rooms available. However, the front desk staff who served us was very professional and thorough, and the concierge staff were extremely courteous. All in all.. not excellent, but it was definitely more than adequate for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Average At Best.”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Novotel Clarke Quay early May 2010. We booked well in advance under a Accor Super Sale and we are also Accor Advantage Plus members. We booked an Executive Premier King room. The room was a good size, but dated with cheap furniture. For the price we paid we didn't find it good value at all. The carpet in our room seemed new at least, we didn't have stain covered carpet like some of the previous guests nor did we have a moldy bathroom. The club lounge was pretty good, we used it 2 of the 3 nights we stayed there for a couple of drinks before heading off to dinner. The staff in the club lounge were very nice and helpful. Breakfast was included in our rate and we found it to be ok with a good selection of food. Service was terrible though, one morning we had finished breakfast and were just standing up to leave when they finally asked if we wanted a tea or coffee. The next morning in a half empty restaurant they seated us right next to a family with 4 screaming kids. Overall the 3 breakfasts we had were a pretty ordinary experience. We tried the dinner buffet to make use of our 50% dinning credit on our Accor card, food was ok, service was fantastic the total opposite to what we experienced at Breakfast each day. We asked the day before we were leaving at the Club Lounge if we could checkout 2 hours later (2pm) as that would work better with our outward flight. They approved that with no worries and recoded our door key cards. Reception ring at 11am to advise of 12pm checkout, we advise a late checkout already approved. Housekeeping arrive at 11:30 to clean room, we advise we are checking out at 2pm. Housekeeping again arrive at 1:30pm to clean room. Clearly there is a lack of communication between hotel staff.. Hotel location is great, we'll give it that, but we still wouldn't go back. Service from this hotel is up there with the worst I had experienced, totally disorganized. Time for a new GM I think.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Run Down but great location and service excellent”
Reviews.Author: Great59
Reviews.Content: Such a great location with supermarket and shops down stairs. Concierge where excellent as was all the staff, including pool, reception, maintance and housekeeping. The kids loved the pool and it is a very relaxed atmosphere. Easy taxi rides to anywhere. If you accept that it is not a new hotel and will have little things that aren't perfect then you will really enjoy the hotel. We had a ball there, and it is such a great location in clarke quay. I was reluctent after reading the reviews, but was really pleased with the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pleasant stay close to lots of restaurants and bars”
Reviews.Author: Vinnyboy10
Reviews.Content: Novotel -Clarke Quay Location-The Novotel is situated in the hub of Clarke Quay. With great amenities within very close proximity, ranging from a wide selection of restaurants serving anything from burgers to Spanish food, along with smaller food stalls and hawker centres and smaller cheaper meals inside the food courts. There is also a small mall to the side of the hotel, where you can grab a starbucks, Subway, 7eleven or pop down to the ground floor hawker centre or little supermarket. The MRT is also less than a 10 minute walk across the bridge and as the name suggest its on the Quay which is a nice area in the evening for food and drinks. Room-We booked a superior room that had more than plenty of space and a large double bed, our room over looked part of the quay and at night, provided great views of the city. However one complaint even though small was our covers had two rips in, which throughout our three night stay was never changed. When this was highlighted to the front of house, they graciously offered to send out a maid to change the sheets for us, however I would have liked this to have been an automatic necessity when the maid clean our room daily. Facilities-We did not opt for the breakfast, as previously mentioned they are plentiful pit stops close to the hotel to grab a bite to eat, or the much needed wake up coffee from Starbucks is next door. They have a large pool situated on the 7th floor with towels provided, sun loungers and shaded areas if need be. On the 6th floor they have a small gym accessible 24hours with two running machines, a bikes, cross trainer, weights and free weights. With water machines provided. In the lobby they had free internet available on 4 computers however during our whole stay only 2 were functioning. Service-The service on the whole check in etc was excellent; staff were more than gracious and polite. Positives Great location Hotel amenities Mall close by Close to the MRT Food court 7 eleven Negatives Minor gripe was having to get into 2 separate lifts, the first lift will only takes you up to reception level, where you then have to walk through the lobby to get in another lift to access your room. Sheets

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Much and You Won't be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RRGT
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Novotel Clarke Quay on business on several occassions, primarily because of its location and the fact that among our corporate hotel list it is among the preferred hotels in Singapore. It also happens to be among the cheapest on our corporate list. My stays have usually been one or two nights long. The rooms I've usually stayed in are at best functional. Nothing lavish certainly. A working desk, small sofa and either king or twin beds are typical. The size of the rooms are a bit small and the low ceiling makes it even appear smaller. The TV is still a small CRT type model instead of the flat screen LCDs that are now becoming the norm. There is wired broadband internet available in the rooms and wifi service in the common areas. The bathrooms usually have a separate bath and shower stall and the ceiling is even lower at the latter for some reason. Despite the vibrant club scene below, I've never really had any problems with noise. I've only had breakfast once and it was nothing special. The choices were limited and the quality was nothing to call home about. There are breakfast options nearby the hotel that probably give better value. The hotel is centrally located and dining options abound. The Clarke Quay MRT station is a good 5 to 10 minute walk away though. Most of the negatives I've found are bordering on nitpicking. For instance, I find the need to use two separate elevators (one to get to the "lobby" on the 7th floor and another one to go from there to the room levels above) a minor hassle. I've also encountered several occassions when the reception was flooded with people either checking out or checking in but most times you'll be attended to quite promptly. While the Novotel is definitely not tops among Singapore hotels in terms of facilities and service, its room rates are certainly competitive. The good location is also a definite plus. One probably just needs to temper expectations when staying here however. If you are looking for luxury, lavish surroundings and top of the line facilities, then best look elsewhere. On the other hand, if you are looking for functional accomodations at a decent price (at least by Singapore price levels) then the Novotel may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back again”
Reviews.Author: merkon
Reviews.Content: Checked in with my husband and our 2 year old boy and that was our 2nd stay at the hotel. The check-in staff was helpful despite my husband bringing in the wrong Accor member card. We managed to check-in without a fuss. The next day, we decided to drive out but was told that the hotel only provide parking pass to the guests upon check-out. Another service staff came by to reiterate the point that even the long-term guests will only be given a parking pass on check out. We were totally bewildered by this comment and after that the staff had to add in a matter of fact tone that 'we will feedback your concern to the management'. There was another hooha for the breakfast when we asked for the price of the breakfast. The staff immediately answered that 'i am not authorised to give you discount' when all we asked was the price. Other smaller incidents e.g. like newspapers not delivered which I shall not go into. All in all, we have decided NOT to extend the Accor membership or stay at this hotel anymore. Extra caution to anyone intending to drive/park the car there.

Reviews.Title: “More like a city motel than a 4*...”
Reviews.Author: jysh55
Reviews.Content: We had an Executive king and the Club Lounge service was good with helpful and friendly staff. If we hadn't had access to the Club Lounge, it would have been a different story. The Reception is on the 7th Floor - you have to take one set of lifts to get there and then another set of lifts from there to your room. The room was comfortable but can't say the general decor of the place reflect the 4* status. Whilst the room was clean, the furnishing was pretty cheap and tacky. The location is great - right on the river with lots of restaurants, bars and shops nearby and easy access to the centre, and considering the hustle and bustle all around the area, our room was very quiet. Don't rely on the Concierge service - they don't know what they're talking about.

Reviews.Title: “good location but disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: smeghead1973
Reviews.Content: Booked well in advance and requested baby cot - was not ready when arrived and had to wait far too long to put tired kids to bed. Room was tired and worn with several lights and power points not working plus a faint aroma of sewage. To top it off Novotel charged us twice on credit card for room and for breakfast we did not have.

Reviews.Title: “great fun and memories”
Reviews.Author: paumil2025
