Reviews.Content: this is the one of the best hotel for rommance and stay.i spend some special time in this hotel.there are 3 Restaurant in this hotel.one of the Restaurant having pure indian food.this is situated at most happening place in singapore.one can enjoy night life around this hotel.behind this hotel one can find junk food aslo.room is soo good specialy bed and facility.

Reviews.Title: “OVER PRICED AND DATED....”
Reviews.Author: WanderingKiwis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because they had a "Recession Package" deal. We arrived late in the evening and found the reception flat out.... and the nightclub / dance music also flat out. Our room was dismal and dirty and worn.... even with the Recession Package deal it was not up to scratch. Fittings were old and surfaces well worn ... the place needs a serious re-fit. We tried the smorgasbord / buffet for breakfast (included in our special package) and it was nice enough but nothing special, I wouldn't recommend it if you have to pay. Also the service wasn't so great either, we had to keep hunting out the wait staff and then they would treat you as if it was an inconvenience. The location also is not that great. We went out at night and during the day and found the place soul-less and sterile, like a shopping mall but full of bars and restaurants. And they were pricey, ridiculously so. Across the river was another large hotel / shopping mall and the MRT (which is handy) but once again soul-less. You could be in any city in the world. But if that's what you like then this is perfect. Personally, I prefer the colourful areas of Singapore like Little India, Newton Hawkers Huts, Chinatown and so on, and I will be staying nearer to these next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- disappointing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelholic88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in an executive king with 2 rollaways for the kids. It took some time for check in to find our reservation- an issue that repeated itself when the other 2 families in our group checked in a day later. The show Fawlty Towers comes to mind. Overbooking is definitely an issue as reviewed below and I'd definitely back up the aircrew issue, there was always a large crew coming and going. When we eventually got our room is was pleasantly furnished and large with plenty of space for the 4 of us, however it was on a smoking floor and stunk. It also had a lousy view over some roof tops, it seemed dark and unpleasant. I complained about the smell and they offered to "refresh" our room and we would be able to move the following day. We decided to stay on in the room knowing we would be using it only for sleeping anyway. Having said this, the hotel was in a fabulous location right next door to a major restaurant and entertainment area. We were on the quiet side of the hotel so had no noise issues at all. The buffet breakfast was lovely and the pool was huge and a welcome relief at the end of a long hot day on our feet. Our main reason for choosing this hotel was the cost, we had pretty much blown the budget by staying at the Peninsula in HK as a treat so I knew it was going to be a huge come down, and we wanted a room that would take the 4 of us. However I won't stay here again, think next time I'd splash a little more cash and probably go for the Swissotel Merchant Court as it's in the same location but a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Clarke Quay location”
Reviews.Author: rubeelima
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here on a stopover in Singapore. We have always stayed in the Orchard area in the past but decided to try out Clarke Quay as we got a promotional rate for our room. We didn't spend as much time as we would like in the area but the bar/pub scene is literally around the corner. Our room was very nice - clean and well kept, and service was good once they found our reservation. Concierge was also very helpful with directions and recommendations. Only downside was that we couldn't get any hawker fare in the vicinity. The closest one was a good 10 minute walk away and choices were very limited. Overall a good stay for a stopover if you're intending to stay in the Clark Quay area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location very handy to night life and transport”
Reviews.Author: tmbobSlough
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in good location above a shoping mall and right on the night life area of Clarkes Quay. Good rooms and staff. Never ate in teh hotel however as so many place to eat so close by. Has very good swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Complete Package.....”
Reviews.Author: Ankitjain
Reviews.Content: A place to relax and have fun at the same time.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: bellavah2
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Singapore within a party of 18. We arrived at the hotel at 5.30am and we did not ask for early check in nor pay and the hotel kindly allowed us entry to our rooms without charge. Only concern was our room had 2 x single beds and considering it was my husband and I with a 2yr old and a 4yr old the bedding needless to say did not add up. So we went back to the reception (located floor 7) and they promptly moved us into a suitable room within 30 minutes. Excellentcustomer service. The rooms were spacious and clean, bathroom large with a good layout especially with young kids. The pool was excellent and the breakfast each morning was excellent. The wait staff eosecially Prabu was awesome each morning he would have tables awaiting our party and paid particular attention to our daughter always ensuring they had suitable cutlerly, a high chair and often got them a hot chocolate and food etc (he was a marvel). All the staff especially the wait staff and conceirge made you feel like part of the family and you were welcomed very warmly. Location was fantastic - only downside if you have prams walking over the brisge to get to MRT etc having to carry up the pram those steps. Restaurants everywhere along Clarke Quay and 7elven right next door and a shopping mall attached (needed nothing all within fingertips)...Money changer and starbucks also attached to hotel. We stayed on floor 11 never heard Clarke Quary bit we also requested facing park so not backing or looking onto the Quay so no noise issues...

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Location - very clean - Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: cluffne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right in the heart of Clark Quay, perfect for any type of Night life / Dining. Pool view room was quiet, clean and had great views. Hotel staff were very very friendly, and could not do enough for us. Concierge was particularly helpful, giving us bus details on how to get to our locations. Hotel is right above a shopping centre, with food court, supermarket, massage, electronics, fragrances and more. Only disadvantage, is concierge is on ground floor with a lift to the hotel check in is on level 7. You need to change lifts to get to the rooms. Walking distance to Central MRT station and a nice 5 to 20 min stroll along the river foreshore to major attractions / tourist interest points, i.e Singapore Flyer.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ShaneJones
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on its fantastic location which is undoubtedly in the heart of Singapore’s nightlife. This is where the positives end however. The hotel room was small, dirty and in a very bad state of repair. The carpet was stained, damp and taped up. The bathroom fixtures showed their age and looked dirty. It wasn’t a problem for us but bear in mind that at the weekend Clarke Quay is lively until dawn which you can hear in the hotel. Overall a very poor hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel like the bubonic plague”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disaster. The basic problems are incompetent management, and no ability to resolve even small problems. The general manager accused me of being a liar, and they proceeded to pad my bill, and brushed it off as just some minor accident, when it fact it was not. It took almost 30 minutes to check in. My key card didn't work, which mean a ten minute trek back to the front desk. I was in what they said was a nonsmoking room, that reeked worse than any place I've ever been in. I was too exhausted to go through another 30 minute nightmare at their front desk. The room was old and worn down: filthy mold, filthy grout, stains all over the bathroom, worn carpet, dirty tub, old crumbling wooden doors, etc. See my pictures, attached. And this was on the PREMIERE LEVEL. I can only imagine the condition of regular rooms. Truly an embarassment to Accor Hotels and NOVOTEL. Also, the size of the room was absurdly small. THe air conditioning temperature didn't work: you either had the room temperture for Siberia, or 100% Singapore humidity. They charge about $25 per day to use the wifi internet. THere are a few terminals in the lobby, which are always occupied and you have to stand to use them. Then I discovered the remote control didn't work. It took me a day and a half, six phone calls, and they still never delivered a remote that worked. I spoke to six different employees from the maid all the way to the General Manager, and no one could get a remote that worked. THe General Manager accused me of not knowing how to work it. I told him it worked, only if you hold the remote 1 inch away from the t.v., which I didn't consider a "remote". He said I was making a big deal out of "small problems". I asked him what the rate was for a room without a remote control that worked, and he accused me of trying to get a free hotel room out of him. That pretty much is calling me a thief. THis General Manager is an embarassment to Accor Hotels and Novotel. He is completely incompetent, and has no ability to resolve small problems. And he gave me some story that he is "an Ambassador for the guests". I guess that doesn't including figuring out how to get a remote control. And it gets worse. When I called the operator to speak to the General Manager, they connected me to his mobile phone, and didn't inform me that would initiate a charge on my bill. So at check out, I see a big charge made, when I complained to the General Manager and Duty Manager. So the Novotel Singapore CHARGES people to make complaints, which they ignore. ONe of the Duty Managers I spoke to lied to me and said the Resident Manager's phone was busy. THen that story changed no less than 3 more times to, "he's in Thailand", "I think his phone is broken", "he's in a meeting", etc. The good points: not exactly, but there is a Starbucks and 24 hours 7-11 downstairs, which is good so you don't have to pay outrageous prices in the hotel dining rooms. THe location isn't great, as it's about a 15 minute walk in Singapore heat to the nearest MTR subway station. And it's not a great line, it's the one where you have to connect at least once to just about anywhere a tourist would want to go, and you lose a lot of time. THe hotel is in a very crowded and congested area where there were constant traffic jams, well into the late evening. THe bottom line is this hotel is substandard, and is in need of a total refurbishment. And it's not cheap either, which makes it a very bad value for money. Combine that with incompetent management, and you have a recipe for a bad stay. I've written dozens of hotel reviews from all over the world, and nothing comes close to this place being such a poor value for money. Avoid like the bubonic plague.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and reasonable rates. Stay on Exec floor for top class service”
Reviews.Author: AliT123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location. Very good service and next to lots or bars and resturants in Clarke Quay. Very reasonable rates considering the location. I stayed on the Exec floor for 2 weeks and would recommend this place over other hotels in Singapore because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Book a room on the executive floors....”
Reviews.Author: Andy_1950
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novatel for 2 nights at the end of February. We decided to book a room on the Executive Floor as this was only slightly more expensive than a standard room but was larger, had stunning city views (23rd floor location) as well as a lounge which provided a check in/out facility, breakfast and complementary drinks for 2 hours in the early evening. On arrival the girl at the main reception desk kindly escorted us to the executive floor where we were efficiently checked in to our very comfortable room, which was also very quiet due to its height above the traffic. The breakfast served in the lounge provided both hot and cold choices and it was very pleasant to start the day in quiet environment with just a handful of other guests rather than in the main restaurant. The location of the hotel is right on Clarke Quay where you have a fantastic range of restaurants and a small shopping mall. The main shopping area of Orchard Road is a short taxi ride away (taxi rank outside the hotel and taxis are plentiful during the day). The attractive area around the Raffles Hotel is within walking distance (pick the shady side of the street!). We did not try the hotels restaurants as there was so much choice of every type of food within a few hundred metres. The Novotel is a large hotel but when you stay on the executive floor you have the illusion that you are staying in a much smaller tranquil hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - again”
Reviews.Author: jamesdwilson
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to the Novotel at Clarke Key, and once again the welcome was fantastic and the service was second to none. We stayed over the New Year (Dec 31st) as we've always wanted to see the fireworks over Marina Bay, and really enjoyed the stay. I needed my suit pressing for New Year's eve dinner, and it was done with no fuss and back for 3pm on the 31st December, after asking for the service the previous day. The hotel kindly did some printing for me with no charge, which was unexpected. The views from the hotel are fantastic over Clarke Key and Boat Key. The swimming pool is seven storeys up, and so also has good views. All in all, I can't fault the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great view - bad service”
Reviews.Author: travelocityknome
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of the Clarke Quay nightlife and was a fanastic location. The pool areas is clean and there are always fresh towels available. However the room was from the 1970's - toliet leaked, the airconditioner smelt like rotten egg, the balcony bars had rusted through and so I was surprised not to have fallen out of the window! Not to mention we waited patiently for 1.5 hours, only to have to go way back downstairs to get our bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Amani10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in February 2010 but after a bit of a hiccup at the beginning we were pleased with our stay. We reached the hotel at 6.30 in the evening but were told our room would not be ready for another hour. When we were eventually shown to our room we were initially pleased but then found that the lights did not work. We brought this to the attention of the management but the matter was not dealt with promptly. By this time we were getting a little irate as we only had 4 nights in Singapore and our first night was rapidly dwindling away. Eventually we were moved to another (better) room. We didn’t encounter any further problems after our inauspicious start. We found the room to be comfortable although lacking in storage space. The breakfasts were good with quite a variety of food. Best of all, the hotel has a fantastic location next to Clarke Quay so was close to all the bars, restaurants and other amenities. We did not experience any noise but then we were on the opposite side of the hotel from all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - maybe a noisy location”
Reviews.Author: GRIZZ54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights - Sunday to Tuesday - in the middle of February 2010. We had a room on the 9th floor overlooking Clarke Quay which gave us a good view but, unfortunately, also gave us quite a lot of late night/early morning noise from the discos by the river. As it was Chinese New Year, I'm unsure whether the noise level on an ordinary weekend would have been less or not. I'm sure it would have been less noisy if we'd had a room on the other side of the hotel overlooking the swimming pool. It was also a good 15 minute walk to Orchard Road which might not suit everyone. That said, the hotel itself was very nice - spacious room and lovely bathroom. The breakfast was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant and would enjoy another opportunity to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: tiffyweapon
Reviews.Content: A short notice booking and yet we were so well recieved one could believe that you were already 'well known' to the staff. Enjoyable and friendly but polite and discreet staff, informative and helpful, would enjoy an opportunity to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KarantheBull
Reviews.Content: The Novotel has an excellent location if you would love to party. Its right there at Clarke Quay & stumbling back from a long night out is really convenient. Whats more, it also has a money exchange located right below it & a 7 11 right next to it to take care of all your small, but important needs. The rooms are ok - nothing really speacial about either their size or the view that they offer. Outside that, for all the reasons mentioned above, its a great property to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: MarriedUk
Reviews.Content: Location When we came to the hotel, the first thing we thought was 'What a great location!'. Its around the corner from Clark Quay which is a great place to walk around in the evenings for bars, restaurants and general entertainment. Room The hotel room was lovely and spacious. In singapore, everything is soooo clean generally. The hotel was great. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was a good size. Food Breakfast was really nice. Lots to pick from and guy making fresh waffles and omlettes. We didnt eat in the hotel restaurant any other time as wasn't in Singapore long enough so most of our time was spent out and about. Food along Clarke Quay was nice but a bit exoensive for a sit down meal. Best thing to do is get a some light bites from variuos smaller vendors. We tried the shawarma from one, churros from another and went for a drink at the very expensive 'Clinic' bar. Wouldn't bother doing that again. Very gimmicky and expensive! Best to take photos of it and move along to a more resonable place! Customer Service Check in was quick, problem free. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our suitcases were taken to our rooms. We had no problems with the room so didnt need to use any other services. We took out the A-club card (well worth doing!) when we booked the room which was excellent as we had free wifi and a free hopper bus for the day which picked us up from hotel and took us on 3 different routes around Singapore where we could jump on and off wherever we wanted. A great way to see Singapore stress free! Other services There was a good size swimming pool which looked lovely (we could see it from out our window) but we didn't get a chance to use it. same with the gym. I highly recommend this hotel. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but needs an upgrade...”
Reviews.Author: iannsa
Reviews.Content: Clarke Quay is a fantastic part of Singapore - the nightlife is amazing - lots of restaurants to choose from. The Novotel is very well located, but the hotel needs an upgrade. The public areas of the hotel were really OK, but the room we had was quite old and small, and the bathroom was definitely not up to scratch for a 4star hotel. Great breakfasts though, and friendly staff. Not a bad place. . . .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: JulesW79
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, but for us it was just a bed to sleep in. We spent most of our time exploring Singapore and all we needed was a nice clean hotel in a good location. So we were very happy with our choice. We stayed for 3 nights in a standard room. The room itself was average in size, probably a little on the small side. As i mentioned, this didn't really bother us since we didn't spend much time in it. The best thing about the Novotel Clarke Quay is the location. MRT station just across the bridge, and if you don't feel like going far for a meal and entertainment then the Clarke Quay area is amazing. There are certainly a lot of restaurants to choose from, all are incredibly expensive when compared to eating in a China Town food court. However i guess you pay for the views over the river and ambiance of the area. We were just as happy eating in the small local food courts, but why not mix it up a bit when in Singapore? Love that city :-)

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of updating in rooms”
Reviews.Author: broomekgb
Reviews.Content: Bed was against the wall and as I was with my husband one of us had to clamber across to get in or out. As we are in our 60 s we found this a bit awkward. Location excellant but would choose a different hotel next time. I use Singapore for a stop over en route to Australia and have been 6 times now and this was the least comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Maintenance Issues but Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: davyp777
Reviews.Content: I can only base this review on a one night stay prior to a cruise departure, however, I have to state I was a little disappointed with the Novotel. The hotel has a strange layout as the reception is on the fifth floor, however, as we had a suite reserved on the executive floor, we had to check in at the executive lounge. What was surprising for Asia was that I had to lug my own baggage around, although I am quite physically capable of doing so. I was given the wrong room on arrival, however, that was rectified and I again had to move my own luggage - again, no big deal. The suite was roomy enough but the decor seemed a little dated, however, there were some little niggles. The wardrobe door was hanging out of its runner, the in room safe was not secured and just resting on a shelf in the bottom of the wardrobe, one of the televisions was not tuned in and batteries were missing from the TV remote - although not major issues, were however quite surprising for one of the supposed premier rooms in the hotel. I had lounge access that offered two hours of free alcoholic drinks (to which you helped yourself - unsurprisingly), however, I was a little disappointed with the limited choice of snacks available. Although breakfast was included, I did not bother eating the following morning therefore I cannot comment on the fayre on offer. The location of the hotel is ideal as it is (as the hotel name suggests) right on Clarke Quay and is within a short walk of the MTR system. Overall, the stay was pleasant enough and maybe I expected too much, however, I would probably stay at the Novotel again as the location is the hotels prime attribute and ideal for easy access to the attractions of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: eatingoutSydney
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel in Singapore. I travel on business once per month to Singapore and always prefer to stay at the Novotel. It is really easy access to pick up a taxi and travel to our offices, and the club lounge is really good to retire to after a long day and catch up on emails (with free Wifi)... and a glass of wine and canapes! The staff are really friendly and professional

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: megsyj
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Clarke Quay, this riverfront hotel, situated above a shopping plaza,has it all. We arrived first thing in the morning so booked an extra night, as we arrived the staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. The pool is huge and beautiful, and the room although a tad smaller than expected was perfect. Novotel is located a 4minute walk from the MRT station so you are literally a 4min walk and train ride away from everything in Singapore. Awesome! Also as the hotel is in the heart of Clarke Quay you can easily walk through the quay for drinks and dinner then walk back to your room REALLY CONVENIENT. As we left my partner and I were already planning our next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice In terms of Location, Esthetics and Value”
Reviews.Author: HappyBaliFamily
Reviews.Content: Making a reservation via the internet was a breeze. Very informative and hassle free. Really appreciated the fact that family with children was considered. I asked for a Non smoking, River view and an Executive Room. Check In - We arrived early and was well taken cared of by Annabelle. Initially, a trainee was assigned to help check us in. Then Annabelle immediately took over the process when things became complicated. I had stated at point of rsvp that I had a 15 year old and 10 year old traveling along but was still asked if I needed an extra bed. Managed to get us a non River view room and was told that it would be ready in an hour and a half. We left and returned 3 hours later and was taken care by the duty manager whom seemed unsure of what was going on. I was asked again for my credit card and was told my room was not ready. After a few minutes of back and forth, he checked and all was in order. I had to wait a further 15 minutes for this process. The room was spectacular with a view of fort canning park and marina sands, singapore flyer etc. Had to call for bag to be delivered and Porters delivered the wrong bag. 10 Minutes later bags were delivered and porter were very helpful. The Breakfast was truly first class and service was impeccable, sincere and efficient despite what seemed like 300 people at the restaurant. The only comment I had were the spoon for the rice were not soaked in water hence it was all sticky. The coffee machine clearly was not simple to use as everyone had to get help. F&B service was very friendly and was very insightful with transportation tips but front desk seemed biased except for a few staff. They only smiled at caucaseans and Asians had no eye contact. Annabelle was an exception, and she befits her title as Guests Loyalty Ambassador. We had a problem printing from the guests internet at the lobby and she came to our rescue. Overall a great hotel and we would recommend to everyone with family or otherwise. Will definitely be back. Benny Raj, Bali, Indonesia

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location just minutes walk from Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: pippy123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a few minutes walk from Clarke Quay (bars,restaurant and shops, and underground). About 10 minutes walk is Boat Quay. Would definately recommend the hop-on-off tour bus which you pick-up at Sun City. Pay the extra £5 to include a 2 day pass and river cruise. Drinks are expensive in Clarke Quay,however we found Hooters bar to be best value. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The internet is free for the first 20min in reception.If you want a real shopping experience go to Vivo City (floors of designer and high street shops all under one roof). From there you can by a monorail ticket to Sentosa Island (beach and activities) well worth a day out.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back”
Reviews.Author: Sati1981
Reviews.Content: +Restaurant, reception, life lobby area has been renovated, thus posh & modern -Rooms were shabby, terribly old in contrast, though spacious -Holds the tiniest television set for hotels rooms todate -Furnitures & fixtures were downy old & wear out +Location though is good, right next to clark quay for its buddly nightlife, variety of shopping centres & eateries. -However, if you are the early sleeper type, do request for a room that does not face clark quay, as the music from it's cluster of clubs can be a bit noisy

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Novotel”
Reviews.Author: improvingservice
Reviews.Content: Great location and value for money, at US$155 (after tax) or US$126 / S$185 before tax, for Christmas day stay. Great location. Service is normal, nothing specular or bad. Good points, once you walk out, it is starbucks, and a 24-hour 7-11 (convenient store) on your left. On your right is the river, clark quay (clubs and restaurants). Within a 2 minute walk from the entrance of the hotel, as Novotel is linked to a shopping center (Liang court), there is a 24 hour Macdonald's at level one (in case you want familiar and very affordable meals) US$4 for a meal at night or US$1.50 for a McChicken. Take the river cruise right on the right hand side of the hotel entrance, 30 seconds walk, for US$8.60 (without tour guide) to reach other parts of the river. Fun and cheap. Don't ever try the mexican restaurants across the river, it is really overpiced and tasted really bad. Instead go for Turkish Kebabs or snacks within Clark Quay. Chinatown is 5 minutes by rickshaw or MRT (train/subway). Try porridge or night food. Bad points: please note you have to pass by a few formal Chinese restaurants and Indian restaurants in order to get the shared swimming pool (shared with Sommerset Hotel). Swimming pool is big and nice. It was a rude shock for me, as I was dripping wet, messed up hair and walked through a wedding reception. Hotel doesn't allow guest to go through the 7th floor reception, so you have to get through 6th floor. If you are lucky, there's no events and you can quietly walk through. If not, better be prepared in case you are caught in some pictures. If you are a TV person, sorry, the TV is the old type of box TV with bad reception. Summary: Bad swimming pool access area, Excellent Location, Good Price, Free use of 5 stylish MAC internet terminal at 7th floor reception, Excellent facilities around the hotel (money changer, starbucks, 24 hr Mac and 7-11, taxi, train station at Clark Quay at Central Shopping mall), Bad TV, great view of the river.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: sipivu
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night. I have an A|Plus Gold card. I paid 181 SGD for a superior room with a king size bed - Price: the "special" rate I was given was obtainable for anybody on the Internet. - Room : my non- smoking room was smelling cigarette. I left the window open for a few hours . - Breakfast: was fine, and not included i the room price - Internet is charged. Speed is good - Service: fine - Location: I used to stay at the Shangri-la on Orchard Road. I wanted to change location. It is interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: mmsbkAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Pretty good really, especially as one reviewer said , if you have a room on the city side . The staff were very good about late checkout, very important if you have a midnight flight out as we did. Mind you, if you have several hours to kill in an airport, Changi Airport got our vote - huge, spotless, full of interesting shops etc. Be careful not to get one of the flash executive-type taxis outside that charge you double. Restaurant good, with big selection of foods of several nations. Would have been good to have more internet access, access to a printer maybe , though staff were very helpful. Beds, airconditioning , bathroms fine

Reviews.Title: “Skyscraper modern hotel in leisure district”
Reviews.Author: alanreynolds
Reviews.Content: This Novotel is in the restaurant area of the re-developed Ckarke Quay. It is one metro stop from Chinatown in one direction; and Orchard Road in the other. I stayed the night of Friday 4 December 2009. I got there and back from the airport by metro, changing at Outram Road. It took an hour but cost just right SGD 1-90 (less than EUR 1). The hotel has floors 6 and above of a brownish tower block on the waterside. If you come out the quay exit of the metro you see the blue Novotel sign on the upper floors. The inside is modern and tastefully furnished. Many regular Novotel equipments are there. Reception is on floor 7 as are the bar and restaurant. There are 4 Internet terminals; free of charge, set up to give you 20 minutes use. There were lots of users each time I went. I had room 2011. Modern style of furniture, large bed with duvet. Iron and ironing board. Bathroom had combined bath+shower which was easy to use. The lighting and air-conditioning was controlled by an electronic terminal by the bed. I thought the room was fine. I had breakfast. Buffet style with lots of fruits, juices and some Asian dishes. I enjoyed the cheese too. Price was built into the tariff. Outdoors on 5th floor was the pool, about 25 metres long. It was open from 06.00 so still dark when I got in. As my room overlooked the pool, I saw several other swimmers later. Though I had a midnight flight home, I could not extend my room beyond 14.00 and left my bag with ground floor porter. I paid SGD 227 (about EUR 110). I would certainly stay again. There are lots and lots of restaurants in the area. No need to dine in the hotel. I liked the Quayside Seafood Grill where I had sashimi, and scallops with broccoli.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Bel_17
Reviews.Content: It was great to be right in Clarke Quay. We loved going there at night. There is a Starbucks next door so we ate breakfast there. It's a short walk to the MRT station. We went on a sale price - around $125AUD/night including taxes and thought it was good value for the location. The staff at reception were very helpful. We didn't catch the taxi's from right outside the hotel - they were much cheaper a short walk around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Freolife
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel Clarke Quay for three nights in October 09 - our second stay at this hotel. Such a great location - right on Clarke Quay, so very close to restaurants and nightlife. Also just a short walk to the MTR which is a great way to get around in Singapore - cheap, clean and efficient! Hotel is clean, well-run, and the rooms have a great view over the river and Clarke Quay. Nice pool and poolside cafe. Good rates for Accor Advantage Plus Members make this hotel reasonable value. Would definitely recommend as a central location for a stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Chica-linda
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel on a layover between US and India. We stayed two nights and it was a great place to relax and get over some of the jetlag. We paid the extra for access to the Executive lounge - this covered our breakfast and snacks - really worth it as we were traveling with an infant. The area around is great - lots of cafes and places to eat. Nightlife too - but not for us on that visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Mxfive
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on the way to Bali. Arrived on Sunday 27th September with tickets to see F1 grand prix that evening. Arrived at 6am but had to wait till 1000 for a room to be free, understandable as such a busy time but not easy to deal with after a 13 hour flight!! Once we got a room it was lovely, large,very clean, well decorated and everything you would expect in a city centre hotel. The hotel was well located for transport links and we were very pleasantly surprised to find that it was only a short walk from the grand prix circuit. Breakfast was included in our package and was very good but would not have liked to have paid the £20 per breakfast plus tax, plus service for it. This being my only criticism that it was very pricey both in and around the hotel to eat out and you had to explore shopping malls and side streets for affordable food and drink. In all we had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Executive floor rooms a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Jeandg
Reviews.Content: Upgrade to executive floor rooms and have access to Premier Lounge that serves a nice breakfast buffet and varied, tasty appetizers and drinks in the evening. Some evenings we skipped dinner. Rooms have free high-speed internet access (can be spotty), but the Lounge provides constant service and a free computer. Nice views of Clarke Quay. Tons of restaurants within a 3 minute walk to Clarke Quay. Shopping mall adjacent, underground service about a 10 minute walk. We would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: freshia31
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty shaby for Novotel standard. I however like the location which is in the heart of Clarke Quay and within walking distance to Central. I love having dinner at one of the Japanese restaurants. Breakfast is good I stayed there during Moslem Ramdhan month and the room service was very helpful and nice

Reviews.Title: “great location right in the guts of were it all happens”
Reviews.Author: bushiepete
Reviews.Content: nice people at this hotel very helpfull and polite great shopping mall under this hotel with good supermarket and great small speciality stores subway starbucks electrical and so much more a real great mix also a great cafe/restaraunt called streets good girls runing this buisness all this coupled with the river and so many fine restaraunts on the river its a must stay place.hotel i guess would be a 4 star and if i return to singapore i would most likel y stay here again. cheers bushie pete echuca australia

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, Dishonest Establishment”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Koala
Reviews.Content: Be very wary of this hotel. The rooms that are sold on the Accor website are not then supplied by the hotel as advertised. They hotel will then ask you to pay for 'upgrades' in order for you to then receive what you have already booked and paid for. Management is in on this scam and openly supports the practice. I would have expected a better standard of honesty, integrity and transparency from an Accor branded property.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: KetutSeminyak
Reviews.Content: Staying frequently in Singapore for business its nice to have some friendliness and welcome as part of the deal. I found the club concierge warm and knowledgable and able to help out to accomodate during high occupancy dates. The staff are so helpful with babies & children with genuine warmth and assistance. The property is in a good location at Clarke Quay, so you can walk into the CBD without raising a big sweat, and feel like you have knocked off when you leave your long hour business tasks behind. Plenty of restaurants and nightlife nearby but not too nearby. Rooms of a good standard, but the place is often full.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hkhappytraveller
Reviews.Content: In April 2007, I've stayed at this hotel and left a comment note to them and their resident manager Mr Tony [-] wrote a letter of apology to me and offered us a free room upgrade on my next visit and asked me to contact him directly. We will travel to Singapore again and I sent an email to their reservation 2 weeks ago, addressing to Mr [-] for reserving rooms for us but up to date, there's no response from Mr [-], only replies from the reservation officer Ms [-] which the price S$218++ she quoted to me is more expensive than the rate offered on their website and after sending a few emails to the reservation, there's still no reply, I called her directly to clarify again. Ms [-] said she would check it out and call me back. Unfortunately, she only replied an email to me shortly, saying that S$218++ is the best rate offered. From the reply emails, I totally could not feel that they have any enthusiasm and inclination to offering. It seems it's only our inspiration of thinking that we are being welcomed to stay at Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Singapore, especially if you get to book it at a discount”
Reviews.Author: siwanderwoman
Reviews.Content: We were able to book this hotel at USD103/night through the Great Accor Sale about two months ago. It turned out to be a great choice. We booked 1 standard room and 1 superior room and were given 2 superior rooms. The beds were comfortable. The shower cubicle was a few buffs away from sparkling (we took a shower in the tub with shower head instead) but everything else was spotless. The hotel is right on Clarke Quay so the restaurants and bars are just an elevator ride away. The MRT is less than 10 minutes away on foot. The USD13 breakfast buffet was substantial with a choice of cheeses and salads, breads, juices, cereals, fruits and hot dishes including porridge, eggs, pancakes, etc. It would have been great if there's free wi-fi in the rooms but I managed to check my mails using the Mac terminals at the reception area. There's free wi-fi at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of the Quay's”
Reviews.Author: little-lily
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful 4 night break at the Novotel at the beginning of June. On arrival we upgraded to a suite on the Premier floor as a treat. The suite was very large (absolutely enormous bed) with typical mid range furnishings (fairly basic but clean and good condition), a large marble bathroom with single sink, large Jacuzzi bath with shower over and electronic toilet which looked like something out of a Star Trek film. The room had a separate lounge with sofa, desk and another TV which was also handy. Everything was clean and well maintained and the extra space was a bonus. The premier lounge was wonderful, they really take care of you and as Singapore is such an expensive city the ‘free’ drinks and food at breakfast and early evening add up to a great deal. The food and drinks and service are worth the upgrade, but what really makes it worth while is the peace and quiet! No screaming kids or hustle and bustle, you can start your day or evening perfectly chilled before heading into Orchard Road or Clarke Quay. The lounge staff make sure you leave feeling very spoilt and pampered. The hotel has free use of Apple Macs (20min use) in the lobby and for Premier Floor customers there are two more with printers and no time limit in the lounge. We tried the restaurant one evening and the food was ok. Unfortunately we had come from Bali which totally spoilt us in terms of quality and price so it was not favourable to compare. My husband enjoyed his Lamb Shank Rendang but sadly my Nasi Goreng just couldn’t compare to the ones from Bali. The Singapore Slings in the bar were mixed fresh, served with a smile and tasted good (S$26.36 for two). I had heard that Singapore service tended to be poor but we found all the staff at the Novotel to be friendly, helpful, professional and charming and could not fault them. The Novotel is in the heart of Clarke Quay and a short MRT ride to all the main attractions. We headed to City Hall MRT where we bought a 3 day tourist pass for S$34 (S$10 refundable on return of card). This gives you unlimited use of the MRT and buses for 3 days, it is also incredibly convenient as you don’t have to scrabble for change (buses only accept the right change) or fiddle around buying MRT tickets on every journey. Central MRT is right over the bridge from Novotel and the most convenient to get to. Singapore is very very expensive. Even in the great Singapore Sale it is far more expensive than the UK. A Radley bag I can buy in the UK for £150 was £180 in the sale in Singapore. If you want a bargain head to Bugis street where you can haggle, steer clear of Orchard Road (the unfavourable currency exchange didn’t help.) We enjoyed our stay at the Novotel and would book again if we return. For value in Singapore it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcome, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jan078
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all staff at Novotel Singapore. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Everyone was friendly and helpful from the moment we registered. Our rooms had river views, the location was exciting and we had a lovely meal and drinks outside close to the pool. A really great place to stay. jan, echuca , vic. australia

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: BJAAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife, 11 year old son and I stayed for three nights on the way through to Thailand. The room was good quality, big enough to cope with the extra roll away bed and clean. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was good with a variety of western and asian foods. The location of the hotel is fantastic, right on the river and easy walking distance to most of the city area. A little expensive but no more so than most hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: jaco95
Reviews.Content: Well, as our plane landed at 2:50am, and we didn't get to our hotel until about 4, we really didn't have time for any trouble. When we checked in, when we had originally asked for inter-connecting rooms, we soon found that our request had been ignored. Our rooms were still on the same floor, but they were about 5 rooms apart! Well, at about 4:30am, you really, really, really want to get to sleep, after a 5 hour flight on a budget airline, and dont want any trouble with turning out the lights..... The rooms were cleverly equipped with a control panel that controlled all of the lights in the room. Well, the room that my mum and sister shared, the lights could not be turned on, so, they had to wait for half an hour for maintanence (excuse my spelling). Also, the rooms smell of cigarettes! The pick-me up for the condition of room maintanence is the location of the hotel, conveniently located right in the heart of clarke quay. Also, a short walk from the local MRT. Overall, I think the Novotel Clarke Quay is a great spot to spend a few nights in, but i wouldn't recommend the hotel for long-term accommodation. Jacson, 14.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Budget Friendly”
Reviews.Author: millieWa
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to suit our requirements as a family of four. It was our second trip as a family to Singapore and this was a budget friendly choice. We booked the room on the Accor Asia Pacific Sale. We stayed in one room and had 2 rollaways. We paid extra on arrival for the 2nd rollaway as you could only book one child on the computer booking system. The condition of the room was good. The bathroom had a separate shower and bath which was good with the kids. The carpets in the hallways on our floor were stained and worn but the rest of the hotel looked very new! The entrance to the hotel is a little bizarre with the lobby just a concierge desk. You need to go up the lift to the 7th floor to get to reception. The restaurant was very busy at breakfast but the quality of the food was good. The pool is fine for a cool off and dip. The hotel is in a pretty convenient location - about a 5 min walk to the MRT. It is located on top of a shopping mall - Liang Court. There is a 7/11, Starbucks, McDonald's, Subway and a huge supermarket in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Melbourneites
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way home from Thailand for 3 nights. We were able to get 2 rooms on the Accor 24 hour sale which was great. The rooms are spacious, king twin room had 2 showers with a balcony, dvd player etc. and king room same with single shower. Rooms are very comfortable, bed was fantastic, sooo comfortable. Check out is 12 noon but we were able to late check out at 3pm on one room which was great for a late night flight home. We did not get breakfast at the hotel but the hotel is above a small shopping centre that has a supermarket and also bakery so we bought our breakfast there and ate in our room. Our rooms were not ready when we arrived, so we went for walk around. When we arrived back they were still not ready but we were shown to a lounge area and given complimentary drinks whilst we waited. Each room is given 2 key cards which can be handy. Free internet access also. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The concergie were great for booking transfers and arranging sightseeing taxis -v- train etc. Taxis are well priced in Singapore. Singapore Airlines has a hop on hop off bus which is great. S$6 if you have flown with Sing Air or Silk Air otherwise S$12 but well worth it. Get on and off as much as you want for the day and it takes you to all the tourist places. Sentosa Island is ok. If you have been to Disneyland or Universal studios and have teenagers I would not bother going unless you want to do the cable car which takes about 1/2 hour for round trip S$18pp. Buses go around Sentosa as it is so big but would not rush back to that. Singapore Flyer is great. Go to tour desk and see if you can get better price, normally S$29 but we got for S$21, takes 1/2 hour also but worth doing. Clark Quay is like being in Melbourne's Southbank with lots of restaurants and bars on the river front. We read on TA that Satay King was great for food, we were disappointed in the food there. Plenty of places to eat. Great place to eat is SunTec food court where all the locals eat, walk through and have a look, well worth it and near one of the ends is Nasi ?????? great nasi goring and curry & curry puffs. MRT (train station is about 3 minute walk and is so easy to use, cheap and clean. All stations are underground. Singapore airport T3 is good, has its own hotel if you need a nap. Good place to eat is Kim Choo, only place we could find beef rendang and good nasi goring.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: bayes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. Location is brilliant, right in the heart of Clarke Quay which was positively buzzing at night - an exciting place for both myself and my 7 year old daughter. Staff are professional, friendly and very efficient. Room was good. Only fault was that it had a balcony that we were not able to access, obstensibly due to having a child with me and potential safety issues (not visible to me). Bathroom products were gorgeous - in a test-tube style packaging and smelt divine. Free use of internet on computers in the lobby. Nice pool. Good breakfast. Aesthetically it's ok - clean colours and lines, but nothing to set it dramatically apart from others in it's class. I'd feel happy staying here again and recommending it to my friends. It's a good, comfortable, reliable and reasonably luxurious hotel with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location!!! Location Plus!”
Reviews.Author: yakityak
Reviews.Content: We had four great days in Singapore and stayed at the Novotel Clarke Quay. We chose this particular hotel for its location! - Close to the Singapore River and the Clarke Quay/Boat Quay restaurants/cafes etc. Everything within easy walking distance, very close to the MRT Underground rail. Hotel was comfortable, staff very friendly and helpful I rate the between average and very good, but more the very good for it's location. Hotel has all the facilities any holiday traveller requires and we would certainly stay here again when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LindyAussie
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through the Accor Great Sale, and were very happy with the price, location, and service. The room needs a little work, but hey we were only there to really sleep. The Square Restaurant attached to the hotel serves superb food from Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner. There seafood buffet lunch is a must have. The location in Clarke Quay was fabulous right in the heart of the action. There is a great shopping mall in the base of the hotel. The front staff were friendly and helpful when we had problems. Was really handy to the Hop On Hop Off bus stop, which is a must when you visit Singapore. We would definitely atyed again.

Reviews.Title: “great ambience”
Reviews.Author: wildcatgirly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in a room for 2 with extra bed for the kids.The view of the riverside from the hotel room was great.Very good staff and our stay was very pleasant.Will recomend it any time.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location, but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: holidayer_717
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel recently and were quite disappointed when we entered our room. a maintenance man was in the bathroom fixing things, the bed had not been made properly, pillows were flung forward on the bed, blood stain on sheet. we spoke to the duty manager who moved us to a new room, where the mini bar was not fully stocked. we advised the duty manager of this, however upon checking out, the hotel tried to charge us nearly $60 in mini bar charges (they ended up cancelling the mini bar charges). breakfast was nice, a good selection. we did not eat any other meals at the hotel. the rooms were nice and very clean, however not worthy of the cost. hotel is in a great location in Clarke Quay, easy to walk to many restaurants. however, certainly not the best hotel I have stayed in for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Fun with family on business”
Reviews.Author: AtrayP
Reviews.Content: We had a business seminar in this hotel for 7 days. Lovely food and a great location. evening full of enthusiasm as going just out for the clarky area of sinagpore. lots of restaurants,bar and shopping arcade. Service was first class in the hotel. Pleasure to stay always there

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great central location”
Reviews.Author: nickbrazel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights whilst in transit during my medical elective overseas. The location is perfect to see Singapore (only 3/4mins walk from Clarke Quay MRT station) and there are plenty of restaurants in walking distance if you don't like the heat. The hotel was beautiful. Extremely clean, great service, the room was amazing with a great view of Clarke Quay and the river. The previous reviewer mentioned the noise - I was on 7th floor (I think - can't quite remember) and I could hear the occasional thud of bass from a nightclub but it didn't bother me too much and I am the kind of person that gets extremely annoyed by things like this. The pool and terrace are in a great location with sun on them all day. The changing rooms by the pool are clean but in need of a lick of paint. They also supply towels for the pool. The stay was expensive but well worth the money. Breakfast had a good selection, I didn't use the restaurant at other times. Note there are several other restaurants in the hotel which are not run by the hotel itself. I tried the Indian there and it was the best curry i've ever tasted. Be wary of the sea-food restaurant by the river closest to the hotel - their pricing is astronomically high and not at all clear. I ended up spending SGP$130 on a meal for just ONE. Not impressed!! Back to the hotel - seriously, stay here if you want a good, luxurious base and have the cash to spare!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: siddharthnaidu
Reviews.Content: Novotel is an ultramodern hotel having all the comforts. As expected the price tag is high. But you cant augur much about because of its location in Clarqe Quay which is one of the most happening spots in Singapore given the prescence of around 20-30 pubs and restaurants in the vicinty. Only the elite stay at this hotel. The first thing that impressed me about this hotel was its amazing scenic location overlooking the clare quay. Night life at clarqe quay is particularly wonderful and u wouldnt want to miss that. I have got absolutely no complaints about this hotel. The only thing thats missing is a pub at the hotel itself. The hotel would have been complete. Definitely recomended for all types of people.Its got all the major cuisine types of restaurants,a beatiful lounge bar, a spacious gym and an indoor pool. But a tip is that given a choice, pick the higher floors for your stay. Skyline of Singapore is captivating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SharenScott
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for exploring Singapore. Room,service and price all very resonable for being so central. Pool area was fab and just what we needed in the heat! Free internet and a lovely bar area too. Didnt have breakfast or eat in the restaurant. Would defo go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Courteous Staff, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ias3458
Reviews.Content: Hotel Novotel Clarke Quay is one of the best hotel I have stayed in. Located in the main city centre, it has great view around. You have 24 hrs open Mcdonalld within the same building. The hotel staff are very helpfull and polite. Pool is very good and so is the fitness centre. For me an authentic Indian restaurant on the 6th floor was added attraction. I would definitely recommend this to all my friends & colleagues to stay in this hotel....whenever they get an opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nizocold
Reviews.Content: everything about it is excellent great for familkies with children as well as for a busines straveller great courtoeus staff excellent business facilities wifi in rooms etc location is super near the quay walking distance from shopping areas etc

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but beware of extra charges!”
Reviews.Author: Raven76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were due to arrive at 6am on Wed morn, therefore I booked from the Tues night so we would have the room upon our arrival and didn't have to wait until 2pm check in. Our booking was confirmed and payment taken from my credit card. I even emailed the hotel to let them know that we would be late arrivals, but would definitely be checking in on Wed morn. When we got there we were told that there were no rooms available, and we would have to upgrade our room to the only available at an extra $50 a night DESPITE the confirmation I had already received. All up it came to an extra $200 which might not seem like a lot, but when you are already on a budget it makes things difficult!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, views, facilities for couples or families.”
Reviews.Author: AlanGelder
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Novotel, Clarke Quay half a dozen times in the past & plan on staying there again next month. They provide transport to the Airport & cruise Terminal & even international ferries. Resort style facilities if you are jetlagged & just want a relaxing day to chill out. Rooms with incredible views over the city , river & even the harbour. Service & meals are also top rate. We have stayed in many of Singapore's hotels, but choose this one as a home away from home, whenever rooms are available.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favourite in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: quixipixie
Reviews.Content: Again apologies for such a late review. Novotel Clarke Quay SINGAPORE 20-21 Sep 07 What a nice surprise. We usually always stay at the Holiday Inn Park View but it was full. Novotel Clarke Quay was delightful. Very efficient and courteous staff at check in and kindly let us into our room at 8am (check in time 2pm) after an awful 8 hour flight from Istanbul. We booked a Superior room and we got a lovely room with a huge king bed and a good rollaway for our 12 year old son. The room was very modern and tastefully decorated. The room was spotless and the bathroom huge, sparkling and modern with a separate shower and bath. (not normal for Singapore!) Our little balcony had a great view over the Singapore River and Clarke Quay and after a long sleep we enjoyed wandering around the restaurants and shops nearby. We now have a new favorite in Singapore….the Novotel Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Navitimer1881
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for S$103.80 a night including all taxes, etc during the Accord 48-hour internal sale. Good deal. The hotel is on top of a shopping mall which means ultra convenience. The four gigantic Macs at the reception add a nice touch too. Rooms are average sized and offer a decent view over the Singapore River. If this was this cheap I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service - fine for a short business trip!”
Reviews.Author: Britpop73
Reviews.Content: Arrived at reception to find a fresh, modern lobby. iMacs in the reception area for free internet use. Hotel bar is secluded and quiet - modern 'chill out' style. Nice Asian selection, buffet food for breakfast/lunch etc . Check in staff were attentive and polite - they also upgraded me to a superior room with small balcony and panoramic views of the city skyline. Conference rooms felt a little 'tired' and cramped. Gym was just fine for a business trip - some running machines, stepper, bike and fixed multi-gym style equipment. I stayed for a three day business training event. Good location, walk to Raffles, Shopping Malls, Chinatown etc. Subway is also close to Hotel. Clarke Quay itself is a bit 'naff' and touristy to my tastes , but you at least have a central location from which to base yourself. I'd stay here again - probably better hotels around for a holiday or romantic trip, but the superior room and view I had were ideal for a 'functional' business stay where a comfy bed, gym access and good service were the only things I cared about!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints about the Nova”
Reviews.Author: patsyManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nova in March, we had an executive premier room. The room was large with two king size beds, well lit with enough space for clothes, didn't use the executive lounge, so can't comment on that one. The main restaurant was a bit pricey, and so were the drinks, ( no different to any other hotel in Singapore) our breakfast was included, the buffet breakfast was 30 singapore dollars plus the taxes. But there again Singapore has always been a pricy place, and most people who visit know this before they go and are prepared. Didn't watch the tele or play any dvd's, so no comment on that one either. The towels were changed everyday, 1 bath and 1 hand towel each, plus face cloths, these were adequate for our needs, didn't go on holiday to spend most of the time in the bathroom, which incidentally was a very nice bathroom. Did have one problem whilst staying there, the main mantle lights, which were concealed but were very bright, kept going on whilst they were switched off, not too good in the middle of the night, but the problem was sorted as soon as we reported it. Would stay there again as it is in a very good and nice location, It compares well with most other hotels in that class that we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKen
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed with this hotel. I stayed at the exec premier floor room with access to the premier lounge. I am comparing it with The Hilton Exec Rm with access to exec lounge. The Novotel room was much smaller! Fixtures and fittings were just ordinary. Everything was open - there isn't any drawers by the bedside to put any books or reading materials. There is also no wardrobe drawers for that matter. It's just a square room. Lightings could be improved upon. There is no bedside reading lights by the side. And there is only 1 bedside pedestal (without any drawers). What kind of an exec room is this? I mean, the Hilton's exec room is so spacious, well furnished and wonderfully bright with good lightings and ample cabinets to keep our stuff. The TV, though LCD, was only 21" (compare this with Hilton's 37" or 42" mounted on the wall) and the proprietary cable TV remote control is frustrating as I have to keep on pressing the "up" button when I switched on the TV to get to CNN or Discovery, as there are no buttons for the digits to be entered. There is a DVD player alright - but it could not play my DVDs, even after 2 changes by the technician (he took the DVDs from other rooms on the same floor for me). I was told later by the receptionist at the premier lounge that the DVD players could only play Code 3 discs (Asean region), which baffles me, because the clientele are mainly Europeans and cabin crew staff from Middle East. Surely hotels need to have a multi-player system? The good thing about the toilet is that the bath and the shower stalls are separate. Having said that, the housekeeping is a bit mean in issuing towels. Only 2 were issued out per day. There are 2 toilet holders, but one was so loose that whenever I pulled on it, the whole toilet roll dropped to the floor! There is a small balcony, and being at level 24, this was one of the better features of the hotel - having a scenic and wonderful view of Singapore's skyline. I got the housekeeping maid to open up the sliding door for me, so that whenever I get depressed seeing the size of my so called "exec room", I simply escape to the balcony. Service - was also mediocre. Although the premier lounge staff were courteous, they were not overwhelming in their hospitality, unlike the exec lounge staff from the Hilton. For example, we took a bottle of fruit juice, drank it halfway and decided to go back to our room, only to be told that it is meant to be fully consumed within the lounge area! The premier lounge food? pales in comparison to the Hilton's. Nothing is being offered here after breakfast - no cookies, no finger foods, no cakes or tartlets. Only drinks. Have to wait till 6pm when evening cocktails start. Even then, the range of food wasn't as good. The lounge though offers 2 Apple PCs connected by broadband for use by those having access to the lounge. This is a plus point. But I am used to PCs operating on Microsoft windows OS. And one last bit of annoying fact is that you have to get to the 7th floor where the hotel check-in desk is located. This means you have to use the hotel lift from your room to the hotel lobby at 7th floor, walk to the shopping centre's connecting lift across the lobby and go down to street level. It's just a hassle after some time for us. So you can understand my disappointment when I have to compare the rooms, the different treatment and the services.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool4Singapore
Reviews.Content: Was there with my family on Mar 15 for one night stay. Hotel staff are very friendly and approachable. Room is a bit old but comfortable and cosy as we stayed in the executive room with a superb view of the city skyline. Dined at the hotel's restaurant and find the fod was so so but agin staff are friendly thought slightly short-handed(clearly of plate and refilling of drinks slow). 3 things missing: 1. no children pool 2. free mineral water restricted to one bottle. 3. Complimentary carpark restricted to only 1 free ticket during each stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great pool, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Shejohn
Reviews.Content: Put this one on your list of places to stay. Perfect location just on Clarke Quay, with plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and a small supermarket which seemingly never closed. The room was large, light, airy, well furnished and had excellent views across the Singapore River. No-one can pretend that the design of the actual hotel building is pretty to look at but everything else makes up for it. Although check in was not officially until 2:00 pm, we arrived off a long flight early in the morning and the helpful reception staff allocated a room to us straight away. The pool was one of the largest hotel pools we have seen, complete with loungers, palm trees, spotless changing rooms and looked after by a member of hotel staff who clearly took great pride in looking after the pool and the guests. The Novotel was much cheaper than another hotel we had previously stayed at in Singapore, which offered smaller rooms, a smaller pool and a somewhat less convenient location. The hotel is just a few minutes from Clark Quay Metro station (the Singapore Metro is air conditioned luxury), offering fast access all over the city. This hotel was a pleasure to stay at and we would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Tmike1
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel, each stay has been for 3 weeks. I have been in the Premier Executive class of room which is very large with one king size bed. There is a separate area for a walk-in closet and a very large bathroom. The premier executive rate includes, breakfast, internet, 3 pieces of laundry per day and use of a private lounge with drinks and snacks in the evening. Since I am on a business trip, the cost is paid by my company, so it was not a big concern. The "extras" cost about 175RM per night on top of the room rate. The hotel is very modern, clean and the staff is courteous. They provide van service to different parts of the downtown area on a routine schedule. They even paid for a taxi to take us to Chinatown when the van was not available. Breakfast is good and they change the menu a bit every day. The fitness room is large bu the equipment is lacking. The two treadmills are in constant use during peak hours. A wonderful shopping mall (The Pavilion) is a short walk and it has many eating choices from fast-food to top end dining. The only annoying thing is that it seems the staff is constantly coming into the room to check things. One time a guy came to announce that he needed to change out the food in the mini-bar because it was out of date. Overall this is a great choice for both location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: southeastasiabound
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Novotel Clarke Quay in December. I was surprized to see the negative comments on some of these reviews. I can ony describe my stay as perfect. Its a beautiful hotel, in a fantastick location. The lights at night in Singapore harbour change frequently and my room overlooked the harbour. It was gorgeous. The bathroom was sparkling clean. The bed with so comfortable and linens so cozy. The staff bent over backwards in the executive lounge for me. They were lovely women who took their jobs seriously and I appreciated their attendance and excellent service. Its a lovely hotel and I can only describe my stay as extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: jdaizd
Reviews.Content: Awful hotel. I had booked executive rooms and these were appaling. The basin tap came off in my hand as soon as I touched it. The carpet in the room and the hallway were badly stained and there was a vacum cleaner in the happway for the length of my stay. The DVD remote didn't work and the front desk wouldn't answer their phone - I called house keeping and they said they would get back to me and I am still waiting. The balcony door was locked I couldn't get access. I booked two rooms and recived confirmation for 2 rooms but on checking in they had only one room booked. They were able to give me a second room but at the rack rate and not the original rate I had booked at but this was not discussed - they charged my card after I had left as while there they said everything had been paid for. Many nicer hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..great location...”
Reviews.Author: rajbfy
Reviews.Content: We were here fro 6 nights on our 25th wedding anniversary last week and just loved the place. We got complimentary stay due to redemption of AMEX points for 5 nights and we got the 6th night at 200 singapore dollars for a superior queen bed room,and thats the reaosn we chose this hotel. And are we glad we did so. Fantastic location. Byt hte river..we requested for a river facing room and got it at 2 pm. Well worth the wait. Spacious rooms,with all facilities. Huge bed..soft pillows...daily replenish of tea and coffee bags. Nothing to complain. At Clark Quay..the entertianment nad dininp hub of Singapore. Also the center for taking the river cruises. What more can we want...! Highly recommned it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Christmastravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location. It was right on the quay. There was a huge club/restaurant scene right outside our hotel with excellent food choices, A short walk to the cleanest /safest subway system I have ever seen. Our 15/12 daughters travelled to China Town alone on it. Hotel had a very large pool, deep and everyone thoroughly enjoyed it. Service was quick and freindly. We would definitely stay here again. Very central location, easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KedarP
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to Singapore, but first 3 were short business trips. This time I decided to visit with my wife on a holiday. I selected this hotel for its location - right at the Clarke quay. This is the most happening area in Singapore with lots of choices for food. This is the first hotel I have seen where reception is on 7th floor. Overall hotel building is old and not so inspiring. But rooms are good. We had checked in Superior room. Our room had good view of river. Service was ok. There is no personal touch, but there were no problems either. We had small problems with bed-side light and with secure storage with digital key. Both problems were solved promptly. Breakfast has good veriety with something for every type of taste. We mostly dined outside, but one dinner in Indian restaruent at the hotel was excellent. Check-in was prompt, but check-out took good 20 minutes. So overall experience is good, but this needs to be considered with overall Singapore hotels benchmark. Most of hotels in Singapore offers similar or better facilities and service. So main advantage is its location. Merchant Court hotel on the other side of the river is also a good hotel, but will be bit expensive than Novotel Clark quay.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Josie63
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel when it was the New Otani (2002) couldn't wait to get back - what a disappointment. Booked a superior room - and had to check that a mistake had not been made with room allocation. The room was drab, one of the bedside tables was missing and wires (hopefully not electrically "live") were hanging out of the wall. This was reported to staff the following morning, but nothing was done throughout the stay. The reception staff were polite but certainly not friendly or overly helpful. On night 2 of 3, we were woken a little after midnight with a staff member offering us towels which had not been requested. On morning 2, staff entered the room whilst we were in the room to repair/check the door lock - no offer of coming back later when convenient to us - we had to stand there for some considerable time with the room door wide open whilst they worked on it. On morning three, the housekeeper let herself into the room, without knocking, and entered the room whilst we were still there and although she apologised, it was by then becomming apparent that our privacy was of absolutely no interest to the hotel staff. Very poor courtesy facilities for guests requiring facilities after checking out and with late flights (unless $150 dollars paid for room extension from 12 noon until 6.30 pm !) The hotel really does not seem geared up to holiday guests - more of a business hotel. Really quite a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service hotel I have stayed in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: WorldViewAce
Reviews.Content: This review is based on a few stays at this hotel during July-Aug this year. The location is indeed good, right next to the happening Clarke Quay area, but the service is pretty sad. During the first stay I saw a centipede in the toilet bowl. When I left a feedback for the hotel GM, there was absolutely no response. If I was at a Le Meridien, I would have received a personal call and a letter apologizing. During the second stay the room was not done up completely and no hand-towels in the washroom. When I called up to ask for the towels, the person was absolutely non-chalant and sounded irritated I couldn't make do with no towel! I again left a feedback in good faith, to no response. I have now moved to Royal Plaza at Scotts road or Traders hotel and both of these are much better on service.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: virgintripper
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Singapore early morning after long flight from London, no sleep as a toddler near us cried for most of the way (poor parents had a rotten trip as well). Check in not till 2.00 pm but staff went out of their way to get us a room and we were able to check in at 9.30 am with no extra charge. Most appreciated as not only were we tired but also had on warm clothing as we left London in 9 degrees and arrived to 34 degrees in Singapore! Breakfast each morning was great, certainly the best of our five weeks overseas. Everything you can imagine, eggs cooked as you waited and service excellent. We purchased a two day pass for metro / buses etc and rode the trains which are clean, airconditioned and always on time. Travelled to Chinatown, Little India and Bugis where we did some cheap shopping, lots of bargains and souvenirs to bring home. Went to Vivo City on the metro and this shopping centre is HUGE, very easy to get lost (as we did) but worth the trip on the metro. Felt extremely safe in Singapore, no graffiti and no gum. Transport system first class!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ally25London
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We upgraded to an Executive room on arrival as it wasn’t going to cost too much more than we were already due to pay. Rooms (executive) - large and nicely decorated, lovely beds. Quiet, so good for sleeping! Nice bath and separate shower and lots of spa products. Tea and coffee facilities in room. Great views. Executive lounge – good views over Singapore. Nice variety of canapés and drinks from 6-8pm, snacks during the day are a little more mundane, but still nice. And very useful if you plan to spend a lot of time by the pool. Location – Right in the centre of Clarke Quay so great for local bars and restaurants (try Bar Opium at Indochine Waterfront). Across the bridge is the Clarke Quay metro station from which you can get everywhere. Pool – large and with loads of sun loungers. Complimentary beach towels on each. Pool was quite cold so better for cooling off in than relaxing in. Good size for laps though. Not many people were using it while we were there so quiet and relaxing. Restaurant – we only had breakfast here but it was easily the best breakfast buffet I’ve experienced at a hotel. I’m sure the afternoon tea and dinner are equally good. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Ball2007
Reviews.Content: Pretty good location on Clarke Quay, only a 15min walk from Orchard Road. Great for sightseeing and in the evening for bars an restaurants. Great atmosphere at night. Rooms are descent, not over the top compared to more upmarket hotels but pretty good. Pool is OK, a few floors up, nice size but lacks a bit of greenery. Great as a base, but not very romantic, suits business types more or those just wanting a bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mel059
Reviews.Content: Clarke Quay is a great location in Singapore. The Quay is bustling at night, its close to shopping, and there are plenty of nice restaurants around. The Novotel was expensive, like anywhere else in Singapore. The room was nice, and the view from the window was beautiful, overlooking the Quay. It was a bit noisy at night, but that didn't bother us. The bathroom was spacious, and had both a bath and a shower, but the water temperature fluctuated a little. My only complaint is that we arrived early in the morning and weren't able to check in until about 2 hours after we arrived, but the hotel doesn't guarantee check in until after 2pm, so that was to be expected. The hotel was good and I would stay there again.
