Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tkd1615
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 3-30 in the morning and as I had already emailed them to let them know of our early morning arrival, I had hoped that our 2 rollaway beds would have been ready. They weren't, however the front desk were great and they got onto it straight away. Two very efficient people then came to make up the beds along with apologies. After that hiccup, we had a great stay there. The people were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was great. A very good location if you're not fussed on staying on Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to everything”
Reviews.Author: franky3844
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights 4 - 6 September. The first night we arrived at midnight due to our plane from Melbourne being delayed. Check-in was quick and the stafff were smiling and friendly. We had booked a superior room and were upgraded to the deluxe room on the 23rd floor. I had requested a room with a river view and that is exactly what we received. The room was beter than I expected and nice and big. We were not able to open the door onto the balcony but I knew they would open if I had requested it. We had breakfast both mornings at the hotel and dinner one night - all meals were what I expect of a Novotel and we were very pleased with both the service and standard of food. I would have no hesitation recommended the Novotel Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NZLTraveller
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is in a great area for eating and entertainment. We stayed in a deluxe room which was comfortable, great bathroom. Breakfast was good, good selection available I would stay here again on my next trip to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Predictable Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: LaTravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family (husband and 2 kids, ages 4 and 7) at the Novotel at Clark Quay for 5 days in early June and had an enjoyable stay. Novotels are never adventurous or exciting, but they are really good at what they promise to deliver -- a consistent traveler experience in every city they are located. And the fact that they never charge for 2 kids under 16 years old in the room is a HUGE plus. Especially in Asia and Europe where we found many hotels won't even let you have 2 children in the same room with you (they often only allow 1). I think they also give the kids free breakfast, although we ended up going out to the Starbucks in the bottom of the building every a.m. The hotel itself is in good condition. There is a first floor elevator lobby, you go up to the main lobby and restaurant area. There are 2-3 free usage big screen MAC computers in the main lobby that my kids used to play games when there was no one else waiting to check email, etc. The buffet lunch in the main restaurant was expensive but amazing in the array of food and the desert table, complete with chocolate fondue fountain. We took it as a good sign that there were mostly locals eating in the dining room, not many tourists. The best part of the hotel is probably the large pool area on the roof of one part of the building. We actually got a bit of a breeze up there (it was stiflingly hot even in early June), and there were many umbrellas and wait service from the restaurant. Singapore itself is a bit antiseptic -- its a very modern city and much of the culture has been "Disneyfied" but it is certainly clean and there are an abundance of restaurants and things to do. The Novotel is located on Clark Quay along the river, and I would say that is the best place to be if you are traveling with children. There is a large pedestrian mall, at least 50 restaurants within walking distance, and the bumboat river cruises leave from 50 meters away. Our kids also enjoyed Sentosa Island, and walking around through the bazaars of Chinatown and Little India. We didn't get to do the day trip to Pulau Ubin unfortunately, as it shows the traditional way of life in stilt houses, etc., but we had just finished moving out of our house in Sydney and spent one day just resting by the pool. Overall, nice experience, if a bit sterile...but even adventurous travelers sometimes just want an easy experience and Novotel is alway clean, easy, and relatively affordable (when you consider that the kids are free.)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: PerthHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: The Novatel is a huge hotel that is in a central location in Singapore. We travelled there with a 2 and 3 year old and found it not at all family orientated! The pool area is shared with a neighbouring hotel and is very plain and simple! nothing special at all but clean and well maintained. The breakfast is absolutely to die for with everything you could possibly think of and more in a buffet style. The rooms were comfortable but again nothing special for the price! I would not take my family there again however if your travelling for business it is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “OK- does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: sciat
Reviews.Content: OK, but nothing special. We were here only 2 nights & were only looking for somewhere easy, central with pool. Desk service was better than some reviews have suggested. Breakfast was good, but we missed one day due to very early departure. We were booked & pre-paid with a deluxe room & the check-in suggested they were doing us a favour to get one of the better rooms. In truth it was nothing special & I really wonder what a lower grade room would be offering! As an alternate the Swissotel Merchant Court is very close on other side of river and outwardly looked in better shape, closer to MRT and Chinatown. It seems to have better reviews......

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, BAD service”
Reviews.Author: thebarrettos
Reviews.Content: If you like the night life and PUB environment this is the place to stay, its bang in the center of it. The rooms are clean and of a decent size. The service however is SAD, to give you one example, we on a daily basis asked for a local newspaper, but till the last of the 5 days that we stayed, we did not get any. What was even more frustrating was that, a number of our neighbors had one hanging off their door every morning. It was only after making a frustrated complaint in person at the reception that we received the same. The service is far from any five star standards.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Deal”
Reviews.Author: bkrider9
Reviews.Content: FAMILY HOTEL with a difference! Are you searching for a way to get back and forth to Asia with your kids? Look no further. With one, two or three kids we have traveled throughout the US, Europe, the Middle East and now Indonesia, and with fifteen years of family-travel experience I can say that we've never had a hotel as nice as this one for the money. It's actually a very professional business hotel, but they accommodate families with such grace you think that's all they do. You can't go wrong here. The first thing that strikes you is the lovely fragrance flooding the lobby. Everything is pleasant, neat, artistic, very feng shui. The staff are extremely efficient and courteous. Our room was expansive and we had more than enough space for two adults and three growing children ages 13, 9 and 8. Best of all is the buffet dinner! Don't miss it. Usually when you think of buffet you think of leftover food the chef is trying to get rid of. Not so here. This is a place where Singaporeans come to dine, because they know it's great food at a great price. Absolutely delicious. And my wife and I are very picky, mostly vegetarian and macrobiotic eaters, and we are sensitive to things like MSG and preservatives (get reactions, etc.). But I stuffed myself to the gills and felt full of energy that night and the next day. The famous Maxwell Market is great - if you can tolerate high levels of MSG. At the Novotel you won't miss Maxwell; what a selection of foods: sushi (so delicate and flavorful), beef, selections of fish, scallops on the shell, shrimp, soups, cheeses and breads, and desserts galore. All gourmet standard. Everything extremely fresh - it was a work of art. I'm now spoiled and I don't think I can accept anything less anymore. And the cost was about US $25 per adult, very cheap because guests at the hotel get a big discount. Just to give you an idea of my experiences, my two other favorite hotels are the Bristol in Vienna and Annahotel in Munich, both great, but Novotel Clarke Quay rivals and surpasses them in many ways. And did I mention the view? Just check out the gazillion photos on this website.

Reviews.Title: “Alright night”
Reviews.Author: charliegirl_b
Reviews.Content: We arrived early one morning and left early again the next morning after spending 6 weeks in Europe. We stayed in Singapore for 5 nights on the way to Europe at Traders Hotel just off Orchid Road. We arrived at the Novotel around 6am and we were told our room wouldnt be ready for a while but if we wanted to upgrade we could have a room straight away. We decided just to wait as the hotel wasnt cheap to start with. We asked if we could lay by the pool and they said that wouldnt be a problem. They held our luggage and we went and sleept on the pool loungers. My husband checked around 9:30 and they had a room ready. It was a lovely corner room - larger than Traders. The curtains were really good and darkened the room enough for us to have a sleep. The shower was a little odd in that it didnt hang very high - it was around hip height so you had to hold it in your hand the whole time. Hard when you wanted to wash hair as when you hung it on the little hook water would hit the wall and splash out of the bath and on the floor. The area around Clarke Quay was dead during the day but at night it really lit up. We didnt eat at the hotel as it was very pricey. When we checked out they tried to charge mini bar foods but we hadnt had any and house keeping had only come to check the mini bar about 5 hours after we checked in to the room. They got us to sign a form to remove the charges. The lady on reception was nice about it though. Overall it was a nice hotel but lacked a little warmth. Clarke Quay also didnt offer much excitement during the day where as the Traders was a couple minutes walk from Orchid Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Orpheous_8
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 6 nights last year, on the 8th floor. The view was fantastic as was the location, but the building itself is showing it's age a little. We chose Novotel Clarke Quay for it's location, as it's right amongst all the busltling nightlife, only a short walk from the nearest MRT (train) station, and close to Chinatown! A select few of the staff members were helpful, but I think this place would be best reserved for those who know they're way around Singapore, or who don't require much assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the location”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneRunner
Reviews.Content: You stay here for the convenience and location as the Quay is really the loveliest and most lively place to be in Singapore. It's walking distance to China Town, to several train stations, and the night life around the Quay is wonderful. That was certainly the highlight. We found the staff fairly neutral and we also had difficulty in checking in. We were informed that we'd been 'upgraded to two single beds' however the looks on our face probably told them that we'd much prefer to be 'downgraded to a queen bed, thank you very much'. Be careful if you pay in advance. They tried to charge us when we checked out but thankfully we had our receipt on hand from the booking site. Apparently this is a 'common mistake'. They will allow you to leae your luggage there for a while. We travelled to Borneo from Singapore and left our luggage there for a week without problems. And also be careful of the taxi's waiting outside the door. They're 'hotel taxis' and will charge you double. It's just as easy to walk to the end of the street and get a standard one.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Naseer A
Reviews.Content: The Good: Location is excellent. Clarke Quay is a great place to be around as its vibrant and happening with a plethora of nightlife spots and restaurants. You are also within walking distance of Boat Quay with all of the eating places on the water. There is a shopping mall in the same building as the hotel and a 7-11 on the ground floor. The rooms are spacious (at least the ones assigned to us were) and the breakfast is quite nice (it was included in our package rate). The Bad: Service is really really bad. Check in took ages plus the staff seem to have an attitude problem. Not a single smile anytime you approach the counter. I would agree with a previous poster that they seem to have issues with brown skinned individuals. Room service is slow and it takes ages for house keeping to resolve any problem. The internet PCs are always occupied and business center staff have an even worse attitude than the front desk staff. On the whole, this location is ok from the perspective of location and the rooms but you have to be willing to put up with the attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Found the hotel great”
Reviews.Author: Julie01Bunbury
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from 8 days at the Novotel Clarke Quay and found the hotel to be great. We stayed on the 12th floor overlooking the road and had no problem with noise, could hear a bit of noise but nothing to distrub us. The location of the hotel was great. A easy walk to the MRT, which we use a lot for getting about. A big bonus was the supermarket in the basement of the hotel building. We could just take the lift down to the supermarket, it was open from 10am to 10pm and had everything you could want. We plan to go back to Singapore and would certainly stay at Clarke Quay's again. There was building work going on in the shopping centre attached to the hotel but that had no affect on the hotel. The shopping centre also had a McDonalds and a Starbucks for those that need their caffine fix.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to restaurant area”
Reviews.Author: Finnish_female
Reviews.Content: We were first time in SG on vacation and a local friend confirmed that Novotel is well located for tourists. She was right - the hotel is right next to the Clarke Quay area with dozens of restaurants, bars and discos. The nearest MRT station is underneath The Central shopping mall across the river, 5 - 7 minutes (hot!) walk. We preferred using the metro during the day for sightseeing / shopping etc. and being able to have dinner at a walking distance from the hotel. Room: We had booked a standard queen room but after 1st night decided to upgrade to a bigger room (+85 SGD/night) with more closet space and better view. The closet in the first room was absolutely tiny! Standard queens overlook the pool + next hotel and not the city skyline. The second room on 25th floor was much better and the view was really good (my photos are from the 2nd room). As we stayed for 6 nights we preferred a larger room and view. Bathroom was big with bath and shower. Service: The staff was friendly but quite neutral, nothing special. We had to call maintenance 3 times to our rooms. In our first room the main light did not go off at night, staff came in 10 minutes and fixed it through the ceiling. In our second room TV remote was not working properly, sink was not working well and the desk light was not working. These were all fixed as well, but made me think that they could check these things every once in a while by themselves without waiting or the guests to inform that the sink is not working (which housekeeping should notice!) etc. Hotel: We did not take the expensive breakfast nor did we use the restaurants so we cannot comment on that. There are so many restaurants right next to the hotel that we did not consider eating at Novotel. The pool is rather big and with app. 20 - 30 sunbeds. I went to the pool a couple of mornings around 9 am and it was reasonably busy already in the morning (but still got a good sunbed facing the morning sun). There are towles ready on the beds and extra towels on the side. They are renovating something by the pool so you will see some construction issues going on but they did not make any noise at all. The Clarke Quay discos, on the other hand, play music quite loud late at night and we could hear the disco beat to our room on 25th floor at night (didn't bother me but my light sleeping spouse mentioned it a couple of times). There are 2 complimentary computers with internet in the lobby but they were always occupied - we used them only once for that reason. There is a 7-11 next to the lobby which was very convenient for little daily shopping and cheaper beer / drinks before dinner time. The hop-on hop-off sightseeing bus has a stop right in front of Novotel - I reccommend taking those tours!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service possible”
Reviews.Author: sant99
Reviews.Content: Novotel Clarke Quay is a good property with lousy service.At check in we were greeted by the staff as we would have been greeted at a jail. He was stern and did not care to smile. The room service staff take ages to deliver anything. It took them one hour to deliver water to us . I had to ask for the Newspapers from the bell desk daily. The Business lounge staff dislike brown people. Whites and chinese are given preferential treatment. Internet charges are horrendous. They wanted 30 SGD for it daily. The location of the hotel is good. But I guess Swissotel is better located since it is opposite the Mrt station. All in all a disappointing experience. Please go to the hotel if you want to be looked down upon and prefer lousy service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley loved it!”
Reviews.Author: flam_287
Reviews.Content: Travelled from england in May 2008. Booked the hotel with ebookers.com just because it was cheaper than booking directly with novotel or any other website really. Getting to the hotel is straight forward, either getting a cab from the airport or getting the MRT. Cab will be the easiest from the airport and costs approx S$20 which is fine really and takes about 20-30 mins. Check-in is a straightforward process although there are normally on two check-in desks open so you do have to wait. The staff are efficient so your not waiting for very long. Rooms are excellent, the view we had was over clarke quay itself and its really good. Everything you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. Wi-fi conection is available free of charge i believe but the signal and connection isnt very reliable but it's ok if you just need to check emails etc. Only thing which i find a bit dissappointing is that in a hotel such as novotel, where the prices are quite high (im a budget traveller but decided to splash out), that breakfast isn't complimentary when many other budget hotels can afford to provide one. Other than that very very good hotel. It provides everything you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. Would definetly stay then again!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like the location”
Reviews.Author: motheranddaughterduo
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because had stayed at several Novotels previously. Was on a short stop over and was disappointed with the location - woke up early and all the shops (and many restaurants) were closed until 10am. The hotel itself was very nice and we were upgraded to a suite however i preferred being on the Marina Bay side of town. Also hotel staff encouraged us to get a hotel taxi to the airport at $35 flat fee - which was really just a $10 rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Location Better Than Rooms?”
Reviews.Author: AJBJDS
Reviews.Content: Get a deluxe room. The standard room we saw was dumpy and tired looking. We were upgraded to a deluxe after protesting that we didn’t want to be in a smoking (though we booked non smoking) standard room due to the smoke and musty smell, and the bad condition of the room. The deluxe upgraded room was much better, though still a little tired looking. The room and bed were clean, though. Good pool and great location in Clarke Quay, close to the MRT Clark Quay station (5-7 minutes walk), with a supermarket below the hotel. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: RichieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Novotel for 3 nights purely because in Singapore the normal sequence of events is to end up in Clarke Quay for dinner at the end of the night, and the 50m walk to bed is very convenient. The location is Fantastic... But... The hotel is fairly average and tired looking. At check in the girl told us that our breakfast wasn't included, and didn't believe me until I showed her the booking confirmation printed from the Hotel's own website. No apology for her mistake, just a begrudging acceptance. The shower was mouldy and the room was average. Bed was fairly uncomfortable. Could hear the 'doof doof' of the night clubs down below until all hours (we were on the 10th floor). My wife and I are in our late 20's and not exactly 'nannas' but it is nice to be able to get some sleep in your hotel room. I think for the money there are much better Hotels in Singapore, and if you really want the Clarke Quay Location stay at the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: josieWashingtonDc
Reviews.Content: great staff great restaurant great room with balcony great location what more can I say? Singapore is not the most interesting city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at Clark Quay, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Texas06
Reviews.Content: We just spent 1 night at the Novotel Clark Quay in Singapore. The hotel is very nice and conveniently located. Our check in process at 2am was a bit frustrating but once we got the room that we wanted, the stay was fine. The night staff was a bit rude and non-accomodating but the manager helped us out. The hotel location is great since it is in the 'happening' part of town with bars, clubs and restaurants all around it with great night life. The room was big and clean. The view from our room was really nice. The staff was ok, nothing to rave about. The metro station is a bit of a walk away in the basement of Central mall. We bought the 1 day pass and used it quite a bit. Try the Pepper crab at the Jumbo seafood restaurant on the river. We liked the city and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Coree
Reviews.Content: Reviews of the Novotel through tripadvisor.com were really helpful in making my decision of what hotel to stay in. It was my first trip to Singapore and the hotel was great, great priced, and right along the SIngapore River. There were many shopping centers around the area and restaurants to choose from. Starbucks, Mcdonalds, and even a supermarket were conveniently located in a shopping mall connected to the hotel. Taxis were readily avaialble for hire and even the MRT station was within walking distance. The room was amazing, very spacious. We stayed on the 18th floor and the view overlooking the river and the city was priceless. Staff was very helpful from checkin to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cap3tt3
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location. It is right on Clark Quay and from the hotel it is only a short 5min walk to some superb restaurants. The Novotel is also close to the China town and Fort Caning Hill which is fascinating place to stroll around. The hotel is right by the river and tours can be organised from the hotel although we did not use this service. By Taxi it is 20 mins if that to Orchard Road, the Esplanade and The Raffels Hotel. The service here was wonderful and the buffet breakfast was delicious. We were very impressed by the courteous and helpful staff. For those who need access it has ADSL connections. The rooms were clean and modern. Also the airport is approximately 30 mins away which is nice and handy, but that is arriving and departing in the early hours of the morning so perhaps this time could take longer at other hours. We thought this hotel was great value and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, pool is a bit spartan”
Reviews.Author: dougly
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms nice bathrooms that have stand-alone showers in addition to bathtubs. There is a large pool, but it isn't very inviting. There is little shade on the pool deck. Some may like the hotel's location on Clarke Quay. It seemed like a center for expat life with many different types of cuisine. Clarke Quay itself is very walkable on both sides of the river. Staff was fairly accomodating, but I've received better service at other SIN hotels. The breakfast buffet had lots of choices, but again, I've had bettter at other SIN hotels.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: swissbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May. First of all we got a room with a broken aircon.(1014) We changed to a room above(1114) And everything seemed fine. After the second night, I noticed that i had alot of bites on my arm and a few on my leg. I thought they were mosquito bites. But after the third night I knew they were not. I suspected beg bugs but could not believe that the Novotel would have bed bugs. I checked the bed and sheets after the room was cleaned, they seemed fine except for a few hairs (i assumed they were from me and my husband) - but from that, i knew they did not change the sheets daily) Then i began to be paranoid and switched sides of the bed with my husband (who thus far was unaffected) I then covered my by body from head to toe when i slept. In the morning i had no additional bites,,,but my husband's arm was bitten all over! So then i concluded it had to be bed bugs. It was our check out day and we complained to the duty manager who did apologise and promise to get the room checked and cleaned for the bed bugs. But it had ruined the end of our vacation and we will not stay here again! (to be fair, aside from this, the staff were very friendly and clarke quay is amazing)

Reviews.Title: “We Love Singapore”
Reviews.Author: HolidayfunKenya
Reviews.Content: We have visited Singapore twice staying at the Novotel Clarke Quay. This is a very good location for getting out and about by bus bum boat or on the Metro. These are very good systems and very near the Hotel. It was handy having a shopping centre under the Hotel.The staff are friendly and helpful in this busy business and short holiday stay hotel. There are some very interesting places to visit, eating out at the street markets is cheap and an interesting experience. The people are friendly and helpful. We are two pensioners and had a marvelous time looking forward to going again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: lichie01
Reviews.Content: We had a City Break deal at the Novotel Clarke Quay, staying for 3 night over the weekend. The City Break deal included breakfast, a superb international buffet in The Square restaurant. We had booked a standard room on the Accor website, but when checking in at reception we requested a room with a balcony if possible. The very helpful person on reception offered to upgrade our room to a superior room with a river view and balcony for no extra charge! Our room was on the 12th floor and overlooked Clarke Quay which comes alive at night with its dozens of eateries and bars. It was great having such an array of restaurants and cafes on the doorstep. The room was really comfortable, with 2 queen beds, shower and bathtub. We had to call for housekeeping to unlock the balcony but this was no problem and was promptly done. We spent an afternoon by the hotel pool which was lovely. The breakfasts were very satisfying and the waitresses were very attentive in taking away plates and offering top ups of hot drinks. We found the staff at the hotel to be very courteous and helpful. There's free internet access available on the 2 Apple Macs near reception. Wired internet (in your room) and WiFi are a bit pricey but there's a free WiFi option available in lots of places across Singapore if you register with Singtel wireless@SG. Our stay at the Novotel Clarke Quay was a very relaxing and enjoyable experience, and the hotel's location is superb. We really enjoyed what we saw of Singapore and we'll definitely return and stay at the Novotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, if you don't need to use the internet!”
Reviews.Author: bretto
Reviews.Content: Location, price and breakfast were great. Rooms were clean, in good condition for the price, and well supplied. Internet access charges (my pet hate, especially in "business" hotels) were the highest I have come across in 20 years of travel. They were asking (get this...) SGD 24 for ONE HOUR of access, more than 10% of the room rate!!! The 24 hour rate of SGD 36 wasn't much of an improvement. Considering how internet access has become a necessity, not a luxury, especially for business travellers, I personally consider this on the verge of misleading pricing. Yes there was free internet in the lobby, considing of 2 computers (one of which wasn't going on the morning I left), but bearing in mind the ridiculous charges for in-room access, you can imagine the queue at 8am to use it! If they sort this out, this would be my bet for a hotel in Singapore. Otherwise, I would strongly advise business customers to steer clear, or at least remember to consider an extra SGD 40 on top of the room rate they are quoted. And I definitely won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: lizzy309
Reviews.Content: We loved the Novotel Clarke Quay! The location was excellent for a stroll around near the river & there are many restaurants & clubs around (although quite expensive we thought...). We arrived in Singapore at 5:30 in the morning & were hoping that we could atleast have a shower and freshen up before doing anything that day.. We arrived at the hotel (by the "limo" outside the airport. Tip, they are set rates, so probably good if you are arriving at such an early time because normal taxis charge a surcharge..) and we were so pleased when the front desk allowed us to check in then with no extra charge! We slept the whole morning on the very, very comfortable beds. We had breakfast included in our rate (we paid about $210 for a standar queen room). Cannot complain. Better than other hotels that we have had before! Really enjoyed it. If you don't have breakfast included there is McDonalds around the corner!! hehe Highly suggest taking a bus tour around the city as you can see everything & they have great deals! Can't quite remember how much it was, but there is a Tourist Information booth on Orchard Rd. Overall, we loved it! I couldn't quitre cope with the humidity, but I wasn't going to let that ruin our holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Coopers4
Reviews.Content: The Novotel is in an older brick building that has been renovated. There is a slightly annoying entry to the hotel in that you have to take one elevator from the street to the 7th floor where reception is located and then another to the rooms. The room we were in had 2 double beds and a rollaway to accomodate 1 adult and 2 teenagers. There was enough room to do this and not feel too cramped. The bathroom was large and had both a bath with a shower over it and a separate shower. The room was comfortable and completely unexceptional. Internet access is very expensive. The outdoor pool is quite large and pleasant, the gym is very mediocre. The exercycles were elderly and only one worked properly and then only intermittently. We didn't eat at the hotel. I went to have a drink in the bar at one stage but was scared away by the exorbitant cost of drinks. They have a Happy Hour - I should have aimed for that! Clarke Quay is a good place to be based for a couple of nights in Singapore because of the myrad of cafes and restaurants located there and the pleasant waterside atmosphere. The Novotel is on the other side of the waterway from the Central shopping mall and there are currently no shops near the hotel although t his will change shortly as the mall which is directly under the hotel is in the throes of renovation. At the moment the only nearby alternative to breakfast in the hotel is either Starbucks or McDonalds which are both directly underneath. The construction noise makes them both unpleasant places to linger presently but this obviously won't last for long. There is a taxi stand just around the corner and the fares are very reasonable so it is easy to get around. The MTR station was just a little too far away to walk to comfortably in the heat of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Not enough Sun beds”
Reviews.Author: Jayn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 25th April for two nights. We were given an updgrade due to a double booking error when we arrived. We were on the 24th floor but not entitled to breakfast or the Bizz Room. The hotel room was small but comfortable, not much room for hanging your clothes but the bathroom was a nice size. The hotel was next to the river so it was ideal for going out on the riverside, although we found it very expensive to eat and drink. The pool was nice although we went down twice and found we couldnt get a bed so had to use a chair which isnt ideal when you want to have a sleep or sunbathe. Singapore MRT is cheap and ideal as the station is only five mins away and Taxis are cheap but for eating out and drinking it is expensive I would say more expensive than London. There is a supermarket next to the hotel where you may want to buy cold cans to put in the mini bar as drinks in the mini bar are over £2.00 for a can of 7UP. Weather was fantastic, but very humid. A nice break to break up a long journey home back to the UK, clean city but be prepared for expensive eating and drinking. Approx £14 for two alcoholic drink.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SKILancs
Reviews.Content: Reception on 7th floor, shopping arcade underneath which was being refurbished. Hotel room clean and comfortable. Fantastic views of Clarke Quay. Breakfast excellent. Would recommend this hotel and location for easy access to the city and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tulip
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at the Novotel. Check in was pretty painless. We were first offered rooms on different floors from our teenagers but after insisting that was not appropriate the staff did their upmost to at least put us on the same floor. we were on the 11th floor. our rooms were lovely, the king size bed was enormous with crisp, clean linen. Lots of nice extras in the bathroom, inluding complimentary toothbrushes, paste, mouthwash etc. In our teens bedroom we found a pair of dirty underpants under the curtain! Not really impressed but the staff were very quick to get them shifted! Yuk! There was a bit of misunderstanding when our room wasnt refreshed one day but as soon as you mention a problem they're onto it. the staff are all very courteous and respectful. There is a lot of extensive building work going on at the moment but it didnt really affect our stay, it was all organised to keep disruption to a minimum. The pool is lovely and there is a great restaurant next to the pool called the Square bar. You can sit outside to eat and the food was very reasonably priced, i thought and most delicious. It is in a brilliant position for dining out at night. It's dead during the day but at night it all comes alive and there are lots of different bars and restaurants to choose from, right on the doorstep. It's walking distance to China Town as well. We even used the MRT (train) to get back to Changi Airport on the way home. Bit of a bugger to to drag the cases to as its about 6-8 mins walk away and underground through a bit of a rat run but worth it as you can get to the airport for $2.80 plus you get a dollar refund when you give your card back to the machine! $1.80 is a bargain if you ask me! All in all, we had a great time at the Novotel and i wouldnt hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: dazAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel twice as short stopovers in Feb 2008 First was just for one night and the second for three nights two weeks later. This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in while in Singapore. Check in and out went very smoothly both times, the staff were friendly and efficient. Luggage was promptly handled and they stored it for us after check out for six hours until we had to go to the airport. We had a standard room that overlooked the city on the 17th floor. The room was clean neat and tidy and the bed was large and comfortable. Breakfast was included in the tarriff and was the usual buffet style. Plenty of choices and very tasty. Lots of fruit available which is always handy while touring. We never ate in the hotel for dinner because the Novotel is within a two minute walk to clarke quay and all the resturants and nightlife there. This is an above standard hotel in a city that has plenty of competition for the tourist dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, great location, good family option”
Reviews.Author: exspat
Reviews.Content: We needed accom. for a family of 4. Singapore is sorely lacking in this area (family accom), so we booked 2 nights in a deluxe room (through wotif.com). I also checked direct with the hotel that this room can accomodate 4. Check-in was impersonal, however our request for non-smoking was succesful. Room (11th floor) was very large, but we had to request the kids beds to be made up (twice). Room had: King bed, big bathroom including bath and separate shower, great view, minibar, flat screen tv, dvd player, great lighting. Good bits: location, room size & facils, swimming pool area and opening hrs, housekeeping. A couple of gripes: Service at reception was impersonal and verged on dismissive. Hefty internet access fees (my pet peeve!) Staff always a bit keen to get in the room, on 4 occasions they knocked, then entered before we had got to the door to answer. Fire alarm testing took place on one morning, however, we were not informed of that in-room, so there was concern when it first went off. I rang reception and no one answered! I only figured out there was no need for panic when the alarm went on and off several more times. Only after we went downstairs at midday did we see a sign by the lift at 7th floor reception that there was testing going on. Singapore accomm. is becoming very expensive and hard to book at peak times. This hotel is in a great location near a MRT station and Clarke Quay and other attractions, so it is a well-priced choice for tourists and families. Overall I would recommend this hotel, especially if you need a large room in a good location, but there was nothing outstanding about our visit. .

Reviews.Title: “i really liked this place”
Reviews.Author: Drivatruk
Reviews.Content: i was really happy with the service i received here. i tried my luck checking in very early at 7am. They didn't have any spare rooms. i had booked executive standard which give use of the biz lounge on the 24th floor. While i waited i was alllowed to use the Biz lounge and scored a breakfast and watched some tv and used the internet. they notified me as soon as there was a vacant room. the room was fairly spacious and had huge windiws which made seem huge. all clean too. the staff were so helpful and polite. i would recomend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Noodlesetc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Novotel. We have been to Singapore many times and stayed at a different hotel. The Novotel were offering good rates so we decided on this for a change. I was very impressed with the size of the room, we had 3 double beds and the room still had plenty of room. The Biz floor is definitely worth the extra. The staff were fantastic, free internet, nibbles and drinks for most of the day. The location is great, the view from our room and the Biz floor was the best we have seen of Singapore generally. I would highly recommend this hotel. Just ask to be on the river side of the hotel because we did stay one night on our return on the other side and must admit could hear music and we were on the 24 floor.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kerri_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Clarke Quay Singapore from the 14th - 16th February 2008 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Check in was smooth and the service was fantastic, particularly from John who was most professional and welcoming during check in and out. We were upgraded to a large room on floor 23 (with access to the business centre) and had a terrific view of the river and Clarke Quay. The hotel was well located and only a short walk to the MRT (although we mostly took very cheap taxi rides to the nearby attractions as our conversations with the cab drivers were always very informative!) and we were within a stone's throw of plenty of live entertainment and good restaurants along the river. Our room was spotless and very comfortable, and as it was included in our rate, we enjoyed a lovely buffet breakfast at the hotel both mornings overlooking the pool area. There is some construction going on at the base of the hotel (in the attached shopping mall) but this didn't affect our stay at all. Overall, the service from all staff, location and quality of the hotel made our stay most enjoyable and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but quite a few problems with bill, room configuration and noise”
Reviews.Author: eautmb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through ratestogo.com. We paid a deposit through the website but when we got to the hotel, they made us pay 20% on top of what the invoice stated claiming it was local taxes and room service. The website and invoice had a disclaimer about local taxes and service charges but it no different to other hotels we've booked before and we've never been charged extra. If the hotel will charge more than advertised, they should also say what the extra cost may be. Since then, having complained to ratestogo.com, we have recovered the taxes charged as the Novotel has admitted the advertised fee at the time of our booking included the taxes, but we're still wondering what the 10% charged on top for "room service" was about. We settled the account before we got the rooms, so I'm wondering what sort of room service they charged us for. If the invoice mess up wasn't enough, there was the room configuration problem. On the website the room was advertised as suitable for 2 adults and 2 children but when we got there the only thing they could offer us was a room with a king size bed and 2 extra king single beds. Our room was large but with the two extra beds, there wasn't much room to move about. Then there was the noise every night up to 5am or so. We didn't investigate the origin of the loud music but it sounded like there was a night club somewhere in the hotel. We were on the 13th floor so I can't imagine how people on lower levels slept at night. We can't say it's not a nice hotel. It's also clean and in a nice location, but the problems experienced with the bill and the room configuration, plus the nightly noise, were enough to spoil part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Peg
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a club room, very small compared to other hotels we have visited. Double bed with only space for bedside cabinet on one side of the bed. Bathroom had tiles that were cracked and coming away from the wall. Club lounge quite small, snacks looked as though they had been out all day and none were covered so things a little curled round the edges. An ok hotel but not great compared to some hotels in Singapore, wouldn't hurry back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellorcairns
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back in Cairns Australia this morning after spending the last four nights at Novotel Clark Quay. For location, service and cleanliness this hotel is up with the best. When I was in the process of booking hotels in Singapore I was concerned of reports of hotels not bing clean, smelling of smoke and being old and needing refurbishing so when I booked the Novotel I went for a deluxe room. My concerns were not headed at this establishment as not one of the above problems is in this hotel. The staff are frindly and the buffet breakfast and lunch are sensational. It is only a $7.00 taxi ride to most of the major shopping centres and eating is not a problem because at your doorstop on Clark Quay are some of the best eateries you will find. A must see is the flying angel at Divine Wine Bar, the building is magnificent and the angel that flies to get your selected bottle of wine will be one of the highlights of your Singapore visit.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: mimi0
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Upgraded to a suite ( 2 adults, 2 ten year olds), upon arrival - it was worth it. Huuuuuuge bed in bedroom, we all got into it for a couple of hours when we arrived and slept comfortably!!!! Had access to the business room on 24th floor. Nibbles and drinks nearly all day long and free internet and printer access. Brilliant. Nice pool but it was being renovated whilst we were there - loads of workmen. This is due to finish soon. Clarke Quay is definately unique!! Deadsville during the day then everyone in Singapore appears to descend upon it at night. I thought it was a great place, very trendy, non threatening and certainly interesting!!! The seating at 'The Clinic' is wheelchairs sprayed gold - still not sure about that one!!! Loved Singapore and it sights . The newly opened terminal 3 at Changi airport is an experience in itself. Would return to the Novotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: SaraDubai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Novotel Clarke Quay last week starting from January 12 till 15th Jan.The most important thing is for me is that the rooms are clean.The hotel is in a great location that very near to MRT(metro) and easy walk to Clarke Quay-Singapore river-full with cafes,bars,restaurants.10 minutes to Chinatown.The stuff at the reception was ok.Not really smiling faces though!! The stuff where we had the breakfast were very friendly and kind.We fly with Singapore airlines which I definitely suggest to everyone.It was so comfartable.Shortly,if you want to discover the city all day and have a peaceful stay in a clean hotel Novotel Clarke Quay is great.It is not a hotel that you want to stay in whole day though!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Young Travellers”
Reviews.Author: rose_e86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 6 friends. Only knowing it was close to water we did not know what to expect. The hotel has been recently done up. All very clean and modern. All of the rooms were great with everything you need. All of the staff were very friendly and very funny. Saturday night was our arrival and we came to find the whole of Clarke Quay lit up with lights and busselling with people. Newly renovated Clarke Quay is unreal. Very modern with crazy artwork everywhere. A whole undercover city with about 4-5 streets all leading into one central area dominated by a huge circular fountain. All of the streets are filled with resteraunts, bars and clubs. A stand out has got to be the Ministry of Sound club! Great area for young travellers!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelguyandgirl26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Novotel hotel for 3 days to celebrate new years. The hotels location is excellent as it's right at clarke quay which is a pretty happening area. Lots and lots of restaurants and night clubs, shopping close by too. Also, if you like eating different, exotic cuisines, Clarke Quay is the place to be! It has everything from Balinese to Moroccan. We weren't sure whether we should stay here or in a hotel on Orchard Road, but were so glad we chose this place instead because its not AS crowded and noisy as hotels on orchard road. Also, it's just abt 5-7 minutes by taxi to Orchard Road and hardly costs anything so I thought it was worth it. The hotel is situated above a shopping mall which was undergoing renovation at the time. The construction noise could only be heard when we were taking the elevator upstairs. Could barely hear anything from the rooms so no complaints there. The hotel itself is very clean and done up well. There is a lobby at the ground floor where they will take care of your luggage. Check-in is on the 7th floor. Didn't find this inconvenient at all. Staff was extremely friendly too. We had a problem with our suitcase (the zip was stuck) and we called the reception who sent someone up immediately to fix it. Very prompt service as well. The rooms are pretty big and comfortable as is the bathroom. I thought it was very stylishly done up. There was a DVD player, mini bar and in-room safe as well. We only had breakfast at the hotel as it was included in our package. Very nice spread, but it was SO crowded! I don't know if it's always that packed, or if it was just like that because it was new years weekend, but there is actually at least a 5 minute wait for most people (I noticed that the later you go, the more crowded it gets). And because its so crowded, the tables are put within 3 inches of each other so you can actually eat off the other persons plate! A little awkward when you know the people next to you can hear every word you're saying (not to mention they can see every thing you're eating)! The only odd thing I noticed was that every day, the fire alarm would go off. It wasn't noisy or anything, just a few second beeping noise, but I did get worried at first. After about a minute, they announced that they were investigating the situation and not to panic. And after another minute, they would say it was a false alarm. Now this happened all three days we were there. Maybe they were just checking it to make sure it worked, or maybe something was wrong with their system, but I don't think you should be too alarmed if it does go off when you're there! The pool was nice, but couldn't go to the gym because of the renovations. They did say we could use the gym in the apartment or something next door, but we didn't. Other than that, our stay at Novotel was great and I have no real complaints. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Singapore as the location was amazing and I'd also stay there again if I ever visit Singapore. (In fact, I've already told my dad to stay there on his next trip). Excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linklater
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very conveniently located at Clarke Quay. Excellent service, lovely room, with nice toiletries. Very good breakfast buffet with lots of choice. Very nice breakfast staff. The bathroom was lovely. Clean room. This will be our hotel in Singapore from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to Stay”
Reviews.Author: hatster31
Reviews.Content: I booked the room on the Novotel website months prior and got a great rate. Overall, the Novotel was a great hotel to stay at. We booked a superior room and was upgraded to a deluxe. I would highly recommend this for families. There were two double beds and a sofabed. The rooms were very spacious with balcony and a big bathroom with separate shower. The hotel buffet looked great although we did not eat there. The location was fabulous. It was a short cabride to almost everywhere we wanted to go. The subway was close by, about a 5 minute walk, and there were shopping malls very close by. The restaurants by Clarke Quay were a bit expensive but had a good variety of choices. There were two small complaints. First, as others have mentioned, the drain in the sink makes a pretty loud sound, like the bathroom is being flooded. Second, the location can be a bit noisy. We stayed on the 15th floor facing the park and not the Clarke Quay area, but I was still able to hear cars honking at night. Not super noisy, but audible. Overall, it was great, and the price was good. The place was clean and had free water bottles, coffee maker, fridge and tons of amenities. The pool was also awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: totravelmore
Reviews.Content: Room is clean and spacious, but the building is a bit old, it has an odor in the bathroom. Location is excellent, near Clarke Quay and MRT. Breakfast buffet and dinner buffet are good, various selections and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: rammer1012
Reviews.Content: First time to Singapore and checked reviews about Novotel before booking it and was not disappointed with the numerous raves about this hotel. We stayed for 3 nights and have no complaints at all. Excellent location, close to MRT and the Clarke Quay offers a festive atmosphere at night. The room was clean and staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Morning breakfast buffet offers lots of selection and we also tried the dinner buffet and it was over and above what I expected. I highly recommend this hotel for travelers visiting Singapore. Great job Novotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Singapore - Novotel Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Kazoz
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Hotel, my family and I were impressed with the superior service and standard of the hotel. Even with a slight mix up in our booking, the front office staff rectified the situation (my two teenage children were going to be placed in a queen bed instead of the two twins we had ordered through our travel agent). The breakfasts each day, were also of a superior standard and contained a large selection of cusines. The close proximitey to Clarke Quay was also a very favourable component of our stay - Monday to Saturday. Each morning the concierge gave our family great sightseeing tips - and our saving booklet came in handy at dinner time, at Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Keslergo
Reviews.Content: Date of Stay: November 21 to 23,2007 Room Type: Superior Twin Room Upgrade: none Amount Paid Per Night: S$285.00++ ($196.44++) Reservation Method: Company Reservation Loyalty Card: none Airport/Hotel Transfer: Didn’t get hotel transfers since it’s very easy to get a cab or limo at the airport. Location: Clarke Quay – Very close to restaurant and Central Mall, There is a small mall connected to the mall but is under renovation. Check-in: Quick check-in, but since I arrived at 11:30 am I had to wait about 1 hour for the room to get cleaned up. Room: Room is quite adequate. TV is quite small but the provide a DVD player for those who want to watch their DVDs (like you bring some when traveling). The work area is quite limited but at least could fit a laptop and some stuff, but not more than that. There is good room lighting for those who hate dark rooms like me, it has cover lighting above the bed which you can turn on at night when you want to read or work at least you don’t have to make do with lamp stands and bed side lamps. The bathroom is quite big and has a separate shower which is good, vanity is a bit small but adequate. Bed: The bed was springy and had a thin mattress topper, which doesn’t do much. I also don’t like that it’s small. Breakfast: Breakfast was okay, spread was good. I had a bad case of flu so I had a hard time tasting anything. Check-out: Check out was fast, since everything will be settled by the company directly. Overall Evaluation: A good hotel to stay but it’s quite far from Orchard (well since Singapore is not really big, it’s not really that far). Cab drivers know where it is but it could be hard getting a cab at times. At night it would be better to stay at the hotel and ask the staff to get 1 for you instead of going to the main street and wait with everybody else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: schaf1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights following 4 nights at a different location so we could experience two different areas. Refurbished room was larger than expected and cleanly and cleverly furnished to maximise space. Bed was a bit hard but OK. The Hotel felt young, modern and casual as suited the climate. I had a balcony for smoking. Buffets were very good. We enjoyed a lunch and dinner buffet at a senior's special. We were pleased to spy soft shell pepper crab and the range of desserts were excellent. I usually do not enjoy sweets, but a range of clever little serves of special things changed my mind. The bath was deep and the bath foam literally blooped about tired limbs, followed by a shower washdown. (I've never felt so clean and what a change from water restricted Australia). The lights were easy to manipulate from a little bedside console with graphics to guide you. From this the air-con could be adjusted to just how you like it. Ice could be had for no charge from room service. Safe in room and an Iron/board with room to put it up. Location great especially if young. We had no time to sample pool. This was the only bland area in the hotel which could be made attractive and they will probably get around to that in time. The MRT was about 10mts walk away. We really enjoyed having a bit of space to move around in as my hubby is a big guy.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MiaBournemouthUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks in the Far East. Stayed at the Novotel which was in an excellent location. Upgraded the room which was on 20th floor with great views. Hotel very clean and modern inside despite its orange tiles on the exterior. Excellent buffet breakfast included in the price. Good size swimming pool, but could do with some shade from the blazing sun. Believe the hotel management have this in hand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great room”
Reviews.Author: Neehill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading positive reviews on Tripadvisor. We were quite happy with our stay. The best part was the clean, well appointed rooms, and the brilliant location right next to Clark Quay. The breakfast was excellent, and the roof top pool was really nice as well. The only complaint was when we checked in they only had a twin room, rather than a double. However they gave us a 'better view' to placate us, and moved us first thing in the morning to a double. We were also initially charged for breakfast when this was included in our room rate, so my advice is to make sure that you keep a copy of your booking receipt just in case this happens. They did not believe us until we returned to our room and were able to produce evidence that our breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: b00zee
Reviews.Content: Good location and hotel. B/fast provided and catered for all nationalities. Rooms were large and clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. Location provides a good choice of restaurants. A very touristy area so plenty of choice for drinking and eating.

Reviews.Title: “old and refurbished”
Reviews.Author: vixbkk
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed by Novotel clarke Quay and Staff. First, hotel is old and refurbished. The elevators are old and dangerous as it doesn't have proper sensors on the doors. Rooms are clean and location is good if you want to eat and walk around Clarke quay. Building and mall is under construction as of aug 2007. Too many tours bus stay at this hotel. The Staff overcharged us 1 night on accor novotel website and it took many calls to get our money back then the staff at the hotel wanted to charge us again for the room upon check out. Something is wrong with the accounting of this hotel. Please be careful with your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Good position”
Reviews.Author: snowbabe311
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the at this hotel on the 16th Aug 2007 for 6 days and loved this hotel – we were on the 18th floor the room was lovely with a great bathroom which included a separate shower and bath - good views from our balcony we had three adults in our room and there was plenty of room – we booked a room with access to the BIZ lounge which I cannot recommend enough we used this lounge most nights before we went for our evening meal free drinks including alcohol and lovely canapés which my daughter adored – the staff were very pleasant and very helpful if you need any tips on where to go – booking into the biz lounge also gave us free internet access not only in the lounge but also in the room (ideal for my daughter and her Laptop) We used the pool a couple of times and found this to be very clean and not too crowded towels were provided round the pool. Our room included breakfast which although we could eat in the club lounge we preferred to eat in the main dining area – the breakfast was very good with a large choice of food, freshly cooked eggs and omelettes were great The location of the hotel is excellent with a MRT station a few minutes away – previously we stayed on Orchard Rd but much preferred being around Clarke Quay. The hotel is above a shopping centre which is being updated (this did not have any effect on the hotel) there is a great Japanese supermarket on the bottom floor, which sells almost everything at good prices. Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Henrythefish
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We cannot comment on meals as we never ate in the hotel - not even breakfast. We decided to forgo breakfast and stay instead in a superior suite. The room was very large and very comfortable with a balcony and the air con worked perfectly. The bathroom was large and in excellent working order, including a separate shower cubicle. The only problem was that the safe didn't work but this was soon sorted out. We found the hotel service to be extremely prompt and efficient. In retrospect the only thing I would do differently next time would be to request a room overlooking the river to get more of a view. The hotel is above a small shopping mall where one can get things to eat; there is also a 24/7 MacDonalds for coffee etc. Also in the mall is an excellent massage centre - cheaper than the hotel, and seemed to be very professional and used by locals. The Clarke Quay area is very touristy, lots of eating places and it's nice being by the river. Lots of places to walk to from the hotel. Strongly recommended and would certainly go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Disadvantages Plus Card”
Reviews.Author: Jemtide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of July and I booked using the Accor ( Dis)advantage Card Plus - this card seems to guarantee the worst possible room in the Accor chain of hotels - have had problems in Fiji (mercure) - room next to a loud generator, Fiji (Sofitel) deluxe ocean front room at rear of property - view obscured by a tree and buildings, Sydney (Wentworth/Sofitel)- no room available when we turned up to check in, so they gave us a room at the rear of the hotel that was the size of a cupboard - I'd booked a deluxe room, Singapore and Phuket - you can read about that drama in the Novotel Phuket reviews. I'd foregone our 'free' night in Singapore to use as an upgrade to an executive suite however we were given a standard room, when we complained we got the Accor company reply - hotel is full, I produced the documentation to show what I had booked - no-one should have to do that. We were eventually shifted to a higher floor with nice views but it wasn't an executive suite, what I had paid for and had been promised in not what I got. In our experience Accor has taken our money, not honoured our bookings, left their staff to deal their company policy and I could of got better deals booking the rooms I wanted on-line through Asia-Rooms etc. We have had this card for several years and re-newed it quite by accident (long story). As for the Novotel Clarke Quay - our new room, although not an executive suite had a great view and was very nice. However at 12.00 midnight a band or something in the Clarke Quay area started up every night, the thump, thump, thump, could be heard clearly in our room - so if you're a light sleeper it may be somewhat of a problem. Obviously we won't be returning to this hotel I don't need to start a holiday with a confrontation with a check-in clerk and we've had the same problem repeated at each Accor hotel we have booked. This time the Accor Dis Advantages Plus Card is headed for the shredder, I like happy holidays not dramas and confrontations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a VERY good location”
Reviews.Author: kapsi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip where we spent 3 days in novotel, singapore. This property is located at Clarke Quay which is the center of action for food, bars & pubs and also weekend roadshows etc. We were glad we didn't select a hotel on Orchard road and stayed at Novotel. The reception is located on the 7th floor because this hotel is in a shopping mall which occupies 6 floors. The swimming pool is compact just what you would find in a business hotel. We didn't get a chance to taste any of the restaurants except for the breakfast which has a decent spread of items. They have a movie on demand channel which shows movies at a pricey SGD18 per movie. It wasn't working earlier and they took 2 days for somebody to come and repair the same. FUNNY! There was a DVD player in the room so that let me see my own collection too. I am not sure if they had a DVD movie library in the Hotel, you can check that. The bathroom tub was a little small compared to the standard sizes, i believe. There is a bookshop, electronics store, currency exchange and a tourist information center right below the hotel in the mall. A little away there is a taxi stand at Clarke Quay from where you can get a cab very easily. The bell boys are helpful too if you can't get one, for any reason. If you work across the lake towards Central Mall, there is the nearest MRT station which connects you to important locations around Singapore. NOTE: when you check-in, make sure you collect the FREE boat ride tickets and also discount coupons valid at certain outlets in Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dgtravelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for one night on a recent Singapore stopover. We have stayed down by the river before and always enjoy this part of town. In fact, we were trying to find a previous hotel we had really enjoyed (nice room with fantastic views) but it appeared to have gone out of business. When we arrived we realised that the hotel we had stayed in before was the previous incarnation of the Novotel (Novotel bought in 2005) so we ended up staying in the hotel we wanted anyway! We chose the Novotel because we are members of the Accor Advantage Plus Club (and because its in a fantastic location right on Clarke Quay). We were "upgraded" to a balcony room although we were only given a room with twin beds. I did say we would prefer a room with one bed, but as we were using a complementary voucher for our stay I didn't complain too much. The room was relatively compact but had a good view over the river and Clarke Quay. When we stayed 7 years ago we had a room up near the top which I'm sure was much larger so maybe the more expensive rooms are bigger. The choice of dining at Clarke Quay is quite overwhelming, and as we weren't that hungry after our flight we chose to dine in at the Novotel's restaurant which was nice but not spectacularly exciting. The pool is quite big and has lots of lounge chairs. We managed a quick swim before checking out at midday. The hotel had no problem keeping our luggage locked up for the afternoon until our evening flight. The rooms at the Novotel are pretty much standard Novotel decor - the best thing about the hotel is the great location for night dining and a good pool for relaxing around. Its also one of the few hotels in Singapore where you can open an external door to get a break from the A/C, or just take a picture from your balcony. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clarke Quay Update”
Reviews.Author: lindso
Reviews.Content: Since we last stayed here in Feb.2005 there have been significant changes in the area around the hotel. The hotel standard has been maintained and the staff were as helpful as ever. In our "superior" room, the bathroom fittings around the washbasin were loose and repairs had been attempted in a very amateurish way. It took two messages to the hotel to acknowledge this in the comments made in the hotel questionnaire. Having said that, the hotel is still the one we would return to on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Relax, enjoy pool, consider Clark Quai dining options”
Reviews.Author: freekicker
Reviews.Content: I was there on a 2 day stopover between Hongkong and Europe. A perfect location if you plan to relax and are not stressed by business meetings downtown. I enjoyed the pool and the sunshine even better, when thinking about snow and ice back home in Europe. Poolsite very well kept, attentive service. Found the department store in the block quite practical. Rooms rather small, but come with bathrobe amenities etc. This place is a former New Otani hotel, so its design does not fit into the usual Novotel line. Did not try the restaurants, too much competition from the leisure time hub Clark Quai.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Cacti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and in a great location on the door step of Clarke Quay. The staff were professional at check in and the room was large and modern with a great bathroom (seperate bath and shower) and was spotless (there was a sticker on the toilet saying that the bathroom has been assessed with a UV light to look for dirt!). The hotel is connected to a shopping centre which has a department store in the basement which we used for cheap water etc. The pool area (6th floor) is large with loungers and towels. A very positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jeremy21
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on the way to Australia, Having used Novotel in Europe, which we found poor quality and value, we found it to be great value and great location. Check in was slow even at 8pm, and we had to wait for about 20 mins for the rooms( we had booked two) to be ready. But they upgraded the rooms as a result, so no problem. Pool was good with lots of space around it, we only ate breakfast in which was good value, I would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Clark Quay”
Reviews.Author: Annalise_Andy_UK
Reviews.Content: Not the best Novotel we have stayed at but pretty good. The layout is pretty strange as the hotel is on top of a shopping centre. You have to take the lift to the 7th floor to reach the hotel lobby and then another lift to get to your room. The location is brilliant however - right in the centre of Clarke Quay and very near the river. Great location... no faults there. The standard rooms are ok - Queen size bed and floor to ceiling windows. The whole hotel has obviously just had a make over which is pretty good but the finish could be better. Flat screen TVs in the rooms, new decor etc. We had to move rooms mid way through our stay because our shower was not working and we were given a superior room - much larger bathroom, stand alone shower and a balcony. ASK FOR A ROOM WITH A BALCONY - THE ROOMS ARE MUCH BIGGER AND MUCH NICER! The pool was great here (shared with an apartment block) but the gym was poor. We only tried the main restaurant but we were very disappointed with the food - after Novotel Dubai the food really was second rate. Front desk staff were pretty rude - rare for the Far East. Overall, an OK experience but I have learned to expect more from Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel location you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: rollofhonour
Reviews.Content: The hotel is strategically placed on Clarke's Quay, 30 yards and you are on the banks of the Singapore River with a whole choice of eating places and entertainment. For sightseeing it is ideally placed and right next to the bumboats which are a must for a night trip. We stayed for three nights and found the hotel accessible, the food was fine, the pool relaxing. The service was excellent and the room met all expectations without being expensive. We were also given free tickets for a ride on the bumboats and the bus - brilliant both. The hotel is within walking distance of the MRT station and close to all the places laid out in the sightseeing book. A must for us the next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Clarke Quay is 'The' place to be.”
Reviews.Author: BorderMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on 27th/28th February and thoroughly enjoyed it. Clarke Quay is vibrant and alive and much the best location in Singapore, with bars & restaurants galore and such a happy buzz about the place. The Hotel is modern and clean with friendly, helpful staff. Our Executive Standard room was more than adequate for our short stay and the other Hotel facilities - restaurant, bar, business suite, rooftop pool etc. provided all the services we needed. We would stay here again and thought it represented excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bigw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights 10 - 13 March 2007. The reason I chose this hotel is I am a member of Advantage Plus and got a very good deal. The hotel is in a great location with all the facilities that one expects of a Novotel 4 - 4 1/2 star in a capital city. Bonuses are the proximity to Clarke Quay and the Singapore river, the shopping mall in the building with a variety of shops, a supermarket and several eating places for snacks and coffee. The service at the hotel and the staff were friendly and efficient and they arranged and booked local tours. The room, on the 12th floor was spacious and comfortable with a great view over the river and Singapore. There was a little residual noise from Clarke Quay on Saturday night but not enough to disturb sleep. Reception is on the 7th floor with restaurants etc. Buffet meals were good to excellent. Overall, a good hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: beach_specialists
Reviews.Content: Novotel Clarke Quay has a fantastic location on Clarke Quay, Singapore River. It is ideal for the first time visitor to Singapore & in our case as return visitors we were wanting to enjoy the river area. RESERVATION Our booking was made direct with the hotel. On arrival there was a slight mix up with the reservation but it was resolved in a timely manner. The hotel was fully booked during our stay so it was fortunate the change could be made. ARRIVAL/DEPATURE We pre-organised private car transfers to/from hotel from Singapore airport. We have previously travelled to Singapore many times and used taxis, bus transfer & MRT (all cheaper) but wanted a different experience. It was SGD60 nett plus tax one way but we wouldn’t bother with the additional expense in the future. For a special occasion it was worth it though. RECEPTION Arriving at the front of the hotel concierge is on the ground floor. The elevator only goes to the 7th floor then a walk across the lobby to the reception area. Check in was prompt. No big queues besides a tour group checking in at the same time. There is another set of elevators that are used to go to the guest rooms. So there is always the need to cross the lobby as from the street/concierge area you cant select the elevator floor to your room. ROOM Our room was of an average size. We had a lovely view of the Singapore River area. Good size bathroom with a separate shower and bath. Good selection of amenities provided, even a mini talcum power. The television had very limited cable channels. Mini bar offered a good selection of drinks. Bathrobes & slippers provided for use. There was an in room electronic safe. We found the room most comfortable. Room key only operates to the floor of guest room. We had friends staying at the hotel as well and were not able to visit there floor. Our room was quiet & experienced no noise & were on the 12th floor facing the pool/river. FACILITIES The business centre was easy to find and opposite the elevators that go from concierge to lobby. We used the internet there and it wasn’t cheap but convenient. There is an outdoor pool and deck chair area. Only disadvantage with this was we had to cross the lobby to access the area the only other way we found was to cut through the restaurant. On one of our mornings at the hotel we enjoyed the buffet breakfast at The Square Restaurant. With tax about SGD 30 pp. Strange set up of tables in this restaurant as there were lounge chairs with small table that gave a modern feel. There are limited facilities at this hotel, however, in the immediate area just about everything can be found. AREA On street level there is 7/11 mini convenience store, Starbucks & a 24 hour McDonalds. There is a local shopping centre where we found good price items. The Singapore River Clarke Quay area is literally outside the hotel entrance with a great range of restaurants & bars to enjoy. The area comes alive at night with locals and tourists. It is a short walk to Chinatown & the Clarke Quay MRT stop. A taxi to Orchard Road was SGD $3.50. To make use of the hotel limousine service was SGD$8.00 plus the taxi meter. We enjoyed lovely walks along the river & nearby park s by day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Putter7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated for acces to Orchard Road and of course is right next to Clarke Quay, the river walks (only 5-10 minutes to Boat Quay) and Chinatown (10 minutes away by foot). Good eating all around the place and remember very cheap taxies can get you anywhere in no time. Staff are helpful and cheerful at all times. Everyone is willing to assist without expectation of tipping (generally not done in Singapore anyway). Room is perfectly adequate and since this is not a five star hotel, not decorated and finished like some of the higher class places in the city but still very, very good. Everything was clean and maintained that way on a frequent basis. A good and solid place to stay. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great BIZ Lounge-Beds Were definitely Hard”
Reviews.Author: jacks24
Reviews.Content: I actually enjoyed this hotel. Positives were: endless nibbles and drinks basically from 6am till 8pm at night, My daughter loved the free alcohol between 6-8pm as alcohol is very expensive in Singapore. Complimentary bottled water & shampoos etc when you are in the room, Being on the top floor facing the river, Most staff were pleasant and 2 in particular in the BIZ room (male & female) who were especially pleasant (can't remember their names though), Taxis always out the front as we found it just as easy to pay S $3-$4 to get around. Close to Chinatown as just over the bridge and about 10min walk, close to all the Clarke Quay restraunts, satay club. 7/11 is next door, shopping centre underneath. Free internet and printing (this helped when checking in to our flight from the hotel) Free Bumboat ride up and down the river. Does have a massage service also (this is part of the negative too though). Cute how they leave a goodnight card with an orchid on it, pity couldn't bring it home and you received a free paper each morning. Negatives: HARD BEDS & HARD PILLOWS, so first nite was hard to sleep, Sometimes reception didn't seem to be interested in telling you how to get places etc, BIZ lounge were more helpful. Foot massages even though advertised were not available as the person was away, thought should advise in room if this is the case. Even though i didn't find it a negative some people would in the fact that reception is on 7th floor therefore you have to catch 2 lifts. The lift from 7-25 was very frustrating as if you do not get your keycard either in quick enough or the button won't press you end up going down or up when your trying to go the opposite way. Other than that it was a great hotel, however I would only pay to be on the Business Floors as this was well worth it for the free extra's you received. We managed to get our room for S$195 per night- i think if you paid more than this there are just as good a hotels anywhere else, especially maybe closer to Chinatown. Rooms are smaller than what i've seen in other countries but it was clean, tidy and well maintained, bathroom was big.
